Headlines: Cramer makes the bull case for China's move to cut US debt purchases
Description: Jim Cramer laid out the benefits of China potentially halting its purchases of U.S. sovereign debt.

Headlines: Cambridge Analytica played key Trump campaign role, CEO says: UK TV
Description: The suspended chief executive of UK-based political consultancy Cambridge Analytica claimed in secretly recorded video that his company played a decisive role in the 2016 election campaign of President Donald Trump, Channel 4 News reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Amazon is now second most valuable U.S.-listed company, tops Alphabet
Description: Amazon.com became the second most valuable publicly listed U.S. company on Tuesday, surpassing Google parent Alphabet Inc for the first time.

Headlines: New Zealand court rejects Megaupload founder's call for Obama appearance
Description: A New Zealand court rejected on Wednesday internet entrepreneur Kim Dotcom's application for former U.S. President Barack Obama to appear in court in relation to a damages claim over his defunct Megaupload streaming website.

Headlines: France's Le Maire blames 'unfair trade' for global commerce woes
Description: Unfair trade and an overproduction of steel are at the root of international tensions over commerce, France's finance minister Bruno Le Maire said on Tuesday after a G20 gathering in Buenos Aires.

Headlines: UK investigates Facebook over data breach, to raid Cambridge Analytica
Description: Britain is investigating whether Facebook did enough to protect data after a whistleblower said a London-based political consultancy hired by Donald Trump improperly accessed information on 50 million Facebook users to sway public opinion.

Headlines: Tesla denies Musk in talks with Israeli AI vision firm Cortica
Description: U.S. electric car company Tesla Inc said on Tuesday that Chief Executive Elon Musk, who was visiting Israel, did not discuss a collaboration with artificial intelligence firm Cortica.

Headlines: Germany alarmed by Facebook data abuse reports, lawmakers demand answers
Description: Germany on Tuesday voiced alarm at reports that a political consultancy hired by Donald Trump improperly accessed information on 50 million Facebook users, and lawmakers demanded answers from the company and the government.

Headlines: Toys 'R' Us says 'making every effort' to pay vendors
Description: Toys 'R' Us said at a bankruptcy court hearing on Tuesday that it was working hard to maximize payments to suppliers and lenders, as it starts to shutter 735 big-box toy stores across the United States.

Headlines: Drillers give tepid response to record U.S. offshore lease sale
Description: Oil and gas drillers bid on only a tiny fraction of Gulf of Mexico acreage offered on Wednesday in the largest lease sale in American history, a setback to the Trump administration's efforts to rapidly pump up investment in the region.

Headlines: Factbox: Top S&P 500 companies exposed to China
Description: Investor worries about a trade war between the United States and China ratcheted up on Wednesday, leaving a number of large U.S. companies potentially in the crosshairs of a dispute because of their business with China.

Headlines: Brazil prosecutors open investigation into Cambridge Analytica
Description: Brazilian prosecutors on Wednesday said they had opened an investigation into whether London-based political consultancy Cambridge Analytica acted illegally in Brazil, as controversy over the firm's data harvesting practices spreads across the globe.

Headlines: Trump will announce trade actions on China on Thursday
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will announce on Thursday the actions he will take against China for its alleged theft of U.S. intellectual property and technology, a White House official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Kaspersky Lab plans Swiss data center to combat spying allegations - documents
Description: Moscow-based Kaspersky Lab plans to open a data center in Switzerland to address Western government concerns that Russia exploits its anti-virus software to spy on customers, according to internal documents seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Germany wants clarity from Facebook after reports of data abuse
Description: Germany said on Wednesday it wanted Facebook to clarify the use of its data after reports that a UK-based political consultancy improperly accessed information on millions of Facebook users to build detailed profiles on American voters.

Headlines: U.S. trade actions on China could slip to Friday, official says
Description: New U.S. tariffs on China imports expected to be announced as early as Thursday could slip until Friday, a Trump administration official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: G20 sees need for 'dialogue,' fails to defuse trade war threat
Description: The world's financial leaders rejected protectionism on Tuesday and urged "further dialogue" on trade, but failed to defuse the threat of a trade war days before U.S. metals tariffs take effect and Washington is to announce measures against China.

Headlines: U.S. carmaker Ford, India's Mahindra to develop SUVs, electric vehicle
Description: U.S. carmaker Ford Motor Co and India's Mahindra & Mahindra said on Thursday they have signed an agreement to develop midsize and compact sports utility vehicles (SUV) and an electric vehicle, which Ford could also potentially sell in other markets outside India.

Headlines: Exclusive: China to respond to U.S. tariffs, resist protectionism - WTO envoy
Description: China is preparing a range of responses to planned U.S. tariffs and will stand up to protectionism, but still hopes for dialogue, Beijing's ambassador to the World Trade Organization (WTO) said on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump initiates trade action against China
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump initiated a trade action against China on Thursday, saying the U.S. deficit with Beijing was "out of control" at about $504 billion and there was a huge "intellectual property theft situation."

Headlines: China 'would fight to the end' in any U.S.-launched trade war: embassy
Description: China is "strongly disappointed" in U.S. President Donald Trump's decision to launch trade sanctions against Beijing but will not recoil from a trade war with the United States, the Chinese embassy in Washington said on Thursday.

Headlines: Boeing will not appeal trade case against Bombardier: spokesman
Description: Boeing Co will not appeal against the U.S. trade commission ruling that allows Canada's Bombardier Inc to sell its newest jets to U.S. airlines without heavy duties, a Boeing spokesman said on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump moves toward China tariffs in warning shot on technology transfer
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump lit a slow-burning fuse on Thursday to launch long-promised anti-China tariffs, but his actions appeared to be more of a warning shot than the start of a full-blown trade war with Beijing.

Headlines: China urges U.S. against taking trade relations to 'dangerous place'
Description: China urged the United States on Friday to avoid taking bilateral trade relations to a "dangerous place", the Chinese commerce ministry said in a statement on Friday, responding to planned U.S. tariffs following an intellectual property probe.

Headlines: Trump set for China tariff announcement on Thursday, trade war fears grow
Description: President Donald Trump will announce tariffs on Chinese imports on Thursday, a White House official said, in a move aimed at curbing theft of U.S. technology and likely to trigger retaliation from Beijing and stoke fears of a global trade war.

Headlines: Malta freezes Pilatus bank's operations after chairman's arrest
Description: Malta's regulators have imposed a freeze on the business of Pilatus Bank after its chairman's arrest on charges of breaking U.S. sanctions prompted a fresh wave of criticism of the island's authorities.

Headlines: Best Buy cuts ties with China's Huawei: source
Description: Best Buy Co Inc, the largest U.S. consumer electronics retailer, will cut ties with China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, a person familiar with the matter said, amid heightened scrutiny on Chinese tech firms in the United States.

Headlines: German BGA trade association welcomes US tariff exemptions for EU
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's decision to pause the imposition of new steel and aluminum tariffs on the European Union is a "triumph of reason", the chief of Germany's BGA trade association said on Thursday.

Headlines: Canada calls end to trade case positive for 'longstanding' Boeing ties
Description: Canada on Friday welcomed as a "positive development" in its long ties with Boeing a decision by the U.S. planemaker to end a trade dispute over sales of Bombardier CSeries jets in the United States.

Headlines: U.S., South Korea on verge of trade deal: Trump
Description: The United States and South Korea could announce a trade deal next week that would cover an exemption from U.S. steel and aluminum tariffs and other trade issues, President Donald Trump and his commerce secretary said on Friday.

Headlines: China urges U.S. away from 'brink' as Trump picks trade weapons
Description: China urged the United States on Friday to "pull back from the brink" as President Donald Trump's plans for tariffs on up to $60 billion in Chinese goods moved the world's two largest economies closer to a trade war.

Headlines: EU demands permanent exemption from U.S. steel tariffs
Description: European Union leaders demanded on Friday that U.S. President Donald Trump give the bloc a permanent exemption from new tariffs on steel and aluminum imposed by Washington as part of a trade conflict with China.

Headlines: UK investigators enter Cambridge Analytica offices in London
Description: Investigators from Britain's data watchdog on Friday entered the London offices of a data analytics firm at the center of a storm over allegations it improperly harvested Facebook data to target U.S. voters, a Reuters witness said.

Headlines: Wall Street nosedives as investors flee on trade war fears
Description: Wall Street tumbled on Friday with more than 1,000 points knocked off the Dow in two days as investors, increasingly nervous about a potential U.S. trade war with China, shied away from risk ahead of the weekend and sought shelter from further losses.

Headlines: China says in touch with U.S. after tariff announcement
Description: China is in touch with the United States and communication channels are smooth, a senior Chinese Commerce Ministry official said on Friday, after U.S. President Donald Trump announced plans to target up to $60 billion in Chinese goods with tariffs.

Headlines: China hopes U.S. takes seriously China's position on trade
Description: China's foreign ministry said on Friday it hoped the United States can take China's position seriously and make a rational decision, after U.S. President Donald Trump announced plans to target up to $60 billion in Chinese goods with tariffs.

Headlines: Germany welcomes U.S. tariff exemption, wants more trade cooperation
Description: Germany's economy minister on Friday welcomed U.S. President Donald Trump's decision to temporarily exclude European Union countries from higher U.S. import duties on steel and aluminum and called for more international cooperation on trade.

Headlines: U.S. has not given China a list of trade remedy actions: U.S. official
Description: The United States has not given China a list of actions it wants Beijing to take in order to remedy two-way trade ties, a senior U.S. official told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: Norway subject to U.S. steel, aluminum tariffs
Description: Norway will be subject to the new U.S. tariffs on steel and aluminum, the Nordic country's foreign minister said on Friday, calling on her American counterparts to remedy the situation.

Headlines: Oh nuts! China shoppers lament tariffs on US almonds, pistachio and fruit
Description: As Beijing and Washington exchange barbs that threaten a potential trade war, health-conscious Chinese shoppers are beginning to fret over what this could mean for their pockets: a potential jump in prices for U.S.-grown cherries and pistachios.

Headlines: Ireland chooses investment firms to manage Apple cash
Description: Ireland on Friday chose Amundi , BlackRock Investment Management , and Goldman Sachs Asset Management to manage up to 15 billion euros ($18.5 billion) in disputed taxes Brussels has ordered it to collect from Apple.

Headlines: Russia eyes restrictions on U.S. imports in response to tariffs
Description: Russia will likely prepare a list of restrictions on imported products from the United States in response to U.S. tariffs on steel and aluminum, Moscow's trade ministry said on Friday, according to Interfax news agency.

Headlines: Norway not exempted from U.S. steel and aluminum tariffs
Description: Norway is not exempt from U.S. tariffs on steel and aluminum, the Nordic country's foreign minister said on Friday.

Headlines: China should target U.S. soybeans, says former finance minister
Description: The response by China's commerce ministry to the latest U.S trade measures is too weak, and should target U.S. soybeans, former Chinese finance minister Lou Jiwei said on Saturday.

Headlines: UK investigators search London office of firm at center of Facebook data storm
Description: Investigators from Britain's data watchdog searched the London offices of Cambridge Analytica, the data analytics firm at the center of a storm over allegations it improperly harvested Facebook data to target U.S. voters.

Headlines: Mexico's Chedraui buys Fiesta Mart to grow U.S. Latino sales
Description: Mexican grocer Chedraui, a powerhouse in the fast-growing Latino market in the United States, said on Sunday it had bought smaller U.S. grocery store chain Fiesta Marts for an undisclosed amount.

Headlines: Smurfit Kappa rejects raised bid from International Paper
Description: Ireland's Smurfit Kappa rejected a raised takeover offer from International Paper on Monday, frustrating a bid to combine the largest listed U.S. paper packaging firm with Europe's biggest.

Headlines: U.S., South Korea revise trade deal with quotas on Korean steel
Description: The United States and South Korea agreed to revise a trade pact sharply criticized by U.S. President Donald Trump, Seoul said on Monday, with U.S. automakers winning improved market access and Korean steelmakers hit with quotas but avoiding hefty tariffs.

Headlines: Wall Street rebounds on hopes for U.S.-China talks on trade
Description: The main U.S. stock indices advanced more than 2 percent on Monday, helping recoup some of last week's losses, amid signs that the United States and China were willing to negotiate on tariffs eased concerns about a trade war between the two countries.

Headlines: Cancelling new Mexico airport would cost $6.6 billion: company CEO
Description: Cancelling the new Mexico City airport would cost about half its $13 billion budget, the head of the company in charge of the project said on Monday following threats by the presidential election front-runner to scrap it.

Headlines: Hyundai's union says revised trade deal with U.S. 'humiliating'
Description: Hyundai Motor Co's South Korean labor union on Tuesday called Seoul's revised free trade deal with the United States "humiliating", and said the extended tariffs on pick-up trucks mean a missed opportunity to tap into the U.S. market.

Headlines: U.S. banks provide rescue financing for gunmaker Remington
Description: U.S. gunmaker Remington Outdoor Co has obtained commitments for nearly $300 million from its existing lenders, including some of the biggest U.S. banks, after new sources of funding dried up in the months leading up to its filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy.

Headlines: Mnuchin: Trump not afraid of a trade war with China - Fox News
Description: Despite threats of retaliation from China over U.S. plans to impose tariffs on up to $60 billion in Chinese goods, Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin on Sunday said President Donald Trump had no intention of backing down and was not worried about a trade war.

Headlines: U.S., South Korea revise trade deal, Korean steel faces quota
Description: The United States and South Korea agreed to revise a trade pact sharply criticized by U.S. President Donald Trump, Seoul said on Monday, with U.S. automakers winning improved market access and Korean steelmakers hit with quotas but avoiding hefty tariffs.

Headlines: White House's Navarro says U.S. in talks with China on trade
Description: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro said on Monday that United States is in talks with China after Washington announced plans to impose tariffs on up to $60 billion of Chinese products.

Headlines: China urges WTO members: Put U.S. tariff 'beast back in the cage'
Description: China called on World Trade Organization members on Monday to unite to prevent the United States "wrecking" the WTO, and it urged them to oppose U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs targeting China's alleged theft of intellectual property.

Headlines: China's Li says working towards dialogue with U.S. but prepared for trade war
Description: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang told visiting U.S. lawmakers on Tuesday that China is working towards dialogue with the United States on trade but is prepared for a trade war, state television reported.

Headlines: China steel industry adds voice to steel import concerns
Description: China's steel industry on Tuesday urged Beijing to ensure any increase in steel products seeking a market in the wake of U.S. tariffs did not affect its domestic industry, following the announcement of a European Union import probe.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia to sign memorandum with Boeing to support fleet
Description: Saudi Arabia will sign a non-binding agreement with Boeing Co for the U.S. planemaker to provide support and training to the kingdom's fleet, the chairman of the state-owned military industrial company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Appeals court revives Oracle's copyright claim against Google
Description: A U.S. appeals court on Tuesday resurrected a multi-billion dollar copyright case brought by Oracle Corp against Alphabet Inc's Google.

Headlines: Amazon targets French grocery market with Monoprix deal
Description: U.S. e-commerce giant Amazon has made further inroads into food retail in France as Casino's upmarket Monoprix chain became the first local retailer to agree to sell groceries via Amazon.

Headlines: Amazon shares fall after report Trump wants to curb its power
Description: Amazon.com Inc shares fell almost 5 percent on Wednesday, wiping more than $30 billion off its market value, after news website Axios reported that U.S. President Donald Trump is obsessed with the world's largest online retailer and wants to rein in its growing power.

Headlines: Novo Banco posts record loss, remedied by Portugal resolution fund
Description: Portugal's Novo Banco, rescued by the state and acquired last year by U.S. private equity firm Lone Star, reported a record net loss of 1.4 billion euros on Wednesday for 2017 and a fresh capital injection from the country's bank resolution fund.

Headlines: Brexit and the City: Tracking the fortunes of London's financial districts
Description: Is London's position as the largest international center of finance slipping as a result of Brexit?

Headlines: Brexit and the City: Food for thought from London dining room
Description: Diners are still flocking to the elegant, glass-domed dining room at 1 Lombard Street, despite uncertainty about London's future after Britain exits the European Union next year.

Headlines: Drugmaker Shire soars as Japan's Takeda considers bid
Description: Japan's largest drugmaker Takeda Pharmaceutical is considering a bid for London-listed rare disease specialist Shire that could top $40 billion and spark another takeover battle in the deal-hungry pharma industry.

Headlines: On China trade clash, Wall Street embraces Trump's poker face
Description: To Wall Street money managers who make bets for a living, U.S. President Donald Trump's aggressive stance against China on trade looks like a high-stakes poker hand - but they believe they can play it for all it's worth.

Headlines: China preparing list of retaliatory tariffs on U.S. imports: Global Times
Description: China will soon announce a list of retaliatory tariffs on United States exports to China to counter an expected announcement from the United States of proposed new tariffs on Chinese imports, the Global Times said Wednesday.

Headlines: In South Korea, U.S. cars are rare, and often German or Japanese
Description: The United States and South Korea have agreed to revise a trade pact with a side deal to deter competitive currency devaluation by Seoul and with concessions for U.S. autos and pharmaceutical companies, Trump administration officials said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Tesla returned to German subsidies list, ending row
Description: Tesla buyers in Germany can apply for subsidies again because a government agency has ended its dispute with the U.S. carmaker over whether its Model S was too expensive to qualify for the incentives scheme.

Headlines: NYSE in talks to acquire Chicago Stock Exchange: Wall Street Journal
Description: Intercontinental Exchange Inc's New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) is in talks to buy the Chicago Stock Exchange (CHX), the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, a month-and-a-half after U.S. regulators blocked the sale of CHX to China-based investors.

Headlines: Uber seen girding for battle with Ola in India ahead of IPO
Description: Uber's decision to exit Southeast Asia, where it was bleeding money, should give the global ride-hailing giant more firepower to focus on India, where it's locked in a fierce battle with local rival, Ola, industry analysts say.

Headlines: How Seoul raced to conclude U.S. trade deal ahead of North Korea talks
Description: South Korean trade officials braved snowstorms, ate instant noodles to save time and spent weeks hotel-hopping in Washington as they raced to overcome major trade hurdles with their U.S. ally ahead of high-stakes nuclear discussions with North Korea.

Headlines: Transcontinental beefs up packaging business with $1.32 billion Coveris deal
Description: Transcontinental Inc said it would buy the U.S. packaging business of Coveris Holdings S.A. for $1.32 billion (C$1.70 billion) as the Canadian publisher looks to join other top North American companies in the flexible packaging space.

Headlines: Dollar slips on China tariffs, U.S. stocks tumble
Description: The dollar slid on Monday as China raised tariffs on U.S. goods in an escalating spat between the world's two biggest economies while stocks on Wall Street tumbled, led by a rout in technology shares, after President Donald Trump again attacked Amazon.com.

Headlines: Trump to unveil China tariff list this week, targeting tech goods
Description: The Trump administration this week will unveil a list of advanced technology Chinese imports targeted for U.S. tariffs to punish Beijing over technology transfer policies, a move expected to intensify trade tensions between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: China hits U.S. goods with tariffs as 'sparks' of trade war fly
Description: China has increased tariffs by up to 25 percent on 128 U.S. products, from frozen pork and wine to certain fruits and nuts, escalating a dispute between the world's biggest economies in response to U.S. duties on imports of aluminum and steel.

Headlines: White House criticizes China for trade practices, tariff increases
Description: The White House on Monday accused China of distorting global markets and said the country should not target "fairly traded U.S. exports" after Beijing increased tariffs on 128 U.S. products in response to U.S. duties on imports of aluminum and steel.

Headlines: Instant View: Stocks tumble, led by tech pullback and trade fears
Description: U.S. benchmark stock indexes fell sharply on Monday, undermined by weakness in the technology sector while a growing trade dispute with China has investors pulling back on concerns over economic growth.

Headlines: GM Korea's March sales dive; seeks to halt one shift at Bupyeong plant
Description: General Motors Co's South Korean unit has proposed suspending one of two shifts at a plant near Seoul, an internal union newsletter seen by Reuters showed, increasing uncertainty about the fate of the factory as the U.S. automaker grapples with slumping sales.

Headlines: Trump, Abe to discuss trade after U.S. aluminum, steel tariffs-White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will discuss "reciprocal trade and investment ties" with Japan's prime minister Shinzo Abe during a visit later this month, the White House said on Monday.

Headlines: Stocks rally on Amazon's rebound, dollar gains
Description: A gauge of global equity markets edged higher on Tuesday on a rebound in Amazon.com shares and as a still bright earnings outlook offset a somber mood among investors, while the U.S. dollar rose on easing concerns over a China-U.S. trade spat.

Headlines: China formally notifies the WTO of retaliatory tariffs against U.S.
Description: China has notified the World Trade Organization it is imposing $611.5 million worth of retaliatory tariffs on $2.75 billion worth of U.S. imports including pork, nuts and ethanol in response to U.S. duties on aluminum and steel, a WTO document showed.

Headlines: China slams U.S. trade action, to retaliate on same scale, strength
Description: China on Tuesday condemned the U.S. announcement of tariffs on $50 billion worth of Chinese imports and said it would "take corresponding measures of equal scale and strength against U.S. products."

Headlines: California wine and nut growers call China tariffs a blow
Description: California farmers, many of whom voted for President Donald Trump and his tough talk on trade, say China's increased tariffs on products like almonds, pistachios and wine are a competitive blow, but some are hopeful they will lead to a better deal down the road.

Headlines: China commerce ministry condemns U.S. tariffs, will take countermeasures
Description: China's commerce ministry said on Wednesday it "strongly condemns and firmly opposes" the proposed U.S. tariffs following the Section 301 probe and will take counter measures, according to the official Xinhua news agency.

Headlines: China ready for proportionate response to U.S. tariffs: envoy
Description: China will take counter-measures of the "same proportion" and scale if the United States imposes further tariffs on Chinese goods, China's ambassador to Washington said, amid growing fears of an impending trade war.

Headlines: China imposed tariffs on U.S. products to 'balance losses': state media
Description: China imposed tariffs on 128 U.S. products ranging from wine to oranges in order to "balance the losses" caused by U.S. duties and to protect China's national interests, according to a commentary on the front page of the official People's Daily.

Headlines: China warns U.S. not to open Pandora's Box, unleash trade ills on world
Description: (This version of the March 29th story corrects value of China's U.S. semiconductor imports in paragraph 8)

Headlines: China's premier pledges market opening in bid to avert U.S. trade war
Description: (This version of the March 26th story corrects value of China's U.S. semiconductor imports in paragraph 9)

Headlines: U.S. seeks China trade moves on autos, financials, chips: source
Description: (This version of the March 26th story corrects value of China's U.S. semiconductor imports in paragraph 14)

Headlines: U.S., China may pursue talks over trade differences: USTR official
Description: The United States and China may pursue negotiations to resolve deepening differences over trade, a U.S. trade official said on Wednesday, but he declined to say whether any new high-level meetings were planned.

Headlines: U.S. meat groups fear China beef tariff hike risks market growth
Description: China's proposal on Wednesday for tariffs on U.S. beef confirmed the worst-case scenario for the U.S. cattle industry, trade groups said on Wednesday, even as they remained hopeful the dispute could be resolved quickly.

Headlines: China tariffs on soy, sorghum spread fear in U.S. farm country
Description: China aimed a direct strike at America's heartland on Wednesday, moving to slap an aggressive 25 percent retaliatory tariff against U.S. soybeans, farm country's most valuable export to China last year, worth $12 billion.

Headlines: Deere says assessing impact of Beijing's new tariffs
Description: U.S. agricultural machinery maker Deere & Co said on Wednesday it would monitor Beijing's new tariff proposals to evaluate their impact on the company and its customers.

Headlines: U.S. must 'mitigate' trade damage on American farmers: senator
Description: U.S. Senator Chuck Grassley on Wednesday blasted the Trump administration over its handling of trade issues, saying while the United States should act, China's retaliatory moves were disproportionately affecting America's agriculture sector.

Headlines: Cargill 'deeply concerned' over trade tensions between U.S., China
Description: Cargill Inc [CARG.UL] said on Wednesday that it was "deeply concerned" by the escalating U.S.-China trade conflict, after Beijing announced new tariffs on imports of U.S. soybeans and other goods.

Headlines: White House not planning new big trade initiative against China: official
Description: President Donald Trump's administration does not at this time have another new, big trade initiative planned against China and is focused on implementing the moves that have already been announced, a White House official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: DowDuPont says U.S.-China conflict could hit its agriculture unit
Description: DowDuPont Inc said on Wednesday that its agriculture unit could be affected by the escalating U.S.-China trade conflict, after Beijing announced new tariffs on imports of U.S. soybeans and other goods.

Headlines: Ford Motor urges U.S., China to resolve trade issues
Description: Ford Motor Co on Wednesday said it encouraged the U.S. and Chinese governments to "work together to resolve issues" after China retaliated against U.S. plans to impose tariffs with a list of similar duties.

Headlines: U.S. says China's WTO objection to steel, aluminum tariffs 'baseless'
Description: Beijing's objections to U.S. steel and aluminum tariffs are "completely baseless" and there is no justification to impose $3 billion in retaliatory tariffs on U.S. fruits, nuts and other goods, the Trump administration said it told China and the World Trade Organization Wednesday.

Headlines: China trade retaliation puts stocks of U.S. exporters in spin
Description: Shares in U.S. exporters of everything from planes to tractors were volatile on Wednesday after China proposed duties on key U.S. imports including soybeans, planes, cars, beef and chemicals in retaliation to Trump administration tariff plans.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. winners and losers from trade tit-for-tat
Description: China on Wednesday hit back at U.S. President Donald Trump's plan to impose tariffs on $50 billion of Chinese imports, proposing additional tariffs of 25 percent on 106 categories of U.S. goods, from soybeans to autos, chemicals and some kinds of aircraft.

Headlines: Broadcom completes move to U.S. from Singapore
Description: Broadcom Inc said on Wednesday it had completed its move back to the United States from Singapore, weeks after President Donald Trump blocked its $117 billion offer to buy Qualcomm Inc on national security grounds.

Headlines: White House adviser says expects China to 'play ball' on trade
Description: President Donald Trump's top economic adviser said on Wednesday he expected China would "play ball" on trade and come to agreements that would avoid the need for the United States to implement steep tariffs on Chinese imports.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade war could hit German automakers, plus Tesla, Ford
Description: Escalating trade tensions between the United States and China may dent production of German luxury SUVs made in the U.S. South and sent to China, with exports from electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc and Ford Motor Co also vulnerable.

Headlines: White House says hopes China changes trade practices to avert tariffs
Description: The White House said on Wednesday it hoped China would change its "unfair trade practices" in a way that would avoid the need for the Trump administration to move forward with announced import tariffs.

Headlines: Oil giants stay in their own backyards in U.S. auction
Description: The Trump administration heralded the government's sale last month of U.S. drilling leases in the Gulf of Mexico as a bellwether.

Headlines: China has never given in to external pressure: vice finance minister
Description: China has never given in to external pressure, Vice Finance Minister Zhu Guangyao said on Wednesday, shortly after Beijing unveiled a list of U.S. goods it will target in response to planned U.S. tariffs.

Headlines: China announces additional tariffs on $50 billion of U.S. goods
Description: China will impose additional tariffs of 25 percent on 106 U.S. goods including soybeans, autos, chemicals, some types of aircraft and corn products, among other agricultural goods, the finance ministry said on Wednesday.

Headlines: China to impose tariffs on soybeans, autos among 106 U.S. products
Description: China will impose additional tariffs of 25 percent on 106 U.S. products including soybeans, autos and chemicals, state broadcaster CCTV reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: China state media journalist says on Twitter Beijing to announce retaliatory trade steps Wednesday
Description: Global Times's Editor-in-Chief Hu Xijin said on Twitter that China will announce retaliatory steps on Wednesday afternoon, after the U.S. administration unveiled a list of Chinese goods that could face additional U.S. tariffs.

Headlines: China diplomat says latest U.S. tariffs a further step in wrong direction: media
Description: China's ambassador to the United States, Cui Tiankai, said Washington's latest tariffs on Chinese goods is a further step in the wrong direction, state television reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump says 'we are not in a trade war with China': tweet
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump denied on Wednesday that the United States was in a trade war with China, hours after Beijing slapped tariffs on a list of U.S. imports in retaliation for similar duties levied by the White House one day earlier.

Headlines: China-U.S. trade frictions must be resolved via talks: Chinese official
Description: Trade frictions between China and the United States must be resolved through negotiations, Vice Finance Minister Zhu Guangyao said on Wednesday, while adding that Beijing will continue to hit back if Washington wants to keep up the fight.

Headlines: China deploys soybeans in trade war, but may hit own foot
Description: China will struggle to replace U.S. soybean supplies after implementing an additional 25 percent tariff on American shipments, likely inflicting severe financial pain on domestic companies, analysts and executives at feedmakers said.

Headlines: U.S. escalates China trade showdown with tariffs on $50 billion in imports
Description: The Trump administration on Tuesday raised the stakes in a growing trade showdown with China, targeting 25 percent tariffs on some 1,300 industrial technology, transport and medical products to try to force changes in Beijing's intellectual property practices.

Headlines: China retaliates, slaps duties on U.S. soybeans, planes; markets skid
Description: China hit back quickly on Wednesday against the Trump administration's plans to impose tariffs on $50 billion in Chinese goods, retaliating with a list of similar duties on key U.S. imports including soybeans, planes, cars, beef and chemicals.

Headlines: Kudlow says U.S. trade actions intended to uphold laws and customs of free trade
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's top economic adviser, Larry Kudlow, said on Wednesday that U.S. trade actions against China are aimed at upholding the "laws and customs of free trade."

Headlines: Trade tension may pare U.S. growth 0.1-0.2 percent point: Moody's Analytics economist
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's recent tariffs and retaliation from other nations, in particular China, may reduce domestic economic growth by 0.1 to 0.2 percentage point over the next 12 months, Moody's Analytics' chief economist Mark Zandi said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. Commerce chief Ross: trade talks likely with China
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Wednesday he expects trade actions between the United States and China will likely lead to a negotiated deal, but that it was unclear whether such talks would happen by the end of May or later.

Headlines: Chinese companies react to U.S. tariffs announcement
Description: China hit back on Wednesday at the U.S. government's plan to slap tariffs on $50 billion in Chinese goods, retaliating with a list of similar duties on key U.S. imports, and adding to fears that the world's two largest economies are heading towards a trade war.

Headlines: Boeing shares fall after China announces tariffs on U.S. planes
Description: Boeing shares tumbled 7.2 percent in pre-market trading after China hit back at U.S. tariffs, announcing a raft of duties on key U.S. imports including aircraft.

Headlines: Chinese official says U.S. charge on forced tech transfer is groundless
Description: China's Vice Commerce Minister Wang Shouwen said on Wednesday that the U.S. accusation that foreign firms are forced to transfer technology to China is groundless.

Headlines: Tariffs not the solution for intellectual property theft: MEMA
Description: A trade group representing U.S. auto parts makers said on Wednesday it supported stronger bilateral engagement between the United States and China and that tariffs were not the solution for intellectual property theft.

Headlines: Trump to urge Latam to look to U.S., not China, on trade: official
Description: President Donald Trump, engaged in an escalating confrontation with Beijing over trade, will urge Latin American leaders next week to work with the United States - not China - on trade, a senior U.S. official said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S., China rivalry poses risks, benefits for Latin America
Description: As the trade dispute between the United States and China was gaining steam last month, a half-dozen Chinese dancers and a person in a panda bear suit paraded across a stage inside a hotel lobby in the heart of Argentina's wine country.

Headlines: Dollar, stocks climb in relief rally over trade spat
Description: The U.S. dollar gained and equity markets around the world jumped on Thursday as fears eased of a trade war between China and the United States after Washington expressed a willingness to negotiate.

Headlines: Trump proposes $100 billion more in tariffs on China, cites IP
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said in a statement on Thursday that he has instructed U.S. trade officials to consider $100 billion in additional tariffs on China "in light of China's unfair retaliation" against earlier U.S. tariff actions.

Headlines: Brazil unclear on benefits of U.S.-China trade spat: minister
Description: Brazil's agriculture minister Blairo Maggi said on Thursday that the country has yet to evaluate if there will be any benefits to its exports due to the trade dispute between the United States and China.

Headlines: China launches WTO complaint on U.S. tariffs linked to IP issues
Description: China has sought consultations with the United States, the first step in a WTO dispute, over its announced tariffs on $50 billion worth of Chinese imports on grounds of alleged theft of U.S. intellectual property, the World Trade Organization said on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. willing to talk trade with China, no session set yet - official
Description: The United States is willing to negotiate with China on trade, but only if talks are serious, as previous attempts produced little progress, a senior U.S. official told Reuters late on Thursday as trade tensions between the two nations escalated.

Headlines: Stock futures fall after Trump proposes $100 billion more in tariffs on China
Description: U.S. stock futures fell more than 1 percent late on Thursday after U.S. President Donald Trump said he had instructed U.S. trade officials to consider $100 billion in additional tariffs on China.

Headlines: Key events in rapid escalation of U.S.-China trade dispute
Description: Washington and Beijing are slapping each other with tit-for-tat tariff threats, with U.S. President Donald Trump proposing another escalation of the dispute late on Thursday.

Headlines: Chinese state media slams latest U.S. tariff call as 'ridiculous' attempt at intimidation
Description: Chinese state media on Friday slammed Donald Trump's threat of more trade action against China as "ridiculous" after the U.S President called for an additional $100 billion of tariffs, escalating an already high-stakes trade dispute between the two nations.

Headlines: U.S. expects talks with China as trade fight escalates
Description: The United States voiced willingness on Wednesday to negotiate a resolution to an escalating trade fight with China after Beijing retaliated against proposed U.S. tariffs on $50 billion in Chinese goods by targeting key American imports, but the Chinese ambassador to Washington said it "takes two to tango."

Headlines: China tariffs on U.S. business jets seen a boon for Canada's Bombardier, others
Description: China's plan to slap tariffs on some U.S.-made planes will hit demand for Gulfstream and Boeing business jets but benefit Canada's Bombardier and other rivals seeking a larger share of Asia's biggest market, jet brokers and analysts said.

Headlines: Jet weight puzzle to determine China tariff impact on Boeing
Description: China on Wednesday announced plans to place a 25 percent tariff on certain U.S. aircraft, in a move expected to affect some older Boeing Co narrowbody models, according to documents from China's Ministry of Commerce and the U.S. manufacturer.

Headlines: China seeks WTO dispute resolution with U.S. over steel, aluminum tariffs
Description: China's commerce ministry said on Thursday it has initiated a World Trade Organization (WTO) dispute resolution procedure over U.S. tariffs on its import of steel and aluminum.

Headlines: Trump adviser: Trade moves not intended to hurt U.S. sectors
Description: The Trump administration's recent trade actions toward China were not intended to punish any industries or the markets, but Beijing should shoulder the blame for any hit to the U.S. economy, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Thursday.

Headlines: Spanish judge prevents Swiss bank leaker Falciani from leaving country
Description: Spain's High Court released Swiss bank whistleblower Herve Falciani from custody on Thursday but ordered him to remain in Spain while it considers an extradition request from Switzerland which wants to jail him for industrial sabotage.

Headlines: Trump trade adviser says administration will help farmers: CNBC
Description: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro on Thursday defended U.S. trade action toward China, saying it ultimately would lead to free trade after imbalances are corrected and that the Trump administration would help American farmers who could take an economic hit in the process.

Headlines: India asks Hong Kong to arrest jeweler Nirav Modi in bank fraud
Description: India has asked authorities in Hong Kong to arrest jeweler Nirav Modi, one of the main suspects in a $2-billion fraud at state-run Punjab National Bank , the government said, suggesting it believes the fugitive is in the Chinese territory.

Headlines: 'We can't just trust': The thinking behind Trump's get-tough approach to China
Description: When Liu He, Chinese President Xi Jinping's top economic adviser, came to Washington in late February, he was expected to make arrangements for restarting trade talks that President Donald Trump had put on ice.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers skeptical of promises to shield farmers from trade dispute
Description: U.S. lawmakers and the farm industry were skeptical of the Trump administrationâ€™s promise to shield farmers from the rapidly escalating trade dispute between the United States and China, concerned about the lack of details in protecting the U.S. agricultural export sector now embroiled in the back-and-forth.

Headlines: Oil, stocks slide on Trump's new trade salvo
Description: Crude oil and global equity markets tumbled on Friday after U.S. President Donald Trump upped the ante in a trade dispute with China, reviving investor jitters about the impact a tariff war could have on the world economy.

Headlines: Wall Street ends down 2 percent as U.S.-China trade fears intensify
Description: U.S. stocks dropped about 2 percent on Friday, with the Dow falling more than 570 points, as U.S. President Donald Trump's latest tariff threat on Chinese imports fueled increasing concern over a U.S. trade war with China.

Headlines: China trade dispute could slam U.S. retailers
Description: The Trump administration's trade dispute with Beijing could slam U.S. retailers if tariffs are implemented and lead to higher prices or a shortage of merchandise.

Headlines: White House's Kudlow: China dispute could be resolved in three months
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Friday it was possible that an escalating trade dispute with China could be resolved within three months, but he said President Donald Trump's threat to impose tariffs was not a bluff.

Headlines: Trump threatens more China tariffs, Beijing ready to hit back
Description: China warned on Friday it was fully prepared to respond with a "fierce counter strike" of fresh trade measures if the United States follows through on President Donald Trump's threat to slap tariffs on an additional $100 billion of Chinese goods.

Headlines: China says prepared, won't hesitate to respond if Trump follows through on tariff threat
Description: China said on Friday it is fully prepared to respond after U.S. President Donald Trump instructed trade officials to consider imposing tariffs on another $100 billion worth of Chinese goods.

Headlines: China says will take new measures if U.S. sticks to protectionist trade stance
Description: China's Ministry of Commerce said it would take new comprehensive measures to safeguard the country's interests if the United States sticks to its protectionist behavior, after President Donald Trump threatened an extra $100 billion in tariffs on Chinese imports.

Headlines: ABB hopes for U.S. concessions on tariffs on Chinese special steel
Description: Swiss engineering group ABB hopes the U.S. government will make some concessions on its plan to slap tariffs on steel imports from China, its chief executive told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. treated unfairly vs China at WTO: tweet
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump blasted the World Trade Organization on Thursday, saying the international trade body was "unfair" to the United States while giving China "tremendous perks and advantages," but he offered no evidence or examples to back up his claim.

Headlines: Treasury's Mnuchin: U.S. talking to China, will defend interests - CNBC
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin said on Friday that U.S. officials including himself are in regular communication with China as a tariff dispute escalates between the two countries.

Headlines: South Korea notifies WTO of plans to suspend tariff concessions on U.S. goods
Description: South Korea said on Friday it has notified the World Trade Organization (WTO) that it seeks to suspend tariff concessions on imported U.S. goods worth $480 million, in response to U.S. measures against South Korean imports.

Headlines: Panic! Don't panic! Navigating the trade talk proves dicey
Description: "Don't overreact," President Donald Trump's chief economic adviser told investors on Wednesday, when U.S. stocks were deep in the red over worries about the administration's plan for $50 billion of import duties aimed at China.

Headlines: China's HNA to sell Hilton stake in secondary offering
Description: Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc's main shareholder HNA Tourism Group will sell about 63 million shares of Hilton common stock in a secondary offering, making good on signals it would exit its stake in the U.S. hotel operator.

Headlines: Wall Street rises but pares gains late after report of FBI raid
Description: Wall Street's major indexes rose on Monday as a softer stance by U.S. policymakers on China tariffs powered a rebound from last week's selloff, but stocks pared much of their gains late in the session after a report that the Federal Bureau of Investigation raided the office of President Donald Trump's lawyer.

Headlines: China blames U.S for trade frictions, but Trump voices optimism
Description: China stepped up its attacks on the Trump administration on Monday over billions of dollars worth of threatened tariffs, but U.S. President Donald Trump again voiced optimism the two sides would hammer out a trade deal.

Headlines: Tech group urges U.S. to recruit allies to take on China, not tariffs
Description: A trade group representing top technology companies on Monday told U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin that it opposes the Trump administration's focus on tariffs to try to change China's unfair trade practices.

Headlines: No new NAFTA deal this week, but 80 percent chance for early May: Mexico minister
Description: Mexico's economy minister on Monday said he saw an 80 percent chance of a new NAFTA deal by the first week of May, and said in a TV interview that conditions were not right for reaching an agreement this week.

Headlines: White House adviser says Trump could seek coalition on China trade
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump may be open to forming an international coalition to grapple with Chinese trade issues, his top economic adviser said on Monday, adding that it remained unclear whether the proposed U.S. tariffs on China would eventually materialize.

Headlines: Russia's Rusal debt removed from MarketAxess bond trading platform
Description: Debt issued by Russian company Rusal has been removed from bond trading platform MarketAxess after it was included in a new round of U.S. sanctions against Moscow.

Headlines: Libyan sovereign wealth fund files lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase
Description: Libya's sovereign wealth fund has filed a lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase in a London court, a spokesman for the Libyan Investment Authority (LIA) said on Monday.

Headlines: Uber loses EU court case in fight against French criminal charges
Description: France is entitled to bring criminal proceedings against local managers of ride-hailing app Uber [UBER.UL] for running an illegal taxi service, the EU top court ruled on Tuesday, dealing the Silicon Valley start-up another legal setback.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia and France sign deals worth $18 billion: Al Arabiya TV
Description: Saudi Arabia and France signed 20 economic deals worth more than $18 billion, Al Arabiya TV said on Tuesday as Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman visits Paris, without specifying whether they were full contracts or memorandums of understanding.

Headlines: Exxon, Qatar in talks for potential U.S. shale gas deal: report
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp is in talks with Qatar over a possible deal that could see the country investing in the company's U.S. shale gas resources, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Exclusive: Sinopec USA turns copper buyer to supply China operations - sources
Description: The U.S. unit of China's oil major Sinopec Corp is procuring copper to send to its equipment suppliers in China, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters, a rare move by a Chinese oil company.

Headlines: Trump welcomes Xi's vow to further open China's economy
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday welcomed a promise by Chinese President Xi Jinping to open China's economy further, expressing confidence the world's two largest economies would come through an ongoing trade spat and "make great progress together."

Headlines: Nestle to launch ruby chocolate KitKat in Europe and Americas
Description: Nestle will launch a ruby chocolate version of its KitKat brand in Europe next week after it made its debut this year in Japan and South Korea, the Swiss food group said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Cryptocurrency miners seek cheap energy in Norway and Sweden
Description: Cryptocurrency miners are moving in to Norway and Sweden to take advantage of cheap hydro-electric energy and low temperatures to power and cool their servers.

Headlines: TSX futures rise as trade dispute fears ease
Description: Futures pointed to a higher opening for Canada's main stock index on Tuesday as Chinese President Xi Jinping's promise to lower import tariffs eased concerns about a Sino-U.S. trade war.

Headlines: Wall Street rises as Chinese president eases trade worries
Description: U.S. stocks climbed on Tuesday as investor concerns about rising trade tensions between the United States and China eased after Chinese President Xi Jinping promised to cut import tariffs.

Headlines: White House says China's words encouraging, but need concrete steps
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is encouraged by Chinese President Xi Jinping's promise to further open its economy, but will continue pushing for concrete changes to Beijing's trade policy, the White House said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wall Street falls on Syria concerns, interest rate worries
Description: Wall Street stocks fell on Wednesday as possible U.S. military action against Syria stoked investor concerns about geopolitical risk to the American economy and minutes from the Federal Open Market Committee sparked worries about a more hawkish view on interest-rate increases.

Headlines: South Korea to complete due diligence on GM Korea by early May
Description: South Korea said on Thursday it expects to complete due diligence on General Motors Co's local subsidiary by early May, as the government considers whether to inject taxpayers' money into the U.S. automaker's money-losing unit.

Headlines: Negotiations still best tool in U.S.-China trade row: Perdue
Description: U.S. Agriculture Secretary Sonny Perdue on Wednesday said negotiations were the preferred method for easing trade tensions between China and the United States.

Headlines: Moody's, Fitch see limited impact of U.S. tariffs on Chinese economy
Description: Global rating agencies Moody's Investors Service and Fitch Ratings said on Wednesday the proposed U.S. tariffs will have limited direct impact on China's economy and a negotiated solution is most likely.

Headlines: Trump touts effect of his call with China's Xi on U.S. beef exports
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday said he thinks a conversation he had with China's President Xi Jinping has had an impact on U.S. beef exports to China, where American exporters are now selling "a lot" of beef.

Headlines: China vows to fight back if U.S. escalates trade spat
Description: China's commerce ministry said on Thursday trade negotiations with the United States would be impossible as Washington's attempts at dialogue were not sincere, and vowed to retaliate if U.S. President Donald Trump escalates current tensions.

Headlines: Wall Street gains on earnings optimism, waning Syria jitters
Description: U.S. stocks climbed on Thursday as investors anticipated a strong earnings season and as U.S. President Donald Trump's suggestion that a military strike on Syria may not be imminent ratcheted down geopolitical worries.

Headlines: Stocks, U.S. dollar rise as Trump amends previous comments on Syria
Description: Wall Street led stocks higher globally on Thursday, more than offsetting declines in Asia, as an expected strong earnings season took front seat after U.S. President Donald Trump cast doubt over the timing of his threatened strike on Syria.

Headlines: WeWork snapping up China-based rival Naked Hub
Description: U.S. co-working space provider WeWork Cos said on Thursday it would buy China-based rival Naked Hub to boost its footprint in the world's second largest economy.

Headlines: Ford to ramp up Lincoln rollout in China in bid to catch rivals: sources
Description: Ford Motor Co's premium Lincoln brand plans to build as many as five new vehicles in China by 2022, according to two U.S. sources, in a move to expand sales in the world's largest vehicle market that would also blunt the impact of trade U.S-China trade spats.

Headlines: Bratz maker's CEO bids $890 million for Toys 'R' Us stores
Description: Bratz doll maker MGA Entertainment said on Friday its billionaire founder and chief executive, Isaac Larian, had made an $890 million bid for Toys 'R' Us stores in the United States and Canada.

Headlines: Stocks dip, oil gains as Syria fears go on; U.S. bank shares fall
Description: Oil prices extended recent gains and a gauge of global stocks eased on Friday as concern over a broader conflict in Syria left investors nervous, while U.S. bank shares led Wall Street lower.

Headlines: Airline SAS gauging U.S. sanctions impact on Russia World Cup plans
Description: Scandinavian Airline SAS is assessing the potential impact of U.S. sanctions on plans to fly Denmark's World Cup soccer team to a Russian airport owned by a blacklisted firm, joining two other airlines looking into the issue.

Headlines: Wall Street rises, focus turns to earnings from geopolitics
Description: U.S. stocks closed higher on Monday, with the biggest boosts from technology and healthcare sectors as investors were optimistic about earnings season and appeared less worried about U.S.-led missile attacks in Syria.

Headlines: China's ZTE says assessing implications of U.S. decision
Description: China's ZTE Corp said on Tuesday it was assessing the implications of a U.S. decision to ban American companies from selling components to the Chinese telecom equipment maker.

Headlines: NAFTA meeting on tap; Mexico doesn't want to be used to elude U.S. tariffs
Description: The ministers leading the renegotiation of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) could meet again on Thursday in Washington as they push for quick progress, Mexican Economy Minister Ildefonso Guajardo said on Monday.

Headlines: China tariffs on U.S. business jets no clear boost to rivals: aviation executives
Description: China's planned tariffs on U.S. business jets may do little to buoy rivals despite concerns the moves could create an unequal playing field in the fast-growing China market, aviation executives said in Shanghai on Monday.

Headlines: Milan court suspends Serie A TV rights tender after Sky's request
Description: Sky's Italian unit said on Monday a Milan court had suspended the tender for TV rights of Italy's top flight Serie A soccer matches put on sale by Spain's Mediapro until May 4.

Headlines: Exclusive: Google unveils vetting process for drug rehab ads
Description: Google told Reuters Monday it would resume accepting ads from U.S. addiction treatment centers in July, nearly a year after the Alphabet Inc unit suspended the lucrative category of advertisers for numerous deceptive and misleading ads.

Headlines: Shire sells cancer drugs to Servier for $2.4 billion as Takeda circles
Description: Shire, the London-listed rare diseases specialist that is a potential takeover target for Japan's Takeda Pharmaceutical, is selling its oncology business to unlisted French drugmaker Servier for $2.4 billion.

Headlines: Chinese papers warn against politicizing economics after ZTE ban
Description: Economic issues should not be politicized in order to stifle competition, the official China Daily newspaper said in an editorial on Wednesday after a U.S. decision to ban American firms from selling parts and software to China's ZTE Corp .

Headlines: Exclusive: China seeks trade firewall with U.S. allies in rush of ambassador meetings - sources
Description: China's international trade representative held a series of meetings with the ambassadors from major European nations last week to ask them to stand together with Beijing against U.S. protectionism, according to four sources familiar with the discussions.

Headlines: China currency moves hang in the balance in U.S. trade spat
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's latest complaint about China devaluing its currency is off base. But the yuan could potentially become a major sticking point in efforts to resolve the trade dispute between the world's two biggest economies.

Headlines: ZTE may lose Android software license under U.S. order: source
Description: China's ZTE Corp may not be able to use Google's Android operating system in its mobile devices because of a U.S. Commerce Department export control order, a source familiar with the matter said on Tuesday, adding that ZTE and the Alphabet Inc unit have been discussing the impact of the order.

Headlines: Toys 'R' Us turns down bid for stores from toy maker: source
Description: Bankrupt retailer Toys "R" Us has rejected an $890 million bid for some of its U.S. stores and locations in Canada from the CEO of Bratz doll maker MGA Entertainment Inc, a person familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Arming the world: Inside Trump's 'Buy American' drive to expand weapons exports
Description: In a telephone call with the emir of Kuwait in January, U.S. President Donald Trump pressed the Gulf monarch to move forward on a $10 billion fighter jet deal that had been stalled for more than a year.

Headlines: China's Huawei Tech retrenches in U.S. after years of criticism
Description: China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL], viewed with suspicion in congress as a potential threat to U.S. national security, has laid off five employees at its Washington office and slashed lobbying expenditures, according to sources familiar with the matter and government filings.

Headlines: Exclusive: Chinese exporters concerned about U.S.-China trade spat - survey
Description: As Washington and Beijing face off in a simmering trade dispute, Chinese exporters are expressing concerns about an escalation, although many say they expect the worst to be averted as negotiations continue.

Headlines: ICE Europe says could make Brexit changes quickly
Description: The shift in contracts from London to New York earlier this year showed how the transatlantic Intercontinental Exchange could respond rapidly to Brexit if need be, the bourse's European head said on Wednesday.

Headlines: China's ZTE delays earnings amid confusion over U.S. ban
Description: China's ZTE Corp on Wednesday postponed the release of quarterly earnings, saying it needs time to assess the impact of a U.S. order that bans American companies from selling it parts, which could undermine its ability to manufacture equipment.

Headlines: Oil pulls back from gains; OPEC says glut nearly gone
Description: Oil prices on Thursday hit highs not seen since 2014, built on the ongoing drawdowns in global supply and as Saudi Arabia looks to push prices higher, though U.S. crude gave back gains in the afternoon to finish lower.

Headlines: Consumer activists, experts advise against buying ZTE phones
Description: Consumer activists and technology experts are advising consumers to hold off on buying Android handsets from China's ZTE until the company clarifies whether U.S. sanctions against the company prevent it from providing operating system updates for its devices.

Headlines: Exclusive: China nears first Americas refining capacity as CNPC, Petrobras talks mature - sources
Description: Brazil's state-run oil company is nearing a deal in which China National Petroleum Corp Ltd (CNPC) would invest in an oil refinery in exchange for crude oil, two people with knowledge of the talks told Reuters, potentially giving China its first refining capacity in the Americas.

Headlines: Canada hails progress on crucial autos file at NAFTA talks
Description: Canadian, Mexican and U.S. ministers seeking to revamp the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) have made good progress on the key question of autos, Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland said Thursday as pressure for a deal intensified.

Headlines: Exclusive: Allergan in talks to acquire Shire, competing against Takeda - sources
Description: Botox maker Allergan Plc is in talks to acquire Shire Plc, competing against Japan's Takeda Pharmaceutical Co Ltd for the London-listed drugmaker, two sources familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: China looks to speed up chip plans as U.S. trade tensions boil - sources
Description: China is looking to accelerate plans to develop its domestic semiconductor market amid a fierce trade stand-off with the United States and a U.S. ban on sales to Chinese phone maker ZTE that has underscored the country's reliance on imported chips.

Headlines: U.S. ban on sales to ZTE triggers patriotic rhetoric in China
Description: A U.S. ban on sales of American components to ZTE Corp has unleashed a patriotic backlash in China's cyberspace, highlighting the growing tension between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. sorghum armada U-turns at sea after China tariffs
Description: Several ships carrying cargoes of sorghum from the United States to China have changed course since Beijing slapped hefty anti-dumping deposits on U.S. imports of the grain, trade sources and a Reuters analysis of export and shipping data showed.

Headlines: Factbox: Made in China 2025: Beijing's big ambitions from robots to chips
Description: China is looking to catch up with rivals like the United States and Germany in high-end technology, making a major push with a "Made in China 2025" strategy that identifies 10 key sectors, including robotics, aerospace and clean-energy cars.

Headlines: EU suspects tax fraud at China's new gateway to Europe
Description: European Union and Italian authorities are investigating suspected wide-scale tax fraud by Chinese criminal gangs importing goods via Greece's largest port of Piraeus, a trade gateway between China and Europe, officials said.

Headlines: China's ZTE slams U.S. ban, says company's survival at risk
Description: China's ZTE Corp said on Friday that a U.S. ban on selling parts and software to the company was unfair and threatens its survival, and the mobile phone and telecommunications equipment maker vowed to safeguard its interests through all legal means.

Headlines: Tech tumbles ahead of crucial week for quarterly results
Description: U.S. technology stocks tumbled on Friday ahead of a crucial week of quarterly reports from Alphabet, Facebook and other heavyweights as investors worried that the high-performance sector may be running out of fuel.

Headlines: Exclusive: Lockheed Martin to propose stealthy hybrid of F-22 and F-35 for Japan - sources
Description: U.S. defense contractor Lockheed Martin Corp plans to offer Japan a stealth fighter design based on its export-banned F-22 Raptor and advanced F-35 Lightning II aircraft, two sources said.

Headlines: U.S. companies upbeat about business in Germany: survey
Description: Some 82 percent of U.S. companies operating in Germany expect revenues to increase this year, a survey showed on Friday, despite a brewing trade conflict over the U.S. decision to impose tariffs steel and aluminum imports.

Headlines: U.S. questions COSCO's takeover of California cargo terminal: WSJ
Description: A U.S. national security review has raised concerns about a takeover by China's COSCO Shipping Holdings Co of a large container terminal in Long Beach, California, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.

Headlines: Japan may soften trade stance as U.S. keeps up pressure
Description: Despite calls to resist protectionism and for the United States to rejoin a multilateral trans-Pacific trade pact, Japan is gradually shifting gear to adjust to a trade environment shaken up by U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: China welcomes U.S. to visit China to discuss trade
Description: China on Sunday said it welcomed plans by top U.S. officials to visit the country to discuss trade and economic issues, amid tensions between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: China's ZTE seeks resolution of U.S. export ban
Description: China's ZTE is seeking a resolution to a U.S. ban on selling it parts and software that it has said threatens its survival.

Headlines: Trump's next $100 billion tariff dilemma: hit Wal-Mart or Apple Store?
Description: U.S. consumers may be about to directly feel the effects of the trade fight started by U.S. President Trump with China and other countries this year when a new list of Chinese imports to be taxed is announced in coming days.

Headlines: Stocks fall as U.S. yields rise, commodities tumble
Description: A gauge of global equity markets declined on Monday as U.S. bond yields moved closer to the 3 percent level that has unsettled investors in recent months, while a fall in commodity prices pressured materials stocks.

Headlines: EU seeks to join U.S.-China steel dispute at WTO
Description: The European Union asked on Monday to join a dispute brought by China to the World Trade Organization over U.S. import tariffs on steel and aluminum, just over a week before U.S. President Trump decides whether they should apply to Europe.

Headlines: German engineering trade body calls for new EU trade deal with U.S.
Description: The head of Germany's engineering trade body on Monday called for a fresh attempt at a free trade agreement between the United States and the European Union in the face of steel and aluminum tariffs announced by U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: 'People will revolt': workers say Russia must save sanctions-hit Rusal
Description: Workers at one of Russia's biggest aluminum smelters say their Siberian town is doomed unless Moscow mitigates U.S. sanctions against aluminum giant Rusal, a predicament mirrored across the company's sprawling operations.

Headlines: U.S. fund managers brace for trade war with focus on pricing power
Description: Investors' fears of an all-out trade war between the United States and China is prompting U.S. stock fund managers to hunt for companies that can easily pass on higher costs to their consumers.

Headlines: Mexico minister says NAFTA deal will depend on flexibility
Description: Mexican Economy Minister Ildefonso Guajardo said on Tuesday that agreeing a new North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) deal will depend on the flexibility of negotiations as he prepared to meet his U.S. and Canadian counterparts in Washington.

Headlines: Trump says NAFTA talks going 'nicely,' Canada sees progress on auto rules
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday a new North American Free Trade Agreement could be agreed on quickly, as Canada hailed progress on forging new rules for the auto industry, the pivotal issue in talks to revamp the 24-year-old accord.

Headlines: "Very good chance" of a U.S.-China trade deal: Trump
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday said the United States would likely reach a trade agreement with China and that officials from both sides would sit down for negotiations in a few days.

Headlines: Rusal sanctions seen risk to Kazakh coal venture: Samruk Energy
Description: The Bogatyr Komir coal mining joint venture between Kazakhstan's state-run Samruk Energy and Rusal could face risks linked to U.S. sanctions against the Russian aluminum producer, Samruk said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Volkswagen CEO says China tax hike on U.S. vehicle imports would sting
Description: Volkswagen AG's chief executive Herbert Diess said on Tuesday that a Chinese tariff hike on U.S vehicle imports would be tough for the firm, amid a brewing trade war and threats of punitive tariffs exchanged between Washington and Beijing.

Headlines: VW sales momentum positive in all regions, says CEO
Description: Volkswagen trumpeted a bright start to 2018 at the Beijing auto show on Tuesday and outlined spending plans for electric vehicle and autonomous driving ventures in China.

Headlines: Salesforce announces $2.2 billion French investment as Macron meets Trump
Description: U.S. software company Salesforce will invest more than $2.2 billion in its French business over the next five years, it said on Tuesday, in another sign of America Inc's new love affair with France since President Emmanuel Macron's election.

Headlines: SoftBank to move ride-hailing stakes worth $20 billion to Vision Fund: FT
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group plans to shift more than $20 billion of its investments in top ride-hailing companies including Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL], Ola, Grab and Didi Chuxing into its Saudi-backed Vision technology fund, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: China carmaker GAC says trade war could hurt plans to enter U.S. market
Description: Guangzhou Automobile Group Co Ltd (GAC) on Wednesday said a brewing trade war between China and the United States could hurt the Chinese automaker's plans to break into the U.S. market if tariff barriers were raised.

Headlines: Trump, top aides talk trade with Apple CEO Cook at White House
Description: President Donald Trump and two top aides talked about trade issues with Apple Inc chief Tim Cook on Wednesday as the White House prepares to try to avert a trade war with China, a manufacturing hub for the iPhone maker.

Headlines: Chevron evacuates Venezuela executives following staff arrests
Description: U.S. oil major Chevron Corp has evacuated executives from Venezuela after two of its workers were imprisoned over a contract dispute with state-owned oil company PDVSA, according to four sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Boeing defers Iran deliveries, eases output concerns
Description: Boeing has found new homes for jets it hoped to deliver to Iran this year, further clouding the prospect of quick deliveries as U.S. President Donald Trump considers whether to withdraw from a pact to remove nuclear-related sanctions.

Headlines: Boeing adds German partners for heavy-lift helicopter battle
Description: Boeing has teamed up with 10 German firms as part of its bid to win a 4 billion euro ($4.9 billion) heavy-lift helicopter contract from Berlin, the U.S. company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Shire bid marks Takeda's latest - and biggest - push for global status
Description: Takeda Pharmaceutical Co Ltd's $64 billion bid for London-listed rare disease specialist Shire Plc bolsters its credentials as Japan's most outward facing drugs firm, a mould-breaking image that has been more than a decade in the making.

Headlines: China's ZTE will take 'certain actions' against U.S. ban
Description: China's ZTE Corp said on Wednesday it planned to take "certain actions" under U.S. laws following a ban by the U.S. government on American firms doing business with the company.

Headlines: Comcast backs Sky bid with 23 billion pounds of loans
Description: LONDON (LPC) - US cable operator Comcast Corp said on Wednesday that it is backing its offer for Sky Plc with Â£23bn (US$32.06bn) of loans.

Headlines: Conoco sues to enforce $2 billion award that Venezuela scorns
Description: Venezuela on Thursday scorned a $2.04 billion award to ConocoPhillips over a decade-old nationalization as the U.S. oil producer filed suit in a federal court to enforce the decision.

Headlines: ZTE tells suppliers China trade row may be factor in U.S. ban: source
Description: China's ZTE Corp held a conference call on Wednesday with major suppliers, during which a company representative suggested the trade dispute with Beijing may have been a factor in last week's U.S. order banning American firms from selling goods to the smartphone maker, according to a person familiar with the call.

Headlines: U.S. probing Huawei for possible Iran sanctions violations: sources
Description: U.S. prosecutors in New York have been investigating whether Chinese tech company Huawei [HWT.UL] violated U.S. sanctions in relation to Iran, according to sources familiar with the situation.

Headlines: China's Hollywood romance sours amid trade war, debt fears
Description: When Dalian Wanda, the Chinese conglomerate, announced in 2013 that it would build an $8 billion film studio in China to lure U.S. film producers, it did so with Hollywood flash.

Headlines: From Volkswagen to Bunge, concession holders in Brazil face hefty bill
Description: Companies from Brazilian state oil company PetrÃ³leo Brasileiro SA to commodities giant Louis Dreyfus Company and German car giant Volkswagen AG could face hefty bills after Brazil's Supreme Court this month allowed local governments to charge property taxes to operators of public concessions.

Headlines: German business leaders fear U.S. tariffs after Merkel-Trump talks
Description: German business leaders voiced disappointment on Saturday over the outcome of talks between Chancellor Angela Merkel and U.S. President Donald Trump, saying they feared he would impose tariffs on steel and aluminum imports.

Headlines: Factbox - Who are Hong Kong's top biotech IPO hopefuls?
Description: Biotechs without revenue can apply to list in Hong Kong from Monday under new rules aimed at attracting listings, mostly from China's fast-developing market.

Headlines: U.S. treasury chief: 'Cautiously optimistic' on China trade talks
Description: U.S. and Chinese officials will hold highly anticipated trade talks in China on Thursday and Friday, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin told Fox Business Network, saying he was "cautiously optimistic" about the meeting.

Headlines: Australia corporate watchdog expands legal action against Rio Tinto, former executives
Description: Australia's corporate watchdog said on Tuesday it has expanded legal action against miner Rio Tinto and two former top executives, alleging a failure to recognize an impairment in its Mozambique coal assets in 2012 financial statements.

Headlines: Germany wants wider trade talks with U.S. even if tariffs hit
Description: Germany on Monday dampened hopes that an exemption from U.S. tariffs on steel and aluminum could be extended for European Union countries, but called for trade negotiations to continue regardless of whether the levies are applied.

Headlines: Sprint, T-Mobile merger backed with $38 billion of loans
Description: LONDON (LPC) - T-Mobile US , Deutsche Telekomâ€™s US unit, is backing its US$26bn takeover of Sprint Corp with US$38bn of fully committed loans, the company said.

Headlines: Wall Street rises on optimism on NAFTA deal and China trade
Description: The S&P 500 edged higher on Tuesday after comments from a Trump administration official on trade with China and the Mexican economy minister on the renegotiation of the North American Free Trade Agreement provided cause for optimism.

Headlines: Trump trade chief wants to open China, not change its economic system
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's chief trade negotiator said on Tuesday he was not looking to negotiate changes to China's state-driven economic system in trade talks in Beijing this week but would seek to expose it to more foreign competition.

Headlines: Canada pushes for permanent tariff exemption; industry worried
