Description: Canada will push for a permanent exemption from U.S. steel and aluminum tariffs but the U.S. administration's decision to postpone them is a "step forward", Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Trump trade chief wants to open China, not change its economic system
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's chief trade negotiator said on Tuesday he was not looking to negotiate changes to China's state-driven economic system in trade talks in Beijing this week but would seek to expose it to more foreign competition.

Headlines: U.S. factory activity slows further, tariff concerns grow
Description: U.S. factory activity slowed for a second straight month in April, with manufacturers complaining about rising commodity prices in the wake of the Trump administration's tariffs on steel and aluminum imports.

Headlines: Elliott begins dispute against South Korea over 2015 Samsung merger: government official
Description: U.S. activist fund Elliott Management has begun a legal dispute with South Korea over a controversial 2015 merger of two Samsung affiliates after Elliott lost a proxy battle to block it, a South Korean government official said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Germany wants permanent U.S. tariffs exemption, deeper trade ties
Description: Germany has taken note of U.S. President Donald Trump's decision to postpone the imposition of steel and aluminum tariffs on the European Union and, in principle, still expects a permanent exemption, deputy government spokeswoman Martina Fietz said.

Headlines: Wall Street loses gains from Fed decision on China trade worries
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Wednesday as potential U.S. restrictions on Chinese telecom companies reinforced investor concerns about worsening trade relations between the United States and China.

Headlines: U.S. investment house backs changes at Australia's scandal-hit AMP: Fairfax
Description: The largest shareholder in Australia's AMP Ltd, U.S. investment house Harris Associates, supports the ouster of top executives after damaging revelations of misconduct at the wealth manager, Fairfax Media reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Fujifilm says to file objection against Xerox settlement with shareholders
Description: Japan's Fujifilm Holdings Corp said it would file an objection with a U.S. court over a settlement announced earlier between Xerox Corp and activist shareholders who oppose a $6.1 billion deal between the two companies.

Headlines: Merkel: Europe must get long-term exemption from U.S. tariffs
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Wednesday Europe must get a long-term exemption from U.S. tariffs on metal imports and European Trade Commissioner Cecilia Malmstrom should therefore get a clear mandate from member states for her negotiations.

Headlines: Exclusive: Apollo Global approaches Xerox about possible acquisition - sources
Description: Buyout firm Apollo Global Management LLC has approached Xerox Corp to express interest in a possible acquisition, casting new uncertainty over the U.S. printer company's $6.1 billion sale to Japan's Fujifilm Holdings , people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump praises China's Xi as trade talks begin in Beijing
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday praised his relationship with Chinese President Xi Jinping as officials from the world's two largest economies began trade talks in Beijing, while state media said China would stand up to U.S. bullying.

Headlines: A big trade deal 'unlikely to happen' with Trump's team in China: Former government official
Description: Former Department of Commerce official says a big trade deal "is unlikely to happen," as Trump administration officials visit to China this week.

Headlines: Trump tweets about trade delegation in China
Description: As a U.S. trade delegation arrived in Beijing for talks on Thursday, U.S. President Donald Trump said in a Twitter message, "Our great financial team is in China trying to negotiate a level playing field on trade."

Headlines: China's Xiaomi picks Hong Kong for $10 billion IPO, lifts lid on financials
Description: Chinese smartphone and connected device maker Xiaomi is bringing its blockbuster initial public offering to Hong Kong, where it could raise about $10 billion in the largest listing globally in almost four years.

Headlines: Last man standing: lonely Fed tightening spurs dollar surge
Description: As speculation about interest rate rises and policy 'normalization' in the euro zone, Japan, Britain and China falls away rapidly, the U.S. Federal Reserve's now lonely monetary tightening has suddenly supercharged the dollar.

Headlines: Bank of America to shift 125 British jobs to Ireland ahead of Brexit
Description: Bank of America will relocate up to 125 jobs from Britain mostly to Ireland as it prepares for Britain's exit from the European Union, according to a corporate filing.

Headlines: Trump to decide next steps after 'frank' U.S.-China trade talks: White House
Description: U.S. trade officials had candid trade discussions with their Chinese counterparts, the White House said in statement on Friday following a two-day bilateral meeting in Beijing, adding that President Donald Trump will decide the next steps.

Headlines: China offers to increase U.S. imports, cut tariffs on some products: sources
Description: China has offered to buy more U.S. goods and lower tariffs on some goods including cars as part of negotiations to resolve an escalating trade dispute, according to two sources with knowledge of the matter and a document reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: U.S. trade delegation leaves Beijing: U.S. official
Description: A visiting high-level U.S. trade delegation has left Beijing and is headed back to the United States, a U.S. official told Reuters.

Headlines: China says trade talks with U.S. continuing
Description: China's foreign ministry said on Friday it understood that trade talks with visiting senior U.S. officials were ongoing.

Headlines: U.S. asks China to reduce trade imbalance immediately: WSJ reporter on Twitter
Description: A U.S. trade delegation wants China to cut a bilateral trade imbalance immediately and to stop subsidizing advanced technology, a Wall Street Journal reporter wrote on Twitter on Friday, citing a document issued to the Chinese before talks.

Headlines: Trump team demands China slash U.S. trade surplus, cut tariffs
Description: The Trump administration has drawn a hard line in trade talks with China, demanding a $200 billion cut in the Chinese trade surplus with the United States, sharply lower tariffs and advanced technology subsidies, people familiar with the talks said on Friday.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank to move NY headquarters from Wall Street
Description: Deutsche Bank AG will shift its New York headquarters from Wall Street to a location midtown, at a time when Germany's largest bank is scaling back its U.S. operations.

Headlines: When the U.S. goes it alone, what does the rest of the world do?
Description: Before the financial crisis hit more than a decade ago, the easy way to test the global outlook was to apply the maxim that when the U.S. sneezes the rest of the world catches a cold.

Headlines: Exclusive: Conoco moves to take over Venezuelan PDVSA's Caribbean assets - sources
Description: U.S. oil firm ConocoPhillips has moved to take Caribbean assets of Venezuela's state-run PDVSA to enforce a $2 billion arbitration award over a decade-oil nationalization of its projects in the South American country, according to three sources familiar with its actions.

Headlines: Trump, China's Xi discuss trade ahead of talks next week
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping discussed ongoing trade issues on Tuesday, as both sides continue to position themselves amid a heated feud over tariffs between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: U.S. and China each say the other is wrecking the WTO
Description: China and the United States blamed each other on Tuesday for risking the destruction of the World Trade Organization, with Beijing's ambassador decrying U.S. hostage-taking and Washington's envoy calling China's claims "Alice in Wonderland".

Headlines: Wall Street erases losses after Trump quits Iran deal
Description: Wall Street cut losses to end little changed on Tuesday while energy stocks rallied after U.S. President Donald Trump said the United States would quit the Iran nuclear deal, confirming what many investors had expected.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury's Mnuchin: Revoking Boeing, Airbus licenses to sell jets to Iran
Description: Licenses for Boeing Co and Airbus to sell passenger jets to Iran will be revoked, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Tuesday after President Donald Trump pulled the United States out of the 2015 Iran nuclear agreement.

Headlines: Airbus says needs time to study U.S. decision on Iran
Description: European planemaker Airbus will study U.S. President Donald Trump's decision to pull out of the Iran nuclear accord before responding, the company said on Tuesday, adding that this would take some time.

Headlines: Oil pares losses after U.S. exits Iran deal, dollar off 2018 highs
Description: Crude prices pared losses that earlier on Tuesday ran as deep as 4 percent after U.S. President Donald Trump said the United States will withdraw from the Iran nuclear deal, while the dollar edged off fresh 2018 highs.

Headlines: Wall Street opens higher as oil lifts energy stocks
Description: Wall Street opened higher on Wednesday, with shares of energy companies getting a boost from surging oil prices after President Donald Trump decided to pull the United States out of a nuclear deal with Iran.

Headlines: EU defense of Iran deal brings companies little relief
Description: European governments vowed on Wednesday to try to shield their improved economic ties with Iran from the impact of renewed U.S. sanctions, but business leaders struck a more pessimistic note.

Headlines: French carmaker PSA hopes EU will take common position regarding Iran
Description: French carmaker and Peugeot-manufacturer PSA said on Wednesday that it hoped the European Union would adopt a common position on Iran, following U.S President Donald Trump's decision to pull the U.S. out of a nuclear deal with Iran.

Headlines: MTN says U.S decision on Iran may limit its ability to repatriate cash from Irancell
Description: MTN Group said on Wednesday that U.S. President Donald Trump's decision to pull out of the Iran nuclear accord may limit the South African telecoms firm's ability to repatriate cash from MTN Irancell, sending its shares lower.

Headlines: South Korea says GM deal to ensure it remains in country for at least 10 years
Description: South Korea said on Wednesday that an impending deal with General Motors to refinance its local unit will ensure the U.S. automaker remains in the country for at least 10 years, as its rights to sell shares and assets will be curtailed.

Headlines: Red light: Ford facing hold-ups at China ports amid trade friction - sources
Description: Ford Motor Co's imported vehicles are being held up at Chinese ports, three people with knowledge of the matter told Reuters, underscoring how U.S. goods are facing increased customs scrutiny in China amid a tense trade stand-off.

Headlines: Wall Street surges on higher oil after U.S. quits Iran deal
Description: Wall Street surged on Wednesday as surging oil prices boosted energy stocks following U.S. President Donald Trump's decision the previous day to quit a nuclear agreement with Iran.

Headlines: Oil soars after Trump nixes Iran nuclear deal, stocks rally
Description: Crude oil prices rose more than 3 percent on Wednesday after U.S. President Donald Trump's decision to withdraw from a nuclear accord with Iran, a move that helped lift equity markets as Exxon Mobil, Chevron and other oil majors rallied.

Headlines: Oil edges up at settlement as supply questions vex market
Description: Crude prices ended the session slightly higher on Thursday as investors weighed the potential disruption to oil flows from major exporter Iran in the face of U.S. sanctions.

Headlines: GM to locate new Asia-Pacific headquarters in South Korea: government
Description: General Motors has agreed to set up its Asia-Pacific headquarters in South Korea, in a further commitment by the U.S. automaker to its loss-making local unit, the government said on Thursday.

Headlines: RBS reaches $4.9 billion deal to settle U.S. mortgage bond investigation
Description: Royal Bank of Scotland has agreed to pay a smaller-than-expected $4.9 billion to resolve a U.S. investigation into its sale of mortgage-backed securities, paving the way for a long-awaited return of cash to UK taxpayers who bankrolled its post-crisis survival.

Headlines: GM agrees to stake lock-in, make South Korea regional HQ in rescue deal for unit
Description: General Motors will stay in South Korea for at least 10 years and set up its Asia-Pacific headquarters in the country, government officials said on Thursday, revealing terms of a deal aimed at rescuing the U.S. automaker's struggling GM Korea unit.

Headlines: Walmart Go Back! Some Indian trader, farmer groups decry Flipkart deal
Description: A day after U.S. retail giant Walmart struck its largest deal with a big ticket investment in Indian online marketplace Flipkart, a right-wing Hindu group that fears small traders will suffer staged a protest in New Delhi calling for the deal to be scrapped.

Headlines: U.S. and UAE sign pact to resolve airline competition claims
Description: The United States and United Arab Emirates signed a deal on Friday to resolve U.S. claims that Gulf carriers have received unfair government subsidies, the U.S. State Department said.

Headlines: China Three Gorges launches $10.8 billion bid for Portuguese power firm EDP
Description: China's state-owned utility China Three Gorges on Friday launched a bid to take control of Portugal's biggest company EDP, offering a premium of just below 5 percent on the power firm's closing stock price.

Headlines: Iran aims to buy Airbus jets before sanctions window closes: official
Description: Iran is in contact with European planemaker Airbus to try to use a narrow window available for business following this week's U.S. decision to withdraw from an international nuclear pact, said a senior official.

Headlines: Oil prices fall as Iran nuclear deal retains support
Description: Crude prices fell in a see-saw session on Friday, retreating after early gains as it looked likely that U.S. allies would push to maintain a deal with Iran, which could keep that country's crude exports on global markets.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler CEO says company may 'redirect' Mexican auto exports
Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV Chief Executive Sergio Marchionne said on Friday proposed changes to automotive rules by the U.S. government may prompt the Italian-American automaker to shift exports of the company's Mexican-made vehicles.

Headlines: Walmart may launch IPO for Flipkart in as early as four years
Description: Walmart Inc said on Saturday in a filing with a U.S. regulator that it may take India's Flipkart public in as early as four years, detailing for the first time a potential listing timeline for Walmart's largest-ever acquisition.

Headlines: Bayer CFO sees lower Monsanto synergies after divestments: Boersen-Zeitung
Description: Bayer's potential synergies from buying U.S. rival Monsanto will be lower than $1.5 billion because of anti-trust divestments, the German company's Chief Financial Officer told Germany's Boersen-Zeitung.

Headlines: Conoco authorized to seize $636 million in Venezuela PDVSA assets
Description: WILLEMSTAD Reuters - - A Curacao court has authorized ConocoPhillips to seize about $636 million in assets belonging to Venezuela's state oil company PDVSA due to the 2007 nationalization of the U.S. oil major's projects in Venezuela.

Headlines: Trump asked Commerce chief to look into limits on China's ZTE: White House
Description: President Donald Trump asked Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross to look into U.S. restrictions placed on Chinese telecommunication company ZTE Corp , a White House spokesman said on Monday, calling the limits "an issue of high concern for China."

Headlines: Trump defends intervention to help China telecom company ZTE
Description: President Donald Trump on Monday defended his decision to revisit penalties for Chinese company ZTE Corp for flouting U.S. sanctions on trade with Iran, saying the telecom maker is a big buyer for U.S. suppliers.

Headlines: Wall St. ekes out gains as trade optimism pressured by defensive stocks
Description: Wall Street ended a choppy session slightly higher on Monday as weakness in defensive stocks offset optimism following U.S. President Donald Trump's conciliatory remarks toward China's ZTE Corp that calmed the waters of U.S.-China trade tensions.

Headlines: Trudeau, Trump discussed bringing NAFTA talks to conclusion: PM's office
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday discussed the possibility of bringing talks over the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) to a "prompt conclusion", Trudeau's office said.

Headlines: Gap apologizes for selling T-shirt with 'incorrect map' of China
Description: U.S. retailer Gap Inc apologized on Monday for selling a T-shirt which it said had an incorrect map of China, adding it would implement "rigorous reviews" to prevent a repeat mistake.

Headlines: JPMorgan applies to set up majority-owned securities business in China
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co said on Monday it has applied to China's securities regulator to set up a securities business in which the U.S. bank would own a majority stake under recently relaxed ownership rules.

Headlines: China says appreciates U.S. position on ZTE
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Monday the country appreciated the U.S. position on ZTE Corp, following a pledge by President Donald Trump to help the firm "get back into business, fast."

Headlines: Uber names new UK boss as it battles to keep London licence
Description: Uber appointed a new boss for its UK business on Monday, as the taxi-hailing app fights to keep its drivers on the streets of London, its most important European market.

Headlines: In concession, Trump will help China's ZTE 'get back into business'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump pledged on Sunday to help ZTE Corp "get back into business, fast" after a U.S. ban crippled the Chinese technology company, offering a job-saving concession to Beijing ahead of high-stakes trade talks this week.

Headlines: Global banks signal pragmatism over EU access after Brexit
Description: Top banks in London have begun lobbying to improve the European Union's existing system of market access after the bloc's officials dismissed British calls for a bespoke Brexit deal.

Headlines: Thomson Reuters to move forex derivatives to Dublin due to Brexit
Description: Thomson Reuters Corp said on Tuesday it would transfer its $300 billion-a-day foreign exchange derivatives trading business to Dublin from London ahead of Britain's departure from the European Union next year.

Headlines: Iceland's Wow Air to launch low cost, long haul flights to India
Description: Iceland's transatlantic budget carrier Wow Air plans to launch cut-price flights between Delhi and North America, the airline's CEO said, in an effort to attract cost conscious travelers in India - the world's fastest-growing aviation market.

Headlines: Taiwan seeks 'correction' after Air Canada lists Taipei as part of China
Description: Taiwan's foreign ministry has asked Air Canada for a "speedy correction" following the airline's decision to list Taipei, the capital of Taiwan, as a part of China on its booking website, according to a statement from the ministry on Tuesday.

Headlines: Soros foundation to shut its office in 'repressive' Hungary
Description: Billionaire George Soros's pro-democracy foundation said on Tuesday it would shut its office in Budapest and move to Berlin, leaving what it called "an increasingly repressive political and legal environment" in Hungary.

Headlines: White House's Kudlow: Not certain what U.S. will do on China's ZTE: Politico
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Tuesday it was far from certain what steps the U.S. government would take on China's ZTE Corp, which he characterized as an enforcement, rather than trade, issue.

Headlines: U.S., Japan to 'move rapidly' on trade deal: Hagerty
Description: The United States and Japan will "move rapidly" to get a trade deal under a new framework aimed at intensifying bilateral trade consultations, U.S. ambassador William Hagerty said, keeping pressure on Tokyo to open up protected markets like agriculture.

Headlines: Soros university says will stay in Budapest after foundation leaves
Description: Central European University, a graduate school started by U.S. billionaire George Soros, said on Tuesday it would stay in Hungary's capital despite a decision by its founder's foundation to leave.

Headlines: U.S. chipmaker Intel submits plans for $5 billion Israel expansion
Description: Intel Corp said on Tuesday it had submitted plans to expand its production operations in Israel, with the government saying the U.S. chipmaker would invest about $5 billion.

Headlines: China's customs says has stepped up inspections of U.S. pork imports
Description: China's customs said on Monday it had ramped up inspections of U.S. pork and had taken unspecified regulatory steps on high-risk waste imports, confirming earlier Reuters reports.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's Tianqi nears $4.3 billion deal to buy stake in Chile's SQM - sources
Description: China's Tianqi Lithium is nearing a deal to buy a 24 percent stake in Chile's Sociedad Quimica Y Minera (SQM) , one of the world's biggest lithium producers, for about $4.3 billion, two people close to the transaction said.

Headlines: Highlights: Hedge funds chomped on FAANGs during first quarter tech turmoil
Description: The following are some hot stocks including the so-called FAANG technology stocks - Facebook Inc , Amazon.com , Apple Inc , Netflix Inc and Google parent Alphabet Inc - as well as other companies in which hedge fund managers either took new stakes, adding to or exiting existing positions in the first quarter, filings with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wall St. drops as Treasury yields surge
Description: A surge in U.S. government bond yields to their highest level in almost seven years sent Wall Street shares sliding on Tuesday after strong retail sales data stoked inflation concerns and investors fretted about looming trade talks between the United States and China.

Headlines: Dollar extends rally, euro weak; political risk jolts Italian markets
Description: The U.S. dollar rallied further to a five-month high on Wednesday, supported by relatively robust U.S. economic data in recent days, while Italy's borrowing costs jumped and its stocks slid on concerns linked to economic plans from the country's potential coalition government.

Headlines: NAFTA deal still possible from end-May onwards: Guajardo
Description: Mexico's economy minister Ildefonso Guajardo said on Wednesday that he would not rule out reaching a deal to agree a new North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) from the end of the month onwards, even if it was not possible this week.

Headlines: Exclusive: Norway not happy with Gazprom-OMV asset swap deal: energy minister
Description: Norway is not happy with an asset swap deal between Austria's OMV and Gazprom that would give the Russian gas giant access to the Norwegian continental shelf, the minister in charge of approving the deal has told Reuters in Norway's first comments on the matter.

Headlines: Australia's trade minister says China ties a priority after recent 'differences'
Description: Australia's trade minister will use a visit to China this week to reinforce ties with his country's largest trading partner, he said on Wednesday, following a recent souring in relations.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers push back on Trump talk of helping China's ZTE
Description: U.S. lawmakers on Tuesday rejected any plan by President Donald Trump to ease restrictions on China's ZTE Corp , calling the telecommunications firm a security threat and vowing not to abandon legislation clamping down on the company.

Headlines: FBI chief says agency 'deeply concerned' about any company like China's ZTE
Description: FBI Director Christopher Wray told a Senate panel on Wednesday that the law enforcement agency is "deeply concerned" about any company like China's ZTE gaining positions of power in the U.S. telecommunications market.

Headlines: U.S., China to launch trade talks; China hawk Navarro's role reduced: officials
Description: The United States and China launch trade talks on Thursday in a bid to avert a damaging tariff war, with the White House's harshest China critic relegated to a supporting role, senior Trump administration officials said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Canada's Trudeau says feeling positive about NAFTA talks
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Thursday said he felt positive about talks to update the NAFTA trade pact, which U.S. officials say need to be wrapped up very quickly for the current Congress to vote on a final text.

Headlines: China said to offer $200 billion U.S. trade deficit reduction package
Description: China has offered U.S. President Donald Trump a package of proposed purchases of U.S. goods and other measures aimed at reducing the U.S. trade deficit with China by some $200 billion a year, U.S. officials familiar with the offer said.

Headlines: NAFTA nations 'nowhere near' a deal: USTR Lighthizer
Description: The top U.S. trade official on Thursday poured cold water on the prospect of an imminent breakthrough in talks to rework the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) hours after Canada's prime minister struck a positive note.

Headlines: Trump: China, other nations have become 'spoiled' on trade
Description: President Donald Trump said on Thursday that China and other countries had become "very spoiled" on trade, as U.S. and Chinese officials hold high-level talks in Washington on trade ties.

Headlines: White House adviser expects China to bring proposal to trade talks
Description: White House chief economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Thursday that he expects China to bring a proposal to trade talks in Washington this week, and said that would "extend the conversation and permit additional negotiations."

Headlines: China approves Toshiba's sale of $18 billion chip unit to Bain consortium
Description: Toshiba Corp said on Thursday that China regulators have approved the $18 billion sale of its chip unit to a consortium led by U.S. private equity firm Bain Capital, marking the end to a year-long saga surrounding its most prized asset.

Headlines: Blood but not much treasure: Vivendi's European media crusade
Description: French tycoon Vincent Bollore's stated goal to create a southern European media empire faces defeat in Italy, despite pumping 5 billion euros ($5.9 billion) into his biggest foreign conquest, raising questions over whether the strategy ever existed.

Headlines: Japan buys 3 vessels of sorghum amid China-U.S. trade spat: sources
Description: Japanese buyers have bought between 150,000 and 180,000 tonnes of U.S. sorghum carried by three vessels previously bound for China amid a trade spat between Beijing and Washington, five industry sources with knowledge of the deals told Reuters.

Headlines: Japan plans retaliatory tariffs against United States: NHK
Description: Japan is considering tariffs on U.S. exports worth $409 million in retaliation against steel and aluminum import tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump, media reported on Thursday.

Headlines: China vice premier says proactively seeking resolutions on trade dispute with U.S.: Xinhua
Description: China's Vice Premier Liu He said China was proactively seeking appropriate resolutions on the trade dispute with the United States during his visit of Washington, official Xinhua News Agency reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Staying close to home, Infineon to build new chip plant in Austria
Description: Germany's Infineon Technologies plans to build a 1.6 billion euro ($1.9 billion) chip facility in Austria, in a major strategic bet on Europe at a time of growing trade and political uncertainty in Asia.

Headlines: Snail cream, smelly fruit: Thai cosmetics, food firms tap into Chinese tourism boom
Description: The label on the pink and white box of face cream sold in a Bangkok hypermarket proudly declares that it is based on a "snail secretion filtrate moisture system". The Snail White branding - plus some positive internet reviews - is enough to have Chinese tourists recently lining up to buy the slime-infused product.

Headlines: U.S., China talks focus on cutting trade gap, $200 billion target disputed
Description: China is "meeting many" Trump administration demands to cut its trade surplus with the United States, but a definitive deal to resolve deep trade differences could take a while to develop, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. could take 'very harsh' changes in case of China's ZTE: White House adviser
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross is having a second look at trade remedies in the case of China telecommunications company ZTE Corp "and if there are any structural changes in their case, they will be very harsh," White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow told Fox Business Network on Friday.

Headlines: China retreats from U.S. sorghum probe amid global market havoc
Description: China dropped its anti-dumping probe into imports of U.S. sorghum on Friday, beating a hasty retreat from a dispute that wreaked havoc across the global grain market and raised concerns about rising costs and financial damage at home.

Headlines: ADM has resold most U.S. sorghum shipments that were bound for China
Description: Most of agricultural trader Archer Daniels Midland Co's sorghum shipments to China had been diverted and resold to other markets when Beijing dropped an anti-dumping probe into U.S. imports of the grain on Friday, a company spokeswoman said.

Headlines: Oil prices fall, Brent set for sixth week of gains
Description: Oil prices fell on Friday, but Brent crude was on track for a sixth straight week of gains, boosted by plummeting Venezuelan production, strong global demand and looming U.S. sanctions on Iran.

Headlines: China offering Trump package to slash U.S. trade deficit, officials say
Description: China is offering U.S. President Donald Trump a package of trade concessions and increased purchases of American goods aimed at cutting the U.S. trade deficit with China by up to $200 billion a year, U.S. officials familiar with the proposal said.

Headlines: China's buyers balk at U.S. corn on trade fears, GMO controls
Description: China's purchases of U.S. corn have slowed significantly due to worries the grain might be drawn into the trade spat between the world's two largest economies, and as Chinese customs keeps the brakes on clearances for cargoes, four traders told Reuters.

Headlines: China agrees to import more from U.S., no sign of $200 billion figure
Description: China has agreed to significantly increase its purchases of U.S. goods and services, the two countries said on Saturday, but made no mention of a $200 billion target the White House had touted earlier.

Headlines: U.S. stocks futures open higher with possible China trade war on hold
Description: U.S. stock future opened higher on Sunday after Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Sunday that the United States and China agreed to drop their tariff threats to work on a wider trade agreement.

Headlines: U.S., China putting trade war on hold, Treasury's Mnuchin says
Description: The U.S. trade war with China is "on hold" after the world's largest economies agreed to drop their tariff threats while they work on a wider trade agreement, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Sunday.

Headlines: German companies worry Trump moving toward 'America Alone'
Description: German companies are concerned that U.S. President Donald Trump is increasingly thinking only of America rather than just putting his country first, the head of Germany's DIHK Chambers of Commerce told media.

Headlines: Wall St. rises on trade war truce; industrials lead
Description: U.S. stocks rose on Monday and gains in industrials helped propel the Dow to a more than two-month closing high, after a truce between the United States and China calmed fears that a trade war might be imminent.

Headlines: U.S. Commerce chief to travel to China next week: Mnuchin
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross will travel to China next week to help finalize a trade agreement after Washington and Beijing reached an initial framework last week, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump says China to buy more U.S. farm products, offers no details
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday said China had pledged to buy "massive amounts" of American agricultural products but gave no other details about planned commitments from Beijing following U.S.-China trade talks last week.

Headlines: Trade war fears ebb as U.S., China agree to continue talks
Description: Washington and Beijing both claimed victory on Monday as the world's two largest economies stepped back from the brink of a global trade war and agreed to hold further talks to boost U.S. exports to China.

Headlines: Italy must present Monte dei Paschi exit plan by 2019: CEO tells paper
Description: Italy must present the European Commission with a plan for its exit from lender Monte dei Paschi by 2019, Chief Executive Marco Morelli told daily Corriere della Sera.

Headlines: Japan, Russia, Turkey bring potential U.S. tariff retaliation to $3.5 billion
Description: Japan, Russia and Turkey have warned the United States about potential retaliation for its tariffs on steel and aluminum, the World Trade Organization said on Tuesday, bringing the total U.S. tariff bill to around $3.5 billion annually.

Headlines: Trump says there is no deal with China to lift ban on ZTE Corp
Description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday said there is no deal with China on ZTE Corp, as lawmakers from both parties worked to block him from easing penalties on the Chinese telecommunications company.

Headlines: China, U.S. near deal on ZTE reprieve; Beijing cuts auto tariffs
Description: Washington neared a deal to lift its ban on U.S. firms supplying Chinese telecoms gear maker ZTE Corp, sources said on Tuesday, and Beijing announced tariff cuts on car imports, further easing trade tensions between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: U.S. Senate's top Democrat warns on relaxation of U.S. sales ban on ZTE
Description: The top Democrat in the U.S. Senate on Tuesday warned against relaxing a U.S. order banning American companies from supplying Chinese telecommunications firm ZTE Corp, saying it would be a capitulation to Beijing by the Trump administration.

Headlines: Wall St. slips on U.S.-China trade talk uncertainty; energy falls
Description: U.S. stocks ended lower on Tuesday, weighed down by lingering uncertainty over the outcome of trade talks between the United States and China and declines in energy and industrial shares.

Headlines: China's ZTE estimates at least $3.1 billion loss from U.S. sanctions: Bloomberg
Description: China's ZTE Corp is estimating losses of at least 20 billion yuan ($3.1 billion) due to Washington's ban on U.S. firms supplying the telecommunications firm, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday, citing unnamed sources.

Headlines: Germany says up to U.S. to avoid damaging trade row escalation
Description: The European Union has reached out to the United States to talk about strengthening free and fair trade within the framework of the World Trade Organisation and it is up to Washington to respond, Germany's economy minister said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: Joint ventures in China may be a thing of the past
Description: Jim Cramer explains how U.S. companies may soon sell products directly in China, and it could be huge.

Headlines: European shares eye four-month high, Italy sell-off relents
Description: European shares inched toward four-month highs on Tuesday, as an easing of pressure on Italy's debt markets coincided with China's latest move to open up its giant economy to the rest of the world.

Headlines: U.S. farmers plow ahead with plantings as China trade war fears ebb
Description: U.S. farmers said they would push ahead with plantings planned before U.S.-China trade tensions eased and, now that the two countries have resumed talks, take a wait-and-see approach to President Donald Trump's promises for more sales to China.

Headlines: China signals to state giants: 'Buy American' oil and grains
Description: China will import record volumes of U.S. oil and is likely to ship more U.S. soy after Beijing signalled to state-run refiners and grains purchasers they should buy more to help ease tensions between the two top economies, trade sources said on Wednesday.

Headlines: China's Sinopec to boost U.S. crude imports to all-time high: sources
Description: Sinopec, Asia's largest refiner, will boost U.S. crude oil imports to an all-time high as China tries to reduce its trade deficit with the United States, two sources with knowledge of the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: China fines Muji for packaging that lists Taiwan as a country
Description: Japanese retailer Muji has been fined 200,000 yuan (23,445 pounds) in Shanghai for using packaging that lists Taiwan as a country, underscoring China's growing sensitivity to how companies refer to the self-ruled island.

Headlines: Tesla trims up to $14,000 off Model X in China after tariff cuts
Description: Tesla Inc has slashed up to $14,000 off its Model X in China after Beijing announced major tariff cuts for imported automobiles, a potential sales boost for the U.S. firm as the world's largest auto market pivots towards electric cars.

Headlines: Republicans in Congress slam Trump probe of auto imports
Description: Some of President Donald Trump's fellow Republicans in the U.S. Congress said on Thursday that his administration's national security investigation of car and truck imports amid a trade spat with China is being pursued under false pretenses and could hurt U.S. consumers.

Headlines: Olympics: Taxi! Tokyo tackles tourist boom with accessible cab
Description: Tokyo's taxi industry is undergoing some radical changes as Japan, already dealing with unprecedented levels of tourism, gears up to host two major sporting events in the next 26 months.

Headlines: U.S. Commerce's Ross to visit China for trade talks in early June
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross will visit China early next month for another round of talks amid ongoing trade frictions between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: Oil slips further below $80/bbl on talk OPEC may lift output
Description: Oil prices fell about $1 on Thursday, with expectations building that reduced supplies from Venezuela and Iran could prompt OPEC to wind down output cuts in place since the start of 2017.

Headlines: China says has good potential in cooperation with Germany in new energy cars, AI
Description: China's commerce ministry said on Thursday that the nation has good potential in cooperation with Germany in sectors such as digitalization, new energy cars, artificial intelligence and driverless cars.

Headlines: China's Premier Li says China and Germany uphold free trade
Description: China's Premier Li Keqiang said on Thursday China has always supported a unified and prosperous Europe and that China and Germany uphold free trade.

Headlines: U.S. auto import probe borders on 'provocation': Germany's DIHK
Description: A U.S. decision to launch a national security investigation into car imports marks a further low point in business ties with Europe and will hit both manufacturers and consumers, Germany's DIHK Chambers of Industries and Commerce said on Thursday.

Headlines: Uber will soon detail plan to stop using diesel cars in London
Description: Uber [UBER.UL] said it will provide more information in the coming weeks on how it plans to stop diesel using cars in London and of a proposed scrappage scheme, as the court date nears for the taxi app to defend its right to operate in London nears.

Headlines: Indian state seeks permanent closure of Vedanta's copper smelter: officials
Description: India's Tamil Nadu state said on Thursday that it was seeking a permanent closure of a big copper smelter run by London-listed Vedanta Resources after 13 people died in protests demanding the closure of the plant on environmental grounds.

Headlines: Mexico minister: 40 percent chance of NAFTA deal before July election
Description: There is about a 40-percent chance of concluding the renegotiation of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) before Mexico's presidential election on July 1, Mexican Economy Minister Ildefonso Guajardo said on Friday.

Headlines: Canada's Trudeau raises U.S. auto import probe concerns with Trump
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke with U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday and raised "strong concerns" about a U.S. probe into car and truck imports that was launched this week, the prime minister's office said.

Headlines: Japan's PM defends its automakers against U.S. import probe
Description: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said on Monday he would seek to convince President Donald Trump of the crucial role his country's automakers play in boosting the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Bombardier launches longer-range variants of Global business jets
Description: Canada's Bombardier Inc on Sunday announced two new longer-range variants of its existing large-cabin Global business jets, which the company expects to generate higher revenues during a time of recovering appetite for corporate planes.

Headlines: Tencent chairman pledges to advance China chip industry after ZTE 'wake-up' call: reports
Description: Tencent Holdings chairman pledged to advance China's semiconductor industry, saying the blow to ZTE Corp from Washington's ban on U.S. firms supplying telecommunications company was a "wake-up" call, local media reported.

Headlines: Oil hits multi-week lows on fears of growing supplies
Description: Oil prices extended losses on Monday as Saudi Arabia and Russia said they may increase supplies while U.S. production gains showed no sign of slowing.

Headlines: EU trade chief to meet U.S. peers Ross, Lighthizer in Paris on Wednesday
Description: Europe's top trade official Cecilia Malmstrom will meet U.S. counterparts Wilbur Ross and Robert Lighthizer in Paris on Wednesday, two days before a temporary reprieve from U.S. steel and aluminum tariffs is due to expire.

Headlines: Germany seeking deal to end EU-U.S. trade dispute
Description: Germany is seeking to end a dispute between the United States and the European Union over President Donald Trump's decision to impose high tariffs on steel and aluminum imports, Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said on Monday.

Headlines: Wall Street shares slide with Italy in focus
Description: U.S. stock markets tumbled on Tuesday, on downbeat trading guidance from JP Morgan and worries over Italy putting the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average on track for their biggest one-day drops in seven weeks.

Headlines: Wall Street falls on Italy worries; bank shares drop
Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average registered their biggest one-day percentage drops in a month on Tuesday as political turmoil in Italy sparked concerns about the stability of the euro zone and shares of U.S. banks tumbled.

Headlines: Exclusive: Mexico central bank ready for election, could support peso-Diaz de Leon
Description: Mexico's central bank is prepared for different scenarios resulting from the country's July 1 presidential vote, central bank chief Alejandro Diaz de Leon said late on Monday, adding that policymakers could act to support the peso if liquidity dries up.

Headlines: U.S. and China clash over 'technology transfer' at WTO
Description: Chinese and U.S. envoys sparred at the World Trade Organization on Monday over U.S. President Donald Trump's claims that China steals American ideas, the subject of two lawsuits and a White House plan to slap huge punitive tariffs on Chinese goods.

Headlines: Nestle plans to cut up to 500 IT jobs in Switzerland
Description: Nestle plans to eliminate up to 500 information technology jobs at its Swiss home base as its shifts work to an existing tech hub in Spain and other locations, the food and beverage giant said on Tuesday.

Headlines: France's Iliad ventures into Italy with low-price mobile offer
Description: French telecoms operator Iliad launched its first foray outside France on Tuesday when it presented its new low-price mobile offer for Italy as it looks to offset weakness at home.

Headlines: Canada vows to 'respond appropriately' to any U.S. steel tariffs
Description: Canada will "respond appropriately" to any U.S. steel and aluminum tariffs, Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland said on Wednesday, less than two days before the punitive measures are due to kick in.

Headlines: India's RCom plans $2.68 billion asset sale to Jio, Brookfield in next few weeks
Description: India's Reliance Communications (RCom) said on Wednesday it expects to complete its asset sale to Reliance Jio Infocomm and Canada's Brookfield in coming weeks, after the bankruptcy appeals court halted insolvency proceedings against the debt-laden company.

Headlines: Wall Street rebounds as Italy worries ease; energy shares soar
Description: U.S. stocks ended higher on Wednesday, and the S&P 500 and Dow registered their biggest daily percentage gains since May 4, on signs of easing political turmoil in Italy and as a surge in oil prices boosted energy stocks.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. bill would force tech companies to disclose foreign software probes
Description: U.S. tech companies would be forced to disclose if they allowed American adversaries, like Russia and China, to examine the inner workings of software sold to the U.S. military under proposed legislation, Senate staff told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: How Kinder Morgan won a billion-dollar bailout on Canada pipeline
Description: U.S. energy firm Kinder Morgan's C$4.5 billion sale of an oil pipeline to Canada's government marked an extraordinary escape from months of fraught negotiations among warring camps of Canadian officials.

Headlines: Trump giving Japan's Abe a hard time on trade despite close ties
Description: Tariffs on steel, threats of car import levies and intense pressure for a two-way economic deal: despite warm personal ties, U.S. President Donald Trump is giving Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe a decidedly tough time on trade.

Headlines: PSA production move wins deal with German unions, angers French
Description: French carmaker PSA Group said on Wednesday it will move production of the Opel Grandland X model from France to Germany under a deal with Opel unions, drawing immediate criticism from domestic workers' representatives.

Headlines: China vows to protect its interests from 'reckless' U.S. trade threats
Description: China lashed out on Wednesday at renewed threats from the White House on trade, warning that it was ready to fight back if Washington was looking for a trade war, days ahead of a planned visit by U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross.

Headlines: China's commerce ministry says U.S. trade delegation arrives
Description: A U.S. trade delegation arrived in Beijing on Wednesday for negotiations, China's commerce ministry said.

Headlines: China slams surprise U.S. trade announcement, says ready to fight
Description: China on Wednesday lashed out at Washington's unexpected statement that it will press ahead with tariffs and restrictions on investments by Chinese companies, saying Beijing was ready to fight back if Washington was looking to ignite a trade war.

Headlines: NXP shares fall as China's warning revives concerns over Qualcomm deal
Description: Shares of NXP Semiconductors NV fell 5 percent on Wednesday after China's latest warning against U.S. trade threats dulled hopes of an early approval by Beijing for Qualcomm's $44 billion acquisition of the chipmaker.

Headlines: Canada to impose tariffs on U.S., challenge at WTO
Description: Canada will impose retaliatory tariffs on C$16.6 billion ($12.8 billion) worth of U.S. exports and challenge U.S. steel and aluminum tariffs under the North American Free Trade Agreement and the World Trade Organization (WTO), Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland said on Thursday.

Headlines: Trade conflict undermines investor confidence
Description: Investor concerns over U.S. trade policy overshadowed worries about political instability in Italy, driving equity prices lower on Thursday.

Headlines: NAFTA deal very difficult before Mexico election: Guajardo
Description: Mexico's economy minister said on Thursday that it would be "very difficult" to reach a deal to revamp NAFTA before Mexico's July 1 presidential election.

Headlines: U.S. tariff move breaks international law: German finance minister
Description: The U.S. decision to impose tariffs on Canadian, EU and Mexican steel and aluminum flies in the face of international law, German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. Commerce Department to announce section 232 tariff changes
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross will hold a news briefing at 9 a.m. (1300 GMT) to announce "Section 232" national security-related tariff modifications, the U.S. Commerce Department said in a statement on Thursday.

Headlines: Air India sale gets no bid, exposes hurdles for Modi's divestment drive
Description: India's offer to sell a stake in Air India failed to draw a single bid by the Thursday deadline, underlining the challenges it faces in fixing the debt-laden state carrier and meeting a broader target of stake sales in government-held firms.

Headlines: Mexico says will continue NAFTA talks with US despite tariffs
Description: Mexican Foreign Minister Luis Videgaray said on Thursday that the country will continue negotiating with the United States to revamp the North American Free Trade Agreement despite "unjust and unilateral" tariff measures by the U.S. government.

Headlines: China-backed Mediapro has no intention to resell French soccer rights: manager
Description: Spain's Mediapro will not resell the broadcasting rights it has won for France's main soccer competition, betting that its new dedicated TV channel will be distributed by other groups instead, its manager said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. justification of steel tariffs is 'grotesque': German steel body
Description: Germany's steel industry association said justifying U.S. steel tariffs based on national security concerns is "grotesque", after the U.S. announced it was moving ahead with 25 percent tariffs on steel imports from the European Union.

Headlines: As Trump talks of trade losses, China is a win for U.S. East Coast ports
Description: For America's fastest growing East Coast ports, trade with China equals billions of dollars of investment and thousands of well-paid jobs in the heart of Trump country and not, as the president portrays it, the death knell for America's middle class.

Headlines: UK PM May 'deeply disappointed' at U.S. tariff move
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday she was deeply disappointed by the U.S. move to apply tariffs to EU steel and aluminum imports.

Headlines: U.S. Commerce chief proceeding with China trade trip: officials
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross will be in Beijing this weekend for trade talks with senior Chinese officials as previously planned, two administration officials familiar with the trip said on Friday.

Headlines: UK PM May 'deeply disappointed' at U.S. tariff move
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday she was deeply disappointed by the U.S. move to apply tariffs to EU steel and aluminum imports.

Headlines: Brazil says U.S. tariffs and quotas unjust, still open to negotiate
Description: The Brazilian government said U.S. quotas and tariffs that went into effect on Friday on Brazil's steel and aluminum exports to the United States were unjustified, but said it remains open to negotiate a solution that benefits industries in both countries.

Headlines: Crude retreats on trade concerns as dollar strengthens
Description: Oil prices retreated on Friday after strengthening early in the session as U.S. President Donald Trump's remarks on trade led the dollar to strengthen against other currencies, weakening greenback-denominated commodities including crude.

Headlines: Trump discussed rebalancing trade with France's Macron: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday discussed addressing a trade imbalance with Europe on a call with France's President Emmanuel Macron, the White House said on Friday, one day after the Trump administration announced it would levy steel and aluminum tariffs on the European Union.

Headlines: Trump blasts Canada over trade, hints at lumber action
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday fired back at Canada after Ottawa and other American allies retaliated against Washington's steel and aluminum tariffs, and appeared to threaten possible action against Canada's lumber industry.

Headlines: Nomura gets trading licence for new Frankfurt unit ahead of Brexit
Description: Nomura has been granted a securities trading licence for its new Frankfurt-based unit by German regulator Bafin as it prepares for Brexit, Japan's largest brokerage said on Friday.

Headlines: Where's the data? Angst for commods traders as China trade figures held in limbo
Description: Commodities traders have been waiting more than a week for China to release overdue monthly import-export data, frustrating many market watchers and fuelling speculation about reasons for the delay.

Headlines: U.S. Commerce chief set for China trade talks amid metals tariff rancor
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross is proceeding with plans for trade talks in Beijing on Saturday, U.S. officials said, after the Trump administration launched steel and aluminum tariffs on Western allies and renewed its tariff threats against China.

Headlines: U.S. jobs report brightens prospects for stocks, dollar
Description: World stocks and the U.S. dollar rose while Treasury debt prices fell on Friday as investors welcomed a stronger-than-expected American jobs report and an apparent end to a political crisis in Italy, although prospects for a full-blown global trade war limited the gains.

Headlines: Salzgitter sees limited impact from U.S. steel tariffs
Description: Salzgitter, Germany's second-largest steelmaker, says tariffs slapped on steel imports by the U.S. government will have a limited impact on its business.

Headlines: U.S. trade mission seeking structural changes to China's economy: Mnuchin
Description: The Trump administration is pursuing structural changes in China's economy as part of trade talks under way in Beijing, in addition to increased Chinese purchases of American goods, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Saturday.

Headlines: U.S. commerce secretary, Chinese vice premier to hold dinner meeting on Sat: U.S. official
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross will have a dinner meeting with Chinese Vice Premier Liu He on Saturday evening at Beijing's Diaoyutai State Guest House, a U.S. government official said.

Headlines: U.S. might have to exempt some German steels from tariffs: minister
Description: The United States might have to exempt certain types of steel made in Germany from import tariffs especially if U.S. firms dependent on special metals struggle to find locally-produced alternatives, a German minister said.

Headlines: U.S. commerce secretary says China meetings friendly, frank
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Sunday that his meetings in China have been friendly and frank.

Headlines: Talks end with China warning trade benefits at risk if U.S. imposes tariffs
Description: China warned the United States on Sunday that any agreements reached on trade and business between the two countries will be void if Washington implements tariffs and other trade measures, as the two ended their latest round of talks in Beijing.

Headlines: Trump aide says Canada's Trudeau overreacting to trade dispute
Description: Trade frictions between the United States and Canada are a "family quarrel," President Donald Trump's economic adviser said on Sunday, brushing aside concerns expressed by Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau as an overreaction.

Headlines: Highlights of Merkel interview on Europe
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel gave her most detailed response to French President Emmanuel Macron's proposal to reform the euro zone in an interview with the Frankfurter Allgemeine Sonntagszeitung newspaper published on Sunday.

Headlines: Exclusive: After deadly Indian smelter protests, arrests stoke tension
Description: Eleven days after police in southern India fired on protesters seeking the shutdown of a copper smelter owned by London-listed Vedanta , killing 13, residents say people suspected of involvement in the demonstrations are being targeted in a wave of arrests.

Headlines: China warns U.S. trade benefits hinge on stopping tariffs
Description: If the United States implements trade sanctions including tariffs then all outcomes of the China-U.S. trade talks will be void, state news agency Xinhua said on Sunday following high-level trade discussions in Beijing.

Headlines: Jetmakers race to meet Sydney-London non-stop challenge
Description: Planemakers gave a glimpse of the ultra-long-distance jets of the future on Sunday as they work to meet a demanding goal from Australia's Qantas to connect Sydney and London in a non-stop 20-hour flight.

Headlines: U.S. CFTC proposes rule to keep higher threshold for swap dealers
Description: The U.S. derivatives regulator on Monday proposed maintaining the existing cutoff for U.S. firms to register as swaps dealers, backing off an earlier plan that would have subjected more firms to stricter oversight under the 2010 Dodd-Frank financial reform law.

Headlines: France's PSA suspends joint ventures in Iran to avoid U.S. sanctions
Description: French carmaker PSA Group has begun to suspend its joint venture activities in Iran to avoid U.S. sanctions after Washington's withdrawal from the international nuclear deal.

Headlines: SocGen says to pay $1.3 billion to settle U.S., French probes
Description: Societe Generale said on Monday it had agreed to pay around $1.3 billion in penalties to authorities in the United States and in France to resolve investigations into its transactions in Libya and its handling of money market rates.

Headlines: With maple syrup tariff, Canada-U.S. trade dispute spills beyond metals
Description: Canada's retaliation against U.S. President Donald Trump's steel and aluminum tariffs includes proposed duties on maple syrup, a nod to a national symbol and a powerful industry in the French-speaking province of Quebec that could hurt producers in Maine.

Headlines: Canada faces significant risks from U.S. tax, trade policy: IMF
Description: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) said on Monday that while Canada's economy has performed well, it faces significant risks including trade tensions and a potential hit to competitiveness from lower U.S. corporate taxes.

Headlines: SocGen to pay $1.3 billion to settle Libya, Libor probes
Description: French bank Societe Generale will pay $1.3 billion to resolve criminal and civil charges in the United States and France for bribing Gaddafi-era Libyan officials and manipulating the Libor interest rate benchmark, U.S. authorities said on Monday.

Headlines: With deal to close this week, Bayer to retire Monsanto name
Description: Germany's Bayer will wrap up the $63 billion takeover of Monsanto on Thursday and also retire the U.S. seeds maker's 117 year-old name.

Headlines: BHP process to unload U.S. shale operations could take until 2019
Description: The planned exit of BHP Billiton Ltd from its U.S. shale business has drawn oil companies and private equity firms into a competition that may have no clear winner until late this year or early next year, according to people familiar with the negotiations.

Headlines: Societe Generale to pay over $860 million to resolve bribery, Libor manipulation cases
Description: Societe Generale S.A. will pay over $860 million to resolve criminal charges in the U.S. and France for bribing Gaddafi-era Libyan officials and manipulating the Libor rate, the U.S. Department of Justice said on Monday.

Headlines: China's Xiaomi plans $3 billion CDRs in blockbuster July IPO: sources
Description: HONG KONG (Reuters/IFR) - Chinese smartphone and connected device maker Xiaomi plans to raise up to 30 percent of its blockbuster $10 billion IPO by selling shares in mainland China while offering the remainder in Hong Kong, said people with knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Trade war turns Canada's G7 summit into six-plus-Trump
Description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau this week plays host to a summit of the Group of Seven leading industrialized nations with six of the seven members outraged at the United States over a slew of recent moves by President Donald Trump.

Headlines: China says in principle door is open to trade talks with U.S.
Description: China's door to talks is open in principle, the country's Foreign Ministry said on Monday, a day after Beijing warned that any trade and business deals reached with Washington would be void if the United States implemented tariffs.

Headlines: Expect disagreements over tariffs at G7 summit: Canada official
Description: The Group of Seven leading industrial nations at its summit this week is poised to disagree over U.S. metals tariffs, which have infuriated Canada and European Union members of the bloc, a Canadian official said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Brent gains after touching one-month low on supply concerns
Description: Brent crude reversed losses on Tuesday, after hitting its lowest price in nearly a month following a report the U.S. government asked Saudi Arabia and other major exporters to increase oil output.

Headlines: Mexico firms eye workaround on U.S. metals tariffs; consumers in bind
Description: Mexican firms will need to cut deals with suppliers and consider buying goods elsewhere once a conflict over U.S. steel and aluminum import tariffs starts to bite, even as consumers are seen ultimately picking up the tab from any higher prices.

Headlines: Factbox: Plans for electric car battery production in Europe
Description: China's BYD is looking at launching battery production in Europe, the latest Asian battery maker aiming to make inroads in Europe as Brussels seek to build a home-grown industry to fuel a surge in electric car production.

Headlines: StanChart plans to bring Asian operations under two main hubs
Description: Standard Chartered is drawing up plans to consolidate its Asian operations into two hubs - one in Hong Kong and one in Singapore - in order to better manage its capital, a source familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Ex-State Street executive cheated clients with secret fees: U.S. prosecutor
Description: A former State Street Corp executive directed a fraudulent scheme to overcharge several of the bank's clients, including Kuwait's sovereign wealth fund, by applying secret commissions to billions of dollars' worth of trades, a U.S. prosecutor told jurors on Tuesday.

Headlines: Oil falls on U.S. crude build; global supply seen rising
Description: Oil prices fell on Wednesday on worries that global supply is climbing after U.S. inventories rose unexpectedly and Saudi Arabia and other big producers signaled that they may increase output.

Headlines: Oil vs wild rice: Enbridge, opponents gear up final U.S. pipeline push
Description: Canada's Enbridge Inc faces an indefinite delay to its biggest-ever capital project if a U.S. state regulator denies its preferred pipeline route through Minnesota, but a victory would spell relief for Canadian oil shippers and northern U.S. refiners.

Headlines: Mexico's Walmex says same-store sales up 7.2 percent in May
Description: Mexico's biggest retailer, Wal-Mart de Mexico , said on Wednesday that same-store sales in Mexico rose in May by 7.2 percent.

Headlines: Congress has few options to stop Trump from saving China's ZTE
Description: There is little Congress can do to stop President Donald Trump if he wants to relax penalties on ZTE Corp , despite strong bipartisan opposition to easing restrictions on China's No. 2 telecommunications equipment maker.

Headlines: G7 likely to discuss global economy, concerns about U.S. trade policy: Japan's Suga
Description: Japan's top government spokesman said on Wednesday that the Group of Seven leaders were likely to discuss the global economy and concerns about U.S. trade policy.

Headlines: Mexico minister sees more than 50 percent chance of initial NAFTA deal this year
Description: Mexico's economy minister said on Tuesday that he sees a better than 50 percent chance of reaching an agreement in principle on NAFTA this year despite escalating tensions between his country and the United States.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's ZTE signed preliminary agreement to lift U.S. ban: sources
Description: ZTE Corp has signed an agreement in principle that would lift a U.S. Commerce Department ban on buying from U.S. suppliers, allowing China's No. 2 telecommunications equipment maker to get back into business, according to sources familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Fujifilm could walk away from Xerox deal if no progress for six months
Description: Japan's Fujifilm Holdings Corp said on Thursday it may have no choice but to abandon a $6.1 billion merger with Xerox Corp if there is no progress in talks with the U.S. firm's new board for about half a year.

Headlines: Ford plans to close Bordeaux plant if no buyer found
Description: Ford plans to close its Blanquefort gearbox plant in southwestern France if no buyer can be found for the site, which employs 900 workers, the U.S. carmaker said on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump sticks with hard line on trade as showdown looms at G7
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is not backing down from the tough line he has taken on trade, the White House's top economic adviser said on Wednesday, setting the stage for a showdown with top allies at this week's G7 summit in Canada.

Headlines: U.S. senator queries Alphabet, Twitter on ties with Huawei
Description: A senior U.S. senator said on Thursday that he has asked Google parent Alphabet Inc and Twitter Inc for information about any data sharing agreements they have with Chinese vendors, after Facebook Inc this week disclosed such partnerships with several Chinese companies.

Headlines: Chinese phone maker ZTE saved from brink after deal with U.S.
Description: Chinaâ€™s No. 2 telecommunications equipment maker ZTE secured a lifeline from the Trump administration on Thursday after agreeing to pay a $1 billion fine and overhaul leadership in a deal that will lift a ban on its doing business with U.S. suppliers.

Headlines: New Zealand allows fired NBC host Matt Lauer to keep his farm
Description: The New Zealand government ruled on Friday that former U.S. "Today Show" co-host Matt Lauer can keep his farm in the country, saying there was currently "insufficient evidence" he had failed required character tests for overseas investors.

Headlines: OPEC likely to reject Iran request for discussion of U.S. sanctions
Description: OPEC is likely to reject a request by Iran to discuss U.S. sanctions against Tehran at this monthâ€™s meeting of the oil producer group, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Oil falls on concerns over rising supply, weaker demand
Description: Oil prices fell on Friday as concerns about surging U.S. output and falling demand in China weighed on the contract and JP Morgan cut its price forecast.

Headlines: Canada's Freeland holds firm on tariff retaliation at G7
Description: Talks among top world leaders at the Group of Seven summit have so far been cordial, but Canada will not change its mind when it comes to illegal U.S. steel and aluminum tariffs, Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland said on Friday.

Headlines: France's Macron sees way forward on trade, Trump says working together
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Friday it was possible to make progress on trade issues that have split the United States and its allies after meeting with U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Trump, Macron cool down the buddy act at Canada's G7
Description: It was only six weeks ago when U.S. President Donald Trump and French President Emmanuel Macron grinned, laughed, and hugged their way through a state visit in Washington, showing all the signs of two leaders with a genuine friendship.

Headlines: Trump says does not endorse G7 communique, after 'weak' Trudeau comments
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday that he has asked U.S. representatives not to endorse the joint communique put out by the Group of Seven leaders after Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's "false statements" at a news conference.

Headlines: Canadian PM open to compromise on disputed NAFTA sunset clause
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Saturday rejected a U.S. demand for a sunset clause in NAFTA but said he was prepared to compromise on the issue, which is holding up talks to update the 1990s-era pact.

Headlines: In battle of tweets, Canada's Trudeau dismisses Trump critique
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said nothing in his G7 news conference that he has not said before to U.S. President Donald Trump, his office said after Trump criticized Trudeau on Twitter as "weak and dishonest" in the wake of the Group of Seven summit.

Headlines: After G7, Japan's Abe says no country benefits from protectionism
Description: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said on Saturday that no country benefits from protectionism, and that all measures should be consistent with World Trade Organization rules, as he wrapped up a sometimes contentious summit with other Group of Seven leaders in Canada.

Headlines: One 'rant,' rough talks sour G7 mood in confrontations with Trump
Description: The Group of Seven leaders came to their summit in Canada braced for battle, and while everyone had smiles ready for the cameras, behind the scenes U.S. President Donald Trump delivered a "rant" and recriminations on trade to U.S. allies, leaving the once united club deeply divided.

Headlines: After a year of nice, Trump brings Trudeau to brink of trade war
Description: In the end, the long charm offensive by Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to avoid the ire of U.S. President Donald Trump failed just hours after success seemed closest, with Trump raining insults as Trudeau closed what seemed like a triumphant global summit.

Headlines: UK's May: welcomes G7 agreeing to maintain Russia sanctions
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May welcomed a G7 statement that recognized the need to maintain sanctions on Russia on Saturday, after U.S. President Donald Trump floated the suggestion that the country be allowed back in the group.

Headlines: Italy's anti-elite prime minister plays by rules at G7 club
Description: Italy's new anti-elite Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte played by the rules at the Group of Seven industrialized nations summit, leaving none of the club's members unhappy in his debut on the international stage in Canada.

Headlines: U.S.-Canada dispute escalates after tense G7; Trump renews criticism of Trudeau
Description: The United States and Canada swung sharply on Sunday toward a diplomatic and trade crisis as top White House advisers lashed out at Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau a day after U.S. President Trump called him "very dishonest and weak."

Headlines: 'Fair trade now fool trade', Trump vents anger on NATO allies, Trudeau
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump issued a volley of tweets on Monday venting anger on some of Washington's closest NATO allies over the United State's trade deficit, following a divisive G7 meeting in Canada.

Headlines: Trump torpedoes G7 effort to ease trade spat, threatens auto tariffs
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump threw the G7's efforts to show a united front into disarray after taking aim at Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, adding he might double down on import tariffs by hitting the sensitive auto industry.

Headlines: After 'difficult' G7 summit, UK's May warns against unilateral action on trade
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday that a meeting of the Group of Seven leaders in Canada had been "difficult" and that countries had to avoid taking unilateral action in order to protect the global trading system.

Headlines: U.S. reveals ZTE settlement details, ban still in place
Description: ZTE Corp's settlement with the U.S. Commerce Department that would allow China's No. 2 telecommunications equipment maker to resume business with U.S. suppliers was made public on Monday, days after the company agreed to pay a $1 billion fine, overhaul its leadership and meet other conditions.

Headlines: 'Fair trade, fool trade', Trump's tweets spew ire on NATO allies, Trudeau
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump fired off a volley of tweets on Monday venting anger on NATO allies, the European Union and Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau in the wake of a divisive G7 meeting over the weekend.

Headlines: Foxconn says investigating labor conditions at China factory used for Amazon
Description: Contract manufacturer Foxconn said on Sunday it is investigating a plant in China that makes devices for Amazon.com Inc , after a U.S. watchdog group criticized what it described as harsh working conditions at the factory.

Headlines: Pompeo says confident G7 ties will move forward despite clash
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Monday he was confident that relations between the United States and G7 countries would continue to move forward, in spite of a major clash over trade at a weekend summit in Canada.

Headlines: Trump, Trudeau swap jokes but hold firm in trade dispute
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau were all jokes and smiles for the media as they met at the Group of Seven leaders summit in Quebec on Friday, but neither budged on the serious trade dispute between them.

Headlines: Blackstone in agreement to acquire Australia's Investa Office Fund for $2.3 billion
Description: Australia's Investa Office Fund (IOF) and Blackstone Group on Wednesday entered into a scheme implementation agreement through which the U.S. private equity giant would acquire real estate investment trust for A$3.08 billion ($2.3 billion).

Headlines: Malaysia says U.S. to monetize and return assets seized from 1MDB probe
Description: The U.S. ambassador to Malaysia has told Kuala Lumpur that assets seized by the United States as part of its probe into the 1MDB fund will be monetized and returned to Malaysia, the Southeast Asian nation's finance minister said.

Headlines: Senate, White House gear up for battle over China's ZTE
Description: Legislation to block the Trump administration's agreement allowing China's ZTE Corp to resume business with American suppliers could be killed in the U.S. Congress in the coming weeks, lawmakers and aides said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump, Iran spar over oil prices ahead of OPEC meeting
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Iran exchanged sharp words over oil prices on Wednesday, with Trump blaming OPEC for high oil prices and Tehran accusing him of stoking volatility after he withdrew last month from a global nuclear arms deal with Iran.

Headlines: Euro falls most since Brexit as ECB delays rate hikes into 2019
Description: The euro on Thursday suffered its worst day against the dollar since the UK's Brexit vote nearly two years ago after the European Central Bank unexpectedly indicated that it planned to keep interest rates at record lows into the summer of 2019.

Headlines: Trump sets $50 billion in China tariffs with Beijing ready to strike back
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump announced hefty tariffs on $50 billion of Chinese imports on Friday as Beijing threatened to respond in kind, in a move that looks set to ignite a trade war between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: British M&A booms two years on from Brexit vote
Description: Deal-making involving UK companies has picked up in the two years since the country's decision to leave the European Union, defying worries that Brexit would stifle mergers and acquisition activity, data from Thomson Reuters Deals Intelligence shows.

Headlines: Trump announces 25 percent tariff on Chinese technology
Description: President Donald Trump on Friday announced that the United States will implement a 25 percent tariff on $50 billion of goods from China related to intellectual property and technology, and pledged to impose further levies if the Asian nation takes retaliatory measures.

Headlines: Ford's China struggle continues as May vehicle sales slump 29 percent
Description: Ford Motor Co's struggle to boost sales in China showed no sign of ending soon with volumes for May sliding 29 percent despite steps being taken by the U.S. automaker like appointing a new sales leader and readying launches of new products.

Headlines: As trade war with China looms, U.S. readies second wave of duties
Description: The United States has nearly completed a second list of tariffs on $100 billion in Chinese goods, as President Donald Trump prepares to enact an initial round of duties that is expected to trigger an in-kind response from Beijing, several sources said.

Headlines: Pipe dream? Chevron, Woodside vie to shape Australia's LNG sector
Description: After spending a decade and billions of dollars developing Australia's vast gas reserves, U.S. energy giant Chevron Corp and local firm Woodside Petroleum are at odds over the pace and timing of the next leg of expansion.

Headlines: Chinese ride-sharing giant Didi picks Australia for first Western foray
Description: Didi Chuxing Technology Co Ltd, the Chinese ride-sharing company that bought the mainland operations of Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL], will begin offering its service this month in Australia, its first foray in a Western-style country.

Headlines: China announces anti-dumping measures on some chemical product imports
Description: China will apply temporary anti-dumping measures to hydroiodic acid products originating from Japan and the United States, its commerce ministry said on Saturday.

Headlines: At odds with Trump over trade, Canadians say they will avoid U.S. goods: poll
