Description: A top White House adviser warned China on Friday not to underestimate U.S. President Donald Trump's resolve in a brewing trade battle between the world's two largest economies, showing little concern over Beijing's threat to impose retaliatory tariffs on $60 billion worth of U.S. goods.

Headlines: China's Unipec suspends U.S. oil imports as trade spat intensifies
Description: China's Unipec, the trading arm of state oil major Sinopec, has suspended crude oil imports from the United States due to a growing trade spat between Washington and Beijing, three sources familiar with the situation said on Friday.

Headlines: White House: Open to further talks with China on trade
Description: The White House said on Friday the United States is open to further talks with China on how to resolve a tit-for-tat trade dispute between Washington and Beijing.

Headlines: China plans tariffs on $60 billion of U.S. goods in latest trade salvo
Description: China proposed retaliatory tariffs on $60 billion worth of U.S. goods ranging from liquefied natural gas (LNG) to some aircraft on Friday, as a senior Chinese diplomat cast doubt on prospects of talks with Washington to solve their bitter trade conflict.

Headlines: Upbeat earnings lift stocks as trade fears cap gains and pressure dollar
Description: Stocks around the world advanced on Friday on strong earnings, with consumer staples results boosting Wall Street, though a trade spat between the United States and China along with weaker-than-expected U.S. jobs numbers capped gains and weighed on the dollar.

Headlines: China tariffs on LNG, oil aim at U.S. energy dominance agenda
Description: China's proposed tariffs on U.S. liquefied natural gas and crude oil exports opens a new front in the trade war between the two countries, at a time when the White House is trumpeting growing U.S. energy export prowess.

Headlines: Wall Street gains as upbeat earnings trump trade jitters
Description: U.S. stocks advanced on Friday as upbeat earnings helped investors shrug off heightened trade anxieties and weaker-than-expected July jobs growth.

Headlines: Facing U.S. tariff threat, Toyota warns car costs could rise
Description: Toyota Motor Corp on Friday said higher U.S. auto tariffs would ramp up the cost of vehicles produced locally along with those imported to the United States from Japan, which would have a "big impact" on its bottom line.

Headlines: Race is on for second place after Apple's $1 trillion valuation
Description: Amazon , Microsoft and Alphabet are locked in a tight race to become the second publicly-listed U.S. company to reach a $1 trillion stock market value after Apple became the first to touch the 13-digit milestone.

Headlines: For investors in Russia, U.S. sanctions will not pack the same punch as before
Description: A threat to impose sanctions on Russian sovereign debt transactions is one of the biggest financial weapons that the U.S. can deploy against the Kremlin, but Moscow's slide down the investment league table in recent years means the move will not pack the punch it once would have.

Headlines: Japan weighs sovereign wealth fund for U.S infrastructure investment: Nikkei
Description: Japan is considering creating a sovereign wealth fund to invest in U.S. infrastructure projects and U.S.-Japan joint projects in third countries and will float the idea at two-way trade talks in Washington next week, the Nikkei daily reported on Friday.

Headlines: Indonesia to hand over yacht linked to 1MDB to Malaysia
Description: Indonesia has agreed to hand over to Malaysia a $250 million luxury yacht it impounded in Bali earlier this year in connection with a corruption scandal at a Malaysian state fund, Indonesian authorities said on Saturday.

Headlines: China won't accept U.S. trade 'blackmail': state media
Description: China's state media said on Saturday the government's retaliatory tariffs on $60 billion of U.S. goods showed rational restraint and they accused the United States of blackmail.

Headlines: Indonesia lobbies U.S. to maintain special tariff treatment
Description: Indonesia lobbied visiting U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo to keep the Southeast Asian nation on a list of countries that receive preferential trade terms, its foreign and trade ministers said on Sunday.

Headlines: China state media attacks Trump on trade in unusually harsh terms
Description: China's state media on Monday lashed out at the policies of U.S. President Donald Trump in an unusually direct attack, accusing him of "starring in his own carefully orchestrated street fighter-style deceitful drama".

Headlines: Indonesia hands yacht linked to 1MDB over to Malaysia
Description: Indonesia handed over to Malaysia on Monday a $250 million luxury yacht, impounded earlier this year as part of an international hunt for assets purchased with billions of dollars allegedly siphoned off from state fund 1Malaysia Development Bhd.

Headlines: Trump's trade 'extortion' won't work, China state media says
Description: Chinese state media on Monday lambasted U.S. President Donald Trump's trade policies in an unusually personal attack, and sought to reassure investors anxious about China's economy as growth concerns battered its financial markets.

Headlines: U.S. argues judge failed to take its arguments into account in AT&T trial
Description: The U.S. government said on Monday the judge in the trial to stop AT&T Inc's purchase of Time Warner failed to take into account how companies negotiate with each other and seek to maximize profits in considering the Justice Department's arguments about how the deal would decrease competition.

Headlines: Haier sees costs spike at GE arm amid steel tariffs, U.S.-China trade spat
Description: China's Haier Group said rising steel prices amid hefty U.S. import tariffs was driving up costs for its business in America, and warned that consumers stood most to lose from a mounting trade spat between the world's top two economies.

Headlines: Global stocks rise on China boost, S&P 500 nears record; oil gains
Description: Equity markets around the world neared a six-month high on Tuesday, buoyed by a rebound in Chinese stocks and an earnings-driven surge on Wall Street, while oil prices rose on concerns U.S. sanctions against Iran could cause supply shortages.

Headlines: Amazon and Microsoft nudge S&P 500 closer to record high
Description: The S&P 500 inched nearer to a record high on Tuesday, lifted by Amazon, Alphabet and Microsoft, and by a strong second-quarter earnings season that fueled optimism about the U.S. economy's strength.

Headlines: Toshiba posts record quarterly profit on chip sale, outlook unclear
Description: Japan's Toshiba Corp reported a record quarterly net profit on Wednesday, thanks to the $18 billion sale of its flash memory chip business earlier this year to a consortium led by U.S. private equity firm Bain Capital.

Headlines: China's HNA to sell over $2 billion Avolon stake to Orix: sources
Description: China's HNA Group Co Ltd is in advanced talks to sell a 30 percent stake in aircraft lessor Avolon Holdings Ltd to Japan's Orix Corp , two sources said, as the company attempts to restructure and trim stakes even in its core assets.

Headlines: UniCredit has stopped using Facebook for advertising: CEO
Description: Italy's UniCredit has stopped using Facebook for advertising and marketing campaigns and will not do so again until the U.S. giant improves its ethical standards, the bank's CEO said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Factbox: European companies respond to latest Iran sanctions
Description: New U.S. sanctions against Iran took effect on Tuesday, and President Donald Trump, who defied Washington's allies to impose them, pledged that companies doing business with Tehran would be barred from doing business with the United States.

Headlines: Daimler abandons Iran expansion plans as sanctions bite
Description: German car and truck manufacturer Daimler on Tuesday said it has dropped plans to expand its Iran business in reaction to renewed U.S. sanctions, which come into effect on Tuesday.

Headlines: India doubles import tax on textile products, may hit China
Description: India doubled the import tax on more than 300 textile products to 20 percent on Tuesday as the world's biggest producer of cotton tries to curb rising imports from China.

Headlines: Nestle sees no direct implications on business from Iran sanctions
Description: Nestle sees no direct fallout from renewed U.S. sanctions on Iran, the world's biggest food company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Chinese exports accelerate even as Trump escalates trade war
Description: China's exports surged more than expected in July despite U.S. duties and its closely watched surplus with the United States remained near record highs, as the world's two major economic powers ramp up a bitter dispute that some fear could derail global growth.

Headlines: Indian regulator clears Walmart's $16 billion acquisition of Flipkart
Description: India's anti-trust regulator has approved U.S. retail giant Walmart Inc's $16 billion acquisition of online marketplace Flipkart, beefing up the competition to Amazon.com Inc in the fast growing e-commerce market.

Headlines: Factbox: Impact of U.S.-China trade tariffs on U.S. companies
Description: U.S. companies are putting in place measures to cushion the impact of escalating trade tensions between the United States and China.

Headlines: Tariffs on Chinese goods could batter the U.S. vaping industry
Description: Proposed tariffs on U.S. imports from China of electronic cigarettes, known as vaping products, could not come at a worse time for the industry.

Headlines: Factbox: European companies respond to latest Iran sanctions
Description: New U.S. sanctions against Iran took effect on Tuesday and President Donald Trump, who defied Washington's allies to impose them, pledged that companies doing business with Tehran would be barred from doing business with the United States.

Headlines: China to slap additional tariffs on $16 billion of U.S. goods
Description: China is slapping additional tariffs of 25 percent on $16 billion worth of U.S. imports from fuel and steel products to autos and medical equipment, the Chinese commerce ministry said, as the world's largest economies escalated their trade dispute.

Headlines: Khamenei says Iran does not have anything to be concerned about
Description: Iran's utmost authority Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said the Islamic Republic had nothing to be concerned about, a report on his official website said on Wednesday, as the country's clerical leadership faces biting U.S. sanctions.

Headlines: HSBC shifts European branches to French unit control ahead of Brexit
Description: HSBC has shifted ownership of its Polish and Irish subsidiaries from its London-based entity to its French unit, and will do so for seven more European branches, as it prepares for Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headlines: China soybean prices spike as trade war worries feed supply fears
Description: China's soybean and soymeal prices jumped on Wednesday, with beans posting their biggest daily gain in a decade, as data showing a drop in soybean imports stirred supply concerns as a bitter trade dispute between Washington and Beijing plays out.

Headlines: Ford to launch new basic SUV as part of China revival effort
Description: Ford Motor said on Wednesday it will launch in China early next year a new â€œentry-levelâ€ sport utility vehicle developed jointly with a local partner, as the U.S. automaker attempts to revive its slumping business in the worldâ€™s biggest auto market.

Headlines: China's July exports rise more than expected despite U.S. tariffs
Description: China's exports growth unexpectedly accelerated in July despite fresh U.S. tariffs, while its trade surplus with the United States remained near record highs as Beijing and Washington ramped up a bitter dispute that has rattled financial markets.

Headlines: U.S. sanctions slam Russian ruble, Turkey's lira tumbles
Description: New U.S. sanctions against Moscow drove down Russia's ruble, while worries that Turkey was sliding into a full-blown economic crisis battered the lira on Thursday, but global equity markets largely shrugged off the turmoil to edge higher.

Headlines: Factbox: China tariffs on revised list of $16 billion U.S. goods
Description: China said on Wednesday that it is slapping additional tariffs of 25 percent on $16 billion worth of U.S. imports from fuel and metals to autos and medical equipment, as the world's largest economies escalated their trade dispute.

Headlines: Papa John's cuts costs for North America franchisees as sales fall
Description: Papa John's International Inc on Friday said it would lower royalties and fees charged to its U.S. and Canadian franchisees as sales at the U.S. pizza chain decline following the acrimonious exit of it founder.

Headlines: Iran official says gas field contract with Total, CNPC unchanged: SHANA
Description: A gas field development contract with France's Total , and China's state-owned CNPC remains unchanged, a senior Iranian oil official said according to the oil ministry news agency SHANA on Saturday - hours after state new agency IRNA quoted him as saying CNPC had taken Total's share in the project.

Headlines: U.S. soybean cargo docks in Chinese port after weeks at anchor amid trade row
Description: A ship carrying soybeans from the United States docked in the port of Dalian on Saturday, more than a month after it arrived off China's coast just as hefty tariffs were imposed on U.S. goods, according to Thomson Reuters Eikon shipping data.

Headlines: Brazil's Congress should weigh in on Embraer-Boeing deal: lawmaker
Description: Brazil's Congress should be consulted on a plan for U.S. planemaker Boeing Co to take over the commercial jet unit of Embraer SA , the speaker of Brazil's lower house of Congress said in a newspaper interview published on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. hedge funds bet on retail, tech in second-quarter as economy sizzled
Description: Prominent hedge fund managers appeared to make big second-quarter bets that the U.S. economy would continue to expand despite increasing concerns about a broadening trade dispute between the United States and China, regulatory filings showed Tuesday.

Headlines: Shares rebound as Turkish lira pulls out of dive
Description: World share markets rebounded on Tuesday as Turkey's lira pulled out of a recent nosedive and reassuring data from Germany helped offset the latest softness in China's economy.

Headlines: The Chinese street's view of the trade war: some say they won't buy U.S. products
Description: Chinese officials have been mostly measured and moderate in their response to U.S. President Donald Trump's ratcheting up of a trade war with Beijing in recent weeks through his announcement of a series of punitive tariffs. They have generally avoided adding to tensions, allowing the Communist Party's official media to make the most bellicose comments.

Headlines: German union to start pay talks for Ryanair cabin crew on Wednesday
Description: German union Verdi will meet Ryanair in Dublin on Wednesday to start pay talks for around 1,000 cabin crew working in Germany for Europe's largest low-cost airline, it said.

Headlines: Emerging markets lead global stocks lower, commodities sink
Description: Equities around the world took a dive led by emerging market stocks on Wednesday and commodities tumbled as investors looked for safety due to worries about China and Turkey.

Headlines: Sen. Elizabeth Warren: Trade deals help companies, not workers
Description: Jim Cramer sits down with Sen. Elizabeth Warren to discuss her new bill, the Accountable Capitalism Act, and also hear her views on U.S. trade policies.

Headlines: Exclusive: In Chinese port city, Japan's Toyota lays foundation to ramp up sales
Description: Toyota Motor Corp is likely to make 120,000 more cars a year in the Chinese port city of Tianjin as part of a medium-term strategy that's gathering pace as China-Japan ties improve, said four company insiders with knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Blackstone invests $400 million in HEC Pharm via convertible bonds
Description: U.S. private equity firm Blackstone Group LP has signed a deal to invest $400 million in Hong Kong-listed YiChang HEC ChangJiang Pharmaceutical Co. via convertible bonds, HEC said Wednesday.

Headlines: China says U.S. solar tariffs violate trade rules, lodges WTO complaint
Description: China's commerce ministry said a U.S. decision to subsidize renewable energy firms and impose tariffs on imported products has seriously distorted the global market and harmed China's interests, firing the latest shot in a broader trade conflict.

Headlines: USTR Lighthizer eyes NAFTA 'breakthrough,' Mexico urges flexibility
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer on Thursday expressed hope a breakthrough could be made in coming days on reworking the NAFTA trade deal, though his Mexican counterpart said flexibility was needed to reach agreement.

Headlines: Citi settles SEC charges over bad controls, supervision
Description: Citigroup agreed to pay $10.5 million to settle two separate complaints, one relating to bad loans made by its Mexican subsidiary, Banamex, between 2008 and 2014, U.S. regulators said on Thursday.

Headlines: Stocks, emerging market currencies rise on planned U.S.-China trade talks
Description: U.S. stocks and emerging market currencies rebounded on Thursday after China said it will hold trade talks with the United States this month and Turkey's lira continued its recovery.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon considering UK insurance comparison site - sources
Description: Amazon.com Inc is sounding out some of Europe's top insurance firms to see if they would contribute products to a UK price comparison website in what would be a major foray by the U.S. online retail giant into the region's financial services.

Headlines: Turkey must commit to policies to promote stability amid market volatility: IMF
Description: Turkey should commit to sound economic policies to promote stability and reduce imbalances at a time of market volatility, an IMF spokesperson said on Wednesday as a row between Washington and Ankara over the jailing of an American pastor dragged on.

Headlines: Walmart asks some beauty suppliers to consider sourcing outside of China
Description: Walmart Inc has asked some beauty suppliers to consider sourcing products from outside China, as it looks for ways to mitigate the impact of a new set of tariffs on Chinese products proposed by the Trump administration.

Headlines: Brazil mall executives shrug off looming Amazon.com expansion
Description: Fears of e-commerce taking off in Brazil have sunk shares of the country's big mall operators this year, but industry executives expressed confidence that local shopping habits, the reputation of malls as public spaces safe from crime and other factors will help them avoid the shakeout that has hit their U.S. peers.

Headlines: Toyota to increase production capacity in China by 20 percent: source
Description: Japan's Toyota Motor Corp will build additional capacity at its auto plant in China's Guangzhou, a company source said, in addition to beefing up production at a factory in Tianjin city by 120,000 vehicles a year.

Headlines: Google employees demand more oversight of China search engine plan
Description: Google is not close to launching a search engine app in China, its chief executive said at a companywide meeting on Thursday, according to a transcript seen by Reuters, as employees of the Alphabet Inc unit called for more transparency and oversight of the project.

Headlines: China's Geely in deal to let Malaysia's Proton tap new-energy, other vehicle tech in global push
Description: Chinese automaker Geely has agreed to extend its existing partnership with Proton Holdings Berhad to upgrade the Malaysia carmaker's line-up of cars and power Proton go beyond Malaysia, part of an ongoing effort to help Proton establish a presence in China and other international markets.

Headlines: Iran says no OPEC member can take over its share of oil exports
Description: Iran told OPEC on Sunday no member country should be allowed to take over another member's share of oil exports, expressing Tehran's concern about Saudi Arabia's offer to pump more oil in the face of U.S. sanctions on Iranian oil sales.

Headlines: Wall St. rises on trade optimism, pares gains after Trump Fed comments
Description: Wall Street's major indexes rose on Monday on optimism over trade talks between the United States and China, though they fell from session highs after President Donald Trump criticized the Federal Reserve's raising interest rates.

Headlines: Nissan to invest $900 million on new assembly plant in China: Nikkei
Description: Japan's Nissan Motor Co will spend around $900 million to build a new auto assembly plant in China that will increase production capacity in the company by 30 percent, the Nikkei newspaper reported on Monday.

Headlines: Greece set to exit bailout, still faces daunting challenges
Description: Greece exits the last of its three bailouts on Aug. 20 and hopes to be able to borrow again in international markets after a nearly nine-year debt crisis that shrank the economy by a quarter and forced it to implement painful austerity measures.

Headlines: Nissan to boost China production capacity by 40 percent, source says
Description: Japan's Nissan Motor Co plans to invest about $900 million to boost vehicle-making capacity in China by 40 percent by 2021 - part of a 60 billion yuan ($8.73 billion) strategy to become a top three player in the worldâ€™s largest auto market.

Headlines: ConocoPhillips and Venezuela's PDVSA reach $2 billion settlement
Description: U.S. producer ConocoPhillips and Venezuela's PDVSA have reached a payment agreement over a $2 billion arbitration, the companies said on Monday, suspending a dispute that blocked the state-run company from exporting oil from most of its key Caribbean facilities.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump says 'most likely' to meet North Korea's Kim again
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he would "most likely" meet again with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, while defending his efforts to convince Pyongyang to give up its nuclear weapons.

Headlines: Instant View: Trump takes Fed to task for rate hikes in Reuters interview
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he was "not thrilled" with Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell for raising interest rates and accused China and Europe of manipulating their respective currencies.

Headlines: Britain can't afford to close door to EU banks after Brexit
Description: Britain is expected to keep the door open for European Union banks and investors after Brexit to try to preserve London's global financial clout, irrespective of whether it gets a good trade deal from the bloc, bankers and industry officials say.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump doesn't expect much from China trade talks this week
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump does not expect much progress from trade talks with China this week in Washington, he told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Two U.S. airlines cut China routes as state-backed rivals turn up heat
Description: Two U.S. airlines on Tuesday cut routes between China and the United States, underscoring increasingly tough competition from state-backed Chinese rivals as they aggressively expand their fleets with cut-price tickets.

Headlines: Fiat Chrysler, Volkswagen issue recalls for cars in Mexico
Description: Citing possible electronic problems, the Mexican unit of Fiat Chrysler issued a recall notice to the owners of more than 122,000 vehicles, Mexico's consumer watchdog Profeco said on Thursday.

Headlines: Britons living in EU could lose access to UK bank services in no-deal Brexit
Description: Britons living in the European Union could lose access to their UK bank account services and businesses on the continent could be cut off from investment banks in London if there is a no-deal Brexit, the British government said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. says Facebook fugitive Paul Ceglia arrested in Ecuador
Description: The New York man who spent nearly 3-1/2 years as a fugitive after being charged with trying to defraud Facebook Inc founder Mark Zuckerberg out of half of the social media company has been arrested in Ecuador and may be extradited, U.S. prosecutors said on Thursday.

Headlines: Microsoft faces U.S. bribery probe over sales in Hungary: WSJ
Description: Microsoft Corp is being investigated by U.S. authorities over potential bribery and corruption related to software sales in Hungary, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Oil, copper slip as U.S.-China trade fight escalates
Description: Oil and copper prices edged lower on Thursday as the U.S.-China trade dispute escalated while global equity markets fell as gains in U.S. technology shares failed to offset declines in commodity-related and trade-sensitive stocks.

Headlines: British Airways, Air France halting flights to Iran from next month
Description: British Airways and Air France said on Thursday they would halt flights to Iran from September for business reasons, months after U.S. President Donald Trump announced he would re-impose sanctions on Tehran.

Headlines: China says will continue to fight back against U.S. tariffs
Description: China's commerce ministry said on Thursday that Beijing will have to continue to fight back against the latest implementation of U.S. tariffs on $16 billion of Chinese goods.

Headlines: Exclusive: China's Unipec to resume U.S. oil purchases after tariff policy change - sources
Description: China's Unipec will resume purchases of U.S. crude oil in October after a two-month halt due to the trade dispute between the world's two largest economies, three sources with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. Commerce's Ross picks ZTE monitor after rejecting 'Never Trump' lawyer
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross has appointed a former federal prosecutor to monitor China's ZTE Corp after people familiar with the matter said he rescinded an offer to a former U.S. official for signing a "Never Trump" letter before the 2016 presidential election.

Headlines: Global stocks rally after speech by Fed's Powell, oil prices surge
Description: Global equity markets rose on Friday after Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said the U.S. central bank's policies are best to keep the economy humming, spurring new highs on Wall Street, while oil surged on signs Iran sanctions may crimp worldwide supply.

Headlines: Canada to rejoin NAFTA talks once U.S., Mexico resolve bilateral issues: Freeland
Description: Mexico and the United States need to resolve complicated bilateral issues before modernization of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) can move forward, Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland said on Friday.

Headlines: Enbridge to buy Spectra Energy for $3.3 billion
Description: Enbridge Inc, Canada's largest pipeline operator, said on Friday it would buy its U.S. master limited partnership Spectra Energy Partners for a sweetened deal of $3.3 billion.

Headlines: Nike stores in South Africa reopen following backlash over racist video
Description: Nike stores in South Africa were all open on Friday, the company said, after some were closed following a backlash over racist comments by a man said to have links to the U.S. sportswear company.

Headlines: UK says Brexit could hit banks' stock of 'risk free' EU debt
Description: Britain could force European Union banks operating in London to start holding capital against inventory of riskier EU government bonds in the case of a 'no-deal' Brexit.

Headlines: 'Old' bull market sputters on while tech inflows slow: BAML
Description: Investors bought back into U.S. stocks this week which set their longest-ever market rally, although risks ahead spurred anxiety over how much longer the ageing bull can last, Bank of America Merrill Lynch strategists said on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: China to keep hitting back at U.S. over trade, to boost government spending - finance minister
Description: China will keep hitting back at Washington as more U.S. trade tariffs are imposed, but its counter-strikes will remain as targeted as possible to avoid harming businesses in China - whether Chinese or foreign, Finance Minister Liu Kun said.

Headlines: Much detail, little progress in U.S.-China talks, sources say
Description: U.S-China trade talks this week were heavy on details but short on progress as U.S. negotiators outlined cases of American firms harmed by Chinese practices and China argued it was meeting its WTO obligations, people familiar with contents of the discussions said.

Headlines: U.S. softens stance on NAFTA sunset clause: Mexican official
Description: Mexico's incoming trade negotiator said on Saturday that the United States, in talks to revamp the North American Free Trade Agreement, had softened its position on a "sunset clause" that would force a renegotiation of the deal every five years.

Headlines: U.S.-Mexico NAFTA talks to continue Monday: minister
Description: Mexico's Economy Minister Ildefonso Guajardo said on Sunday evening that bilateral negotiations with the United States over the future of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) were advancing and that talks would continue on Monday.

Headlines: Mexico minister says can't declare NAFTA victory yet
Description: Mexico's Economy Minister Ildefonso Guajardo said on Sunday that he couldn't yet declare victory in bilateral talks with the United States over the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA).

Headlines: Venezuela's PDVSA files appeal against Crystallex court ruling
Description: Venezuela's state oil firm Petroleos de Venezuela SA (PDVSA) said on Saturday it filed an appeal requesting that a Delaware court vacate a decision on Aug. 23 granting Canadian miner Crystallex the right to seize its U.S. assets.

Headlines: Turkey says U.S. trade sanctions could destabilize region, lira slide continues
Description: Turkey warned on Monday that U.S. trade sanctions against it could destabilize the Middle East and ultimately bolster terrorism and the refugee crisis, underscoring the regional impact of Ankara's deepening rift with Washington.

Headlines: Turkish lira weakens 3 percent as markets reopen, eyes on U.S. stand-off
Description: The Turkish lira slid 3 percent against the dollar on Monday as local markets resumed trading after a week-long holiday and investors focused again on a bitter dispute between Ankara and Washington over an American pastor being tried in Turkey.

Headlines: Advent to invest $485 million in Walmart operations in Brazil
Description: Advent International, the private equity firm that acquired 80 percent of Walmart Inc 's Brazilian operations, is going to invest 1.9 billion reais ($485.66 million) in the existing stores as part of an agreement with the world's biggest retailer, according to a document published in Brazil's official gazette.

Headlines: Mexico, U.S. closing in on NAFTA deal, talks to resume Monday
Description: U.S. and Mexican trade negotiators are close to squaring away bilateral differences on the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) and will resume talks on Monday morning, Mexican Economy Minister Ildefonso Guajardo said on Sunday.

Headlines: Yuan hits four-week high as China signals support, revives X-factor for fixing
Description: China's yuan finished Monday afternoon trade at a near 4-week high to the dollar after the central bank revived a "counter-cyclical factor" in its daily fixing to support the currency, halting a record 10-week slide that rattled global markets and irritated Washington.

Headlines: S&P 500, Nasdaq hit new highs on U.S.-Mexico trade deal
Description: A broad-based rally pushed the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq to record-high closes for the second straight session on Monday as a trade agreement reached between the United States and Mexico buoyed investor sentiment.

Headlines: World stock index at highest in over five months on trade deal
Description: An index of major world stock markets rose to its highest level in more than five months on Monday after the United States and Mexico struck an agreement that lowers trade tensions.

Headlines: Most Mexican auto exports can meet new NAFTA rules, says minister
Description: Most of Mexico's auto exports should comply with new rules drawn up under the agreement struck between Mexico and the United States in the renegotiation of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA), Mexico's economy minister said on Monday.

Headlines: Mexico's next leader says NAFTA deal preserves energy 'sovereignty'
Description: Mexican president-elect Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador welcomed a deal between Mexico and the United States to overhaul the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) that he said preserved Mexican "sovereignty" in the energy sector.

Headlines: Canadian NAFTA negotiator says 'encouraged' by U.S.-Mexico progress
Description: Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland said on Tuesday she was "encouraged" by progress made by the United States and Mexico towards a new North American Free Trade Agreement.

Headlines: Chinese soy buyers leave U.S. exporters show empty handed
Description: An annual U.S. soy exporters' conference wrapped up on Wednesday without any known sales to Chinese buyers, in sharp contrast to previous years where billions of dollars of the main U.S. cash crop have been signed over to China in elaborate ceremonies.

Headlines: Canada's Trudeau says NAFTA deal possible by Friday
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Wednesday that it may be possible to reach a deal on NAFTA ahead of U.S. President Donald Trump's Friday deadline.

Headlines: Canada's Freeland says optimistic about NAFTA talks this week
Description: Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland said on Wednesday progress made by the United States and Mexico to resolve their trade differences set the stage for productive talks toward a revamped North American Free Trade Agreement.

Headlines: Wall St. rally ends as risk-selling grows on rising tariff fears
Description: U.S. stocks ended their four-day winning streak on Thursday as risk reduction ahead of the long holiday weekend accelerated on growing trade anxieties.

Headlines: U.S. stocks drop on fear of escalated trade spat; Argentine peso roiled
Description: The rally in U.S. stocks came to a halt on Thursday on new concerns that the U.S.-Chinese trade dispute will intensify, while economic turmoil in Argentina and Turkey sent those countries' currencies tumbling.

Headlines: Canada's Freeland says NAFTA talks with U.S. to resume Friday
Description: Canada's foreign minister Chrystia Freeland said on Thursday that talks between Canadian and U.S. officials over the renegotiation of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) would resume on Friday.

Headlines: Now you see it, now you don't: oil surplus vanishes ahead of Iran deadline
Description: An overhang of homeless crude in the Atlantic Basin has halved in recent weeks, suggesting oil traders are bracing for a further supply loss from Iran due to U.S. sanctions and a new rally in prices.

Headlines: U.S. closely following Danske Bank money laundering case: paper
Description: U.S. authorities are closely following an investigation into Danske Bank over allegations that Denmark's biggest lender had been involved in money laundering through its Estonian branch.

Headlines: China's ZTE sees third-quarter profit after first-half loss on U.S. supplier ban
Description: China's ZTE Corp said it expects to make a profit in the third quarter after recording its worst-ever first-half net loss on Thursday, the result of a U.S. supplier ban that forced the telecoms gear maker to halt operations for three months.

Headlines: Trump says Canada has been taking advantage of U.S. on trade
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that Canada had taken advantage of the United States on trade, as talks between the two countries, who are seeking to revamp the North American Free Trade Agreement, soured sharply.

Headlines: Trump confirms off-record comments on U.S.-Canada trade talks
Description: President Donald Trump on Friday confirmed off-record, hard-line comments he had made about the United States' negotiating stance in trade talks with Canada, saying on Twitter: "At least Canada knows where I stand."

Headlines: Canada's Freeland says 'win-win-win' trade deal with U.S. within reach
Description: Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland on Friday expressed confidence that Canada could reach agreement with the United States on a renegotiated NAFTA trade pact if there was "good will and flexibility on all sides."

Headlines: U.S. hedge fund King Street seeks board shake-up at Toshiba: WSJ
Description: U.S. hedge fund King Street Capital Management LP has proposed new independent directors at Japan's Toshiba Corp , the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: China says putting pressure on Beijing won't work amid trade war with U.S.
Description: China's foreign ministry on Friday said that putting pressure on Beijing over trade won't work, after a report that U.S. President Donald Trump is prepared to quickly ramp up a trade war between the two countries.

Headlines: U.S., Canada make late-night push for NAFTA; no deal yet
Description: Top NAFTA negotiators from Canada and the United States wrapped up a third day of two-way talks on Thursday, agreeing to meet the next day to resolve final differences before a deadline, with Mexican counterparts on standby to rejoin negotiations.

Headlines: Trump's reported off-the-record remarks hit U.S.-Canada trade talks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said in off-the-record remarks to Bloomberg News this week that any trade deal with Canada would be "totally on our terms," the Toronto Star reported on Friday, citing remarks it had obtained.

Headlines: Canada, U.S. may not reach NAFTA deal within deadline: Globe and Mail
Description: Canada's government officials have expressed concern that a final North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) pact will not be reached within the Friday deadline set by U.S. President Donald Trump, the Globe and Mail reported, citing a source familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Trump ready to ratchet up China trade war with more tariffs: report
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is prepared to quickly ramp up a trade war with China and has told aides he is ready to impose tariffs on $200 billion more in Chinese imports as soon as a public comment period on the plan ends next week, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump says Canada not needed in NAFTA deal, warns Congress not to interfere
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday there was no need to keep Canada in the North American Free Trade Agreement and warned Congress not to meddle with the trade negotiations or he would terminate the trilateral trade pact altogether.

Headlines: Qatar plans to invest billions of dollars in Germany: report
Description: Qatar plans to invest billions of dollars more in Germany and will broaden its focus to the country's medium-sized companies, business newspaper Handelsblatt said in a report due to be published on Monday.

Headlines: Indonesia to work with Alibaba's Jack Ma to increase exports: minister
Description: Indonesia will partner with Alibaba's CEO Jack Ma to look into ways to use Alibaba's ecosystem to increase its exports, particularly to China, its communications minister told Reuters on Sunday.

Headlines: JD.com CEO returns to China after arrest in U.S. sexual misconduct case
Description: The CEO of JD.com Inc , Richard Liu, has returned to China, the Chinese e-commerce giant said on Monday, days after he was arrested by police in the U.S. city of Minneapolis on suspicion of criminal sexual conduct and later released.

Headlines: JD.com CEO returns to China after arrest in U.S. sexual misconduct case
Description: The CEO of JD.com Inc , Richard Liu, has returned to China, the Chinese e-commerce giant said on Monday, days after he was arrested by police in the U.S. city of Minneapolis on suspicion of criminal sexual conduct and later released.

Headlines: Sanofi to pay more than $25 million to resolve corruption charges: SEC
Description: French pharmaceutical giant Sanofi will pay more than $25 million to settle charges that its Kazakhstan and Middle East subsidiaries made corrupt payments to win business, the top U.S. securities regulator said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. arbitration court can rule on Vattenfall's German nuclear claim: paper
Description: A U.S. arbitration court has rejected a German government petition that said the panel had no right to rule on a damages claim by Sweden's Vattenfall [VATN.UL] over a decision to pull out of nuclear power, a newspaper reported.

Headlines: Lockheed to make wings for F-16 jet in India with partner Tata
Description: Lockheed Martin will build wings for its F-16 combat plane in India with its local partner, Tata Advanced Systems Limited, an executive at the U.S. company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Amazon touches $1 trillion, on pace to overtake Apple
Description: Amazon.com Inc on Tuesday briefly joined Apple Inc to become the second $1 trillion publicly listed U.S. company after its stock price more than doubled in a year as it grew rapidly in retail and cloud computing.

Headlines: Trump says outcome in Canada trade talks to be known within days
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump told reporters that trade talks with Canada were coming along, with the result known in the next few days or possibly even on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump says we have to make a fair trade deal with Canada
Description: President Donald Trump on Wednesday said the United States should have a fair trade deal with Canada, as the two countries resumed negotiations over renegotiating the North American Free Trade Agreement.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit surges to five-month high as exports fall
Description: The U.S. trade deficit rose to a five-month high in July, with the politically sensitive gap with China hitting a record high, which economists said could embolden the Trump administration to aggressively pursue its "America First" agenda.

Headlines: Trump says not ready to make trade deal with China
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that the United States was not yet ready to come to an agreement over trade disputes with China but he said talks would continue.

Headlines: Conoco waiting for Venezuela to pay $2 billion settlement: CEO
Description: U.S. oil producer ConocoPhillips is still awaiting payment from Venezuela on a $2 billion arbitration settlement reached last month with the country's state-run PDVSA, Chief Executive Ryan Lance said on Wednesday.

Headlines: EU, U.S. trade chiefs to mend ties after Trump tariff detente
Description: U.S. and EU trade chiefs will hold a first meeting in Brussels on Monday to pursue closer transatlantic ties after U.S. President Donald Trump agreed to drop his threat of tariffs on EU cars.

Headlines: Mexico wants steel dispute ended before new NAFTA signed: minister
Description: Mexico wants to end to a tariff dispute over steel and aluminum with the United States prior to signing off on a reworked trade agreement with its northern neighbor, Mexican Economy Minister Ildefonso Guajardo said on Thursday.

Headlines: Novartis unloads U.S. assets at loss to bargain-hunting Aurobindo
Description: New Novartis Chief Executive Vas Narasimhan has further reshaped the Swiss drugmaker, announcing on Thursday he is selling U.S. dermatology and generic pill assets to India's Aurobindo Pharma Ltd for up to $1 billion.

Headlines: UK, U.S. urge EU not to lock out foreign banks
Description: Britain's top markets regulator, backed by the United States, urged the European Union to soften its stance and grant broad access to UK banks after Brexit to avoid hitting investors and harming markets.

Headlines: Uber launches taxi-hailing app in Japan's Nagoya
Description: Uber Technologies [UBER.UL] on Thursday said it would launch a taxi-hailing app for taxis operating in Nagoya, as the U.S. firm tries to expand its foothold in a country where it has been blocked from offering its own ridesharing service.

Headlines: As next round of U.S. tariffs on China looms, both sides dig in
Description: With U.S. President Donald Trump gearing up to impose tariffs on $200 billion in Chinese goods and Beijing certain to retaliate against any measures, the world's two biggest economies are locked in an escalating trade war, with no resolution in sight.

Headlines: Exclusive: Customers to shun Rusal at Berlin 'mating season' for 2019 aluminum deals
Description: European customers will avoid deals with Russia's United Company Rusal, under U.S. sanctions, when the industry meets in Berlin next week to seal 2019 metal supply agreements, three sources familiar with the discussions said.

Headlines: U.S. job growth surges; annual wage gain largest since 2009
Description: U.S. job growth accelerated in August and wages notched their largest annual increase in more than nine years, the clearest signs that the economy was so far weathering the Trump administration's escalating trade war with China.

Headlines: Canada's Freeland sees 'very good progress' in NAFTA trade talks
Description: Canada's top trade negotiator said on Friday she and her U.S. counterpart were making "very good progress" in talks to save the North American Free Trade Agreement amid increasing Canadian optimism that a deal could be reached, even if a conclusion did not appear imminent.

Headlines: Instant View: U.S. August job growth surges
Description: U.S. job growth accelerated in August, with wages notching their largest annual increase in nine years, strengthening views the economy was so far weathering the Trump administration's escalating trade war with China.

Headlines: Premier hopes U.S. firms will boost China investment: state TV
Description: China will continue opening up and improving market access, Premier Li Keqiang said, adding that he hoped U.S. firms would boost investment in the world's second-largest economy, state television reported on Friday.

Headlines: China's record trade surplus with U.S. adds fuel to trade war fire
Description: China's trade surplus with the United States widened to a record in August even as the country's export growth slowed slightly, an outcome that could push President Donald Trump to turn up the heat on Beijing in their cantankerous trade dispute.

Headlines: May wraps 'suicide vest' around UK over Brexit, says Johnson
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal wraps "a suicide vest around the British constitution" and hands the detonator to the European Union, former foreign minister Boris Johnson said in comments that drew strong criticism.

Headlines: Chequers plan is only deal on the table with EU: Britain's Javid
Description: British interior minister Sajid Javid said on Sunday that the prime minister's so-called Chequers plan was the only one on the table with the European Union, suggesting that Theresa May is not planning to succumb to pressure to change tack over Brexit.

Headlines: Orexo soars after winning opioid drug appeal against Teva
Description: A U.S. appeals court on Monday revived Swedish pharmaceutical company Orexo AB's lawsuit accusing a unit of Israel's Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd of infringing a patent for its opioid addiction drug Zubsolv.

Headlines: U.S., Europe optimism helps global stock index dodge trade war dread
Description: An index of global stock markets rose on Monday for the first time in eight trading sessions on optimism about policy from Italy to the United States, dodging anxiety about the U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: State Street opens Abu Dhabi office, eyes regional growth
Description: U.S. financial services provider State Street Corporation opened a new office in Abu Dhabi on Monday, expanding in the United Arab Emirates as it eyes growth prospects in the Middle East region.

Headlines: Trump says trade talks with Canada going well
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that trade talks with Canada were going well and that Ottawa very much wanted to make a deal.

Headlines: Japanese firms dealing with Russia feel little impact from U.S. sanctions: Sumitomo
Description: Japanese firms dealing with Russia were experiencing little impact from U.S. sanctions on Moscow, but it was possible that they may also be sanctioned by the United States, the managing executive officer of Sumitomo Corporation said on Tuesday.

Headlines: China seeks WTO backing for $7 billion sanctions on U.S. over dumping duties
Description: China told the World Trade Organization (WTO) on Tuesday it wanted to impose $7 billion a year in sanctions on the United States in retaliation for Washington's non-compliance with a ruling in a dispute over U.S. dumping duties.

Headlines: Unilever details plans for December listing of new Dutch entity
Description: Consumer goods giant Unilever laid out details on Tuesday for the planned December listing of its new Dutch entity, which has sparked criticism from some UK shareholders and become swept up in the debate over Brexit.

Headlines: Brent reaches $80 a barrel after fall in U.S. crude stocks
Description: Oil futures rose on Wednesday, with Brent reaching $80 a barrel, after a larger-than-expected drop in U.S. crude inventories and as U.S. sanctions on Iran added to concerns over global oil supply.

Headlines: Global stocks look for direction in trade strife, oil prices leap
Description: An index of global stocks rose on Wednesday, helped by a report that Washington is proposing a new round of trade talks with Beijing and as resurgent oil prices pumped up energy shares.

Headlines: Takeda to pack up Illinois HQ, nearly 1,000 workers to be affected
Description: Japan's Takeda Pharmaceutical Co Ltd said on Wednesday it plans to shut its U.S. headquarters in Deerfield, Illinois and move it to the greater Boston area, following the closing of its Shire Plc acquisition.

Headlines: FedEx to hire 55,000 workers, raise hours for holiday season
Description: FedEx Corp would hire about 55,000 workers and increase hours for some existing employees for the holiday season as the U.S. package delivery company prepares to cater to an expected jump in shipments due to online shopping boom.

Headlines: Blackstone, Centerbridge consider joint bid for Santander HQ in Spain: sources
Description: U.S. investors Blackstone and Centerbridge are considering a 3 billion-euro ($3.5 billion) offer for Banco Santander's headquarters in Madrid, two sources with knowledge of the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Canada PM says he wants a good NAFTA deal soon, hazy on deadline
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Thursday he wanted a good NAFTA deal as soon as possible, but did not answer directly when asked if he agreed with Washington that the end of September was the final deadline for talks.

Headlines: Wall Street rises with Apple, easing trade concerns
Description: Apple led a rebound in technology shares and boosted all three major U.S. stock indexes on Thursday, while trade worries eased after China welcomed new talks with the United States.

Headlines: IKEA targets home delivery by electric vehicle in five major cities by 2020
Description: IKEA Group, the owner of most IKEA stores worldwide, said on Friday all its home deliveries in the inner cities of Amsterdam, Los Angeles, New York, Paris and Shanghai would be made by electric vehicles or through other zero-emission means by 2020.

Headlines: Takeda weighs sale of Shire's eye care business to cut debt: Bloomberg
Description: Japan's Takeda Pharmaceutical is considering selling Shire Plc's eye care business once it closes its $62 billion purchase of the London-listed drugmaker, as it looks to cut the debt raised to fund the deal, Bloomberg reported on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. firms in China feeling 'clear and far reaching' trade war pinch: survey
Description: American companies in China are being hurt by tariffs in the growing trade war between Washington and Beijing, according to a survey of hundreds of firms, prompting the U.S. business lobbies behind the poll to urge the Trump administration to reconsider its approach.

Headlines: BlackRock gets regulatory approval to set up new firm in France
Description: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, has obtained regulatory approval to set up a new alternative investment firm in France, in another sign of Paris' increasing post-Brexit appeal for financial firms.

Headlines: Trump denies pressure for trade deal as China welcomes U.S. talks invite
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that the United States was under no pressure to make a trade deal with China, even as Chinese officials welcomed an invitation from Washington for a new round of talks with more U.S. tariffs looming.

Headlines: Tennis star Osaka named Nissan ambassador, gives hope to biracial Japanese
Description: Japan's Nissan Motor Co has signed U.S. Open champion Naomi Osaka as its next brand ambassador, the automaker said on Thursday, tapping the tennis star's youth, drive and Japanese roots to appeal to younger customers.

Headlines: Trump readies tariffs on $200 billion more Chinese goods despite talks: source
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has directed aides to proceed with tariffs on about another $200 billion of Chinese goods, despite Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin's attempts to restart trade talks with China, a source familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: Trade conflict looms but higher rates, oil prices help some stocks
Description: A world stock index climbed as bank and energy shares rose on Friday, but the momentum was sapped by a report that Washington may fire a new salvo in its trade war with Beijing.

Headlines: Volvo Cars seeks U.S. tariff exemption for Chinese-made SUV
Description: Volvo Cars has asked the Trump administration to exempt the company's Chinese-made mid-size XC60 SUV from new 25 percent tariffs, the latest automaker to seek relief from new levies on imports from China.

Headlines: Oil mixed as China tariff talk scotches early rally
Description: Oil prices pulled back on Friday on concerns additional U.S. tariffs would be placed on Chinese imports, after an earlier rally triggered by worries that more sanctions on Iran might constrict supply.

Headlines: Brazil space station open for small satellite business
Description: Brazil is ready to launch small commercial rockets from its space base near the equator as soon as it agrees to safeguard U.S. technology that is dominant in the industry, the Brazilian Air Force officer managing the space program said on Friday.

Headlines: Australia watchdog files civil suit against ANZ over 2015 share issue
Description: Australia's corporate watchdog sued Australia and New Zealand Banking Group Ltd on Friday over a troubled A$2.5 billion ($1.8 billion) share placement, flexing its muscle amid criticism levied at regulators for being soft on finance firms.

Headlines: U.S. imposes sanctions on Thai company it accuses of aiding Iran
Description: The United States on Friday imposed sanctions against a Thai aviation company that it said was acting on behalf of Iran's Mahan Air, which it accused of ferrying troops and supplies into Syria in support of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad.

Headlines: Deutsche to shift more assets to Frankfurt, ringfence UK operations after Brexit: source
Description: Deutsche Bank is considering shifting large volumes of assets from London to Frankfurt after the UK's planned exit from the European Union next year to meet demands from European regulators, a person close to the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: Trump says he will announce decision on China tariffs after market close
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he would announce his latest plan for China tariffs after the markets close, with expectations he would levy about $200 billion worth of Chinese imports.

Headlines: China set to convene meeting on Tuesday to discuss response to U.S. tariffs - Bloomberg
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He is set to convene a meeting in Beijing on Tuesday morning to discuss the government's response to the U.S. decision to impose extra tariffs on $200 billion of Chinese goods, Bloomberg News reported, citing a person briefed on the matter.

Headlines: China commerce minister says U.S. unilateralism, protectionism will hurt global economy
Description: China's commerce minister told representatives of foreign firms on Monday that the United States' unilateralism and protectionism will impact both U.S. and China's interests and hurt the global economy.

Headlines: China unlikely to send trade delegation to U.S. after new tariffs: SCMP
Description: China likely will not send a trade delegation to Washington after the Trump Administration announced plans to implement tariffs on $200 billion worth of Chinese goods, the South China Morning Post reported on Tuesday, citing an unidentified government source in Beijing.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. may make a trade deal with China at some point
Description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday left the door open for China to negotiate an end to the trade war between Washington and Beijing, a day after imposing new tariffs on nearly $200 billion Chinese imports and threatening more if China retaliates.

Headlines: China LNG tariff casts shadow over new U.S. export terminals
Description: China set a 10 percent tariff on U.S. liquefied natural gas (LNG) imports, extending a trade dispute into energy and casting a shadow over U.S. export terminals that would propel the United States into the world's second-largest LNG seller.

Headlines: WeWork tops JPMorgan as No. 1 New York tenant as coworking booms
Description: WeWork Cos said it surpassed JP Morgan , the biggest U.S. bank, as the largest tenant of Manhattan office space, a milestone highlighting growing demand for flexible leases.

Headlines: U.S. senators seek punishment if China's ZTE violates deal
Description: Republican and Democratic U.S. senators introduced a bill on Tuesday that would reimpose sanctions on China's ZTE Corp if it does not fully comply with U.S. laws and an agreement with the Trump administration that ended stiff restrictions on the telecommunications equipment company.

Headlines: Japan calls for early solution to U.S.-China trade war
Description: Japanese policymakers on Tuesday called for an early solution to the escalating U.S.-China trade war and warned of the potential damage to global growth in the wake of President Donald Trump's decision to slap new tariffs on China.

Headlines: China says has no choice but to retaliate against latest U.S. tariffs
Description: China has no choice but to retaliate against the latest U.S. tariffs and hopes the United States would correct its behavior, the commerce ministry said on Tuesday in a statement, without specifying what actions it will take.

Headlines: China says U.S. has not been sincere, talks only correct way to resolve trade issue
Description: China's foreign ministry said on Tuesday that talks on an equal footing are the only correct way to resolve trade issues with the United States, after U.S. President Donald Trump imposed 10 percent tariffs on about $200 billion worth of Chinese imports.

Headlines: New U.S. tariffs on China are unfortunate: EU trade chief
Description: New U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports represent an unfortunate escalation of global trade tensions and are the wrong method to force Beijing to reform, the European Union's trade chief said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. tech giants eye AI key to unlock China push
Description: U.S. technology giants, facing tighter content rules in China and the threat of a trade war, are targeting an easier way into the world's second largest economy - artificial intelligence.

Headlines: Trade war impact on China's economy not big, but stocks, FX need to be watched - central bank adviser
Description: The impact on China's economy from Beijing's and Washington's ongoing trade war is not significant, but the impact on stock and currency markets needs to be watched, an adviser to China's central bank said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S.'s Ross says China must decide on trade talks: CNBC
Description: It is up to Beijing to take the next steps on trade talks, U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Tuesday as China vowed to retaliate after U.S. President Donald Trump imposed initial duties on $200 billion worth of Chinese goods.

Headlines: China says Trump forces its hand, will retaliate against new U.S. tariffs
Description: China said on Tuesday that it had no choice but to retaliate against new U.S. trade tariffs, raising the risk that U.S. President Donald Trump could soon impose duties on virtually all of the Chinese goods that America buys.

Headlines: Apple CEO says optimistic on U.S.-China trade talks
Description: Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook, whose products have been spared from new U.S. tariffs imposed on Chinese goods, said on Tuesday he was optimistic that the United States and China will eventually work through their trade differences.

Headlines: Volkswagen pulls out of Iran, according to U.S. official: Bloomberg
Description: Volkswagen AG will end almost of all its operations in Iran, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday, citing a U.S. official who led the discussions with the carmaker.

Headlines: Forecasters unanimous: U.S.-China trade war bad for economy - Reuters poll
Description: The U.S. economy will expand at a robust pace in coming quarters but slow to 2 percent by the end of 2019, according to forecasters polled by Reuters who unanimously said the escalating trade war with China was bad economic policy.

Headlines: Renault-Nissan adopts Android in coup for Google
Description: The Renault-Nissan-Mitsubishi carmaking alliance said on Tuesday it will adopt Alphabet's Google Android operating system, handing a victory to the U.S. tech giant as it pushes for a bigger share of the infotainment market.

Headlines: Factbox: China's low-soy pig diet and the impact on soybean use
Description: China's agriculture industry and government are aiming to put the nation's vast pig herd on a low-soymeal diet to reduce the country's reliance on U.S. soybean imports, a move that would send shudders across the U.S. farmbelt and beyond. [L3N1VJ3WE]

Headlines: Inside China's strategy in the soybean trade war
Description: The executive from one of China's biggest soybean crushers sat on a panel at a Kansas City agricultural exports conference, listening to an expert beside him explain why China would remain dependent on U.S. soybeans to feed its massive hog herds.

Headlines: AstraZeneca plots China robot offensive to counter price cuts
Description: With smart cancer diagnostics, one-stop-shop diabetes kits and AI systems to improve ambulance pick-ups for patients with chest pain, AstraZeneca aims to move from simply supplying drugs to become a broad healthcare provider in China.

Headlines: China to penalize $60 billion of U.S. imports in tit-for-tat move
Description: China and the United States plunged deeper into a trade war on Tuesday after Beijing added $60 billion of U.S. products to its import tariff list in retaliation for President Donald Trump's planned levies on $200 billion worth of Chinese goods.

Headlines: China's Tencent Music seeks $2 billion in U.S. IPO: sources
Description: Tencent Music Entertainment Group, China's biggest music-streaming company, is seeking to raise about $2 billion in a U.S. listing, according to three people close to the deal, down from the up to $4 billion that had been touted earlier.

Headlines: NAFTA deal not yet in sight, Canada stands firm on auto tariffs
Description: Canada and the United States showed scant sign on Thursday of closing a deal to revamp NAFTA, and Canadian officials made clear Washington needed to withdraw a threat of possible autos tariffs, sources said.

Headlines: Alibaba's Jack Ma says people should prepare for 20 years of China-U.S. trade war
Description: Jack Ma, co-founder of Chinese e-tech giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd , said on Thursday that people should make preparations for 20 years of China-U.S. trade frictions.

Headlines: Receding trade fears propel stocks to six-month peak
Description: The U.S. dollar rebounded and world shares hit a six-month high on Friday after China's moves to boost domestic consumption bolstered a rally driven by investor bets that the latest U.S.-China trade dispute was unlikely to dent global growth.

Headlines: French handbag maker Longchamp to invest in China to revive sales
Description: Longchamp, one of France's leading handbag makers, is increasing its presence in China and the United States to boost its sales, its CEO said, betting on celebrity tie-ups and its online platforms to revive sluggish growth.

Headlines: Google defends Gmail data sharing, gives few details on violations
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google gave details about its policies for third-party Gmail add-ons but stopped short of fully addressing questions from U.S. senators about developers who break its email-scanning rules.

Headlines: China cancels trade talks with U.S. as tariff threats escalate: WSJ
Description: China has canceled upcoming trade talks with the United States and will not send vice-premier Liu He to Washington next week, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing sources.

Headlines: Key companies to attend White House quantum computing meeting
Description: The White House will hold a meeting on Monday on U.S. government efforts to boost quantum information science, with administration officials, leading companies including Alphabet Inc , IBM Corp , JPMorgan Chase & Co and academic experts taking part.

Headlines: Global stock markets fall on trade war pessimism; oil rallies
Description: Stock markets around the world retreated on Monday amid concerns over the potential wider impact of a trade spat between China and the United States, while oil prices rallied to a four-year high after OPEC ignored U.S. calls to raise supply.

Headlines: Michael Kors set to snap up Italy's Versace: sources
Description: U.S. fashion group Michael Kors has agreed to take control of Versace in a deal that could value one of Italy's most prized designers at $2 billion, sources familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Canada PM says informal NAFTA talks likely in next few days at U.N.
Description: U.S. and Canadian officials trying to reach a deal on NAFTA are "very likely" to hold informal talks on the sidelines of a major U.N. meeting in the next few days, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Sunday.

Headlines: Asian firms shuffle production around the region as China tariffs hit
Description: A growing number of Asian manufacturers of products ranging from memory chips to machines tools are moving to shift production from China to other factories in the region in the wake of U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs on Chinese imports.

Headlines: Volvo halts Iran truck assembly due to U.S. sanctions
Description: Swedish truckmaker AB Volvo has stopped assembling trucks in Iran because U.S. sanctions are preventing it from being paid, a spokesman for the company said on Monday.

Headlines: China says U.S. putting 'knife to its neck', hard to proceed on trade
Description: A senior Chinese official said on Tuesday it is difficult to proceed with trade talks with the United States while Washington is putting "a knife to China's neck", a day after both sides heaped fresh tariffs on each other's goods.

Headlines: Oil jumps, then pares gains as Trump pressures OPEC again
Description: Oil prices rose Tuesday on global supply concerns following U.S. sanctions on Iran's oil exports, with benchmark Brent surging to a four-year high, then retraced gains to settle just slightly higher after U.S. President Donald Trump called again on OPEC to boost crude output.

Headlines: Raytheon Co wins $1.5 billion U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: Raytheon Co has been awarded a $1.5 billion modification to a contract for the sale of Patriot missile systems to Poland, the Pentagon said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. consumer confidence hits 18-year high; house prices slowing
Description: U.S. consumer confidence surged to an 18-year high in September as households grew more upbeat about the labor market, pointing to sustained strength in the economy despite an increasingly bitter trade dispute between the United States and China.

Headlines: Senior China diplomat says confrontation with U.S. lose-lose
Description: Confrontation between China and the United States means both sides lose, and talks with Washington cannot take place under threats and pressure, the Chinese government's top diplomat State Councillor Wang Yi told U.S. business leaders.

Headlines: China says trade war to 'certainly' hurt U.S. exporters, create opportunities to others
Description: China is being forced to retaliate against the United States in their trade dispute, and U.S. exporters including suppliers of liquefied natural gas would "certainly" be hurt, said Chinese vice commerce minister Wang Shouwen.

Headlines: Japan-U.S. shared broad understanding over trade: Japan economy minister
Description: Japan and the United States have reached a broad understanding over how to promote bilateral trade and may announce specifics on Wednesday, Economy Minister Toshimitsu Motegi was quoted as saying after meeting U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer.

Headlines: U.S. trade chief says China policy change 'not going to be easy'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's top trade official said on Tuesday that changing China's economic policies to become more market-oriented "is not going to be easy" even with tariffs now in place on $250 billion worth of Chinese goods.

Headlines: Rupert Murdoch's Fox to sell Sky stake to Comcast
Description: Twenty-First Century Fox Inc agreed to sell its 39 percent stake in Sky PLC to Comcast Corp , the companies said on Wednesday, a deal that completes the U.S. cable group's takeover and ends Rupert Murdoch's relationship with the UK-based satellite broadcaster.

Headlines: Trump slams Canada over NAFTA, says rejected Trudeau meeting
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday blasted Canada over the slow pace of talks over NAFTA, saying he was so unhappy that he had rejected Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's request for a one-on-one meeting.

Headlines: Versace takeover will bring jobs to Italy, its designer says
Description: Fashion house Versace did not receive any offers from Italian investors before selling to Michael Kors but the deal with the U.S. fashion group will create jobs in Italy, creative director Donatella Versace told newspapers on Wednesday.

Headlines: Factbox: Reuters surveys UK financial services jobs post-Brexit
Description: As few as 630 UK-based finance jobs have been shifted or created overseas so far ahead of Brexit, while the number of jobs that UK-based financial institutions said they expected to move in the event of a "hard" Brexit is 5,766, a Reuters survey shows.

Headlines: Brexit and the City: A barometer for London's financial outlook
Description: London's skyline is changing fast, pierced by gleaming new skyscrapers which defy predictions of a Brexit-related slowdown in the capital's two financial districts.

Headlines: Deutsche Bank dismisses merger reports as 'fictions'
Description: Deutsche Bank has dismissed speculation that it might seek a merger as "fictions", after media reports suggested Germany's biggest lender might seek tie ups with Switzerland's UBS or German peer Commerzbank.

Headlines: EU negotiator seeks orderly Brexit, new partnership respecting UK sovereignty
Description: The European Union's negotiator Michel Barnier said on Wednesday that he was working for a Brexit deal and a future cooperation model with Britain that would respect the UK's sovereignty.

Headlines: U.S. business asks British PM May: how bad can Brexit get?
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May was reminded of how worried businesses are about Brexit on Wednesday when a rallying speech to executives in New York was met with a single stark question from the floor - just how bad can things get?

Headlines: UK faces permanent debate over financial rules after Brexit: lawmaker
Description: Britain faces a permanent debate over whether to copy or diverge from European Union financial rules after Brexit, a top UK lawmaker said on Wednesday in comments likely to prolong uncertainty for banks.

Headlines: Oil rises as investors fret over Iranian supply gaps
Description: Oil edged higher on Thursday, driven by the prospect of a shortfall in global supply once U.S. sanctions against major crude exporter Iran come into force in five weeks.

Headlines: Canada sticks to plan to stay at NAFTA talks despite Trump attack
Description: Canada on Thursday shrugged off U.S. President Donald Trump's criticism that talks to modernize NAFTA were moving too slowly and made clear it had to keep negotiating as long as there was a chance of success.

Headlines: Trump rejects Canada leader's request to meet, unhappy with NAFTA talks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he rejected Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's request for a meeting during the UN General Assembly this week because bilateral North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) talks are going poorly and the United States is unhappy with Canada's negotiators.

Headlines: Tencent Music, bound for U.S. IPO, profits from social savvy
Description: Tencent Music, which owns China's most popular music streaming apps, is often compared to Sweden's Spotify Technology but it offers more in the way of socially interactive services that is helping it hit bigger notes in money making.

Headlines: Unions accuse IKEA of undermining workers' rights in three markets
Description: Unions accused furniture retailer IKEA on Thursday of undermining workers' rights in the United States, Ireland and Portugal, and asked the Dutch government to mediate.

Headlines: Exclusive: With six months to go before Brexit, 630 finance jobs have left - Reuters survey
Description: As few as 630 UK-based finance jobs have been shifted or created overseas with just six months to go before Brexit, a far lower total than banks said could move after Britain's surprise vote to leave the European Union, according to a new Reuters survey.

Headlines: Canada, U.S. make progress in bid to save NAFTA, no deal yet: sources
Description: Canada and the United States on Saturday narrowed their differences in last-ditch talks to save NAFTA but there is no guarantee an agreement will be forged, two Ottawa sources said, a notion echoed by a top adviser to U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Trump was 'tolerant' in trade talks: Mexico president-elect
Description: Mexican President-elect Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Monday that U.S. President Donald Trump had an "open" and "tolerant" attitude during talks to renegotiate the North American Free Trade Agreement.

Headlines: Mexican auto parts makers see new trade deal boosting output
Description: Auto parts output in Mexico will jump about 10 percent over the next three years as automakers scramble to adhere to stricter content rules laid out in a new North American trade deal, a top industry executive said on Monday.

Headlines: Japan car makers welcome North America trade deal, but U.S. export curbs a risk
Description: Toyota, Nissan and Mazda welcomed on Tuesday the revised North America trade deal that left Japanese automakers unscathed but they may face a bumpy ride when Washington and Tokyo hold new talks on over $40 billion of annual U.S. auto imports from Japan.

Headlines: Exclusive: Exxon explores sale of U.S. Gulf of Mexico assets - sources
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp is exploring the sale of many of its U.S. Gulf of Mexico assets, as higher prices prompt the world's largest publicly traded oil company to review its portfolio, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Oil eases below four-year highs; U.S. inventory rise expected
Description: Oil prices eased slightly on Tuesday after rallying for three straight sessions, but remained close to four-year highs on worries that global supplies will drop due to Washington's sanctions on Iran.

Headlines: Tencent Music files for U.S. IPO, first-half revenue surges
Description: Tencent Music Entertainment, which owns China's most popular music apps, has filed for a U.S. IPO seeking funds to develop content and new services, in what is expected to be one of the biggest U.S. listings by a Chinese company this year.

Headlines: Global energy bosses send Trump a message: world needs Russian gas
Description: Global energy bosses assembled in Moscow on Wednesday said the world needed Russian gas to keep the lights on, in a clear message to U.S. President Donald Trump who has warned he may impose sanctions on Russian gas export projects.

Headlines: Brent hits new four-year high on Iran supply worries
Description: Brent crude rose nearly 2 percent after hitting a four-year high on Wednesday as the market focused on upcoming U.S. sanctions on Iran while shrugging off the year's largest weekly build in U.S. crude stockpiles and reports of higher Saudi Arabian and Russian production.

Headlines: U.S. hedge fund King Street urges Toshiba to speed up share buybacks
Description: Japan's Toshiba Corp is "severely undervalued" and should boost share repurchases, U.S. hedge fund King Street Capital Management LP said in a letter on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Saudi Arabia, Russia agreed in September to lift oil output, told U.S.
Description: Russia and Saudi Arabia struck a private deal in September to raise oil output to cool rising prices and informed the United States before a meeting in Algiers with other producers, four sources familiar with the plan said.

Headlines: U.S inquiry deepens Danske money-laundering crisis
Description: Danske Bank faces a U.S. criminal investigation into a 200 billion euro ($230 billion) money laundering scandal at its Estonian branch which has rocked investor faith in Denmark's biggest lender and forced its chief executive to quit.

Headlines: Cramer on Trump's Canada jab: This is no longer the art of the deal, but 'the art of destruction'
Description: Jim Cramer voices concern about the trade tensions between the U.S. and Canada after the president said he rejected a meeting with Canadian authorities.

Headlines: Swedbank says its anti-money laundering procedures not being investigated
Description: Sweden's Swedbank said on Thursday that there were no ongoing investigations into its anti-money laundering procedures, a day after its shares slumped on worries about cross-border transactions by banks in Estonia.

Headlines: Scooter company Bird enters Latin America with launch in Mexico City
