Headlines: China hails Trump-Xi summit, says 'very confident' in trade deal
Description: China on Thursday expressed confidence in striking a trade deal with the United States within their 90-day ceasefire period, praising the recent meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping as highly successful.

Headlines: GM CEO faces harsh criticism from U.S. lawmakers over Mexico investments
Description: General Motors Chief Executive Mary Barra came under harsh criticism from members of Congress from Michigan on Thursday for building a new vehicle in Mexico while ending production at five North American assembly plants and cutting nearly 15,000 jobs.

Headlines: S&P 500, Dow slip on trade worries, but end off of lows
Description: The S&P 500 and Dow industrials ended slightly negative but well above their session lows in volatile trading on Thursday as the arrest of a Chinese technology executive fanned fears of U.S-China tensions over trade, while some beaten-up big technology and internet shares posted gains.

Headlines: Noble Group's $3.5 billion restructuring at risk as authorities block new listing
Description: Noble Group's $3.5 billion debt rescue plan was thrown into doubt on Thursday when Singapore authorities said they would block the re-listing of shares in what was once Asia's top commodity trader.

Headlines: Huawei arrest just made companies like Apple less valuable, Jim Cramer says
Description: Jim Cramer warns that the arrest of a top Huawei executive automatically makes U.S. technology companies with business in China less valuable.

Headlines: Boeing CEO says hopeful U.S.-China on course to resolve trade dispute
Description: Boeing Co Chief Executive Officer Dennis Muilenburg said on Thursday he is hopeful that China and the U.S. are on a path to resolve their trade spat, on a day when global stocks fell on renewed fears of a trade war between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: Ericsson sorry for software glitch that hits mobile services in Britain and Japan
Description: Sweden's Ericsson apologized and said it was working hard to fix a software glitch that was responsible for millions of smartphone users in Britain, Japan and other countries losing internet access on Thursday.

Headlines: Hoarding for Brexit sparks race for warehouse space in Britain
Description: In a vast warehouse complex 40 miles north of London, staff are wrestling with ways to cram in more goods after a surge in demand from companies building stockpiles ahead of Brexit.

Headlines: Russia says detention of China's Huawei CFO shows U.S. arrogance
Description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Friday that the detention of Chinese technology giant Huawei's chief financial officer in Canada was an example of "arrogant" U.S. policy abroad.

Headlines: Trump upbeat on China talks; aides downplay Huawei arrest friction
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday sounded an optimistic note about trade negotiations with China as two of his top economic advisers downplayed friction from the arrest of a senior executive of Chinese telecom equipment maker Huawei Technologies.

Headlines: Global shares mixed as trade worries loom; oil surges
Description: Concerns over China-U.S. trade tensions gave European shares their worst week of losses in two months and sank U.S. stocks on Friday, overshadowing the lift from higher oil prices and jobs data.

Headlines: Exclusive: GE's push to fix power turbine problem goes global
Description: Utilities are shutting down at least 18 of General Electric Co's newest gas turbines for repairs at power plants from Taiwan to France, according to more than a dozen interviews with plant operators and industry experts.

Headlines: U.S. court issued Huawei CFO arrest warrant in August
Description: A New York court issued an arrest warrant for Huawei Technologies' chief financial officer Meng Wanzhou on Aug. 22, asking she be detained to stand trial to face U.S. charges, according to documents released during her bail hearing in Canada on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. accuses Huawei CFO of Iran sanctions cover-up; hearing adjourned
Description: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's chief financial officer faces U.S. accusations that she covered up her company's links to a firm that tried to sell equipment to Iran despite sanctions, a Canadian prosecutor said on Friday, arguing against giving her bail while she awaits extradition.

Headlines: Investors flee bonds and stocks in turbulent week for growth and trade
Description: Investors pulled billions from bonds and stocks this week as U.S. bond movements triggered fears over global growth and a trade tussle between the United States and China heated up, strategists at Bank of America Merrill Lynch said on Friday.

Headlines: China expresses concern over reported Japan government ban on Huawei, ZTE
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Friday that it was seriously concerned over reports that Japan plans to ban government purchases of equipment from China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd and ZTE Corp.

Headlines: China's Huawei appoints chairman as acting CFO after executive's arrest
Description: China's Huawei Technologies has appointed Chairman Liang Hua as acting chief financial officer (CFO) following the arrest in Canada of its CFO, who faces extradition to the United States, staff briefed on an internal memo told Reuters.

Headlines: Explainer: What is China's Huawei Technologies and why is it controversial?
Description: The arrest in Canada of Meng Wanzhou, a top executive at China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd and daughter of the founder and CEO, jolted the global business community on Thursday and raised fears that a truce in the U.S.-China trade war could come to a swift end.

Headlines: Factbox: Power plants with GE turbines shutting for repairs
Description: Utilities are shutting down at least 18 of General Electric Co's newest gas turbines for repairs at power plants from Taiwan to France, according to more than a dozen interviews with plant operators and industry experts.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. probe of China's Huawei includes bank fraud accusations: sources
Description: Chinese telecoms giant Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's chief financial officer was arrested as part of a U.S. investigation into an alleged scheme to use the global banking system to evade U.S. sanctions against Iran, according to people familiar with the probe.

Headlines: Russia's Putin, Novak discussed meeting with OPEC: Kremlin
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Energy Minister Alexander Novak held discussions prior to a meeting with the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries in Vienna, a Kremlin spokesman said on Friday.

Headlines: China's Anta Sports-led group buying Finland's Amer Sports for $5.2 billion
Description: A consortium led by China's Anta Sports made an offer to acquire Finland's Amer Sports in a deal that values the company at 4.6 billion euros ($5.23 billion), the Chinese firm said on Friday.

Headlines: Japan government to halt buying Huawei, ZTE equipment: sources
Description: Japan plans to ban government purchases of equipment from China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd and ZTE Corp to beef up its defenses against intelligence leaks and cyber attacks, sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Sleeping bags and mini golf as traders brace for Brexit all-nighter
Description: As lawmakers gather in Britain's parliament on Tuesday to vote on the future of the country's relationship with Europe, traders in London's financial hub will be bracing for a potential burst of market turmoil that could affect the Brexit process itself.

Headlines: Trump: 'China talks are going very well'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday sounded an optimistic note about negotiations with China on trade issues, but did not offer any details in an early morning tweet, as major companies worried about how the arrest of a top Huawei executive would affect relations between Washington and Beijing.

Headlines: Nissan blamed Ghosn probe for CEO no-show in Amsterdam: sources
Description: Nissan told Renault its Chief Executive Hiroto Saikawa was unable to attend an Amsterdam meeting because he was assisting Tokyo prosecutors investigating alleged misconduct led by Carlos Ghosn, chairman of the carmakers' alliance, sources with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Bayer's German workers mostly spared from Monsanto-related job cuts: labor boss
Description: The lion's share of job cuts from folding U.S. seed maker Monsanto into Bayer's agriculture unit will affect workers outside Germany, the head of Bayer's works council told Reuters.

Headlines: Huawei CFO seeks bail on health concerns; Canada wants her in jail
Description: The CFO of China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] argued that she should be released on bail while awaiting an extradition hearing, citing her longstanding ties to Canada, properties she owns in Vancouver and fears for her health while incarcerated, court documents showed on Sunday.

Headlines: China urges Canada to free Huawei CFO or face consequences
Description: China warned Canada on Saturday that there would be severe consequences if it did not immediately release Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's [HWT.UL] chief financial officer, calling the case "extremely nasty".

Headlines: China says it has never heard of any country having security problem with Huawei
Description: China's foreign ministry on Monday said it had never heard of any country having a security problem with Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL], after a top executive of the telecoms giant was arrested in Canada.

Headlines: Google CEO defends 'integrity' of products ahead of testimony
Description: The chief executive officer of Alphabet Inc's Google on Monday defended the integrity of the company's products a day ahead of a congressional hearing where he is expected to face tough questions from U.S. lawmakers.

Headlines: NZ's Restaurant Brands signs deal to expand Taco Bell in NZ, Australia
Description: Fast-food group Restaurant Brands New Zealand Ltd inked a deal to expand "Tex-Mex" food chain Taco Bell's brand in New Zealand and in Australia's New South Wales, the company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Huawei CFO seeks bail, cites health fears behind bars: court documents
Description: A top executive of China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] argued that she should be let out on bail while awaiting an extradition hearing due to severe hypertension and fears for her health while incarcerated in Canada, court documents released on Sunday showed.

Headlines: Japan's top three telcos to exclude Huawei, ZTE network equipment: Kyodo
Description: Japan's big three telecom operators plan not to use current equipment and upcoming fifth-generation (5G) gear from China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] and ZTE Corp , Kyodo News reported on Monday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump says he could intervene in U.S. case against Huawei CFO
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he would intervene in the Justice Department's case against a top executive at China's Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL] if it would serve national security interests or help close a trade deal with China.

Headlines: White House expects China to cut car tariffs after trade call: auto executive
Description: White House officials told automakers following a U.S.-China trade call that the Trump administration believes China will cut tariffs on U.S. autos to 15 percent from the current 40 percent, an auto executive said on Tuesday after being briefed on the previous evening's call.

Headlines: S&P 500, Dow edge lower as U.S. shutdown threat, China trade in focus
Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow closed marginally lower after volatile trading on Tuesday as investors swiveled their focus between China-U.S. trade talks, President Donald Trump's threat to shut down the U.S. government and political uncertainty in Britain.

Headlines: China, U.S. discuss road map for next stage of trade talks
Description: China has agreed to cut tariffs on U.S.-built cars and auto parts to 15 percent from the current 40 percent, a Trump administration official said on Tuesday, setting the stage for a new talks aimed at easing the bitter trade war between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: S&P 500, Dow edge lower as U.S. shutdown threat, China trade in focus
Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow closed marginally lower after volatile trading on Tuesday as investors swiveled their focus between China-U.S. trade talks, President Donald Trump's threat to shut down the U.S. government and political uncertainty in Britain.

Headlines: Morrisons shares rise on takeover chatter
Description: WM Morrisons shares jumped on Tuesday as traders cited market rumors that the UK supermarket chain could be subject to a takeover approach by U.S. online retail giant Amazon.com Inc .

Headlines: U.S. voices concern about detention of Canadian in China
Description: The U.S. State Department expressed concern on Tuesday about reports a Canadian citizen has been detained in China following the arrest of Huawei Technologies' [HWT.UL] chief financial officer in Canada, and it urged Beijing to end arbitrary detentions.

Headlines: China to cut tariffs on U.S. autos; documentation, timing unclear: official
Description: China has indicated it will cut tariffs on U.S.-made autos and car parts, a Trump administration official said on Tuesday, adding that Washington is still awaiting formal documentation of the reduction and details on timing of the move.

Headlines: China's Zhoushan to go after Singapore marine hub's top billing
Description: China's port city of Zhoushan is planning to challenge Singapore's dominance of the multi-billion dollar shipping fuel industry, relying on proximity to some of the world's biggest ports and Beijing's support to give it an edge.

Headlines: Trade thaw lifts stocks, sterling rises on May bets
Description: A gauge of global stock markets rallied along with U.S. Treasury yields on Wednesday as optimism abounded for a trade thaw between the United States and China while sterling bounced on indications UK Prime Minister Theresa May would survive a no-confidence vote.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump says China 'back in the market' for U.S. soybeans
Description: President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that China was buying a "tremendous amount" of U.S. soybeans and that trade talks with Beijing were already under way by telephone, with more meetings likely among U.S. and Chinese officials.

Headlines: Trump says would intervene in arrest of Chinese executive
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he would intervene with the U.S. Justice Department in the case against a Chinese telecommunications executive if it would help secure a trade deal with Beijing.

Headlines: China's Tencent Music raises nearly $1.1 billion in U.S. IPO
Description: China-based music streaming company Tencent Music Entertainment Group said it raised close to $1.1 billion in its U.S. initial public offering (IPO) after pricing its shares at the bottom of its targeted range.

Headlines: China welcomes any effort to move Huawei case toward resolution
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Wednesday that Canada's arrest of Meng Wanzhou, a top executive with Chinese tech giant Huawei, was a mistake from the start, and welcomed any efforts to move the case toward a correct resolution.

Headlines: United Airlines to add international routes from San Francisco
Description: United Continental Holdings Inc said on Wednesday it would add flights to New Delhi, Toronto and Melbourne from San Francisco, as the No. 3 U.S. airline looks to tap higher-paying international routes.

Headlines: Exclusive: China makes first big U.S. soybean purchase since Trump-Xi truce
Description: China on Wednesday made its first major purchases of U.S. soybeans since President Donald Trump and his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping struck a trade war truce earlier this month, providing some relief to U.S. farmers who have struggled to find buyers for their record-large harvest.

Headlines: Top German court rules Uber limousine service illegal
Description: Germany's highest court ruled on Thursday that a defunct limousine service offered by Uber [UBER.UL] was illegal, in a setback for the U.S. ride-hailing company that has struggled to comply with the law in Europe's largest economy.

Headlines: Canada warns U.S. not to politicize extradition cases
Description: Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland on Wednesday warned the United States not to politicize extradition cases, a day after President Donald Trump said he could intervene in the affair of a Chinese executive detained in Canada at Washington's request.

Headlines: U.S. confirms China soybean sale, but size disappoints
Description: China's meager first purchase of U.S. soybeans since its trade war with the United States began in July disappointed farmers, grain traders and a U.S. government official hoping for larger sales to lift slumping prices and absorb a huge surplus across the U.S. farm belt, they said on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Carlsberg, United Breweries plead leniency in India beer cartel probe - sources
Description: Denmark's Carlsberg and India's United Breweries have filed pleas with Indian authorities, seeking leniency in a probe into alleged collusion to fix beer prices, five sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Ford's rejection of deal for Blanquefort was 'betrayal': French minister
Description: Ford's rejection of a rescue deal for the Blanquefort site in France represented a "betrayal" by the U.S. carmaker, said French finance minister Bruno Le Maire on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump praises China move on autos, says trade deal could happen soon
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump welcomed China's move on Friday to suspend additional tariffs on U.S.-made vehicles, saying it could help push forward a larger trade deal with Beijing.

Headlines: Deutsche Telekom reviews Huawei ties; Orange says no on 5G
Description: Huawei [HWT.UL] faces fresh challenges in Europe after Germany's Deutsche Telekom announced it would review its vendor strategy and Orange said it would not hire the Chinese firm to build its next-generation network in France.

Headlines: Explainer: Ex-Nissan chief Ghosn affair raises issues beyond one man, one company
Description: How big should executive pay packets be? How widespread is lax corporate governance in Japan? And what's the future of the alliance between Nissan and France's Renault?

Headlines: Canada says it agrees with U.S. on need to keep politics out of Huawei case
Description: Canada and the United States agreed on Friday that politics should be kept out of the process to extradite senior Huawei Technologies Co [HWT.UL] executive Meng Wanzhou, who is being held on a U.S. extradition warrant, Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland said.

Headlines: Starbucks sales growth to be steady despite UberEats deal, plans for China expansion
Description: Starbucks Corp said on Thursday it was partnering with UberEats for delivery from about 3,500 U.S. stores and would nearly double its outlets in China over the next four years, but forecast that same-store sales would remain steady, sending shares down 3 percent.

Headlines: Exclusive: T-Mobile, Sprint see Huawei shun clinching U.S. deal - sources
Description: (This story corrects paragraph 8 to show Wanzhou was arrested in Canada, not China)

Headlines: Boeing opens first 737 plant in China amid U.S.-Sino trade war
Description: Boeing Co opened its first 737 completion plant in China on Saturday, a strategic investment aimed at building a sales lead over arch-rival Airbus in one of the world's top travel markets that has been overshadowed by the U.S-China trade war.

Headlines: Nord Stream 2 can be justified if Ukraine's interests safeguarded
Description: Germany's economy minister said he believed the Russian-backed Nord Stream 2 pipeline can go ahead while preserving Ukraine's vital interests, but that Berlin is also in talks to diversify its energy supply with liquefied natural gas.

Headlines: Embraer's net proceeds from Boeing deal the same, despite higher price
Description: Brazil's Embraer SA will receive the same net proceeds from a deal to sell 80 percent of its commercial jet unit to Boeing Co, even though the U.S. aircraft maker increased the enterprise value which includes debt by 11 percent.

Headlines: China says U.S. has brought back 'the ghost of unilateralism' to WTO
Description: China said on Monday that the Trump administration's trade measures on items from steel to intellectual property taken under the guise national security were "bringing back to life the ghost of unilateralism".

Headlines: Canada gets consular access to second man detained in China
Description: Canadian diplomats gained consular access on Sunday to the second of two men detained by China over the past week, Canada's foreign ministry said in a statement that gave few details, as China said it was ensuring their rights were protected.

Headlines: General Dynamics warns Canada: Canceling Saudi deal would cost billions
Description: General Dynamics Corp on Monday put pressure on Ottawa over the sale of armored vehicles to Saudi Arabia, warning that the federal government would incur "billions of dollars of liability" by unilaterally scrapping the deal.

Headlines: FedEx sees global trade slowdown, says U.S. economy still 'solid'
Description: FedEx Corp on Tuesday slashed its 2019 forecast after Europe's economy weakened and the U.S. trade row exacerbated a slowdown in China, sending shares in the package delivery company tumbling more than 6 percent after the closing bell.

Headlines: Heard on the grapevine: How Pacific trade pact primes New Zealand wine for Japan buzz
Description: From sleepy New Zealand hillsides to sleek Tokyo dining scenes, a bottle of Hawke's Bay wine shipped to Japan traces an arc that exporters like Nigel Avery see as an avenue for multi-million dollar growth built on a free trade pact.

Headlines: Raytheon wins $568 million U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Description: Raytheon Co was awarded a $568 million defense contract for modifications to a Patriot missile defense system it is building as part of a foreign military sale to Sweden, the Pentagon said on Thursday.

Headlines: Wall St. slides on Fed plans; Nasdaq flirts with bear territory
Description: U.S. stocks slid on Thursday, with the Nasdaq on the cusp of confirming bear market territory, as the Federal Reserve's plan to continue its balance sheet reduction and the threat of a partial government shutdown fueled investor anxieties.

Headlines: Nissan to lay off 1,000 Mexican workers, cites market challenges
Description: Japanese carmaker Nissan Motor Co Ltd will lay off about 1,000 workers in Mexico at two factories, citing "challenging market conditions," the company said on Thursday.

Headlines: Apple changes how it reports U.S. national security requests
Description: Apple Inc on Thursday changed how it reports on U.S. national security requests for user data, bringing its procedures more in line with those of technology rivals such as Microsoft Corp and Alphabet Inc's Google.

Headlines: Truckmaker Volvo builds safety stockpiles to prepare for no-deal Brexit
Description: Sweden's AB Volvo has triggered its hard Brexit contingency plans, with the truckmaker building "safety stock" with its British dealers and considering alternative shipping routes to minimize disruption.

Headlines: Bombardier delivers Global 7500 jet as corporate travel race intensifies
Description: Canada's Bombardier Inc will deliver its first Global 7500 corporate jet on Thursday, premiering a full-sized bed and optional en-suite shower, in a challenge to U.S. planemaker Gulfstream at the top of the luxury jet market.

Headlines: ExxonMobil shelves Canada LNG export project
Description: U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil Corp has withdrawn its WCC liquefied natural gas (LNG) export terminal in Canada from the environmental assessment process, it said on Thursday, signaling that the project has been shelved.

Headlines: German court rules Apple infringed Qualcomm patent
Description: A German court ruled on Thursday that iPhone maker Apple Inc infringed a hardware patent of Qualcomm Inc and said the U.S. company could no longer sell some iPhone models in Germany which contain a particular component.

Headlines: JD.com CEO will not face assault charges in Minnesota
Description: Minnesota prosecutors will not charge the billionaire chief executive officer of China's JD.com Inc, Richard Liu, after he was accused of rape by a University of Minnesota student during a recent U.S. visit, authorities said on Friday.

Headlines: Global stock indexes slide as U.S. government shutdown looms
Description: World stock markets continued a week-long sell-off on Friday as the threat of a U.S. government shutdown and further hikes in U.S. borrowing costs compounded investor anxiety that global economic growth is slowing.

Headlines: Want to sue Venezuela for millions? These firms can help, for a price
Description: As Venezuela collapses, one little-known U.S. investment fund is poised to win big from litigation against its socialist government: Tenor Capital Management.

Headlines: China poised to buy more U.S. soybeans: sources
Description: China plans to make a third round of U.S. soybean purchases within days, two sources familiar with the matter said on Thursday, after a trade war truce between Washington and Beijing this month triggered two waves of buying.

Headlines: Exclusive: Global traders halt new Iran food deals as U.S. sanctions bite - sources
Description: Cargill, Bunge and other global traders have halted food supply deals with Iran because new U.S. sanctions have paralyzed banking systems required to secure payments, industry and Iranian government sources say.

Headlines: Nike shares rise as strong quarterly results allay China demand concerns
Description: Nike Inc shares rose 9 percent on Friday, after the company's solid quarterly results eased worries that escalating trade tensions between Washington and Beijing would weigh on China demand and hurt the sportswear maker's growth story.

Headlines: Venezuela navy confronts Exxon oil ship in Guyana border dispute
Description: Venezuela's navy "intercepted" a ship exploring for oil on behalf of Exxon Mobil Corp in Guyanese waters over the weekend, Guyana's foreign ministry said in a statement, while neighboring Venezuela said the incident occurred within its territory.

Headlines: Guyana, Exxon in talks after Venezuela dispute halts marine survey
Description: Guyana's government is "in discussion" with Exxon Mobil after two ships searching for oil off the South American country's coast halted work following a weekend confrontation with Venezuela's navy, Guyana's foreign minister said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. trade delegation to travel to China week of January 7 for talks -Bloomberg
Description: A U.S. trade team will travel to Beijing the week of Jan. 7 to hold talks with Chinese officials, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday, citing two people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Exxon continues drilling offshore Guyana as Venezuela lodges complaint
Description: Exxon Mobil Corp said on Wednesday its oil drilling and development activities offshore Guyana were unaffected by a weekend incident in which Venezuela's navy stopped two exploration vessels the company had hired.

Headlines: German industry views Brexit, Trump as biggest risks to economy
Description: Germany's leading industry groups said on Wednesday that Britain's departure from the European Union and trade disputes triggered by U.S. President Donald Trump's 'America First' policies were posing the biggest risks to growth and prosperity.

Headlines: Iran says private exporters had no problem selling its oil
Description: Iran said on Wednesday private exporters have had "no problems" selling Iranian oil, and 3 million barrels of crude could be sold soon to non-government traders, state media reported, despite U.S. sanctions targeting Tehran's oil sales.

Headlines: Mexico says military to play larger role in fighting fuel theft
Description: Mexico's government unveiled a plan on Thursday to step up use of the armed forces to combat fuel theft, vowing to root out corrupt officials it says are largely responsible for a problem that has cost the country billions of dollars.

Headlines: Exclusive: White House mulls new year executive order to bar Huawei, ZTE purchases
Description: President Donald Trump is considering an executive order in the new year to declare a national emergency that would bar U.S. companies from using telecommunications equipment made by China's Huawei and ZTE, three sources familiar with the situation told Reuters.

Headlines: Tesla sets up Shanghai financial leasing unit as China plans accelerate
Description: Tesla Inc has registered a financial leasing company in China, a local business registration filing shows, in the latest sign the U.S. electric car maker is attempting to speed up its push into China.

Headlines: New Mexico oil producers brace for tighter regulation as output jumps
Description: Crude oil output has more than doubled in New Mexico over the last four years, making it the No. 3 producer among U.S. states, but a January change in state leadership to Democratic control has industry executives fearing tougher regulations are coming.

Headlines: China willing to work with U.S. to implement Argentina talks agreement: Foreign Ministry
Description: China is willing to work with the United States to implement the consensus reached during talks between the two countries' leaders in Argentina, the Chinese foreign ministry said in a statement on Sunday.

Headlines: Oil posts first year of losses since 2015
Description: Oil prices ended with full-year losses for the first time since 2015, after a desultory fourth quarter that saw buyers flee the market over growing worries about a supply glut and mixed signals related to renewed U.S. sanctions on Iran.

Headlines: Canada Goose's first China store draws eager crowds despite diplomatic headwinds
Description: Large crowds have been drawn to Canada Goose's new outdoor wear store in downtown Beijing, its first in mainland China, since its opening on Friday, despite sub-zero temperatures and a chill in China's relations with Canada.

Headlines: China factory activity shrinks for first time in over two years, 2019 looks tougher
Description: China's factory activity contracted for the first time in over two years in December, highlighting the challenges facing Beijing as it seeks to end a bruising trade war with Washington and reduce the risk of a sharper economic slowdown in 2019.

Headlines: Trump says 'big progress' on possible China trade deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Twitter that he had a "long and very good call" with Chinese President Xi Jinping and that a possible trade deal between the United States and China was progressing well.

Headlines: Google wins U.S. approval for new radar-based motion sensor
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google unit won approval from U.S. regulators to deploy a radar-based motion sensing device known as Project Soli.

Headlines: Bill Gates' nuclear venture hits snag amid U.S. restrictions on China deals: WSJ
Description: TerraPower LLC, a nuclear energy venture chaired by Microsoft Corp co-founder Bill Gates, is seeking a new partner for early-stage trials of its technology after new U.S. rules forced it to abandon an agreement with China, company officials told the Wall Street Journal.

Headlines: U.S. drugmaker J&J's India sales dip 3 percent in 2017/18: filing
Description: Johnson & Johnson's sales in India dipped 3 percent in the year to March 2018, a regulatory filing showed on Thursday, as the U.S. drugmaker grappled with the country's stringent medical device pricing policies.

Headlines: Truckmaker Volvo to take $778 million emissions hit
Description: Sweden's Volvo is setting aside 7 billion Swedish crowns ($778 million) to cover costs related to its admission in October that its truck and bus engines could be exceeding limits for nitrogen oxide emissions.

Headlines: Apple sales should pick up when U.S.-China strike trade deal: Trump adviser
Description: A sharp drop in Chinese economic growth will hit the profits of U.S. firms but sales by Apple Inc and other American companies should recover once Washington strikes a trade deal with Beijing, a senior White House adviser said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. factory activity hits two-year low, casts shadow over economy
Description: U.S. manufacturing activity slowed sharply to a two-year low in December amid a plunge in new orders and hiring at factories, suggesting the economy was probably not immune to slowing growth in China and Europe.

Headlines: Powell tells markets Fed is flexible and aware of risks
Description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell on Friday sought to ease market concerns that the U.S. central bank was ignoring signs of an economic slowdown, saying he was aware of the risks and would be patient and flexible in policy decisions this year.

Headlines: Trump says China woes help U.S. in trade talks, downplays Apple warning
Description: President Donald Trump on Friday downplayed a revenue warning from Apple Inc that cited slowing sales in China and said China's weakening economic growth puts the United States in a strong position as negotiators from the world's two largest economies prepare for trade talks next week.

Headlines: Offices grow 'brains' as companies seek to attract smarter workers
Description: Employees will not need a key to get into the office of the future when it opens in Berlin this year, featuring ample meeting space, plenty of copy machines always stocked with paper along with high-quality air processed to maximize worker health and minimize sick time.

Headlines: Qualcomm enforces ban to halt some Apple iPhone sales in Germany
Description: U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm Inc took steps to enforce a court order banning the sale of some iPhone models in Germany following a patent dispute, a move that will likely see Apple Inc pull those models from its German stores.

Headlines: Tesla to start delivering Model 3 to China buyers in March
Description: Tesla Inc said on Friday it plans to start delivering Model 3 cars to customers in China in March, cementing a time frame that the U.S. electric vehicle (EV) maker's chief executive, Elon Musk, tweeted about late last year.

Headlines: U.S., China could settle immediate trade issues: Ross on CNBC
Description: The United States and China are likely to reach a good settlement over immediate trade issues while agreement on structural trade issues and enforcement will be harder, U.S. Secretary of Commerce Wilbur Ross said on Monday as U.S.-China trade talks resumed.

Headlines: U.S., China can reach trade deal 'we can live with': U.S. Commerce secretary
Description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross predicted on Monday that Beijing and Washington could reach a trade deal that "we can live with" as dozens of officials from the world's two largest economies resumed talks in a bid to end their trade dispute.

Headlines: Trump: Weakness in China economy gives Beijing incentive for trade deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Sunday that trade talks with China were going very well and that weakness in the Chinese economy gave Beijing a reason to work toward a deal.

Headlines: Chinese tech investors flee Silicon Valley as Trump tightens scrutiny
Description: New Trump administration policies aimed at curbing China's access to American innovation have all but halted Chinese investment in U.S. technology startups, as both investors and startup founders abandon deals amid scrutiny from Washington.

Headlines: Huawei sues U.S. firm InterDigital in China over patent practices
Description: InterDigital Inc on Monday said Huawei Technologies Co Ltd filed a lawsuit against it in China, alleging the U.S. technology firm had not licensed its intellectual property on fair terms.

Headlines: Stocks rise on trade talk optimism; rate outlook hits dollar
Description: An index of world stocks rose on Monday, adding to Friday's strong gains, on optimism about the outcome of trade talks between Washington and Beijing.

Headlines: U.S. delegation member says trade talks with China to continue Wednesday
Description: Trade talks between the United States and China will continue on Wednesday, U.S. delegation member Steven Winberg said on Tuesday, as the world's two largest economies seek to resolve a bitter trade dispute.

Headlines: Factbox: China approves new GMO soybean, corn and canola traits
Description: China approved five genetically modified crops for import on Tuesday, the first in about 18 months, as representatives from the Asian country and the United States met in face-to-face talks to try to resolve trade disagreements.

Headlines: China gives long-awaited GM crop approvals amid U.S. trade talks
Description: China approved five genetically modified (GM) crops for import on Tuesday, the first in about 18 months in a move that could boost its overseas grains purchases and ease pressure from the United States to open its markets to more farm goods.

Headlines: Venezuela congress slams oil deals with U.S., French companies
Description: Venezuela's opposition-run congress on Tuesday issued a resolution calling deals between state-run oil company PDVSA [PDVSA.UL] and U.S. and French companies announced this week illegal, since they had not been sent to lawmakers for approval.

Headlines: U.S. government official says trade talks with China continuing Wednesday
Description: Trade talks between China and the United States will continue on Wednesday, a U.S. government official told reporters.

Headlines: Monsanto patent victory seen as a boost for biotech investment in India
Description: India's Supreme Court ruled on Tuesday that Monsanto can claim patents on its genetically modified (GM) cotton seeds, a victory for the U.S. company that is expected to encourage biotechnology firms to step up investment in the country.

Headlines: Prospect of U.S. profit drop rises for investors
Description: Investors are growing more fearful that U.S. companies' profits could shrink this year following Apple's warning of soft demand in China, coupled with mounting evidence of a drag from tariffs, a global slowdown and fading tailwinds from tax cuts.

Headlines: U.S. initiative warns firms of hacking by China, other countries
Description: The Trump administration on Monday launched a drive to push U.S. firms to better protect their trade secrets from foreign hackers, following a slew of cases accusing individuals and companies of economic espionage for China.

Headlines: Danske Bank, ex-CEO are sued in U.S. over money laundering scandal
Description: Danske Bank A/S and four former top executives were sued on Wednesday by a U.S. shareholder that accused Denmark's largest bank of defrauding investors and inflating its share price by hiding and failing to stop widespread money laundering at its Estonian branch.

Headlines: Renault's CEO moved tax domicile to Netherlands in 2012: paper
Description: Carlos Ghosn, chief executive of French carmaker Renault and ex Nissan chairman, has not had his tax domicile France since 2012, opting instead for the more fiscally favorable Netherlands, French newspaper Liberation reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Mexico fuel shortage worries industry as lines in capital grow
Description: Gasoline shortages in Mexico sparked by a crackdown on fuel theft prompted warnings from business leaders that industries like carmaking will suffer if the shortfalls persist as lines at gas stations in the capital grew on Wednesday.

Headlines: Pacific trade deal spurs Canadian farm sales to Japan as U.S. watches
Description: At the Canadian embassy in Tokyo last month, beef promoters flew in a chef from Canada to cook New York strip steaks for hungry Japanese importers and restaurant suppliers.

Headlines: U.S. expects China's top trade negotiator to visit 'most likely' this month
Description: U.S. officials expect China's top trade negotiator may visit Washington this month, signaling that higher-level discussions are likely to follow this week's talks with mid-level officials in Beijing as the world's two largest economies try to hammer out a deal to end a tit-for-tat tariff war.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. is having tremendous success with China on trade
Description: President Donald Trump said on Thursday the United States was having tremendous success in its trade negotiations with China, a day after U.S. and Chinese officials concluded three days of talks in Beijing.

Headlines: In Beijing talks, U.S. seeks details on Chinese goods purchases, trade promises
Description: U.S. officials used three days of trade talks in Beijing to demand more details on China's pledge to make big purchases of American goods, as well as to push for ways to hold China to any commitments on changes to industrial policies.

Headlines: Nike's Dutch tax status investigated by EU regulators
Description: The European Commission has opened an investigation into the tax treatment of Nike Inc in the Netherlands, saying this may have given the U.S. sportswear maker an illegal advantage.

Headlines: Nike's Dutch tax status investigated by EU regulators
Description: The European Commission has opened an investigation into the tax treatment of Nike Inc in the Netherlands, saying this may have given the U.S. sportswear maker an illegal advantage.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trafigura refuses to hand over emails in Brazil bribery case
Description: Commodities trader Trafigura [TRAFGF.UL] has refused a judge's order to hand over the email archives of two former executives in Brazil who are facing corruption charges over accusations they bribed officials at state-run oil firm Petroleo Brasileiro.

Headlines: Exclusive: China to set lower GDP growth target of 6-6.5 percent in 2019 - sources
Description: China plans to set a lower economic growth target of 6-6.5 percent in 2019 compared with last year's target of "around" 6.5 percent, policy sources told Reuters, as Beijing gears up to cope with higher U.S. tariffs and weakening domestic demand.

Headlines: Indonesia's plans to regulate ride-hailing rates threaten Grab, Go-Jek models
Description: Indonesia is preparing to launch regulations fixing the rates drivers and riders for ride-hailing services such as Grab and Go-Jek receive, two government officials said this week, creating potential obstacles for the companies' expansion.

Headlines: German antitrust body opposes Siemens-Alstom merger: report
Description: Germany's antitrust authority has expressed concerns to the European Union's competition watchdog about the planned merger of the rail operations of Siemens and France's Alstom , a newspaper reported on Sunday.

Headlines: Samsung to launch India-first smartphones to counter Chinese rivals
Description: Samsung plans to launch a budget smartphone series in India ahead of a global release, aiming to regain ground ceded to Chinese rivals such as Xiaomi in the world's second-biggest mobile phone market.

Headlines: Bank of China to enable payment in yuan on U.S. e-commerce platforms: Xinhua
Description: Bank of China's New York branch will enable Chinese firms to receive payment in yuan rather than dollars from their sales on U.S. e-commerce platforms this year, the official Xinhua news agency reported on Sunday.

Headlines: China worries weigh on Wall Street, earnings expectations fall
Description: U.S. stocks declined on Monday as an unexpected drop in China's exports reignited worries of a global economic slowdown and prompted caution among investors as the corporate earnings season kicked off.

Headlines: Tech execs tell Cramer behind closed doors they support Trump's hardline trade policy on China
Description: Jim Cramer says technology executives are telling him off camera that they support the Trump administration's hawkish approach to trade with China.

Headlines: Trump predicts U.S. will reach trade deal with China
Description: President Donald Trump on Monday predicted the United States would reach a deal with China to end a tit-for-tat trade war, saying Beijing wants to negotiate and that talks are going well.

Headlines: Factbox: Huawei's challenges in Europe mount after Polish arrests
Description: China's Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL], the leading global supplier of telecoms network equipment, faces questions over its access to European markets after the arrest of a sales executive in Poland on suspicion of spying.

Headlines: China says countries should end 'fabrications' about Huawei
Description: China on Monday urged countries to end "fabrications" about Huawei, after an official in Poland said his country could limit the use of the company's products by public entities following the arrest of a Huawei employee there on spying allegations.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia plans $2 billion solar and carbon black complex: official
Description: Saudi Arabia plans to develop a $2 billion solar and carbon black integrated complex in partnership with Chinaâ€™s Longi and South Koreaâ€™s OCI, a Saudi official said.

Headlines: First U.S. crude cargoes head to China since trade breakthrough: sources
Description: Three cargoes of U.S. crude are heading to China from the U.S. Gulf Coast, trade sources said on Monday, the first departures since late September and a 90-day pause in the two countries' trade war that began last month.

Headlines: USTR promises exclusion process for higher tariffs if China talks fail
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer has assured lawmakers that companies will be able to request exclusions on tariffs on $200 billion worth of goods under discussion with Beijing if talks do not yield a deal by the March 2 deadline.

Headlines: Netflix, China boost Wall Street as investors shrug off Brexit vote
Description: U.S. stocks rose on Tuesday as technology and internet stocks gained on Netflix Inc's plans to raise fees for U.S. subscribers and hopes of more stimulus for China's slowing economy fostered a risk-on mood among investors.

Headlines: Stocks rise on China hopes; sterling rebounds as Brexit vote fails
Description: Major world stock markets climbed on Tuesday on hopes of more stimulus for China's economy, while sterling rebounded from the day's lows after British lawmakers defeated Prime Minister Theresa May's deal on withdrawing from the European Union.

Headlines: Sterling up after May wins confidence vote; stocks climb
Description: Major world stock indexes rose on Wednesday, with the S&P 500 supported by sharply higher U.S. bank shares after strong earnings, while the pound was up after British Prime Minister Theresa May's government won a confidence vote in parliament.

Headlines: Explainer: Why Siemens-Alstom rail merger is creating European tensions
Description: Germany's Siemens and France's Alstom agreed in 2017 to merge their rail assets, hoping to create a European industrial champion. But the EU's competition authority has doubts about the deal and could turn it down, despite the companies offering to take steps to clinch it.

Headlines: Trade war shifts feed for U.S. hogs away from ethanol byproduct
Description: A steep downturn in U.S. ethanol output linked to the trade war with China is raising costs for American farmers who feed a byproduct of the corn-based biofuel to hogs, cattle and chickens.

Headlines: Germany considers barring Huawei from 5G networks
Description: The German government is debating whether to follow the United States and allies like Australia in restricting China's Huawei Technologies from accessing its next-generation mobile networks on national-security grounds.

Headlines: UK committed to nuclear power after Hitachi decision: PM May's spokesman
Description: Britain is committed to the nuclear power sector, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Thursday, after Japan's Hitachi Ltd froze a 3 trillion yen ($28 billion) nuclear power project in Wales.

Headlines: China calls proposed U.S. legislation against Huawei, ZTE 'hysteria'
Description: China's Foreign Ministry said on Thursday that proposed U.S. legislation targeting Huawei, ZTE and other Chinese telecommunications equipment companies was due to "hysteria", and urged U.S. lawmakers to stop the bills.

Headlines: China's growth set to slow to 6.3 percent in 2019, more stimulus seen: Reuters poll
Description: China's economy is expected to cool further this year as domestic demand weakens and exports are hit by U.S. tariffs, a Reuters poll showed on Thursday, reinforcing views Beijing will need to roll out more stimulus measures.

Headlines: Shutdown is starting to hurt Trump's financial deregulation agenda
Description: The U.S. government shutdown over President Donald Trump's call for Congress to fund a wall he promised to build on the U.S.- Mexican border is threatening another campaign pledge to make rules easier to navigate for banks and corporations.

Headlines: Here's the real reason why stocks popped on China trade reports: Cramer
Description: Jim Cramer says U.S. investors seem to be willing to accept a bad trade deal with China if it means getting back to "business as usual."

Headlines: Wall Street advances as industrials jump on trade hopes
Description: U.S. stocks advanced on Thursday as hopes of a resolution to the trade dispute between the United States and China boosted industrial shares and lifted investor sentiment.

Headlines: Canada dismisses China's warning of repercussions over Huawei ban
Description: Canada's government on Friday dismissed China's warning of repercussions if Ottawa banned Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] from supplying equipment to 5G networks, saying it would not compromise on security.

Headlines: Wall Street extends rally on U.S.-China trade optimism
Description: U.S. stocks rallied on Friday, helping Wall Street's major indexes advance for the fourth consecutive week, as increased hopes the United States and China would resolve their trade dispute lifted shares across sectors.

Headlines: Explainer: How U.S.-China talks differ from any other trade deal
Description: The trade deal that U.S. negotiators are seeking with China may have more in common with a sanctions-monitoring regime than a traditional trade pact.

Headlines: AT&T ads returning to YouTube, two years after pulling back over content
Description: AT&T Inc said Friday it will again buy advertising on Alphabet Inc's YouTube, nearly two years after the U.S. wireless carrier left the video platform when it discovered its ads may have appeared next to inappropriate content.

Headlines: Qatar emir to attend Beirut's Arab economic summit
Description: Qatar's emir will visit Beirut on Sunday for an Arab economic summit which has been marred by regional rifts and internal Lebanese disputes even before it began.

Headlines: Trump says deal 'could very well happen' with China
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday there has been progress toward a trade deal with China, but denied that he was considering lifting tariffs on Chinese imports.

Headlines: China set to post slowest growth in 28 years in 2018, more stimulus seen
Description: China is expected to report on Monday that economic growth cooled to its slowest in 28 years in 2018 amid weakening domestic demand and bruising U.S. tariffs, adding pressure on Beijing to roll out more support measures to avert a sharper slowdown.

Headlines: China's economy cools in fourth quarter, 2018 growth at 28-year low
Description: China's economic growth cooled slightly in the fourth quarter from a year earlier as expected, weighed down by weak investment and faltering consumer confidence as Washington piled on trade pressure, leaving 2018 growth the weakest in 28 years.

Headlines: Global stock markets falter after China data confirms economic slowdown
Description: European shares fell on Monday from six-week highs as a slowdown in China's economy stalled a global equity rally, but sterling rallied to the day's highs after Prime Minister Theresa May promised to be more "flexible" with lawmakers over Brexit.

Headlines: France considers bill amendment to target Huawei: Les Echos
Description: France is considering introducing a bill amendment to empower its security and defence watchdogs to make retroactive checks to telecoms operators' equipment once installed, targeting China's Huawei, Les Echos newspaper reported on Monday without citing sources.

Headlines: China's 2018 growth slows to 28-year low, more stimulus seen
Description: China's economy cooled in the fourth quarter under pressure from faltering domestic demand and bruising U.S. tariffs, dragging 2018 growth to the lowest level in nearly three decades and pressuring Beijing to roll out more stimulus to avert a sharper slowdown.

Headlines: Canadian railways ration space as commodity congestion problems worsen
Description: Canada's two major railways are rationing space on trains traveling to the country's biggest port and recently prioritized some commodities over others to deal with congestion, the latest indication of their struggle to meet demand from new trade deals.

Headlines: France, Germany step up pressure over Alstom-Siemens deal
Description: France and Germany raised pressure on the European Union's competition chief to approve the merger of Alstom and Siemens' rail businesses, warning that thwarting the proposed European champion would be a strategic error.

Headlines: Pompeo voices optimism for good outcome on U.S.-China trade
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo voiced optimism on Tuesday for a good outcome in upcoming trade talks with China and said a superpower conflict between the two nations could be avoided.

Headlines: Oil drops nearly 3 percent on rising supplies, China slowdown
Description: Oil prices fell 3 percent on Tuesday over concerns the world's stumbling economy could pinch fuel demand as U.S. crude output climbs to new heights and cuts by Saudi Arabia and its allies are smaller than advertised.

Headlines: Brexit backer Dyson moves vacuum giant's HQ to Singapore
Description: James Dyson, the billionaire Brexit supporter who revolutionized vacuum cleaners with his bagless technology, is moving his head office to Singapore from Britain to be closer to his company's fastest-growing markets.

Headlines: Canada should ban Huawei from 5G networks, says former spy chief
Description: Canada should ban China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd from supplying equipment to Canadian 5G networks because the security risk is too great, a former spy chief said in an article published on Monday.

Headlines: China's Lishen says has not signed agreement with Tesla on supplying batteries
Description: China's Tianjin Lishen said on Tuesday it has not signed any agreement with Tesla Inc on supplying batteries to the U.S. electric vehicle maker's Shanghai factory.

Headlines: Foxconn says trying to hire 50,000 people in first quarter after job cut reports
Description: Taiwan's Foxconn , assembler of Apple Inc's iPhones, on Tuesday said it was trying to recruit for more than 50,000 positions across its China campuses for the January-March quarter, amid reports of mass lay-offs.

Headlines: Exclusive: Tesla holds battery supply talks with China's Lishen
Description: U.S. electric vehicle (EV) maker Tesla Inc has held talks with China's Tianjin Lishen to supply batteries for its new Shanghai factory, and two people with direct knowledge of the matter said the pair signed a preliminary agreement.

Headlines: Exclusive: Autogrill submitted a bid for Elior's Areas business - source
Description: Italy's Autogrill has submitted a bid for the railways, motorway and airport catering business of France's Elior , a source told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Taco Bell's first Thailand outlet to serve spicy fare and local beer
Description: U.S. fast food giant Taco Bell is opening its first outlet in Thailand, continuing the Yum! Brands chain's Asia expansion, offering adapted menu items and local beer.

Headlines: P&O to change flag of UK ships to Cyprus ahead of Brexit
Description: British ferry and shipping freight operator P&O will shift the registration of its UK vessels to Cyprus ahead of Britain's departure from the European Union, in part to keep its tax arrangements in the bloc, the company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. will seek extradition of Huawei CFO from Canada
Description: The U.S. Justice Department said on Tuesday it will pursue the extradition of the chief financial officer of China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's, arrested in Canada in December.

Headlines: Google, Facebook spend big on U.S. lobbying amid policy battles
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google disclosed in a quarterly filing on Tuesday that it spent a company-record $21.2 million on lobbying the U.S. government in 2018, topping its previous high of $18.22 million in 2012, as the search engine operator fights wide-ranging scrutiny into its practices.

Headlines: Trump won't soften hardline on China to make trade deal: advisers
Description: As much as U.S. President Donald Trump wants to boost markets through a trade pact with China, he will not soften his position that Beijing must make real structural reforms, including how it handles intellectual property, to reach a deal, advisers say.

Headlines: Taco Bell eyes Asia-Pacific to drive overseas expansion
Description: U.S. fast food chain Taco Bell plans to double its international footprint with Asian markets as the main driver for overseas growth as awareness about Mexican cuisine grows, a senior executive said on Wednesday.

Headlines: France aware of Huawei risks, will act when times comes - minister
Description: France is aware of the risks of China's Huawei Technologies access to next-generation mobile networks and will take measures when the time comes, its foreign minister said on Wednesday.

Headlines: JPMorgan's private bank expands business in Mexico: regional CEO
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co's private bank is expanding in Mexico and elsewhere in Latin America, the unit's regional CEO said on Wednesday, as wealth creation and political changes bolster the sector's prospects.

Headlines: Etihad files lawsuit in Britain against Air Berlin administrators
Description: Abu Dhabi's Etihad Airways on Wednesday said it has begun legal proceedings in London, disputing a claim by the administrators of Air Berlin for damages of up to 2 billion euros ($2.26 billion).

Headlines: Madrid taxis block access to tourist fair in anti-Uber protests
Description: Hundreds of taxi drivers protested outside one of Madrid's largest tourist fairs on Wednesday, using their cabs to block access roads and burning rubbish as part of an open-ended strike against Uber and other ride-hailing services.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. voices concern as India's e-commerce restrictions hit Amazon, Walmart - sources
Description: The United States government is concerned about India's revised e-commerce regulations and has told officials in New Delhi the policy will hinder the Indian investment plans of Amazon.com and Walmart Inc, three sources familiar with the talks told Reuters.

Headlines: China's Huawei eyes smartphone supremacy this year after record 2018 sales
Description: China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] on Thursday said it could become the world's biggest-selling smartphone vendor this year even without the U.S. market and as global scrutiny of the firm intensifies.

Headlines: Canada's envoy to China says 'misspoke' on Huawei CFO case
Description: Canada's ambassador to China said he "misspoke" when he said Huawei Technologies Co Ltd Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou had a strong case against extradition to the United States, John McCallum said in a statement on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S., China 'miles and miles' from trade deal: Ross
Description: The United States and China are "miles and miles" from resolving trade issues but there is a fair chance the two countries will get a deal, U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. oil up 1 percent on Venezuela turmoil, but hefty stock build weighs
Description: U.S. oil prices rose by 1 percent on Thursday, boosted by the U.S. threat of sanctions on Venezuela, but gains were capped by record high gasoline inventories and an unexpected big build in crude stocks in the United States.

Headlines: Exclusive: MoneyGram exploring options, including potential sale - sources
Description: MoneyGram International Inc is exploring strategic alternatives, including a sale of the money transfer company, a year after a U.S. government panel nixed its $1.2 billion sale to China's Ant Financial, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headlines: WestJet facing flight delays, cancellations, from disruptions at U.S. airports
Description: WestJet Airlines, Canada's No. 2 carrier, is experiencing delayed and canceled flights and expects "further delays and possible cancellations if more constraints are placed" on the U.S. air traffic system, a spokeswoman said on Friday.

Headlines: Oil climbs on Venezuelan crisis despite surging U.S. supply
Description: Oil prices edged higher on Friday as political turmoil in Venezuela threatened to tighten crude supply, but concerns over surging U.S. fuel stocks and global economic woes weighed on sentiment.

Headlines: These US stocks are most vulnerable to the Brexit outcome
Description: Several U.S. S&P 500 companies have significant revenue in the U.K., raising concerns among investors. Goldman Sachs has outlined 20 of the most vulnerable to the Brexit outcome.

Headlines: Mastercard says plans to apply for China license to clear card payments
Description: U.S. payments card company Mastercard Inc said on Friday it still plans to apply for a bankcard clearing license in China and was in "active discussions" to explore solutions.

Headlines: Visa's European arm pays 13.2 million euros to settle Italy tax dispute
Description: The European arm of U.S. credit card group VISA has paid 13.2 million euros ($15 million) to settle a dispute in Italy over alleged tax evasion, a judicial document filed by Milan prosecutors showed.

Headlines: China and U.S. among 76 WTO members pushing for new e-commerce rules
Description: Impatient with a lack of World Trade Organization rules on the explosive growth of e-commerce, 76 members - including the United States, China, the European Union and Japan - agreed on Friday to start negotiating a new framework.

Headlines: Factbox: China rolls out fiscal, monetary stimulus to spur economy
Description: China's economy grew at the weakest pace in nearly three decades last year amid weakening domestic demand and U.S. trade tariffs, prompting Beijing to announce a series of growth-boosting measures to avert the risk of a sharper slowdown.

Headlines: Qantas customers request exercise bikes, virtual reality for 20-hour flights
Description: Australia's Qantas Airways Ltd on Monday said customers were requesting in-flight innovations such as exercise bikes and virtual reality relaxation to pass the time on proposed 20-hour non-stop flights from Sydney to London.

Headlines: Macron says concerned about conditions of Ghosn's detention in Japan
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Sunday he has expressed concern to Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe over the prison conditions faced by former Renault boss Carlos Ghosn.

Headlines: Phillips 66 expects no disruption to crude supplies after U.S. sanctions on PDVSA
Description: Phillips 66 said on Monday it could mitigate any disruption in the crude supply of its refining business from U.S. sanctions on Venezuela's state-owned oil company PDVSA because it would use alternative sources of crude.

Headlines: China trade delegation arrives in Washington for talks: Xinhua
Description: A Chinese delegation led by Vice Premier Liu He arrived in Washington, D.C. on Monday for economic and trade negotiations, the official Xinhua news agency reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Venezuela's PDVSA orders prepayment for U.S.-bound oil cargoes - sources
Description: Venezuela's state-run company oil company, PDVSA, hit by U.S. sanctions on Monday, ordered customers with tankers waiting to load Venezuelan crude bound for the United States to pay for the cargoes before they depart, three sources with knowledge of the decision told Reuters.

Headlines: China brings U.S. tariff dispute to WTO, berates Washington for blocking judges
Description: China triggered the legal process on Monday for the World Trade Organization to hear Beijing's challenge to U.S. tariffs imposed on $234 billion of goods, and berated the United States for blocking the appointment of judges who could rule on it.

Headlines: LSE lifts halt on En+'s London-listed GDRs available to U.S. investors
Description: The London Stock Exchange lifted the suspension on En+ Group's London-listed global depositary receipts (GDRs) available to U.S. investors, a spokeswoman said on Monday after Washington dropped sanctions on the Russian company.

Headlines: VW's Traton trucks pursues growth with China, U.S. alliances
Description: Volkswagen's trucks business Traton wants to use alliances with rivals in China, the United States and Japan to tap into global growth and achieve a return on sales of nine percent, Chief Executive Andreas Renschler said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Madrid taxis block major road in biggest anti-Uber protest yet
Description: Hundreds of taxis blocked a central traffic artery in Madrid during Monday's morning rush hour, in their biggest show of strength yet as a protest seeking tighter regulation of Uber and other ride-hailing services entered its second week.

Headlines: Russia's Lavrov says U.S. sanctions on Venezuela oil company illegal
Description: U.S. sanctions imposed on Venezuela's state oil company are illegal and Russia will take all necessary steps to support the administration of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov was quoted as saying on Tuesday.

Headlines: China's industry ministry says Huawei indictments are 'unfair, immoral'
Description: The U.S. government's indictments against Huawei Technologies Co Ltd are unfair and immoral, a spokesman for China's industry and information technology ministry said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Factbox: Tariff wars - duties imposed by Trump and U.S. trading partners
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has rattled the world trade order by imposing unilateral tariffs to combat what he calls unfair trade practices by China, the European Union and other major trading partners of the United States.

Headlines: Oil gains on tighter U.S. supply, Venezuela sanctions
Description: Oil prices rose on Wednesday, as U.S. government data that showed signs of tightening supply and investors remained concerned about supply disruptions following U.S. sanctions on Venezuela's oil industry.

Headlines: U.S., China face deep trade, IP differences in high-level talks
Description: The United States and China launch a critical round of trade talks on Wednesday amid deep differences over Washington's demands for structural economic reforms from Beijing that will make it difficult to reach a deal before a March 2 U.S. tariff hike.

Headlines: Trump says wants big trade deal with China or will 'postpone' it
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he would either strike a very big trade deal with China or "postpone" it, but it was not clear precisely what he was referring to.

Headlines: Germany to give fighter jet order to Airbus or Boeing: sources
Description: Germany has narrowed its options for replacing Tornado fighter jets and will decide between European manufacturer Airbus and U.S. rival Boeing, German defense ministry sources said on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump says he thinks U.S. will be able to do trade deal with China
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he thinks the United States will be able to strike a deal with China, as Chinese Vice Premier Liu He visits Washington for trade talks in a bid to ease tensions between the two economies.

Headlines: Not all Huawei's materials come from China, company says
Description: Huawei Technologies Co. has a proven reputation on cyberscurity and does not buy all of its materials from China, the company said on Thursday after the U.S. envoy to the European Union sought to warn consumers away from its products.

Headlines: French regulator orders Google to review ads policies
Description: France's competition regulator on Thursday ordered Alphabet Inc's Google to review its policies and procedures for blocking certain ads, saying that its actions against French firm Amadeus may have been anti-competitive.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. trade delegation to visit China in mid-February: Xinhua
Description: A U.S. trade delegation will visit China in mid-February for a new round of talks, President Donald Trump told Chinese Vice Premier Liu He, the official Xinhua news agency said on Friday.

Headlines: White House says March 1 is hard deadline for China trade deal
Description: President Donald Trump sees March 1 as a hard deadline to reach a trade deal with China, the White House said on Thursday, saying U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods will be hiked if an agreement is not reached by then.

Headlines: China's Xi wants to meet U.S. halfway on trade deal
Description: China's leader Xi Jinping told U.S. President Donald Trump in a letter that he hopes both sides will be able to meet each other halfway to reach a trade agreement before a March 1 deadline.

Headlines: Chinese trade deal 'unacceptable' unless Beijing opens markets: Trump
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump warned on Thursday that a trade deal with China would be unacceptable unless Beijing opened its markets to U.S. financial services, manufacturing, agriculture and other industries.

Headlines: China offers Xi meeting with Trump in China next month: WSJ
Description: China trade negotiators are proposing a meeting between Chinese President Xi Jinping and U.S. President Donald Trump in China next month, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday citing unnamed sources.

Headlines: Trump to meet China's Xi to try to seal trade deal, progress reported
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he will meet with Chinese President Xi Jinping soon to try to seal a comprehensive trade deal as Trump and his top trade negotiator both cited substantial progress in two days of high-level talks.

Headlines: Fed pause validates market fears about U.S. growth
Description: While the U.S. Federal Reserve's indication it is done raising interest rates - for now - has fueled stock gains, investors worry the U.S. central bank's pledge is a double-edged sword and implicit confirmation of the markets' lingering anxiety about growth.

Headlines: Tesla begins sales of cheaper Model 3 car variant in China
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc said it will start taking orders in China on Friday for a lower-priced version of its Model 3 car, as it seeks to accelerate China sales hit by trade friction between Washington and Beijing.

Headlines: Nissan scraps plan to build new X-Trail model in Britain
Description: Carmaker Nissan has scrapped plans to build its new X-Trail SUV in Britain and will produce it solely in Japan, warning two months before Brexit that uncertainty over Britain's departure was making it harder to plan for the future.

Headlines: Some U.S. funds waiting for earnings to buy shares of surging Chipotle
Description: Shares of Chipotle Mexican Grill have surged over 70 percent over the last 12 months, but some U.S. fund managers are waiting for Feb. 6 earnings results to confirm that the burrito-chain is truly back from its 2015 food safety crisis.

Headlines: Apple briefly regains title as most valuable U.S. company
Description: Apple very briefly retook its title as the most valuable publicly listed U.S. company on Monday, beating out Microsoft and Amazon.com, while Alphabet was close behind the trio as it prepared to report its quarterly results.

Headlines: Huawei CFO may fight extradition by claiming U.S. political motive: report
Description: Huawei executive Meng Wanzhou, who was arrested in Canada and faces possible extradition to the United States, is exploring a defense that claims U.S. charges against her are politically motivated, the Globe and Mail newspaper reported on Monday.

Headlines: U.S.-China tariff hike would trigger downturn, trade diversion: U.N
Description: A U.S. plan to hike tariffs on China next month could trigger an economic downturn and let other countries take over about $200 billion of China's exports, a study by the U.N. trade and development agency UNCTAD said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. trade agency sees negotiating new WTO rules to rein in China as futile
Description: Negotiating new World Trade Organization rules to try to rein in China's "mercantilist" trade practices would be largely a futile exercise, the Trump administration's trade office said on Monday, vowing to pursue its unilateral approach to protect U.S. workers, farmers and businesses.

Headlines: Canadian canola runs into Chinese delays after Huawei arrest
Description: A political dispute between China and Canada over the arrest of a Huawei executive is slowing canola shipments through Chinese ports and causing some importers to hesitate to buy from their biggest supplier, according to interviews with a dozen traders.

Headlines: U.S. corporate enthusiasm for France cools, survey shows
Description: A dimming economic outlook and massive street protests against President Emmanuel Macron have made France less attractive for U.S. companies with investments in the country, a survey showed.

Headlines: Renault-Nissan alliance, Google to partner on self-driving cars: Nikkei
Description: The Renault-Nissan-Mitsubishi alliance will tie up with Alphabet Inc's Google to develop autonomous taxis and other services using self-driving vehicles, the Nikkei reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Merkel sets out condition for Huawei's participation in 5G network
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Tuesday Germany needs guarantees that China's Huawei Technologies will not hand over data to the Chinese state before the telecoms equipment supplier can participate in building its 5G network.

Headlines: Factbox: Franco-German mergers: a difficult history
Description: Berlin and Paris are working to change European competition rules to facilitate large cross-border mergers, after the European Union blocked Siemens and Alstom from merging their rail businesses on Wednesday.

Headlines: Siemens deal collapse fuels Alstom-Bombardier tie-up talk, shares rally
Description: The European Commission's decision to block a tie-up between Alstom and Germany's Siemens is fueling speculation over possible merger talks between the French rail business and Canada's Bombardier, lifting both companies' shares on Wednesday.

Headlines: EU antitrust policy under fire after Siemens-Alstom deal blocked
Description: Siemens and Alstom's plan to create a European rail champion collapsed on Wednesday after EU regulators blocked the deal, prompting Germany and France to call for an overhaul of EU competition policy to better meet global challenges.

Headlines: German ministers meeting to discuss how to deal with Huawei in 5G auction: source
Description: German ministers are meeting on Wednesday to discuss how to deal with China's Huawei Technologies in building Germany's 5G network, a government source told Reuters.

Headlines: Trump confirms he won't meet with China's Xi before March 1 trade deadline
Description: President Donald Trump confirmed on Thursday that he did not plan to meet with Chinese President Xi Jinping before a March 1 deadline set by the two countries to achieve a trade deal.

Headlines: New Zealand PM says exporters could suffer due to U.S.-China trade tensions
Description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said on Friday that trade tensions between the U.S. and China, which is New Zealand's top trading partner, could affect exporters in the country and hurt its economy.

Headlines: France 'categorically denies' Nikkei report on Renault-Nissan stakes
Description: France's finance ministry denied on Thursday a report from Japanese news outlet Nikkei that the French government had informed Tokyo it was open to considering reducing Renault's stake in Nissan Motor.

Headlines: Italy denies it will ban Huawei, ZTE from its 5G plans
Description: Italy has denied a report it will ban China's Huawei Technologies and ZTE Corp from playing a role in building its fifth-generation mobile phone network.

Headlines: Volvo Cars feels margin pressure from U.S.-China tariff war
Description: Chinese-owned Volvo Cars reported a fall in 2018 profit margins as a prolonged trade war between Washington and Beijing pushed up costs and resulted in pricing pressure in its main market China.

Headlines: Cramer: Don't rush to buy this dipâ€”there are legitimate reasons to sell
Description: Jim Cramer says his charitable trust sold some stocks Thursday in part on news that the U.S. and China will likely not strike a trade deal by March 1.

Headlines: German banks maneuver in Washington to temper Russia sanction risk
Description: German banks are seeking to blunt any fresh U.S. sanctions against Russia so they can continue existing business with Russian clients, according to an internal briefing paper prepared by a financial industry lobby group.

Headlines: GM Canada says Oshawa production stopped due to supplier strike
Description: Production at General Motors' plant in Oshawa, Ontario, stopped at approximately 12:30 p.m. EST on Friday, a spokesman said, after the U.S. automaker exhausted its on-hand supply of seats from Lear Corp, where workers are striking.

Headlines: Bank of America appoints head of new EU unit in Brexit move
Description: Bank of America Merrill Lynch has named Sanaz Zaimi as head of its new Paris-based European Union broker-dealer unit BofA Securities Europe, the U.S. bank said on Friday.

Headlines: No talks between Trump and China's Xi before trade deadline
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he did not plan to meet with Chinese President Xi Jinping before a March 1 deadline set by the two countries to achieve a trade deal.

Headlines: Explainer: Germany, France face hurdles in push to rewrite EU antitrust rules
Description: Germany and France want to overhaul EU mergers rules following the European Commission's veto of efforts by Siemens and Alstom to create a European rail champion to compete with larger foreign rivals.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. considers withdrawal of zero tariffs for India - sources
Description: India could lose a vital U.S. trade concession, under which it enjoys zero tariffs on $5.6 billion of exports to the United States, amid a widening dispute over its trade and investment policies, people with close knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade talks resume next week, focus on intellectual property
