Description: U.S. negotiators are preparing to press China next week on longstanding demands that it reform how it treats American companies' intellectual property in order to seal a trade deal that could prevent tariffs from rising on Chinese imports.

Headlines: Google extends chip-making efforts to design hub Bengaluru
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google has hired more than a dozen microchip engineers in Bengaluru, India, in recent months and plans to rapidly add more, according to LinkedIn profiles, job postings and two industry executives, as the search firm expands its program to design the guts of its devices internally.

Headlines: U.S., China upbeat on trade talks, but South China Sea tensions weigh
Description: U.S. and Chinese officials expressed hopes on Monday that a new round of talks would bring them closer to easing their seven-month trade war, but a U.S. Navy mission through the disputed South China Sea cast a shadow over the negotiations in Beijing.

Headlines: World stock markets rally on hopes for U.S.-China trade deal
Description: Signs that the United States and China might reach an agreement in trade talks and news of a tentative deal to avoid another government shutdown in Washington helped push world stock markets and bond yields broadly higher Tuesday.

Headlines: TechnipFMC shares fall on report of French corruption probe
Description: Shares in TechnipFMC fell on Tuesday after weekly magazine Le Point reported the oil services company was the subject of a legal probe in France over alleged corruption in Brazil and Africa.

Headlines: Exclusive: Venezuela's self-declared president Guaido to nominate own Citgo board - sources
Description: Advisers to Venezuela's self-declared president Juan Guaido have proposed he appoint six executives to a transitional board for U.S. refiner Citgo Petroleum Corp, Venezuela's most important foreign asset, four people close to the talks said.

Headlines: Few tears shed by French workers after Macron's Alstom dream is blocked
Description: After four decades on the production line at French trainmaker Alstom, Claude Gemino had little sympathy for Emmanuel Macron when Brussels scotched the French president's hopes of creating a European rail champion.

Headlines: Exclusive: India watchdog probes accusations that Google abused Android - sources
Description: India's antitrust commission is looking into accusations that Alphabet Inc's unit Google abuses its popular Android mobile operating system to block its rivals, four sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Venezuela pressures foreign partners on oil venture commitments: sources
Description: Foreign partners of Venezuela's PDVSA are facing pressure from the state-run oil firm to publicly declare whether they will continue as minority stakeholders in Orinoco Belt projects following U.S. sanctions, three people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Trump says could let March 1 deadline for China trade deal slide
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that he could see letting the March 1 deadline for reaching a trade agreement with China slide a little, but that he would prefer not to and expects to meet with Chinese President Xi Jinping to close the deal at some point.

Headlines: Barclays says has spent up to 200 million pounds on Brexit
Description: Barclays has spent 100 to 200 million pounds ($129-258 million) moving operations and staff out of Britain to prepare for Brexit, its UK chairman Gerry Grimstone said on Wednesday as bank bosses detailed the costs involved.

Headlines: Ford told UK PM May it could move business overseas because of Brexit
Description: Ford Motor Co told British Prime Minister Theresa May during a conference call on Tuesday that it may have to move some production out of Britain because of Brexit, according to a source on the call.

Headlines: Netflix has more than 5 million subscribers in France
Description: Netflix now has more than 5 million subscribers in France, a spokesman for the U.S. video streaming giant said on Wednesday, confirming a report by daily Le Figaro.

Headlines: Trump: China trade talks going 'very well' before high-level parley
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday trade talks with China were "going along very well" as the world's two largest economies try to resolve their seven-month tariff war ahead of a March 1 deadline for a deal.

Headlines: Trump says he could let China trade deal deadline slip, 'not inclined to'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that he could let the March 1 deadline for a trade agreement with China "slide for a little while," but that he would prefer not to and expects to meet with Chinese President Xi Jinping to close the deal at some point.

Headlines: Qatar revamps investment strategy after Kushner building bailout
Description: When news emerged that Qatar may have unwittingly helped bail out a New York skyscraper owned by the family of Jared Kushner, Donald Trump's son-in-law, eyebrows were raised in Doha.

Headlines: Trump, Xi expected to meet 'sometime in March': USDA official
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping are expected to meet next month, a U.S. Department of Agriculture official said at an industry event on Wednesday, as the two countries try to hammer out a deal to end a tit-for-tat tariff battle.

Headlines: Senate Democrats press Trump for China IP, tech transfer commitments
Description: Seven U.S. Democratic senators urged President Donald Trump on Wednesday to press China for a trade deal that fully addresses the technology transfer and intellectual property concerns outlined by U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer.

Headlines: Exclusive: FBI investigating top Vitol executives in Americas - sources
Description: The FBI is investigating energy trading firm Vitol's top two executives in the Americas in connection with a Brazil bribery case, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter said, deepening the U.S. role in a probe of foreign oil firms' dealings with state-controlled Petrobras.

Headlines: Oil gains on Saudi output cuts; rally limited by U.S. output
Description: Oil prices rose almost 2 percent on Wednesday after top exporter Saudi Arabia said it would cut crude exports and deliver an even deeper cut to its production, but swelling U.S. crude inventories limited the day's gains.

Headlines: Democratic lawmakers say U.S. military action in Venezuela 'not an option'
Description: Democratic lawmakers on Wednesday said Congress would oppose U.S. military intervention in Venezuela and challenged the credibility of President Donald Trump's special envoy, Elliott Abrams, over his past embrace of American covert action.

Headlines: Venezuela turns to India for oil exports as U.S. sanctions bite
Description: Venezuelan oil company PDVSA is looking to double exports to India as U.S. sanctions hobble deliveries to the United States and Europe.

Headlines: Trump says trade negotiations with China going very well
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday sounded a positive note on the ongoing trade talks with China, telling reporters that Washington had sent a talented team of negotiators to Beijing this week and the negotiations are going along very well.

Headlines: EU brings industry together to tackle dollar dominance in energy trade
Description: The European Union has convened a wide-ranging industrial group to work on promoting the euro and fighting the monopoly of the U.S. dollar in oil and commodities trading, reflecting broader tensions with Washington over trade and sanctions.

Headlines: Hilton's better-than-feared forecast drives shares higher amid trade worries
Description: Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc on Wednesday provided a better-than-feared outlook for its key U.S. and China markets amid concerns around slowing global economic growth and trade wars, sending its shares up 7 percent.

Headlines: U.S. trade envoys to meet China's Xi, no decision on deadline extension
Description: The Trump administration's top two negotiators in trade talks with China will meet on Friday with Chinese President Xi Jinping, but there has been no decision to extend a March 1 U.S. deadline for a deal, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Thursday.

Headlines: Explainer: What's at stake in U.S.-China trade talks
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer and U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin are in Beijing this week as Chinese and American negotiators try to hammer out a trade deal to ease a trade war and avert an increase in U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods scheduled for March 2.

Headlines: Laptop 'for him', vacuum 'for her'? HSBC draws ire with Valentine offer
Description: A Valentine's day special deal for HSBC staff in Hong Kong offering discounted laptops 'for him' but vacuum cleaners and kitchen appliances 'for her' has angered staff over the sexist implications of the campaign.

Headlines: No decision yet on whether to push back China trade deadline: Trump adviser
Description: The Trump administration has not yet made a decision on whether to extend a March 1 deadline for a trade deal with China, a top White House economic adviser said on Thursday.

Headlines: Retailer Payless ShoeSource set to shutter its U.S. stores: sources
Description: U.S. discount retailer Payless ShoeSource Inc plans to close all of its approximately 2,300 stores when it files for bankruptcy later this month for the second time in as many years, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. drafts WTO reform to halt handouts for big and rich states
Description: The United States proposed a reform of the World Trade Organization on Friday that would slash the number of countries that are eligible for "special and differential treatment", a plan likely to be resisted by China, India and other countries.

Headlines: Trump says may extend March 1 deadline for China trade deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he may extend a March 1 deadline for reaching a trade deal with China while keeping current tariffs in place, adding that the negotiations are "very complicated."

Headlines: Exclusive: Alibaba in talks on stake in China operations of Germany's Metro - sources
Description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd is in talks with Germany's Metro about taking a stake in the German wholesaler's China operations, three sources told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Hong Kong company sorry after 'vacuum cleaner for her' HSBC Valentine offer
Description: Hong Kong telecoms company HKT apologized after a Valentine's day deal it sent to HSBC staff offering discounted laptops "for him" but vacuum cleaners and kitchen appliances "for her" angered employees over its sexist implications.

Headlines: China's Xi: trade talks with U.S. to continue in Washington next week
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping said on Friday trade talks with the United States will continue in Washington next week and that he hopes the two sides will be able to reach a mutually beneficial deal in the upcoming negotiations, state media reported.

Headlines: China's President Xi meets top U.S. trade delegation officials
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping met U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Friday, following high-level negotiations aimed at striking a trade deal ahead of a March 1 deadline.

Headlines: U.S., Chinese officials to meet next week in Washington on trade: White House
Description: Officials from the United States and China will meet next week in Washington to continue working on a trade deal after having made progress in talks in Beijing this week, White House Press Secretary Sarah Sanders said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade talks to resume next week, Trump hints at extension
Description: The United States and China will resume trade talks next week in Washington with time running short to ease their bruising trade war, but U.S. President Donald Trump repeated on Friday that he may extend a March 1 deadline for a deal and keep tariffs on Chinese goods from rising.

Headlines: Mexico to inject $3.9 billion in Pemex, seeks to prevent credit downgrade
Description: Mexico will inject $3.9 billion into ailing state oil company Pemex, officials said on Friday, promising to strengthen its finances and prevent a further credit downgrade, although investors saw the plan as only a short-term fix.

Headlines: Payless ShoeSource to start liquidation sales at stores
Description: U.S. discount retailer Payless ShoeSource Inc said on Friday it would begin going-out-of-business sales at its U.S. and Puerto Rico stores on Feb. 17 and wind down its e-commerce operations.

Headlines: Venezuela opposition to leave Citgo funds, management untouched: envoy
Description: Venezuela's opposition has no plans to use funds belonging to U.S. refiner Citgo, which is owned by state oil company PDVSA, despite having named a new board for the company this week, the self-declared interim government's U.S. envoy said on Friday.

Headlines: Canada's Freeland pushes end of steel, aluminum tariffs in meeting with Pelosi
Description: Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland said on Saturday she had made clear in a meeting with U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi at the Munich Security Conference the importance of the U.S. lifting tariffs on steel and aluminum imports from Canada.

Headlines: Britain does not support total Huawei network ban: sources
Description: British security officials do not support a full ban of Huawei from national telecoms networks despite U.S. allegations the Chinese firm and its products could be used by Beijing for spying, people with knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: Honda plan to close UK plant is not due to Brexit: lawmaker
Description: Japan's Honda plans to shut its British car plant in Swindon by 2022 with the loss of 3,500 jobs but the decision is not related to Brexit, a local lawmaker told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: New Zealand will conduct own assessment of Huawei equipment risk: PM
Description: New Zealand will independently assess the risk of using China's Huawei Technologies in 5G networks, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said on Monday after a report suggested that British precautions could be used by other nations.

Headlines: Trump says March 1 deadline for China trade talks not 'magical' date
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that trade talks with China were going well and suggested he was open to pushing off the deadline to complete negotiations, saying March 1 was not a "magical" date.

Headlines: Trump says March 1 deadline for China trade talks not 'magical' date
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that trade talks with China were going well and suggested he was open to pushing off the deadline to complete negotiations, saying March 1 was not a "magical" date.

Headlines: Ford to close oldest Brazil plant, exit South America truck biz
Description: Ford Motor Co said on Tuesday it will close its oldest factory in Brazil and exit its heavy commercial truck business in South America, a move that could cost more than 2,700 jobs as part of a restructuring meant to end losses around the world.

Headlines: U.S. approves Fresenius purchase of NxStage
Description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission has given Germany's Fresenius Medical Care AG and U.S. home dialysis equipment maker NxStage Medical Inc antitrust approval for their merger, the agency said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Honda to shut UK car plant in 2022 with the loss of 3,500 jobs
Description: Japanese car maker Honda is set to announce it's closing its only British car plant in 2022 with the loss of 3,500 jobs, a lawmaker told Reuters, in the latest blow to the UK car industry as Brexit approaches.

Headlines: Chinese government doesn't get involved in Huawei's business: German boss
Description: The head of China's Huawei Technologies in Germany told a German newspaper that the Chinese government does not get involved in the company's business, adding the firm would work on being open and transparent in the debate about security of mobile networks.

Headlines: Mexico pushes mobile payments to help unbanked consumers ditch cash
Description: Mexico's new leftist government is betting on financial technology to help lift people out of poverty.

Headlines: Germany still in talks on Huawei 5G network role, minister says
Description: Germany's government is still in talks on whether China's Huawei will be allowed to participate in building the country's high-speed internet infrastructure, German Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said on Tuesday.

Headlines: German government unlikely to make quick decision on Huawei: source
Description: The German government will probably not take a quick decision on whether to allow China's Huawei to build Germany's 5G network, a government source said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Alibaba boosts stake in investment bank CICC for $231 million
Description: China's e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd has raised its stake in top domestic investment bank China International Capital Corp's Hong Kong-listed shares to nearly 12 percent, an exchange disclosure showed on Monday.

Headlines: Amid trade talks, China urges U.S. to respect its right to develop, prosper
Description: The United States should respect China's right to develop and become prosperous, the Chinese government's top diplomat told a visiting U.S. delegation, reiterating that the country's doors to the outside world would open wider.

Headlines: Norwegian Air aims to fly stranded plane out of Iran in next few days
Description: Budget carrier Norwegian Air expects to fly a plane out of Iran in the next few days after it made an emergency landing there in December and became stranded, partly due to U.S. sanctions on Tehran.

Headlines: FMC expects NxStage deal to close in next couple of days
Description: Germany's Fresenius Medical Care (FMC) said on Wednesday it has won the green light from U.S. regulators to acquire U.S. home dialysis equipment maker NxStage and expects the deal to close in the next few days.

Headlines: EU medicines agency loses bid to end London lease over Brexit
Description: The European Medicines Agency (EMA) has lost its bid to cancel a lease on its office in London's Canary Wharf financial district due to Brexit, in a landmark ruling that lawyers said could stave off similar such claims by other tenants.

Headlines: U.S. ambassador to Italy visits Telecom Italia headquarters
Description: The U.S. ambassador to Italy, Lewis Eisenberg, visited the Rome headquarters of Italian phone group Telecom Italia on Wednesday, a Reuters witness said.

Headlines: U.S. Agriculture Secretary says hopes U.S. will ratify new North American trade deal by summer
Description: U.S. Agriculture Secretary Sonny Perdue said on Thursday that he hopes the United States will ratify the U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade deal known as USMCA by summer, after Congress has a chance to understand the accord's provisions.

Headlines: Huawei to open first flagship store outside China in Vienna
Description: Huawei is to open a smartphone flagship store in Vienna, its first such outlet outside China, as part of a charm offensive in Europe where its future hangs in the balance.

Headlines: U..S can quickly recover lost farm trade to China once deal clinched: Ag Secy
Description: The United States will be able to quickly recover lost markets for U.S. farm products to China once Washington and Beijing clinch a trade deal, U.S. Agriculture Secretary Sonny Perdue said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. carriers compete for new slots at Tokyo's Haneda airport
Description: The top three U.S. carriers announced bids for new slots at Tokyo's Haneda International Airport on Thursday as part of a push to increase daily nonstop flights to the Japanese capital ahead of the 2020 Olympic Games and beyond.

Headlines: Ford's Brazil shutdown highlights automakers' woes with excess capacity
Description: Ford Motor Co's oldest factory in Brazil, slated for closure later this year, was a giant among auto plants, occupying a sprawling 12 million square feet (111.5 hectares), bigger than many of the automaker's U.S. facilities.

Headlines: Swedish and Estonian watchdogs open joint Swedbank probe
Description: Sweden's and Estonia's financial watchdogs have opened a joint investigation following a media report linking Swedbank to a Baltic money laundering scandal involving Danske Bank, they said on Thursday.

Headlines: Mexico president says no more Pemex oil joint ventures for now
Description: President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Thursday Mexico will not offer more oil joint ventures between private companies and state energy company Pemex indefinitely, raising doubts about auctions set for October.

Headlines: Trump says he expects to meet China's Xi soon on trade
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that if he sees progress being made in trade talks with China, he may be inclined to extend negotiations beyond a March 1 deadline, and suggested it was likely the globe's two largest economies would be able to make a deal.

Headlines: Trump says could include Huawei and ZTE in trade deal
Description: U.S. President Donald trump said on Friday he may or may not include Chinese telecommunications companies Huawei Technologies and ZTE Corp in the trade deal being negotiated between the United States and China.

Headlines: Canada's Barrick considers buyout of rival Newmont Mining
Description: Canada's Barrick Gold Corp said on Friday it considered making an all-stock bid for U.S. rival Newmont Mining Corp, a deal that would create a monolith in the global gold sector and likely push smaller peers to start buying each other.

Headlines: Italian ruling-party lawmakers push for Huawei ban: paper
Description: A group of lawmakers from Italy's ruling coalition is pushing the government to ban China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd from supplying equipment for the country's rollout of 5G mobile communications, Il Messaggero newspaper said on Friday.

Headlines: France holds out over start of EU trade talks with Trump
Description: France expressed reservations on Friday about proposed trade negotiations with the United States, diplomats said, while other EU countries supported talks with Washington that could ward off punitive U.S. tariffs on European cars.

Headlines: No clarity yet from Beijing on intellectual property: USDA trade official
Description: Chinese trade negotiators have yet to provide clarity on how Beijing will address Washington's demands for more protection of American intellectual property, a key issue in negotiations to end a trade dispute between the two countries, a U.S. Department of Agriculture official said on Friday.

Headlines: Egypt's top administrative court lifts ban on Uber, Careem services
Description: Egypt's top administrative court on Saturday lifted a ban on operations by ride-hailing companies Uber and Careem, which have faced fierce opposition from traditional taxi drivers, a judicial source and lawyer said.

Headlines: Southwest CEO says mechanics deserve new contract, but company wants 'flexibility'
Description: Southwest Airlines Co's mechanics, who have been in labor contract talks for more than six years, deserve a new deal that makes them among the best paid in the airline industry, but the low-cost U.S. carrier needs "more supplier flexibility" in return, the company's chief executive said.

Headlines: Trump says he's inclined to extend China trade deadline and meet Xi soon
Description: President Donald Trump said on Friday there was "a very good chance" the United States would strike a deal with China to end their trade war and that he was inclined to extend his March 1 tariff deadline and meet soon with Chinese President Xi Jinping.

Headlines: Trump sees 'very big news' in China trade talks in next week or two
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Sunday that he wants to make a trade deal with Beijing that will be great for both the United States and China and that there could be "very big news over the next week or two" if all goes well in negotiations.

Headlines: China, U.S. make 'substantial progress' in trade talks: Xinhua
Description: The United States and China have made "substantial progress" on specific issues in the latest round of trade talks, China's official Xinhua news agency reported on Monday, citing the Chinese delegation to the discussions in Washington.

Headlines: Thirty years on, U.S.-China politics and tech collide
Description: "U.S. EASES CURBS ON EXPORTS TO CHINA" read a Reuters headline on March 1, 1989, when Washington lifted long-standing restrictions on technology shipments to China.

Headlines: Baring Vostok asks Putin to intervene after U.S. investor detained
Description: Russia-based private equity group Baring Vostok appealed on Monday for President Vladimir Putin to intervene in a criminal investigation into its U.S. founder Michael Calvey and other executives.

Headlines: Group of Walmart Mexico workers threatens strike for higher pay
Description: A union representing workers at Walmart Inc's Mexico unit said on Monday it would go on strike next month if it did not secure better pay and conditions for thousands of employees.

Headlines: Trump delays tariff hike on Chinese goods, citing trade talk progress
Description: President Donald Trump said on Sunday he would delay an increase in U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods thanks to "productive" trade talks and that he and Chinese President Xi Jinping would meet to seal a deal if progress continued.

Headlines: Mexico president seeks investigation of losses at Pemex plants
Description: Mexico's president said on Tuesday his government would push for an investigation into the hundreds of millions of dollars squandered by state oil company Pemex after its purchase of two struggling fertilizer plants during the previous administration.

Headlines: Putin won't intervene over detained U.S. investor: Kremlin
Description: Russia's President Vladimir Putin will not intervene in the case of a prominent U.S. investor arrested over embezzlement accusations, the Kremlin said on Tuesday, playing down pressure to release him before trial.

Headlines: U.S. business lobby says most firms favor tariffs while China trade talks underway
Description: A top U.S. business lobby in China said on Tuesday that a majority of its member companies favored the United States retaining tariffs on Chinese goods while Washington and Beijing try to hammer out a deal to end a months-long trade war.

Headlines: Trump says 'signing summit' with Xi for U.S.-China deal possible soon
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he may soon sign a deal to end a trade war with Chinese President Xi Jinping if their countries can bridge remaining differences, saying negotiators were "very, very close" to a deal.

Headlines: Oil rises 2 percent as U.S. crude stocks plunge, OPEC brushes off Trump
Description: Oil futures gained about 2 percent on Wednesday after U.S. crude inventories unexpectedly plummeted and as Saudi Arabia brushed aside comments from U.S. President Donald Trump seeking to keep oil prices from climbing.

Headlines: U.S. wants regular meetings to ensure trade deal enforcement: Lighthizer
Description: The United States wants meetings as regularly as once a month to ensure enforcement of any potential trade pact with China, U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. aims to combat Chinese currency manipulation in trade deal: Lighthizer
Description: The United States is seeking to prevent China from competitively devaluing its currency as part of ongoing trade talks between the countries, following past manipulations of the yuan, U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade: tariff and non-tariff barriers
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said this week he may soon sign a deal with Chinese President Xi Jinping to end a trade war blamed for slowing global economic growth and disrupting markets.

Headlines: Investor Cerberus open to Deutsche Bank merger with Commerzbank: source
Description: U.S. investor Cerberus, a major shareholder in both Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank, is open to a merger between Germany's two biggest lenders, a person familiar with the matter said on Wednesday, raising the chances of a tie-up.

Headlines: Volkswagen deepens cloud computing partnership with Microsoft
Description: Volkswagen said on Wednesday it had struck a deal with Microsoft to cooperate on cloud computing in China and the United States, as part of its drive to offer connected vehicle services across the globe.

Headlines: Mozambique files case against Credit Suisse in London's High Court
Description: Mozambique has filed a case in London's High Court against Credit Suisse, according to court records and a source in Mozambique's Attorney General Office.

Headlines: Aston Martin boss: Brexit delay would prolong uncertainty
Description: A delay to Brexit would be a "further annoyance" which would prolong uncertainty, the boss of luxury carmaker Aston Martin said after Prime Minister Theresa May promised to give lawmakers a vote on extending the date for Britain to leave the EU.

Headlines: U.S. trade chief sees long-term China challenges, continued tariff threat
Description: The United States will need to maintain the threat of tariffs on Chinese goods for years even if Washington and Beijing strike a deal to end a costly tariff war, President Donald Trump's chief trade negotiator told lawmakers on Wednesday.

Headlines: Google workers support proposed U.S. laws to curb mandatory arbitration
Description: Six Google employees on Thursday joined U.S. lawmakers to support bills that would ban mandatory arbitration in employment and consumer contracts, as the workers seek to build on recent success in getting the Alphabet Inc company to drop some arbitration provisions.

Headlines: Exclusive: KKR, China's Tencent eyeing bids for Universal Music - sources
Description: U.S. buyout fund KKR and China's Tencent Music Entertainment Group are exploring rival bids for up to half of Vivendi's iconic Universal Music division, a deal potentially worth up to 20 billion euros ($23 billion), sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Trump warns he could abandon China trade deal as advisers tout progress
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday warned he could walk away from a trade deal with China if it were not good enough, even as his economic advisers touted "fantastic" progress toward an agreement to end a dispute with the Asian country.

Headlines: U.S. Embassy seeks meeting with Swedish watchdog on Swedbank
Description: The U.S. embassy in Sweden has asked the country's financial watchdog FI for a meeting to discuss allegations about Swedbank's involvement in a Baltic money-laundering scandal.

Headlines: U.S. companies put record number of robots to work in 2018
Description: U.S. companies installed more robots last year than ever before, as cheaper and more flexible machines put them within reach of businesses of all sizes and in more corners of the economy beyond their traditional foothold in car plants.

Headlines: Venezuela's oil exports drop 40 percent after U.S. sanctions: data
Description: Venezuela's oil exports sank 40 percent in the first full month after the beginning of U.S. sanctions designed to oust Socialist President Nicolas Maduro, according to data from state-run oil firm PDVSA and Refinitiv Eikon.

Headlines: EU states block putting Saudi Arabia, U.S. territories on dirty-money list
Description: European Union member states unanimously rejected on Friday a proposal to blacklist Saudi Arabia and four U.S. territories for lax controls on terrorism financing and money laundering, sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Canada PM speaks to Trump about tariffs, sources see little progress
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke to U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday about American tariffs on steel and aluminum, Trudeau's office said on Friday, but well-placed sources said there was little sign of progress.

Headlines: U.S. companies adapt to 'endless' China tariffs
Description: U.S. manufacturers are accelerating their shift out of China, coming to terms with a new reality: the Trump administration's tariffs will not go away any time soon.

Headlines: Huawei to be arraigned in U.S. fraud case in New York on March 14
Description: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd and two affiliates will be arraigned on March 14 in U.S. District Court in Brooklyn, New York, on accusations the company committed bank and wire fraud and violated sanctions against Iran, according to a court filing on Friday.

Headlines: Wall Street rises as trade optimism counters weak data
Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average snapped a three-day run of losses on Friday as optimism about the prospects for a U.S.-China trade agreement countered downbeat U.S. and China manufacturing data.

Headlines: Trump asks China to lift tariffs on U.S. farm products
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he had asked China to immediately remove all tariffs on U.S. agricultural products because trade talks were progressing well.

Headlines: U.S. says rejects WTO's 'straitjacket' of trade obligations
Description: The Trump administration filed another salvo at the World Trade Organization on Friday, saying U.S. trade policy was not going to be dictated by the international body and defending its use of tariffs to pressure China and other trade partners.

Headlines: China says it welcomes delay on U.S. tariff increase
Description: China said on Saturday that it welcomed the release of language from the United State Trade Representative's office (USTR) delaying a scheduled hike in U.S. tariffs on $200 billion worth of Chinese goods.

Headlines: Lockheed gets $1 billion down payment for Saudi THAAD missile system
Description: Lockheed Martin Corp will receive the first payment toward the installation a $15 billion missile defense system in Saudi Arabia as part of a $110 billion arms package the Trump administration said it negotiated with the Kingdom in 2017, the Pentagon said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. shares falter, investors await U.S.-China trade deal
Description: U.S. stock indexes closed lower while the dollar edged higher on Monday, as investors appeared to need some convincing the United States and China would reach a trade agreement and weaker-than-expected construction data did not help their mood.

Headlines: Barclays bosses fretted over Qatar deal in 2008 fundraising
Description: Top Barclays executives worried that investors in the bank's 2008 emergency fundraising would go "nuts" if Qatar was given a better deal unfairly, a London court heard on Monday.

Headlines: EU set for trade talks with U.S. on March 6 amid concern over tariffs
Description: The European Union's top trade officials will update their U.S. counterparts this week on progress in obtaining a negotiating mandate for a EU-U.S. trade deal on industrial goods and raise concern over existing and potential future U.S. tariffs.

Headlines: Google rejects Australian regulator's call for scrutiny, denies market power
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google has rejected calls by Australia's competition regulator for tougher scrutiny of its operations, denying that it enjoys market power in online searches and advertising, documents published on Monday showed.

Headlines: U.S. and China said to appear close to deal to roll back tariffs
Description: The United States and China appear close to a deal that would roll back U.S. tariffs on at least $200 billion worth of Chinese goods, as Beijing makes pledges on structural economic changes and eliminates retaliatory tariffs on U.S. goods, a source briefed on negotiations said on Sunday.

Headlines: India won't discuss retaliatory duty with U.S.: trade official
Description: (This version of the story corrects to say India won't discuss retaliatory duty issue with U.S., not that India has no plan to impose retaliatory tariffs)

Headlines: India's farm, marine exports to be hit by U.S. trade action: exporters' body
Description: India's exports of farm, marine and handicraft products to the United States could be hit by U.S. plans to end a preferential trade treatment to the country in the next two months, an official at India's main exporters' body said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Volvo to test full-size driverless bus in Singapore
Description: Sweden's Volvo Buses and Singapore's Nanyang Technological University (NTU) on Tuesday unveiled a full-size autonomous electric bus for testing this year in the city state.

Headlines: Tesla blames misprinted label for China customs hiccup
Description: Tesla Inc said on Tuesday that China's customs authorities have accepted the electric carmaker's plan to resolve problems with the clearance of its Model 3 sedans that centered around misprinting of labels.

Headlines: Trump moves to scrap trade privilege for India, Delhi plays down impact
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump looked set to open a new front in his trade wars with a plan to end preferential trade treatment for India that allows duty-free entry for up to $5.6 billion worth of its exports to the United States.

Headlines: BMW wants clear guidance from Mexico government for investment plans
Description: German carmaker BMW, which is building its first plant in Mexico, is looking for clear signs from the new government of President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador that would guarantee stability to invest in the country, a top executive said.

Headlines: Stocks slip, dollar gains as China cuts growth target
Description: A gauge of world stock markets recovered from early declines but was slightly lower on Tuesday as China cut its growth targets to a 30-year low but added more stimulus, while strong U.S. economic data sent the dollar to a two-week high.

Headlines: China says Canadian stole secrets; Huawei to sue U.S.
Description: China's government and its leading smartphone maker, Huawei Technologies Ltd, stepped up pressure on Monday on the U.S. and Canadian governments in a dispute over trade and telecoms technology that has ensnared Huawei's CFO, who faces U.S. criminal charges.

Headlines: China says can 'absolutely' reach deal with U.S. on financial opening
Description: China can "absolutely" reach an agreement with the United States on opening up its financial sector, China's top banking regulator said on Tuesday, even as the country's commerce minister admitted talks with Washington had been difficult.

Headlines: Retail stocks set to bypass tariff woes but face aftershock risk
Description: Shares of U.S. retail and consumer goods companies appear set to emerge largely unscathed from the trade dispute between the United States and China.

Headlines: Trump says China trade talks going well, predicts 'good deal' or no deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that trade talks with China were moving along well and predicted either a "good deal" or no deal between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: China's February exports seen falling most in two years, imports down again: Reuters Poll
Description: China's exports likely contracted in February after a surprise bounce in January, while imports fell for a third straight month, a Reuters poll showed, heightening anxiety over whether Washington and Beijing can resolve deep differences over trade.

Headlines: Exclusive: Mexican central bank in talks with Amazon about new mobile payments
Description: Mexico's central bank is in talks with Amazon.com Inc to launch a new government-backed mobile payment system that would allow consumers to pay for online purchases using QR codes, the bank's head of payments said.

Headlines: 'We need it now': U.S. farm country pins hopes on China trade deal
Description: Corn and soybean farmer Lorenda Overman from North Carolina has been selling her crops at a loss and delaying paychecks to her workers since the U.S. trade war with China tanked agriculture prices, and her farmâ€™s debt recently topped $2 million.

Headlines: Czech cyber watchdog says its Huawei warning took U.S. by surprise
Description: The Czech cyber-security watchdog was not pressured by the United States or anyone else into issuing its warning about the possible security risks posed by Chinese telecoms equipment maker Huawei, Prague's cyber attache to Washington told Reuters.

Headlines: EU accepts Hollywood studios, Sky UK offers to counter geoblocking
Description: The European Commission has accepted commitments offered by top Hollywood film studios and Sky UK on their pay-TV services that will allow European Union consumers outside Britain and Ireland to access films via satellite or online.

Headlines: Japan sees global growth risks persisting on trade war, China slowdown
Description: Downside risks in the global economy are likely to persist over the medium to long term, pressured by the Sino-U.S. trade war and a slowdown in China, Japan's top financial diplomat said.

Headlines: Boeing jets could be part of broad U.S.-China trade deal: CEO
Description: Purchases of U.S.-made Boeing Co aircraft by China could be part of a sweeping deal currently being negotiated to end the months-long trade war between Washington and Beijing, Boeing's top executive said on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump 'confident' about getting a trade deal with China
Description: President Donald Trump on Friday said he is confident the United States can forge a trade deal with China, but added that he thinks his country would do very well with or without an agreement with the world's second-largest economy.

Headlines: BMW is biggest U.S. automotive exporter by value for fifth year
Description: Germany's automaker BMW AG said on Friday it was the biggest U.S. automotive exporter by value for the fifth consecutive year, with exports totaling over $8.4 billion in 2018.

Headlines: Instant view: China's February commodity imports fall across the board
Description: China's imports of major commodities fell across the board in February from a month earlier, according to official data released on Friday. The Lunar New Year holiday fell in early February this year.

Headlines: Uber pays $2.6 million to settle Dutch case: prosecutors
Description: Uber has paid around 2.3 million euros ($2.6 million) in a settlement after it was found to have offered an unlicensed taxi service in the Netherlands in 2014-2015, Dutch prosecutors said on Friday.

Headlines: Trump team has no plan to go to China for trade talks: official
Description: Trump administration officials have not made any new plans to send a team to China for face-to-face trade talks although there is much work left to be done to reach a deal, White House trade adviser Clete Willems said on Friday.

Headlines: Boeing's 737 MAX back in spotlight after second fatal crash
Description: The latest version of Boeing Co's best-selling 737 family - a global industry workhorse - has again been thrust into the spotlight after a fatal crash in Ethiopia, months after a deadly crash involving an identical brand-new jet in Indonesia.

Headlines: BOE tells some UK lenders to triple amount of liquid assets before Brexit: FT
Description: The Bank of England has told some UK lenders to triple the amount of easy-to-sell assets they hold to help them weather any no-deal Brexit crisis, the Financial Times reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the situation.

Headlines: Exclusive: Saudi's Falih says no OPEC+ output policy change until June
Description: Saudi oil minister Khalid al-Falih said on Sunday it would be too early to change OPEC+ output policy at the group's meeting in April and that China and the U.S. would lead healthy global demand for oil this year.

Headlines: Wall Street snaps five-day losing streak despite Boeing's drop
Description: U.S. stocks jumped on Monday as the technology sector led a broad-based rebound following five straight sessions of losses, but a fall in Boeing's shares limited the Dow's advance after a deadly airline crash in Ethiopia.

Headlines: Royal Air Maroc grounds Boeing 737 MAX 8 after Ethiopian crash
Description: Morocco's national carrier Royal Air Maroc has temporarily grounded a Boeing 737 MAX 8 following the fatal crash of the same type of aircraft in Ethiopia, an official said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump 2020 budget slashes foreign aid, hikes defense spending: official
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday asked Congress in his fiscal 2020 budget to slash spending for foreign aid while increasing spending on the military and for the wall he wants to build on the U.S.-Mexico border, a senior administration official told reporters.

Headlines: Trump budget proposes steep subsidy cuts to farmers as they grapple with crisis
Description: President Donald Trump's 2020 budget on Monday proposed a 15 percent cut for the U.S. Department of Agriculture, calling its subsidies to farmers "overly generous" at a time when they are going through the worst crisis in decades because of depressed commodity prices and Trump's trade tariffs.

Headlines: Stocks surge in broad rally, Treasury yields rise
Description: Global equity markets surged on Monday, lifted by talk of more stimulus from China and by a broad rally on Wall Street that overcame a plunge in Boeing shares after one of its newest jets crashed, while U.S. debt yields rose on improved risk appetite.

Headlines: Indonesia to temporarily ground Boeing 737 MAX 8 jets for inspections
Description: Indonesia will temporarily ground Boeing 737 MAX 8 aircraft operating in the country for inspection, the director general of aviation said on Monday, in the wake of the deadly crash of one of the planes in Ethiopia.

Headlines: Chinese carriers, Ethiopian Airlines halt use of Boeing 737 MAX 8 aircraft after crash
Description: China's aviation regulator on Monday grounded nearly 100 Boeing Co 737 MAX 8 aircraft operated by its airlines, more than a quarter of the global fleet of the jets, after a deadly crash of one of the planes in Ethiopia.

Headlines: India to soon issue additional safety instructions for Boeing 737 MAX 8 planes
Description: India's Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said on Monday it is reviewing safety issues related to Boeing's 737 MAX 8 aircraft operating in the country, a day after the fatal crash of one of the planes in Ethiopia.

Headlines: Global airlines' reaction to Ethiopian Airlines crash
Description: China and Indonesia have grounded Boeing 737 MAX 8 aircraft operated by their airlines in reaction to the fatal crash of a plane of the same type operated by Ethiopian Airlines on Sunday.

Headlines: Doomed with Democrats, Trump's budget boosts Pentagon, targets safety net
Description: President Donald Trump called on Monday for spending more U.S. taxpayer money on the military and a U.S.-Mexico border wall, while overhauling social safety-net programs in a budget plan likely to die in Congress but live on in his 2020 re-election campaign.

Headlines: 'Absurd' to say Trump unreliable trade negotiator with China: White House
Description: The White House said on Monday it was "absurd" to suggest that President Donald Trump was an unreliable negotiator as China reportedly balks at a summit with President Xi Jinping over concerns Trump would walk away from a trade deal.

Headlines: China, U.S. discuss key issues in trade talks: Xinhua
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He held a telephone call on Tuesday with U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer on key issues in their trade talks, state news agency Xinhua said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Pompeo to meet oil executives, push U.S. crude exports, Iran policy - sources
Description: U.S. Secretary Of State Mike Pompeo will meet with top oil executives before he addresses a conference on Tuesday, seeking to get them to help the administration's effort to boost crude exports to Asia and to support its policy of isolating Iran, according to three people at two companies briefed on the agenda.

Headlines: Lumber Liquidators to pay regulators $33 million in flooring scandal settlement
Description: Lumber Liquidators Holdings Inc has agreed to pay a $33 million criminal penalty to settle federal charges it misled investors about the safety of its laminate flooring made in China and sold to U.S. customers.

Headlines: Belgium closes air space for Boeing 737 MAX airplanes: agency
Description: Belgium closed down its air space for Boeing 737 MAX planes, the country's news agency Belga quoted transport minister Francois Bellot as saying on Tuesday after the Sunday's deadly plane crash in Ethiopia.

Headlines: Deal or no deal, U.S.-China trade talks may finish in weeks: Lighthizer
Description: The United States and China may be in the final weeks of discussions to hammer out a deal to ease their tit-for-tat tariffs dispute, U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Poland closes airspace to Boeing 737 Max 8 planes
Description: Poland closed its airspace to Boeing 737 Max 8 airliners from Tuesday evening and grounded its own fleet of the planes after the same type of aircraft crashed in Ethiopia, killing 157 people, officials said.

Headlines: Nissan, Renault retool alliance board structure in wake of Ghosn's ouster
Description: Japan's Nissan Motor Co and France's Renault SA on Tuesday unveiled a new board structure for their alliance that will see the chairman of Renault serve as a director of Nissan.

Headlines: Nissan, Renault break up almighty chairmanship in wake of Ghosn's ouster
Description: Japan's Nissan Motor and France's Renault said they would retool the world's top car-making alliance to put themselves on more equal footing, breaking up the all-powerful chairmanship previously wielded by ousted boss Carlos Ghosn.

Headlines: Huawei criticizes U.S. pressure on Berlin over 5G tech
Description: China's Huawei on Tuesday criticized the United States for warning Berlin that it could scale back intelligence cooperation with Germany if it allows Huawei to participate in construction of a next-generation mobile network.

Headlines: French aviation authority bans Boeing 737 MAX from its airspace
Description: France's DGAC civil aviation authority said on Tuesday it was banning Boeing 737 MAX aircraft from French airspace following the fatal crash last weekend of a plane of the same model in Ethiopia.

Headlines: Fiji suspends Boeing 737 MAX flights
Description: Fiji Airways and the Civil Aviation Authority of Fiji on Wednesday temporarily grounded the carrier's two Boeing Co 737 MAX planes, following two fatal crashes involving the aircraft in Indonesia and Ethiopia.

Headlines: U.S. airlines stand by 737 MAX as some customers, nations reject it
Description: The three U.S. airlines using Boeing Co's 737 MAX continued to stand by the aircraft on Tuesday, even as some customers, unions and politicians questioned its safety after an increasing number of countries banned the plane following a deadly crash in Ethiopia.

Headlines: Mexico backs Disney-Fox deal, orders sale of Fox Sports channels
Description: Mexico's telecoms regulator said on Tuesday it had approved the Walt Disney Co's $71 billion purchase of Twenty-First Century Fox Inc's film and television assets, subject to conditions, including the sale of Fox Sports channels.

Headlines: Ties between Boeing and Trump run deep
Description: When Donald Trump spoke with Boeing CEO Dennis Muilenburg on Tuesday to get assurances about the safety of the 737 MAX plane that crashed in Ethiopia, he wasn't talking to a stranger.

Headlines: Iraq bans Boeing 737 MAX aircraft from its airspace
Description: Iraq on Wednesday banned U.S. planemaker Boeing Co's 737 MAX aircraft from entering or transiting its airspace, a statement from the civil aviation authority said.

Headlines: France's BEA not contacted by Ethiopia over black box analysis
Description: Ethiopian authorities have not contacted France's air accident investigation agency about receiving the black boxes from the Boeing 737 MAX 8 which crashed near Addis Ababa, a spokesman for the BEA said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. will not suspend Boeing 737 MAX planes; discussion on black box analysis
Description: The U.S. aviation regulator said on Tuesday it would not ground Boeing Co 737 MAX planes after a crash in Ethiopia that killed 157 people, bucking a trend of countries around the world that have suspended the aircraft's operations.

Headlines: Iran's oil tanker fleet being squeezed as sanctions bite
Description: Iran is running short of options to replace its aging fleet of tankers and keep oil exports flowing because renewed U.S. sanctions are making potential sellers and flag registries wary of doing business with Tehran, Western and Iranian sources said.

Headlines: Exclusive: Portugal's EDP could create Latam JV with China Three Gorges if takeover bid fails - sources
Description: Portugal's Energia de Portugal EDP could propose a joint venture with China Three Gorges (CTG) allowing CTG to expand its foothold in Brazil and Latin America if the Chinese power giant's bid to take over EDP fails, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. aims to cut Iran oil exports to under 1 million bpd from May - sources
Description: The United States aims to cut Iran's crude exports by about 20 percent to below 1 million barrels per day (bpd) from May by requiring importing countries to reduce purchases to avoid U.S. sanctions, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Mexico suspends operations of Boeing 737 MAX jetliners
Description: Mexico's civil aviation authority on Wednesday temporarily suspended flights by Boeing Co's 737 MAX 8 and MAX 9 aircraft in and out of the country following an Ethiopian Airlines plane crash on Sunday that killed 157 people.

Headlines: France to analyze Ethiopian Airlines flight recorders: spokesman
Description: France's air accident investigation agency BEA will analysis black-box flight recorders from a Boeing 737 MAX 8 which crashed near Addis Ababa on Sunday, a spokesman said.

Headlines: Ukraine suspends flights of two Boeing 737 models
Description: Ukraine has suspended all flights by Boeing's 737-8 and 737-9 MAX aircraft following Sunday's deadly plane crash in Ethiopia, Ukraine's aviation authority said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. says Iran has lost $10 billion in oil revenue due to sanctions
Description: Iran has lost $10 billion in revenue since U.S. sanctions in November have removed about 1.5 million barrels per day (bpd) of Iranian crude from global markets, a U.S. State Department official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Black boxes from Ethiopia crash to be sent to Germany: Ethiopian Airlines spokesman
Description: The black boxes from a Boeing 737 MAX 8 plane that crashed in Ethiopia on Sunday, killing 157 people, will be sent to Germany for analysis, an Ethiopian Airlines spokesman said.

Headlines: German minister fears excluding Huawei could hurt economy
Description: Excluding China's Huawei from participating in the construction of Germany's 5G next-generation mobile network could hurt Europe's largest economy, Interior Minister Horst Seehofer said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Germany says will not analyse Ethiopian Airlines black box
Description: Germany's Federal Bureau of Aircraft Accident Investigation (BFU) said on Wednesday it will not analyse the black box from the Ethiopian Airlines passenger jet which crashed soon after taking off from Addis Ababa on Sunday.

Headlines: Georgia bars flights of Boeing 737 Max after crash in Ethiopia
Description: Georgia's civil aviation agency on Wednesday temporarily barred Boeing 737 Max jets from taking off or landing at local airports, following the fatal crash involving the aircraft in Ethiopia.

Headlines: Volkswagen's Scania sees China rebound, braces for Brexit hit to UK orders
Description: Volkswagen-owned truckmaker Scania said on Thursday that demand in China had bounced back since the start of this year, but it was bracing for a potentially significant drop in UK orders if Britain leaves the EU under a "hard" Brexit.

Headlines: Abu Dhabi state investor Mubadala halts business with Goldman Sachs amid 1MDB lawsuit
Description: Abu Dhabi state investor Mubadala has suspended new business dealings with Goldman Sachs since its subsidiary filed a lawsuit in November against the U.S. bank and others to recover losses suffered through its dealings with Malaysian state fund 1MDB.

Headlines: Huawei pleads not guilty to U.S. charges in New York court
Description: China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd on Thursday pleaded not guilty to a 13-count indictment filed in a New York federal court against the company, as tensions have ratcheted up between the U.S. and Beijing.

Headlines: Huawei CFO wanted to quit job just before arrest, says founder
Description: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou had been looking for another job when she was arrested in Canada last December on a U.S. warrant, the firm's founder said in an interview aired on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. considers sanctions to restrict Visa, Mastercard in Venezuela: official
Description: The United States is considering imposing financial sanctions that could prohibit Visa Inc , Mastercard Inc and other financial institutions from processing transactions in Venezuela, a senior Trump administration official said on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump-Xi summit will not happen in March: Mnuchin
Description: A summit to seal a trade deal between U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping will not happen at the end of March as previously discussed because more work is needed in U.S.-China negotiations, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Thursday.

Headlines: China, U.S. make further substantive progress on trade talks: Xinhua
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He spoke by telephone with U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer and the two sides made further substantive progress on trade talks, Xinhua news agency said on Friday.

Headlines: Q&A: Unpicking China's move to ground Boeing 737 MAX fleet
Description: China's aviation regulator gained global attention when it became the first to ground Boeing's 737 MAX aircraft following Sunday's deadly plane crash in Ethiopia.

Headlines: On Japan Sea coast, small firm shows scars of China's economic woes
Description: In snow country along Japan's northern coast, a small manufacturer of precision moulds is feeling the pain of China's economic slowdown.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin Corp wins $507 million defense contract: Pentagon
Description: Lockheed Martin Corp was awarded a $506.9 million modification to a U.S. defense contract for a guided missile system and associated services, the Pentagon said on Thursday.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco shifts strategy in China to boost oil sales
Description: Rising Russian and U.S. competition has pushed Saudi Aramco to find new buyers for its oil in China, encouraging a shift toward independent refiners and newcomers to the business.

Headlines: Trump says he is in no rush to complete China trade deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he was in no rush to complete a trade pact with China and insisted that any deal include protection for intellectual property, a major sticking point between the two sides during months of negotiations.

Headlines: Ethiopian delegation has flown the black boxes from Ethiopia plane crash to Paris: Ethiopian Airlines
Description: An Ethiopian delegation led by the accident investigation bureau has flown the black boxes from the Ethiopia plane crash from Addis Ababa to Paris for investigation, Ethiopian Airlines said on Thursday.

Headlines: Large-scale solar power set for double-digit growth: Goldman Sachs
Description: Utility-scale solar power capacity is expected to grow by double digits globally in 2019 and 2020, driven by expansions in the United States, Europe, Middle East and China, U.S. bank Goldman Sachs said on Thursday.

Headlines: Indonesia to send officials to Ethiopia to aid Boeing crash probe
Description: Indonesia plans to send a flight inspector and an official from its transport safety agency to Ethiopia to help with the probe into Sunday's crash of a Boeing 737 MAX 8 jet, Transport Ministry official Polana Pramesti said on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump says he hopes grounding of Boeing planes is short
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he hoped Boeing Co can figure out whatever problem might exist with its 737 MAX jetliners and that a U.S. decision to ground them would only have to be in place for a short time.

Headlines: NTSB sending three to France to assist in Boeing 'black box' review
Description: The U.S. National Transportation Safety Board is sending three investigators to France Thursday to assist with the downloading and analysis of flight recorders from the Ethiopian Airlines Boeing 737 MAX 8 that crashed Sunday near Addis Ababa, Ethiopia killing 157 people.

Headlines: 'Positive signs' in Airbus-China talks, says French official
Description: There are encouraging signs that European planemaker Airbus is closing in on a long-negotiated deal with China for dozens of new narrow-body jets, an aide to French President Emmanuel Macron said on Thursday.

Headlines: Blue Air to decide on Boeing 737 MAX order after crash investigation
Description: Romania's Blue Air will take a decision on its order for 12 Boeing 737 MAX 8 jets only after an investigation into a fatal crash of one of the planes in Ethiopia at the weekend, CEO Marius Puiu told Reuters.

Headlines: Foreign brands escape China's glare at annual consumer day gala
Description: China on Friday accused a raft of local firms, from snack makers to a financial tech firm applying for a U.S. listing, of fooling and harassing consumers in an annual event that for the first time in years did not name and shame any foreign or well-known local brands.

Headlines: Ford to cut more than 5,000 jobs in Germany, others in UK
Description: U.S. automaker Ford plans to cut more than 5,000 jobs in Germany and will reduce its workforce in Britain as well as it seeks to return to profit in Europe, the company said on Friday.

Headlines: Russian metals tycoon Deripaska sues U.S. over sanctions
Description: Russian tycoon Oleg Deripaska sued the United States on Friday, alleging that it had overstepped its legal bounds in imposing sanctions on him and made him the "latest victim" in the U.S. probe into Moscow's alleged election interference.

Headlines: Ethiopia crash may test Boeing's success in defeating U.S. lawsuits: legal experts
Description: The crash of Boeing Co's 737 MAX 8 passenger jet in Ethiopia raises the chances that families of the 157 victims, even non-U.S. residents, will be able to sue in U.S. courts, where payouts are larger than in other countries, some legal experts said.

Headlines: Shares in U.S. steel producers could rally along with commodity: Barron's
Description: Several U.S. steel company shares could rally along with a rise in the commodity's price, according to an article in Barron's that also urged caution on the stocks because of historical volatility.

Headlines: Factbox: What we know about Boeing 737 MAX crash and what comes next
Description: More than 300 Boeing 737 MAX 8 and MAX 9 passenger jets around the world have been taken out of service following two fatal crashes over the past five months in Ethiopia and Indonesia that killed almost 350 people in all.

Headlines: Brexit spurs biggest cut in UK business investment in 10 years: BCC
Description: British companies look set to cut investment by the most in 10 years in 2019 because of Brexit, even if Prime Minister Theresa May gets a deal to ease the country out of the bloc, an employers group said on Monday.

Headlines: Brexit, yellow vests take fizz out of champagne sales
Description: Brexit and France's "yellow vest" protest movement pushed the number of bottles of French champagne sold last year to its lowest since 2004, trade group data showed on Sunday.

Headlines: Factbox: What we know about Boeing 737 MAX crash and what comes next
Description: More than 300 Boeing 737 MAX 8 and MAX 9 passenger jets around the world have been taken out of service following two fatal crashes over the past five months in Ethiopia and Indonesia that killed almost 350 people in all.

Headlines: U.S. judge says Rio Tinto must face SEC fraud case
Description: A U.S. judge on Monday rejected Rio Tinto Plc's bid to dismiss a Securities and Exchange Commission lawsuit accusing the Anglo-Australian mining company of civil fraud in its handling of a failed investment in a Mozambique coal project.

Headlines: Ethiopia and Indonesia crash parallels heap pressure on Boeing
Description: Investigators into the Boeing Co 737 MAX crash in Ethiopia have found striking similarities in a vital flight angle with an airplane that came down off Indonesia, a source said, piling pressure on the world's biggest planemaker.

Headlines: Canada re-examining Boeing 737 MAX approval after FAA certification probe
Description: Transport Canada is re-examining the validation it gave Boeing Co's 737 MAX jets, following reports of a U.S. probe into the aircraft's certification by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), Canada's transport minister said on Monday.

Headlines: What we know about Boeing 737 MAX crash and what comes next
Description: More than 300 Boeing 737 MAX 8 and MAX 9 passenger jets around the world have been taken out of service following two fatal crashes over the past five months in Ethiopia and Indonesia that killed almost 350 people in all.

Headlines: EU to study Boeing software updates before allowing flights to resume
Description: The European Union will not allow models of the Boeing aircraft that crashed in Ethiopia to fly in its skies until it has received sufficient guarantees from the U.S. planemaker, the head of the bloc's aviation safety agency said.

Headlines: Ethiopia to lead next stage of cockpit data analysis
Description: Ethiopian investigators will lead the next stage of cockpit data analysis from the Boeing 737 MAX that crashed outside Addis Ababa with U.S. and French support, a person familiar with the investigation said.

Headlines: Trump says tariffs on Chinese goods may stay for 'substantial period'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump warned on Wednesday that the United States may leave tariffs on Chinese goods for a "substantial period" to ensure that Beijing complies with any trade agreement.

Headlines: Bayer shares slide after latest Roundup cancer ruling
Description: Shares in Germany's Bayer's fell more than 12 percent on Wednesday after a second U.S. jury ruled its Roundup weed killer caused cancer.

Headlines: Factbox: What we know about Boeing 737 MAX crash and what comes next
Description: More than 300 Boeing 737 MAX 8 and MAX 9 passenger jets have been grounded worldwide after two fatal crashes in the past five months in Ethiopia and Indonesia killed nearly 350 people.

Headlines: Nokia says it is not taking on new business in Iran
Description: Finnish telecom equipment maker Nokia does not plan to take on any new business in Iran in 2019, it said in its annual report on Thursday, citing difficulties in dealing with conflicting U.S. and European trade policies.

Headlines: Japan firms see prolonged Sino-U.S. trade war, China slowdown to persist: Reuters poll
Description: Three in four Japanese companies expect U.S.-China trade frictions to last until at least late this year, a sharp contrast to market hopes that presidents Donald Trump and Xi Jinping might soon strike a deal to end their damaging trade war, a Reuters poll found.

Headlines: Mexico could pay Pemex debt from $15 billion stabilization fund
Description: Mexico's deputy finance minister said on Thursday the government was considering using part of a $15.4 billion public income stabilization fund to pay some debt obligations for heavily leveraged state oil company Pemex.

Headlines: Reliance sends fuel from India, Europe to Venezuela to sidestep U.S. sanctions
Description: India's Reliance Industries is selling fuels to Venezuela from India and Europe to sidestep sanctions that bar U.S.-based companies from dealing with state-run PDVSA, according to trading sources and Refinitiv Eikon data.

Headlines: Ethiopia says U.S., EU, French teams helping analyze crash black boxes
Description: Ethiopia has begun examining cockpit voice and flight data recordings from doomed Ethiopian Airlines flight 302 and is working with U.S., EU and French experts, the Ministry of Transport said on Thursday.

Headlines: Roche sues U.S. executives in fight over diabetes test strips
Description: Roche is seeking damages and compensation in a U.S. lawsuit against former executives of a Utah-based company, the Swiss drugmaker's latest case targeting what it calls fraudulent schemes involving its diabetes test strips.

Headlines: Finland to investigate Nokia-branded phones after data breach report
Description: Finland's data protection ombudsman said on Thursday he would investigate whether Nokia-branded phones had breached data rules after a report said the handsets sent information to China.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs raises chances of no-deal Brexit after UK PM's late reprieve
Description: Goldman Sachs on Friday lowered its expectations of UK Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal getting ratified, and hiked its estimate of the chances of a "no-deal" exit from the European Union.

Headlines: Factbox: What we know about Boeing 737 MAX crash and what comes next
Description: More than 300 Boeing 737 MAX jets have been grounded worldwide after two fatal crashes in the past five months in Ethiopia and Indonesia killed nearly 350 people.

Headlines: Indonesia's Garuda asks to cancel 737 MAX order it had been reconsidering before Ethiopia crash
Description: Garuda Indonesia has asked to cancel an order for 49 Boeing Co 737 MAX 8 jets, citing a loss of passenger trust following two crashes, although it had been reconsidering the order before the latest disaster in Ethiopia last week.

Headlines: Trump: China trade deal likely; automakers can avoid tariffs with U.S. plants
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said trade negotiations with China were progressing and a final agreement "will probably happen," adding that his call for tariffs to remain on Chinese imported goods for some time did not mean talks were in trouble.

Headlines: More shale, who cares? Saudi Arabia pushes for at least $70 oil
Description: Budget needs are forcing Saudi Arabia to push for oil prices of at least $70 per barrel this year, industry sources say, even though U.S. shale oil producers could benefit and Riyadh's share of global crude markets might be further eroded.

Headlines: Autonomy founder Lynch set for $5 billion Hewlett-Packard court showdown
Description: Mike Lynch, once hailed as Britain's answer to Bill Gates, faces Hewlett-Packard (HP) in London's High Court on Monday in a multi-billion dollar showdown over the U.S. technology company's 2011 purchase of the Autonomy software business he founded.

Headlines: Ex-Autonomy CEO Lynch denies new U.S. charges against him
Description: British entrepreneur Mike Lynch vigorously denies new U.S. criminal charges against him, his spokesman said on Saturday ahead of a court case over the sale of his firm Autonomy which will begin in London next week.

Headlines: China refuses to concede on U.S. demands to ease curbs on tech firms: FT
Description: Ahead of fresh high-level trade talks this week, China is not conceding to U.S. demands to ease curbs on technology companies, the Financial Times reported on Sunday, citing three people briefed on the discussions.

Headlines: Autonomy boss Lynch ramped sales ahead of HP deal, court told
Description: British entrepreneur Mike Lynch artificially inflated revenue at his Autonomy software company before selling it to Hewlett Packard for $11 billion, the U.S. firm's lawyer told a London court on Monday.

Headlines: JPMorgan asks 300 staff to move if no Brexit deal: source
Description: JPMorgan is asking around 300 staff in its London office to sign new contracts that will require them to move to one of the bank's other hubs in the European Union if there is a no-deal Brexit, according to a person familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Factbox: What we know about Boeing 737 MAX crash and what comes next
Description: More than 300 Boeing 737 MAX jets have been grounded worldwide after two fatal crashes in the past five months in Ethiopia and Indonesia killed nearly 350 people.

Headlines: EU demands scrutiny of 5G risks but no bloc-wide Huawei ban
Description: EU nations will be required to share data on 5G cybersecurity risks and produce measures to tackle them by the end of the year, the European Commission said on Tuesday, shunning U.S. calls to ban China's Huawei Technologies across the bloc.

Headlines: U.S. labor unions say NAFTA replacement does not go far enough for workers
Description: U.S. labor officials on Tuesday pressed lawmakers to strengthen enforcement of the provisions of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) intended to protect workers, the latest sign the trade deal could face hurdles to passage in the Democrat-led House of Representatives.

Headlines: Airbus wins China order for 300 jets as Xi visits France
Description: Airbus signed a deal worth tens of billions of dollars on Monday to sell 300 aircraft to China, coinciding with a visit to Europe by Chinese President Xi Jinping and matching a China record held by U.S. rival Boeing.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit narrows sharply as exports rebound
Description: - The U.S. trade deficit dropped more than expected in January likely as China boosted purchases of soybeans, leading to a rebound in exports after three straight monthly declines.

Headlines: Renault aims to restart Nissan merger talks within 12 months: FT
Description: France's Renault SA intends to restart merger talks with Japan's Nissan Motor Co Ltd within 12 months, after which it will set sight on a bid to buy Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. made progress in convincing EU on Huawei technology risks: Pompeo
Description: The United States has made progress in convincing the European Union of the risks in using technology from China's Huawei and will continue to push them on the issue, U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. FAA says it has not granted initial approval for Boeing 737 MAX anti-stall upgrade
Description: The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration said Wednesday that it has not yet granted provisional approval for Boeing Co's announced anti-stall software upgrade of 737 MAX aircraft following crashes in Indonesia and Ethiopia.

Headlines: U.S. starts anti-dumping probe of wooden cabinets imported from China
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department said on Wednesday it had initiated an anti-dumping duty and countervailing duty investigation of wooden cabinets and vanities imported from China to determine whether they are being dumped on the U.S. market.

Headlines: Japan curbs on Chinese telecom firms could hurt ties, says China
Description: Japan's decision to curb government purchases from Chinese telecoms equipment makers Huawei Technologies and ZTE Corp could hurt bilateral ties if Tokyo's actions are deemed unfair, China's commerce ministry said on Thursday.

Headlines: Mnuchin says U.S. eyes productive trade meetings in China
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Thursday he and U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer looked forward to "productive meetings" as they arrived in Beijing leading a delegation for trade talks with China.

Headlines: China says vice premier will hold trade talks tonight with senior U.S. officials
Description: China's commerce ministry said on Thursday that Vice Premier Liu He will hold trade talks later tonight with U.S. trade representative Robert Lighthizer and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin.

Headlines: Exclusive: China shifts position on tech transfers, trade talks progress - U.S. officials
Description: China has made proposals in talks with the United States on a range of issues that go further than it has before, including on forced technology transfer, as the two sides work to overcome obstacles to a deal to end their protracted trade war, U.S. officials told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: PVH to exit high-end collection of Calvin Klein label
Description: Apparel maker PVH Corp said on Thursday it would exit its high-end collection of Calvin Klein apparel and shut the label's flagship store on New York's Madison Avenue, as the fashion line failed to strike a chord with customers.

Headlines: Trade hopes buoy stocks, Brexit setback hits pound
Description: Stock markets around the world moved higher on Friday following signs of progress in U.S.-China trade talks, while the British pound fell after lawmakers rejected Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit agreement for the third time.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump eyeing stepped-up Venezuela sanctions for foreign companies - Bolton
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is considering imposing sanctions on companies from other countries that do business with Venezuela to cut off revenues to President Nicolas Maduro, Trump's national security adviser John Bolton told Reuters TV on Friday.

Headlines: U.S., China report progress in Beijing trade talks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that trade talks with China were going very well, but cautioned that he would not accept anything less than a "great deal" after top U.S. and Chinese trade officials wrapped up two days of negotiations in Beijing.

Headlines: Anti-stall system active before Ethiopian 737 MAX crash: sources
Description: An anti-stall system at the center of a probe into the crash of a Boeing 737 MAX jetliner in Indonesia five months ago was also at play when an identical aircraft crashed in Ethiopia earlier this month, three people briefed on the matter said.

Headlines: Trade hopes lift Wall Street; S&P 500 notches best quarter since 2009
Description: U.S. stocks ended the final trading day of the first quarter on a strong note on Friday and the S&P 500 posted its best quarterly gain since 2009, boosted by optimism over the latest round of trade talks between the United States and China.

Headlines: Mnuchin says U.S.-China trade talks were 'constructive'
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said in a tweet on Friday that he and U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer had concluded "constructive" trade talks in Beijing.

Headlines: Exclusive: Goldmanâ€™s China-backed fund bucks trade tensions to buy U.S. firm
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc invested money from China's sovereign wealth fund in a California-based industrial company and is looking for more U.S. deals, three sources familiar with the matter said, even after increased scrutiny from Washington all but stopped U.S.-China deals last year.

Headlines: Huawei urges U.S. to drop 'loser's attitude' as carrier business revenue slips
