Description: Hopes for an early settlement of the yearlong U.S.-China trade war dimmed this week after the United States accused China of manipulating its currency, and U.S. President Donald Trump said he would not make a deal with Beijing for now.

Headlines: On-off trade tariffs wreak havoc on U.S. company planning
Description: Win Cramer thought his company was out of the firing line in the escalating Sino-U.S. trade war after his "Made-in-China" wireless headphones, speakers and earbuds were taken off Washington's tariff list a year ago.

Headlines: China tariffs on U.S. oil to pressure exports, Gulf Coast prices: traders
Description: China's threat on Friday to slap a 5% tariff on U.S. oil imports could further soften demand for physical crude at hubs along the U.S. Gulf Coast, where exporters already have taken to shipping crude overseas without firm buyers, traders said.

Headlines: Citgo profits hit following split, CEO sees 2H improvement
Description: The two new top executives at Citgo Petroleum PDVSAC.UL disclosed this week that net income in the second quarter slid to less than half its level a year earlier, hit by a broad slump for the refining industry as well as complications from U.S. sanctions on Venezuela and Citgo's split with state-run oil company PDVSA.

Headlines: Factbox: Pending mergers and acquisitions involving U.S. firms that need Chinese approval
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he has ordered American companies to exit China after Beijing unveiled retaliatory tariffs on $75 billion worth of U.S. goods, in a new twist in the bitter trade war between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: U.S.-China Business Council urges talks to end damaging trade tensions
Description: The US-China Business Council on Friday said millions of U.S. citizens will be harmed by the increased trade tensions between the United States and China, the world's largest economies, following the latest salvos in the U.S.-China trade war.

Headlines: Oil prices slide as U.S.-China trade war escalates
Description: Oil prices fell on Friday after China unveiled retaliatory tariffs against about $75 billion worth of U.S. goods including crude oil, another escalation of a protracted trade dispute between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: California rare earths miner races to refine amid U.S.-China trade row
Description: The owner of the only U.S. rare earths mine is going on a hiring spree as it looks to significantly boost production, part of a strategy to build out American refining capability after China raised tariffs on the minerals amid an escalating trade war.

Headlines: Explainer: What tools could Trump use to get U.S. firms to quit China?
Description: Hours after China announced retaliatory tariffs on U.S. goods on Friday, President Donald Trump ordered U.S. companies to "start looking for an alternative to China, including bringing your companies HOME and making your products in the USA.".

Headlines: China says wants 'calm' resolution to U.S. trade war
Description: China is willing to resolve its trade dispute with the United States through "calm" negotiations and resolutely opposes the escalation of the conflict, Vice Premier Liu He, who has been leading the talks with Washington, said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump, Abe say U.S. and Japan have agreed in principle on trade deal
Description: The United States and Japan agreed in principle on Sunday to core elements of a trade deal that U.S. President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said they hoped to sign in New York next month.

Headlines: U.S. equity futures reopen lower, U.S.-China trade relations at new low ebb
Description: U.S. stock index futures dropped when electronic trading resumed on Sunday, with trade relations between the United States and China appearing to reach a new low on Friday, sending Wall Street into a selling frenzy.

Headlines: Trump regrets not raising tariffs on China higher, White House says
Description: President Donald Trump wishes he had raised tariffs on Chinese goods even higher last week, the White House said on Sunday, even as Trump signaled he did not plan to follow through with a demand that U.S. firms find ways to close operations in China.

Headlines: Kudlow does not expect China to retaliate against latest U.S. tariffs
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Sunday that he does not expect China to retaliate against additional tariffs on Chinese goods that U.S. President Donald Trump announced Friday.

Headlines: UK PM Johnson to tell Trump to de-escalate trade tensions
Description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Saturday he would tell President Donald Trump at this weekend's G7 summit to pull back from a trade war that is already destabilizing economic growth around the world.

Headlines: China warns U.S. to stop 'wrong' trade actions or face consequences
Description: China said on Saturday it strongly opposes Washington's decision to levy additional tariffs on $550 billion worth of Chinese goods and warned the United States of consequences if it does not end its "wrong actions".

Headlines: China to fight back against U.S. tariff move: People's Daily
Description: China will fight back against the latest U.S. step to increase tariffs on Chinese goods, the ruling Communist Party's People's Daily said on Sunday amid an escalating trade war between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: Trump says hopes doesn't have to consider tariffs on German cars
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday that he and German Chancellor Angela Merkel discussed a trade deal with the European Union and said he hoped Washington would not have to consider imposing tariffs on German cars.

Headlines: Trump, asked if could delay China tariffs, says: 'Anything is possible'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday that trade negotiations with China were in a much better position than at any time and, asked if he could delay planned tariffs on Chinese goods, replied: "Anything is possible".

Headlines: Tesla to raise prices in China on August 30, may increase again in December: sources
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc will raise prices in China on Friday, earlier than planned, and is considering increasing prices again in December should Chinese tariffs on U.S.-made cars take effect, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Japan PM Abe: Stable U.S.-China relations crucial for global economy
Description: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said on Monday stable relations between the United States and China are "very important" not just for these economies, but for the sake of the global economy.

Headlines: Trump says confident China sincere about wanting a trade deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he was confident that China was sincere about wanting a trade deal with the United States because it had taken "a very large hit" in recent months.

Headlines: Wall Street bounces as trade temperature cools
Description: U.S. stocks rose on Monday, following a sharp sell-off in the prior session, after U.S. President Donald Trump predicted a trade deal with China, cooling investor concerns after a ramp-up in rhetoric derailed markets last week.

Headlines: Macron defuses French digital tax row, Trump coy on wine threat
Description: France and the United States reached a deal to end a standoff over a French tax on big internet companies, though U.S. President Donald Trump declined to say whether his threat of a retaliatory wine tax was off the table as a result.

Headlines: Trump's aggressive, mixed signals on China whiplash Wall Street
Description: President Donald Trump's aggressive stance and often mixed signals in his trade war with China are taking a toll on the shares of U.S. companies that are most reliant on the world's second largest economy.

Headlines: China says it hopes U.S. can create conditions for trade talks
Description: China's foreign ministry reiterated on Tuesday that it had not heard of any recent telephone call between the United States and China on trade, and said it hopes Washington can stop its wrong actions and create conditions for talks.

Headlines: Crowds force Costco to shut maiden China store early on opening day
Description: U.S. hypermarket chain Costco Wholesale Corp was forced to shut its first store in China early on its opening day on Tuesday, according to state media, after large crowds flocked through the door and caused traffic jams in the Shanghai neighborhood.

Headlines: Pentagon in talks with Australia on rare earths plant: official
Description: The U.S. Department of Defense is in talks with Australia to host a facility that would process rare earth minerals, part of an effort to reduce reliance on China for the specialized materials used in military equipment, a senior American official said.

Headlines: Wall Street slips as financials drag, trade outlook clouds
Description: Wall Street slipped on Tuesday, weighed down by financial stocks as a deepening of the Treasury yield curve inversion raised U.S. recession worries and uncertainty over any progress in trade negotiations between the United States and China took a toll.

Headlines: After blacklisting, U.S. receives 130-plus license requests to sell to Huawei: sources
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department has received more than 130 applications from companies for licenses to sell U.S. goods to China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, three sources said, nearly two months after President Donald Trump said some sales would be allowed.

Headlines: U.S. 10-year TIPS yields fall deeper into negative territory
Description: The yields on U.S. 10-year Treasury Inflation Protected Securities slipped deeper into negative territory on Tuesday as a result of intense demand for bonds due to trade and economic anxiety.

Headlines: Oil futures extend gains on larger-than-expected U.S. crude draw
Description: Oil prices rose in volatile trade on Tuesday supported by expectations of a drawdown in U.S. crude inventories, though gains were capped by worries about a recession and uncertainty over a China-U.S. trade deal.

Headlines: Trump says China trade deal coming, Beijing calls for resolution of dispute
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday predicted a trade deal with China after positive gestures by Beijing, calming global markets that have been roiled by new tariffs from the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: Costco limits shoppers in first China store after opening-day fiasco
Description: Costco Wholesale Corp said it will limit the number of shoppers at its new China store after overcrowding forced the U.S. big box retailer to shut it early on the opening day.

Headlines: Oil prices gain nearly 2% after drop in U.S. crude inventories
Description: Oil prices rose nearly 2% on Wednesday after a larger-than-expected decline in U.S. crude stockpiles helped ease worries about weakening oil demand caused by the trade war between Washington and Beijing.

Headlines: Best Buy's sales forecast falls short as tariffs loom
Description: Best Buy Co Inc blamed planned U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports and uncertainty about future consumer behavior for a lower annual sales forecast, becoming the latest company to air concerns about President Donald Trump's trade war with Beijing.

Headlines: Exclusive: T. Rowe Price held talks with Guaido team on Venezuela PDVSA 2020 payment
Description: T. Rowe Price has held informal talks with advisors of Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Guaido about financing a $913 million payment on state oil firm PDVSA's 2020 bond, an executive at the U.S. fund manager told Reuters, adding the plan would only work if Washington alters sanctions on Venezuela.

Headlines: Volkswagen to invest $577 million in Brazil auto plant
Description: Volkswagen will invest 2.4 billion reais ($577 million) in one of its Brazil factories, Sao Paulo state governor Joao Doria said on Thursday during a visit to the automaker's headquarters in Germany.

Headlines: Wall Street rallies after China trade comments
Description: U.S. stocks rallied more than 1% on Thursday, buoyed by gains in the trade-sensitive technology and industrial sectors as China expressed hope on trade negotiations with the United States, easing concerns that rising tensions could stoke a recession.

Headlines: Trade war dims outlook for U.S. business operations in China: survey
Description: U.S. companies doing business in China are still making profits there, but 81% say escalating trade tensions between the world's two largest economies have affected their business operations, a survey released Thursday by the US-China Business Council found.

Headlines: London mayor says firms must play by the rules as Uber faces license renewal
Description: London's Mayor Sadiq Khan said everyone must play by the rules when asked on Thursday about taxi app Uber's London license, which is due to expire in less than a month's time.

Headlines: Trump: U.S.-China trade talks scheduled on Thursday 'at a different level'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said negotiators for the United States and China were scheduled to have talks aimed at easing their trade tensions later on Thursday "at a different level," but did not provide additional details.

Headlines: Exclusive: India to woo foreign firms like Apple to capitalize on U.S.-China trade war
Description: India is targeting companies including Apple, Foxconn and Wistron Corp with a charm offensive aimed at encouraging them to shift business out of trade war-hit China, according to a source and a document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Signs of new U.S.-China trade discussions emerge as increased tariffs loom
Description: The United States and China gave signs on Thursday that they will resume trade talks as the two economic superpowers discussed the next round of in-person negotiations in September ahead of a looming deadline for additional U.S. tariffs.

Headlines: U.S. and China will meet in September, Trump says, but tariff hikes remain
Description: Trade teams from China and the United States continue to talk and will meet in September, but tariff increases on Chinese goods set to go in place on Sunday will not be delayed, President Donald Trump said on Friday.

Headlines: General Motors cuts some 350 jobs in Thailand operations
Description: General Motors has cut about 350 jobs from its Thai subsidiary's operations, a labor representative said on Friday, slashing more than 15% of the workforce for the U.S. automaker that has two factories in Thailand.

Headlines: Yields rise on trade optimism, volumes muted
Description: U.S. Treasury yields edged higher on Friday on hopes the United States and China will take steps to de-escalate their trade war, though trading volumes were muted before a U.S. holiday.

Headlines: Trump prods General Motors over its auto plants in China
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump, who is engaged in a trade war with Beijing, said on Friday that the largest U.S. automaker, General Motors Co , should begin moving its operations back to the United States.

Headlines: China's service sector activity grows at quicker pace in August: official PMI
Description: Growth in China's services sector activity picked up for the first time in five months in August, official data showed on Saturday, cushioning some of the economic impact from intensifying U.S. trade pressure.

Headlines: Tesla hikes prices for Model 3, other cars in China amid weaker yuan
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc had raised prices for some vehicles in China as the yuan trades at its weakest levels in more than a decade.

Headlines: Japan's curbs on high-tech materials exports to South Korea could backfire
Description: Japan's curbs on exports of high-tech materials to South Korea could backfire in the long run, eroding its dominance over a key link in the global chip supply chain, suppliers and experts say.

Headlines: Toyota won't build cars at UK factory the day after Brexit
Description: Japan's Toyota will not build cars at its British factory the day after Britain leaves the European Union as part of plans to handle any disruption from a potentially disorderly Brexit.

Headlines: United extends Boeing 737 MAX flight cancellations until December 19
Description: United Airlines Holdings said on Friday it is extending the cancellation of Boeing 737 MAX flights by another month until Dec. 19 as the jets remain grounded worldwide following two fatal crashes in Indonesia and Ethiopia in the past year.

Headlines: China, U.S. kick off new round of tariffs in trade war
Description: The United States began imposing 15% tariffs on a variety of Chinese goods on Sunday - including footwear, smart watches and flat-panel televisions - as China began imposing new duties on U.S. crude, the latest escalation in a bruising trade war.

Headlines: China starts to impose additional tariffs on some U.S. goods
Description: China on Sunday started to impose additional tariffs on some of the U.S. goods on a $75-billion target list, with effect from 0401 GMT.

Headlines: Walmart's Mexico unit springs into same-day delivery, taking on Amazon
Description: Walmart Inc's Mexico unit has begun offering delivery within three hours for certain home and tech products ordered online, it said on Monday, taking another step to try to best e-commerce rival Amazon.com Inc at speedy shipping.

Headlines: Sanctions choke Iran's crude sales, but oil product exports booming
Description: While U.S. sanctions on Iran's oil industry have slashed the OPEC member's crude exports by more than 80%, oil product sales from the Islamic Republic remain strong at nearly $500 million a month, shipping data and Reuters calculations show.

Headlines: World Bank tribunal lowers ConocoPhillips award for Venezuela expropriation: document
Description: A World Bank arbitration panel lowered an initial $8.7 billion award to U.S. oil company ConocoPhillips as compensation for Venezuela's 2007 expropriation of its assets to $8.5 billion, according to a decision dated Aug. 29 posted online.

Headlines: China lodges tariff case at WTO against the U.S.
Description: China has lodged a complaint against the United States at the World Trade Organization over U.S. import duties, the Chinese Commerce Ministry said on Monday.

Headlines: Lawyers seek $26 million in Volkswagen U.S. fuel economy settlement
Description: Lawyers for owners of 98,000 Volkswagen AG U.S. vehicles that had fuel economy labels that overstated efficiency will ask a U.S. judge for $26 million in attorney's fees and costs, court documents show.

Headlines: Wall Street pushed down by weak data, trade worries
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Tuesday as investors worried about global growth prospects after data showed U.S. factory activity shrank in August for the first time since 2016 and the United States and China imposed new tariffs on each other over the weekend.

Headlines: Google target of new U.S. antitrust probe by state attorneys general
Description: More than 30 U.S. state attorneys general are readying an investigation into Alphabet Inc's Google for potential antitrust violations, a source knowledgeable about the probe said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Hyundai workers OK smaller bonuses, no strike as Japan dispute weighs
Description: Hyundai Motor Co's unionized workers in South Korea voted on Monday to accept the lowest bonus offered in nearly two decades amid widespread restructuring in the auto industry and a damaging trade dispute with Japan.

Headlines: Marvel superheroes power up Lego's sales
Description: Models of superheroes and villains from Marvel's "Avengers" movies helped lift first-half sales at Lego, as the Danish toymaker continued its turnaround drive with investments in China, India, the internet and new stores.

Headlines: Trump warns China against dragging its feet in trade talks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday warned he would be "tougher" on Beijing in a second term if trade talks dragged on, compounding market fears that ongoing trade disputes between the United States and China could trigger a U.S. recession.

Headlines: Fed's rate-cut debate focuses on 'robust' U.S. consumer
Description: Slowing global economies, the escalating trade war between Washington and Beijing and a warning sign of recession flashing in the U.S. Treasury market have all fed expectations the Federal Reserve is poised to lower rates at the close of its Sept. 17-18 meeting.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit shrinks, gap with China remains elevated
Description: The U.S. trade deficit narrowed slightly in July, but the gap with China, a focus of the Trump administration's "America First" agenda, surged to a six-month high.

Headlines: Wall Street rises on strong Chinese data, Hong Kong and Brexit news
Description: Wall Street's main indexes rebounded on Wednesday, after robust economic data from China, easing tensions in Hong Kong and British lawmakers' approval of a law to delay Brexit provided relief to investors worried about global growth.

Headlines: Trump: U.S. does not want to discuss Huawei with China
Description: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday the United States does not want to discuss the U.S. blacklisting of Huawei Technologies with China as the two biggest world economies try to end escalating trade tensions.

Headlines: Republican, Democratic U.S. lawmakers ask Google to expand copyright protections
Description: A bipartisan group of U.S. lawmakers on Wednesday asked the chief executive of Alphabet's Google to expand its use of technology that prevents copyright infringement to smaller creators who are "at a significant disadvantage."

Headlines: Huawei says U.S. enticing, coercing staff to provide company info
Description: China's Huawei Technologies on Tuesday said the U.S. government had instructed law enforcement to "coerce" and "entice" its employees to turn against the company, as it steps up its pushback against a U.S. campaign that could threaten its survival.

Headlines: Hard Rock International eyes bid for Greek tourist resort casino: paper
Description: Hard Rock International will bid for a casino license in a long-delayed tourist development in Athens and plans to spend more than 1 billion euros ($1.11 billion) on the project, the U.S. firm's chairman said in a newspaper interview.

Headlines: Labor pains: Japanese jobs for South Korean graduates dry up amid trade row
Description: Song Min-su, a Japanese major in his final year at Hannam University, south of Seoul, has watched in dismay as a spat between South Korea and Japan over wartime forced labor has spiraled into a damaging political and economic row.

Headlines: Malaysia defends move to extend licence for rare earth firm Lynas
Description: Malaysia's government said on Wednesday its decision last month to extend a licence for Australia's Lynas Corp for processing rare earth minerals aimed to show investors that the Southeast Asian nation was open for business and preserve 600 jobs.

Headlines: Exclusive: Mexico moves to launch world's largest oil hedge program - sources
Description: Mexico has made the first moves to launch its annual $1 billion oil hedging program by asking banks for quotes, sources familiar with the deal said, while buying in financial oil options contracts for 2020 has risen in recent days, consistent with the giant trade.

Headlines: China says phone call on trade with U.S. Thursday went very well
Description: China's commerce ministry said on Thursday that a phone call on Thursday with U.S. top trade negotiators went very well, adding that Beijing opposes any escalation in the trade war.

Headlines: Timeline: Key dates in the U.S.-China trade war
Description: The United States and China have agreed to meet for senior-level trade talks in Washington in October, raising hopes that world's two largest economies could make progress toward ending a damaging tit-for-tat tariff war that is now in its second year.

Headlines: Fashion brand Zara seeks to distance itself from Hong Kong controversy
Description: Spanish fashion brand Zara, seeking to avoid becoming embroiled in controversy over protests in Hong Kong, issued a statement on Chinese social media expressing support for China's sovereignty over the Asian financial hub.

Headlines: U.S. audit regulator levied only $6.5 million in fines in 16 years: study
Description: A top U.S. accounting watchdog has brought only 18 enforcement actions and levied just $6.5 million in fines against the Big Four accounting firms in its 16-year existence, according to a study published on Thursday.

Headlines: Mexico's government says U.S. duties on structural steel part of normal investigation
Description: Mexico's government said on Wednesday that new duties imposed on some Mexican structural steel by the U.S. Commerce Department are part of a normal investigation when an industry feels it is being affected by imports that use unfair practices, such as dumping or subsidies.

Headlines: U.S. imposes duties on structural steel from China, Mexico
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department said on Wednesday it imposed duties on Chinese and Mexican structural steel after making a preliminary determination that producers in both countries had dumped fabricated structural steel on the U.S. market at prices below fair market value.

Headlines: Trade uncertainty to trim $850 billion global output: Fed paper
Description: Trade policy uncertainty driven by the Trump administration's escalating dispute with China means hundreds of billions of dollars in lost U.S. output and as much as $850 billion lost globally through early next year, research published this week by the Federal Reserve suggests.

Headlines: Farm loan delinquencies surge in U.S. election battleground Wisconsin
Description: Farm loan delinquencies rose to a record high in June at Wisconsin's community banks, data showed on Thursday, a sign President Donald Trump's trade conflicts with China and other countries are hitting farmers hard in a state that could be crucial for his chances of re-election in 2020.

Headlines: U.S., China agree to resume trade talks, markets jump
Description: China and the United States on Thursday agreed to hold high-level talks in early October in Washington, cheering investors hoping for a trade war thaw as new U.S. tariffs on Chinese consumer goods chip away at global growth.

Headlines: Apple says Uighurs targeted in iPhone attack but disputes Google findings
Description: Apple Inc on Friday confirmed that China's Uighurs, a mostly Muslim minority group considered a security threat by Beijing, had been the target of attacks due to iPhone security flaws, but disputed rival Alphabet Inc's description of the effort to track users of the smartphone in real time.

Headlines: U.S. states launch antitrust probes of tech companies, focus on Facebook, Google
Description: Two groups of U.S. state attorneys general on Friday announced separate antitrust probes of large tech companies such as Alphabet's Google and Facebook .

Headlines: Wall St. barely gains after mixed U.S. jobs data
Description: The S&P 500 and Dow industrials closed slightly higher on Friday as investors digested a mixed U.S. jobs report and bet on a Federal Reserve interest rate cut this month, while China's stimulus plan helped ease some concerns around global growth.

Headlines: The S&P 500 inches higher; Treasury yields dip after Powell remarks, jobs report
Description: The S&P 500 posted a nominal gain and Treasury yields edged lower on Friday, as remarks from Federal Reserve chief Jerome Powell firmed interest rate cut expectations and China announced an economic stimulus package, both of which helped offset weaker-than-expected U.S. jobs data.

Headlines: Vuitton to hire more French handbag makers as Chinese sales boom
Description: LVMH's Louis Vuitton brand will hire another 1,500 manufacturing staff in France by 2022, as it expands production to meet strong demand in markets like China.

Headlines: China premier hopes Germany loosens export rules
Description: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang said on Friday that China hopes Germany will accept more Chinese companies and loosen export rule for certain goods.

Headlines: Japan's Nissan mulls pulling out of South Korea as trade tensions rise: FT
Description: Nissan Motor Co is considering pulling out of South Korea, the Financial Times reported on Friday, as political and trade tensions between Japan and South Korea have caused sales of Japanese products in the neighboring country to plummet.

Headlines: August jobs report points to slowing economy, Fed rate cut
Description: U.S. job growth slowed more than expected in August, reflecting the U.S. trade war with China and raising expectations for a Federal Reserve rate cut this month.

Headlines: Novo Nordisk to cut insulin prices in the U.S.
Description: Novo Nordisk will offer cheaper insulin to U.S. diabetics, the Danish drugmaker said on Friday, in response to criticism over the high price of the medication and after similar moves by rivals Sanofi and Eli Lilly.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia flags plan to enrich uranium as U.S. seeks nuclear pact
Description: Saudi Arabia wants to enrich uranium for its nuclear power program, its energy minister said on Monday, potentially complicating talks with Washington on an atomic pact and the role of U.S. companies.

Headlines: Factbox: Big Tech faces growing number of federal, state probes
Description: Several U.S. state attorneys general are set to launch antitrust probes of large technology companies such as Alphabet's Google and Facebook amid concerns that the companies have too much power and are harming users and stifling competition.

Headlines: As China trade war escalates, 2020 U.S. Democrats scramble over their message
Description: The growing economic fallout from President Donald Trumpâ€™s drawn-out trade war with China would appear to be a ready-made opportunity for Democratic presidential contenders seeking to blunt his central 2020 re-election pitch: That he has made the economy great again.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury chief sees positive year for economy as China talks loom
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Monday said he did not see the threat of a recession as the Trump administration seeks to revive trade negotiations with China, adding that he expected a positive year ahead for the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Huawei drops lawsuit against U.S. over seized equipment: court filing
Description: China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd has dropped a lawsuit against the U.S. government after Washington released telecommunications equipment it had seized on suspicion of violations of export controls, according to a court filing on Monday.

Headlines: Wall Street opens lower on global growth fears
Description: U.S. stocks opened lower on Tuesday, as weak economic data from China pointed to slowing growth in the world's second largest economy, adding to fears of a global recession.

Headlines: U.S. firms sour on their future in China as trade war bites: AmCham
Description: The China-U.S. trade war is souring the profit and investment outlook for U.S. companies operating in the world's second-biggest economy, a survey by a prominent American business association showed.

Headlines: Mexico sees diminished threat of U.S. tariffs after effort to curb migration
Description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Wednesday the U.S. threat of tariffs on Mexican goods had lessened, after his top envoy met President Donald Trump and other Washington officials to assess progress on reducing migration.

Headlines: Explainer: Advertising executives point to five ways Google stifles business
Description: U.S. authorities investigating Alphabet Inc's Google for anticompetitive behavior have recently begun probing the company's $116 billion-a-year advertising business.

Headlines: Trump: would consider interim trade deal with China
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump told reporters on Thursday he would consider an interim trade deal with China - a step he said he has seen discussed by analysts - but said he would rather reach a larger agreement on the issues.

Headlines: Time for Pemex to step up to fend off downgrade, deputy finance minister says
Description: After a $5 billion government lifeline to pay off debt, Mexico's struggling state oil company Pemex must now do its part to fend off a threatened credit downgrade by keeping promises to increase production and lowering costs, a top official said.

Headlines: 'Not enough:' Investors react to Pemex bond plan
Description: Mexico's national oil company Pemex will need more than the $5 billion cash capital contribution from the government announced on Wednesday to turn around its fate, investors said, although there was interest in the plan's lengthening of debt maturities.

Headlines: Amid U.S. vaping crackdown, Juul enters China with online store openings
Description: U.S. e-cigarettes maker Juul Labs Inc, which faces a widening crackdown on vaping at home, has entered China, with online storefronts on e-commerce sites owned by Alibaba Group and JD.com to tap the worldâ€™s largest market of smokers.

Headlines: Trump favors 'whole deal' with China, two sides prepare for trade talks
Description: President Donald Trump said on Thursday he preferred a comprehensive trade deal with China but did not rule out the possibility of an interim pact, even as he said an "easy" agreement would not be possible.

Headlines: Mexico's Pemex offers to prepay chunk of $14.7 billion in bonds
Description: Mexico's Pemex said on Thursday it had launched a tender offer to prepay around a third of $14.7 billion in bonds maturing between 2020-2023, in President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador's latest effort to shore up the state oil firm.

Headlines: ECB's Draghi faced pushback from heavyweights on new bond buys: sources
Description: European Central Bank President Mario Draghi faced pushback from the representatives of Germany and France as well as at least one of his own board members on Thursday when he pushed for resuming the ECB's bond-buying program, three sources told Reuters.

Headlines: U.S., China grant trade concessions as fresh talks loom
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday welcomed China's decision to exempt some U.S. anti-cancer drugs and other goods from its tariffs and announced a short delay to scheduled tariff hikes on billions worth of Chinese goods.

Headlines: Nigeria and Iraq pledge to cut output to meet OPEC targets
Description: Iraq's and Nigeria's oil ministers pledged on Thursday to reduce oil output to comply with their OPEC output targets.

Headlines: Trump advisers considering interim China trade deal to delay tariffs: Bloomberg
Description: U.S. trade advisers have discussed offering China a limited trade deal that would delay and even roll back some U.S. tariffs for the first time in return for Chinese commitments on intellectual property and agricultural purchases, Bloomberg reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. readies emergency oil reserves in wake of Saudi attacks
Description: The Trump administration said on Saturday it stood ready to tap U.S. emergency oil reserves if needed after attacks in Saudi Arabia shut more than half the crude output in the world's largest oil exporter.

Headlines: U.S. considers more intel sharing with Saudi Arabia after attack: sources
Description: The United States is considering increasing its intelligence sharing with Saudi Arabia after Saturday's attack on Saudi oil facilities, which halved the kingdom's production and jolted world oil markets, U.S. officials told Reuters.

Headlines: German petrol prices at pumps stable after Aramco attack: industry group
Description: The attacks against oil refineries in Saudi Arabia have so far had no impact on prices at filling stations in Germany, the country's Petroleum Industry Association said on Monday.

Headlines: Factbox: Saudi oil attack puts spotlight on global emergency stockpiles
Description: Governments worldwide may need to follow U.S. President Donald Trump's move to tap emergency oil stockpiles if top exporter Saudi Arabia is unable to quickly repair the damage inflicted by attacks on its energy industry on Saturday.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia shuts pipeline to Bahrain after oil outage: trade sources
Description: Saudi Arabia has shut down its crude oil pipeline to Bahrain after attacks on Saudi oil facilities, two trade sources told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Pompeo told Iraqi PM U.S. information affirms Saudi not attacked from Iraq: Baghdad statement
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo told Iraqi Prime Minister Adel Abdul Mahdi that the United States has information confirming Baghdad's denial that Iraqi territory was used to launch an attack on Saudi oil facilities, Iraq said on Monday.

Headlines: Currency provision won't be in Japan-U.S. trade deal: Aso
Description: Japanese finance minister Taro Aso said on Tuesday that a currency provision won't be included in a Japan-U.S. bilateral trade deal that the two countries are aiming to conclude by the end of this month.

Headlines: Japan seeks to confirm no additional tariffs on auto exports to U.S.: Motegi
Description: Japan plans to reconfirm in the final stage of trade talks with the United States that Washington will not impose additional tariffs on Japanese vehicles and auto parts, Foreign Minister Toshimitsu Motegi said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Attack on Saudi Arabia 'unprecedented': U.S. defense secretary
Description: U.S. Defense Secretary Mark Esper said on Monday the recent attack on Saudi Arabian oil facilities was "unprecedented" and the United States, along with its allies, was working to defend the "international rules-based order that is being undermined by Iran."

Headlines: Evidence indicates Iranian arms used in Saudi attack, Riyadh says
Description: Saudi Arabia said on Monday that the attack on its oil facilities was carried out with Iranian weapons, according to a preliminary investigation, but stopped short of directly blaming regional foe Iran.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers blast Iran, wary of war, after Saudi oil attack
Description: Members of the U.S. Congress blasted Iran after the attack on Saudi Arabian oil facilities, but expressed wariness about U.S. military action, especially before they have a clearer picture of who was behind it.

Headlines: U.S.-China deputy-level trade talks to begin Thursday in DC: USTR
Description: Deputy trade negotiators for the United States and China will meet in Washington beginning on Thursday, a spokesman for the U.S. Trade Representative's office said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump says Iran appears to be culprit for Saudi oil attacks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday that it looked like Iran was responsible for attacks over the weekend on Saudi Arabian oil plants, but he was in no rush to respond and was still trying to find out who was behind the strikes.

Headlines: U.S. Senate leader McConnell wants consequences on Iran for Saudi oil attack
Description: U.S. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell blamed Iran on Monday for the weekend attack on a Saudi Arabian oil facility and called for an international response.

Headlines: Explainer: Details on car tariffs fuzzy as U.S., Japan head for trade deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has said Washington and Tokyo have reached an initial trade deal that he and Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe are expected to sign in New York later this month.

Headlines: Factbox: Britain's insulin providers prepare for Brexit fallout
Description: With Britain sourcing the vast majority of the insulin needed by its 1 million diabetics from overseas, its biggest providers have had to restructure their supply chains in case a chaotic Brexit disrupts the normal arteries of trade.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. reaches trade deals with Japan, no word on cars
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday Washington had struck trade agreements with Tokyo that could be implemented without congressional approval, but stopped short of assuring Japan that new tariffs would not be slapped on vital auto exports.

Headlines: Trump says China trade deal could come before U.S. election, or not
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday his administration could seal a deal on trade with China before the U.S. presidential election, or an agreement could be reached the day after U.S. voters go to the polls.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco attacks: What we know so far
Description: An attack on Saudi Arabia that triggered the biggest jump in oil prices in almost 30 years was carried out with Iranian weapons, a Saudi-led coalition said on Monday, as President Donald Trump said the United States was "locked and loaded" to hit back.

Headlines: U.S. believes attack on Saudi Arabia came from southwest Iran
Description: The United States believes Saturday's attack on Saudi Arabia's oil facilities were launched from Iran, two U.S. officials told Reuters on Tuesday, with one of them saying it originated in Iran's southwest.

Headlines: Pence upbeat that Congress will pass USMCA trade deal this year
Description: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence on Tuesday said he believed Congress would act to pass a new U.S.-Mexico-Canada free trade agreement this year, providing important momentum for the U.S. economy.

Headlines: Chipotle adds steak dish carne asada in rare addition to menu
Description: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc said on Tuesday it would add a new steak dish to its menu nationwide for the first time in three years, as the Mexican food chain looks to drive sales in a crowded U.S restaurant market.

Headlines: U.S. weighing best response to Saudi oil attacks: Pence
Description: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence said on Tuesday the United States was reviewing evidence that suggests Iran was behind the attacks on Saudi oil facilities and stands ready to defend its interests and allies in the Middle East.

Headlines: Macron worried attack on Saudi oil may hurt moves to ease U.S.-Iran crisis: diplomats
Description: An attack on Saudi oil installations that halted half the kingdom's output could harm French diplomacy meant to avert feared U.S.-Iranian conflict, diplomats said after President Emmanuel Macron's top envoy held talks in Saudi Arabia.

Headlines: Mexico to keep fuel prices stable despite Saudi attacks: president
Description: Mexico's government will uphold its pledge to keep fuel prices stable and has gasoline supplies secured despite attacks on Saudi oil sites, President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. believes attack on Saudi Arabia came from southwest Iran
Description: The United States believes Saturday's attack on Saudi Arabia's oil facilities originated in southwestern Iran, a U.S. official told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Juul's sales halted in China days after launch
Description: U.S. e-cigarette maker Juul Labs Inc said on Tuesday its products were not currently available on e-commerce web sites in China, days after it entered the world's single-largest market for tobacco consumption with over 300 million smokers.

Headlines: U.S. seeks U.N. action on Saudi attacks despite likely Russian opposition
Description: A senior U.S. official on Tuesday called for a U.N. Security Council response to the attacks on Saudi oil facilities that the United States blames on Iran, but it was unclear what action he sought or whether Washington might secure Russian cooperation.

Headlines: Saudi oil attacks came from southwest Iran, U.S. official says, raising tensions
Description: The United States believes the attacks that crippled Saudi Arabian oil facilities last weekend originated in southwestern Iran, a U.S. official told Reuters, an assessment that further increases tension in the Middle East.

Headlines: Saudi envoy says Iran was behind attacks on oil facilities
Description: Saudi Arabia's ambassador to London said on Wednesday that Iran was almost certainly behind attacks on Saudi oil facilities.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers urge Trump administration to restore India's trade privileges
Description: Forty-four members of the U.S. Congress have urged President Donald Trump's trade representative to restore trade concessions to India, saying the withdrawal of the privilege had led to retaliatory tariffs from New Delhi which were hurting U.S. industry.

Headlines: Japan defense minister: Not aware of any Iran involvement in Saudi attacks
Description: Japan has not seen any intelligence that shows Iran was involved in the recent attacks on Saudi Arabian oil facilities, Japan's new defense chief said on Wednesday.

Headlines: France sending experts to investigate Saudi oil attack: Elysee
Description: France will send experts to Saudi Arabia to help with investigations into an attack on Saudi oil installations, President Emmanuel Macron's office said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Parts shortage leads GM to lay off 1,200 temporarily in Canada
Description: The strike against General Motors Co's U.S. operations has led to a parts shortage, the automaker said on Wednesday, and as a result it announced the temporary lay-offs of 1,200 workers at its Oshawa assembly plant in Canada.

Headlines: Exclusive: Venezuela opposition eyes U.N. asset protection as option to save Citgo
Description: Venezuela's opposition is preparing to seek an asset protection program from the United Nations to prevent creditors from seizing the country's crown jewel overseas asset, U.S. refiner Citgo, a lawmaker and two opposition sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Trump adviser says U.S. president ready to escalate trade war if no deal agreed soon: SCMP
Description: A trade adviser to Donald Trump has said the U.S. president is ready to escalate the ongoing trade war with China if a trade deal is not agreed soon, the South China Morning Post reported on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. stock exchange competition to heat up in 2020 with new entrants
Description: At least three new U.S. stock exchanges are expected in 2020, executives from the companies said on Thursday, potentially lowering trading costs as the upstarts try to take business from the incumbents, while also adding complexity to the marketplace.

Headlines: India's Eros Now ties up with Microsoft's Azure platform
Description: India's Eros Now said on Thursday it is tying up with Microsoft's Azure cloud platform to host and stream its digital video offerings, in a boost to the U.S. software giant's push to expand in the Indian market.

Headlines: We want to set a price for carbon: German finance minister
Description: Germany plans to introduce a carbon pricing model that will encourage companies to invest in technologies that use less carbon dioxide, German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Thursday.

Headlines: France urges Germany to act on economy sooner rather later
Description: Germany should act sooner rather than later to revive its flagging economy, France's finance minister said on Thursday, as he struggled to hide frustration with the pace of Berlin's efforts to engineer a recovery.

Headlines: Saudi Aramco sees full oil production from attacked sites by end September
Description: Saudi state oil company Aramco said it will bring back by end September full crude output at Abqaiq and Khurais, the two oil facilities damaged by attacks last weekend that U.S. officials have blamed on Iran.

Headlines: Trump: Chinese agricultural purchases not enough, wants a 'complete deal'
Description: President Donald Trump on Friday said he wants a complete trade deal with China and that agricultural purchases from the Asian nation would not go far enough, adding that a comprehensive agreement would take time.

Headlines: Uber awaits renewal decision on vital London license, just five days before expiry
Description: Uber is still waiting to see whether its license in London, which expires on Wednesday, will be renewed as the regulator, which previously stripped the taxi app of its right to operate in the city, remains tight-lipped about the decision.

Headlines: Mitsubishi says Singapore-based oil trader lost $320 million in unauthorized trades
Description: Mitsubishi Corp , Japan's biggest trading house by revenue, said on Friday a trader at its Singapore-based unit has lost $320 million through unauthorized transactions in crude oil derivatives, and the matter has been reported to the police.

Headlines: Trump: U.S. making a lot of progress with China
Description: President Donald Trump told reporters on Friday the United States is making a lot of progress with China, as two of the world's biggest economies work toward resolving their protracted trade dispute.

Headlines: No-deal Brexit would force Japanese investors to reassess 40-year bet on UK
Description: Japanese companies and investors would be forced to reassess their four-decade bet on the United Kingdom if there is a disorderly exit from the European Union that shattered supply chains and cut off access to the bloc, Japan's ambassador said.

Headlines: China agriculture delegation scraps U.S. farm visit to Montana
Description: Chinese agriculture officials who were due to visit U.S. farm states next week have canceled their trip to Montana as the officials will return to China sooner than originally scheduled, the Montana Farm Bureau told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: Explainer: Abe, Trump head for trade deal; auto tariffs a sticking point
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe are expected to clinch a deal on farm tariffs and digital trade when they meet in New York next week.

Headlines: Military strike against Iran would result in 'all-out war': Zarif
Description: Any U.S. or Saudi military strike against Iran would bring "all-out war", Tehran said on Thursday, keeping up a drumbeat of warnings to its adversaries after they accused the Islamic Republic of a strike on Saudi oil facilities.

Headlines: Cloud and clear: Tencent draws on gaming tech to lift B2B cloud ambitions
Description: Tech giant Tencent Holdings Ltd plans to leverage its strengths in video games and social media to grab market share in China's burgeoning cloud computing sector from incumbent Alibaba, the head of its cloud unit told Reuters.

Headlines: China, U.S. had 'constructive' trade talks in Washington: Xinhua
Description: China and the United States had "constructive" discussions on trade in Washington, state news agency Xinhua said on Saturday.

Headlines: SoftBank mulls bringing 40 companies to Brazil
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group Corp is considering bringing around 40 companies with high growth potential to Brazil and expects to announce a large investment in the country in around two weeks' time, the group's head in Brazil, AndrÃ© Maciel, said on Friday.

Headlines: Republican casino magnate Adelson cautioned Trump on trade war with China: WSJ
Description: A top Republican donor warned President Donald Trump in a phone call last month that his escalating trade war with China could hurt his re-election prospects, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the call.

Headlines: SoftBank turns against WeWork's parent CEO Neumann: sources
Description: Japan's SoftBank Group Corp , the biggest investor in WeWork owner The We Company, is exploring ways to replace Adam Neumann as chief executive of the U.S. office-sharing start-up, four people familiar with the matter said on Sunday.

Headlines: Macron: Saudi attacks do not help chances of a Trump-Rouhani meeting
Description: The Sept. 14 attack on Saudi oil facilities have not helped diplomatic efforts to organize talks between U.S. President Donald Trump and his Iranian counterpart Hassan Rouhani, French President Emmanuel Macron told Le Monde newspaper.

Headlines: Japan's Motegi says no concern regarding U.S. threats of additional tariffs on Japan's autos
Description: Japanese Foreign Minister Toshimitsu Motegi said on Monday there should be no concern regarding U.S. threats of additional tariffs on Japan's autos, as the two sides hammer out a trade deal.

Headlines: Trump questions Mnuchin over request Chinese delay U.S. farm trip
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday questioned a decision by his top trade negotiators to ask Chinese officials to delay a planned trip to U.S. farming regions after trade talks last week, saying he wanted China to buy more American farm products.

Headlines: Explainer: What is causing Cuba's acute shortage of fuel?
Description: Long lines of drivers at gas stations in Cuba and hours of wait for public transport are signs of the impact of sanctions imposed by the United States this year on the Caribbean island and its main ally, oil producer Venezuela.

Headlines: Uber receives just a two-month London license with new safety conditions
Description: Uber on Tuesday received only a two-month London operating license, failing to secure a maximum five-year term in a battle with the regulator which has previously stripped the app of its right to take rides.

Headlines: Exclusive: Aviva's Asian units attract interest from global suitors - sources
Description: German insurer Allianz, Nippon Life and MS&AD Insurance are vying with rivals to buy the Singapore and Vietnam businesses of Britain's Aviva in a deal likely to be worth up to $2.5 billion, sources said.

Headlines: China supports enterprises to buy certain amount of U.S. farm products: Xinhua
Description: China will support enterprises to continue to purchase certain amount of U.S. farm products, including soybeans and pork, the Xinhua News Agency reported on Tuesday, citing official sources.

Headlines: Mexico tourism mostly unaffected by Thomas Cook closure: ministry
Description: The collapse of British travel firm Thomas Cook will not have a "significant impact" on Mexico's tourist industry as it only represents about 0.4% of the sector's foreign income, the Mexican tourism ministry said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Trump's China trade rhetoric turns harsh at U.N., says won't take 'bad deal'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump delivered a stinging rebuke to China's trade practices on Tuesday at the United Nations General Assembly, saying he would not accept a "bad deal" in U.S.-China trade negotiations.

Headlines: Stocks fall as Trump impeachment talk grows; sterling up after Brexit ruling
Description: A gauge of global stocks fell for a third day on Tuesday as a push by some Democrats for the impeachment of U.S. President Donald Trump gained momentum, and the British pound strengthened after the UK Supreme Court ruled Prime Minister Boris Johnson's decision to suspend parliament was unlawful.

Headlines: Saudi central bank governor says attack on Aramco had no monetary impact
Description: The Sept. 14 attacks on Saudi Aramco facilities had no monetary impact on Saudi Arabia, the kingdom's central bank governor said in an advance copy of an interview provided by Kuwait's Al Rai newspaper that will be published on Wednesday.

Headlines: Chevron says no arbitration for now over Thai energy dispute
Description: U.S. energy major Chevron Corp has decided to continue negotiations with Thailand rather than seek arbitration to resolve a dispute over who should pay the bill for removing offshore oil and gas platforms, the company told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Investors race into U.S. stock funds with largest weekly surge since June
Description: Investors jumped back into mutual funds and exchange-traded funds that hold U.S. stocks last week by sending approximately $11.8 billion in net assets into the category, the greatest weekly surge into domestic equities since early June, according to data released Wednesday by the Investment Company Institute.

Headlines: Japan's Motegi: No extra U.S. tariffs on Japan cars while trade deal is being implemented
Description: No additional U.S. tariffs will be imposed on Japanese cars as long as a U.S.-Japan trade deal, which was agreed on Wednesday between President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, is being implemented faithfully, Japanese Foreign Minister Toshimitsu Motegi said.

Headlines: Boeing settles first Lion Air lawsuits for at least $1.2 million apiece: sources
Description: Boeing Co has settled the first claims stemming from the crash of a Lion Air 737 MAX in Indonesia, a U.S. plaintiffs' lawyer said, and three other sources said that families of those killed will receive at least $1.2 million apiece.

Headlines: Japan's Abe: Trump agreed not to impose new car tariffs on Japan
Description: Japan's Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said U.S. President Donald Trump agreed on Wednesday not to impose national-security tariffs on Japanese.

Headlines: Trump says trade deal with China could happen sooner than people think
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday a deal to end a nearly 15-month trade war with China could happen sooner than people think and that the Chinese were making big agricultural purchases from the United States, including of beef and pork.

Headlines: Ford close to JV deal with Mahindra in India: sources
Description: Ford Motor Co and Mahindra & Mahindra are likely to sign a deal next week to form a joint venture in India, two sources told Reuters, in a move that will see the U.S. carmaker end most of its independent operations in the country.

Headlines: No tariff fears for Nike after online success
Description: Nike Inc's online sales growth and a bullish outlook in China put it on a firm path for years to come and should help it easily ride out rises in U.S. import tariffs on its Chinese-made sneakers, Wall Street analysts said on Wednesday after a strong set of quarterly results.

Headlines: U.S., Japan sign limited trade deal, leaving autos for future talks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe signed a limited trade deal on Wednesday that cuts tariffs on U.S. farm goods, Japanese machine tools and other products while further staving off the threat of higher U.S. car duties.

Headlines: Its leash lengthened, China's yuan flirts with trade war role
Description: China, having let the yuan cross the once sacred red line of 7 per dollar, will allow its currency to fall further and may even risk U.S. anger by using it as a bargaining chip in already thorny trade talks, market participants believe.

Headlines: Samsung to offer financing to help to boost India smartphone sales
Description: Samsung Electronics is to provide finance to potential smartphone buyers, a company executive said on Thursday, in a bid to boost smartphone sales in India where it faces fierce competition from rivals such as China's Xiaomi.

Headlines: Norway will not ban Huawei from 5G mobile network: minister
Description: Norway does not plan to block China's Huawei Technologies[HWT.UL] from building the country's 5G telecoms network, cabinet minister Nikolai Astrup told Reuters, a decision that puts it at odds with NATO ally the United States.

Headlines: Chevron says no arbitration for now over Thai energy dispute
Description: U.S. energy major Chevron Corp has opted to continue negotiations with Thailand rather than seek arbitration to resolve a dispute over who should pay for removing offshore oil and gas platforms, the company told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. imposes Iran sanctions on China tankers
Description: The Trump administration imposed sanctions this week on Chinese tanker companies for alleged involvement in the transport of oil from Iran, calling it one of the biggest sanctions actions it has taken since its crackdown on Iranian oil exports.

Headlines: Wall Street dips as whistleblower report adds to investor caution
Description: U.S. stocks slipped on Thursday as the release of a whistleblower report tied to the Democrats' impeachment move against President Donald Trump kept uncertainty high, while trade comments from China's top diplomat helped to limit losses.

Headlines: U.S.-China trade negotiations set to resume on October 10: CNBC
Description: Trade talks between the United States and China are set to resume on Oct. 10 in Washington, CNBC reported on Thursday, citing three people close to the talks.

Headlines: U.S. stocks, bond yields slip on report against Trump
Description: U.S. stocks and government debt yields fell on Thursday after the release of a whistleblower complaint that accused President Donald Trump of pressing Ukraine to investigate one of his main political rivals in next year's U.S. presidential election.

Headlines: Scottish council approves $185 million Trump housing plan
Description: A Scottish council has approved a 150 million pound ($185 million) plan by U.S. President Donald Trump's family business to build 550 houses at his golf resort north of Aberdeen, despite some local opposition.

Headlines: Explainer: Advertising execs point to five ways Google stifles business
Description: U.S. authorities investigating Alphabet Inc's Google for anticompetitive behavior have recently begun probing the company's $116 billion-a-year advertising business.

Headlines: Oil, shares fall on potential limit on China investments
Description: Crude oil prices and a gauge of global equity markets fell on Friday after a report said the administration of U.S. President Donald Trump was weighing limits on the flow of U.S. portfolio investments into China.

Headlines: 'Something has to change at ENI', says Italy deputy minister
Description: Italy's deputy industry minister said that "something has to change" at oil and gas group Eni after news emerged that the company's chief executive was under investigation for a conflict-of-interest issue over dealings in the Congo.

Headlines: U.S. eyeing possibility of delisting Chinese firms from U.S. exchanges: source
Description: The U.S. government is considering the possibility of delisting Chinese companies from U.S. exchanges, a source briefed on the matter said, in what would be an escalation of trade tensions between the U.S. and China.

Headlines: Oil shipping rates soar as U.S. supertanker sanctions rattle crude trade
Description: Key oil freight rates from the Middle East to Asia rocketed as much as 28% on Friday in a global oil shipping market spooked by United States sanctions on units of Chinese giant COSCO for alleged involvement in ferrying crude out of Iran.

Headlines: China's top diplomat says Beijing willing to buy more U.S. products
Description: China's top diplomat said on Thursday that China was willing to buy more U.S. products, and said trade talks would yield results if both sides "take more enthusiastic measures" to show goodwill and reduce "pessimistic language" in their trade dispute.

Headlines: U.S. sanctions firm it says provides jet fuel to Russia in Syria
Description: The United States on Thursday imposed sanctions on a firm it said was participating in a scheme to avoid U.S. sanctions while helping provide jet fuel to Russian forces in Syria.

Headlines: U.S.-listed China shares, indexers, fall after delisting reports
Description: Shares of Chinese stocks traded in the United States, along with indexing companies, slumped on Friday after reports the Trump administration was considering delisting Chinese firms from U.S. stock exchanges and limiting U.S. investment in China-based securities.

Headlines: Vape product concerns weigh on Canadian cannabis companies looking for sales boost
Description: A U.S. recommendation that consumers avoid vaping products containing the active ingredient in marijuana ahead of their legalization in Canada next month could be a blow to Canadian cannabis companies' hopes that the higher-margin products will help propel them to profitability.

Headlines: Explainer: What delisting Chinese firms from U.S. stock markets could mean
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's administration is considering forcing Chinese firms to delist from U.S. stock exchanges, according to sources, a move that would escalate U.S.-China tensions and could throw some of China's biggest companies into chaos.

Headlines: On U.S. delisting threat, China says 'decoupling' would harm both sides
Description: China warned on Monday of instability in international markets from any "decoupling" of China and the United States, after sources said the Trump administration was considering delisting Chinese companies from U.S. stock exchanges.

Headlines: PayPal to enter China market through local acquisition
Description: U.S. digital money transfer platform PayPal Holdings Inc has obtained Beijing's approval to buy a controlling stake in a domestic payments firm, which would make PayPal the first foreign firm to enter China's payment services market.

Headlines: Sempra Energy to sell Peruvian businesses to China Yangtze for $3.59 billion
Description: Sempra Energy said on Monday it would sell its Peruvian businesses to a unit of China Yangtze Power Co for $3.59 billion, as part of a planned exit from South America to focus on its core U.S. and Mexican markets.

Headlines: China urges 'calm and rational' resolution to U.S.-Sino trade war
Description: China hopes Beijing and Washington will resolve their trade dispute "with a calm and rational attitude", Vice Commerce Minister Wang Shouwen said on Sunday, ahead of talks in two weeks between the two sides.

Headlines: Big drone on campus: UPS gets U.S. government okay for drone airline
Description: United Parcel Service Inc on Tuesday said it won the U.S. government's first full approval to operate a drone airline, which gave it a lead in the nascent U.S. drone delivery business over rivals Amazon.com Inc and Alphabet Inc.

Headlines: Tesla registers Shanghai construction unit in acceleration of China plans
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc has registered a construction company in China, a business registration filing shows, the latest sign Tesla is pushing ahead with its plans in the world's biggest auto market.

Headlines: Ford ties up with Mahindra in India to cut risks and costs
Description: Ford Motor Co and Mahindra & Mahindra said on Tuesday they would form a joint venture in India, in a move aimed at reducing risks for the U.S. automaker's local business and cutting the cost of developing and producing vehicles for emerging markets.

Headlines: London forex trader sues Citigroup over 'malicious' forex prosecution
Description: A London-based former Citigroup trader is suing the U.S. bank for more than $112 million, alleging it made materially false and malicious statements to U.S. prosecutors that led to his trial in New York on foreign exchange-rigging charges.

Headlines: France ready to hit back if U.S. sanctions EU imports: minister
Description: France is ready to retaliate if the United States goes ahead with trade sanctions on EU imports, its finance minister said on Wednesday after Washington won WTO backing for the measures.

Headlines: Website that allowed Huawei phones to install Google apps taken down
Description: A China-based website that allowed for manual installation of Google's Android apps on Huawei's newly launched Mate 30 devices went offline on Wednesday after a security researcher highlighted the "backdoor" to sidestep a U.S. ban.

Headlines: Trump says Chinese delegation coming to U.S. next week for trade talks
Description: President Donald Trump said on Thursday a delegation from China would come to the United States next week for more trade talks.

Headlines: Scotland says U.S. tariff move shows UK's Brexit pipe dream
Description: The Scottish government said on Thursday that the imposition of U.S. tariffs on various goods including Scottish whisky indicated that the United Kingdom could not offset the damage from Brexit by striking a trade deal with U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Britain disappointed at U.S. tariff plans: PM Johnson spokesman
Description: Britain is disappointed by U.S. government's plans to slap tariffs on European-made Airbus planes and duties on Scotch whiskies, Prime Minister Boris Johnson's spokesman said.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. helps Mastercard, Visa score victory in Indonesia in global lobbying effort
Description: U.S. trade officials, at the request of card networks Mastercard and Visa , convinced Indonesia late last year to loosen rules governing its new domestic payment network, according to Indonesian government and industry sources, and emails reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: Shell promotes Australia head to run global conventional oil, gas unit
Description: Royal Dutch Shell has promoted its current Australia chief, Zoe Yujnovich, to the role of executive vice president for conventional oil and gas from Jan. 1, based in the group's headquarters in The Hague, Shell Australia said on Friday.

Headlines: Trump sees 'very good chance' of China trade deal, says no link to Biden probe request
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that his administration has a "very good chance" of making a trade deal with China, and insisted there were no links between China talks and his desire for Beijing to investigate Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden.

Headlines: U.S. Chamber of Commerce, other business groups oppose Trump on 'Dreamers'
Description: The U.S. Chamber of Commerce, other business groups and companies including Amazon.com Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google have filed a brief at the U.S. Supreme Court opposing President Donald Trump's effort to end a program that protects from deportation hundreds of thousands of immigrants who were brought into the United States illegally as children.

Headlines: Spain says it will respond with strength to new U.S. tariffs
Description: Spain has summoned the U.S. ambassador in Madrid to express its complete rejection of any new U.S. tariffs on European Union goods and will press for strong counter measures if they are confirmed, the acting government said on Friday.

Headlines: Spain's Sanchez says he will defend food sector against 'unacceptable' U.S. tariffs
Description: Spain's acting prime minister Pedro Sanchez said on Saturday he would seek to defend the country's agricultural sector in the face of "unacceptable" proposed U.S. tariffs on European agricultural goods.

Headlines: White House adviser sees possible progress in U.S.-China trade talks
Description: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow on Monday said it was possible U.S. and Chinese trade negotiators could make progress when they meet in Washington this week, and said Washington was open to looking at what proposals Beijing brought.

Headlines: Trump to sign trade agreements with Japan on Monday: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will sign two trade agreements with Japan later on Monday, the White House said in a statement.

Headlines: Japan says it will sign trade agreement with U.S. in Washington today
Description: Japanese Foreign Minister Toshimitsu Motegi said Japan and the United States will sign a trade agreement on Monday in Washington, and that Tokyo aimed to bring it into force as soon as possible.

Headlines: Take Five: Vanity Fair
Description: Washington's latest accusation that China is dumping wooden cabinets and vanities on U.S. shores sums up the mood between the two warring sides as they head into another round of high-level discussions.

Headlines: Trump: There's a chance of something 'substantial' in China trade talks
Description: President Donald Trump on Monday sounded an optimistic note about this week's negotiations with China to end the trade war between the two global economic super powers, adding that he would not be satisfied with a partial deal.

Headlines: U.S.-Japan trade deal versus TPP: where it falls short, where it exceeds
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday called his new trade deal with Japan "a game changer for our farmers and our

Headlines: Netflix to make movies in Italy with Berlusconi's Mediaset
Description: U.S. streaming service Netflix has struck a deal with Italy's top commercial broadcaster Mediaset to produce films in the country, the two companies said on Tuesday, as they try to grab new viewers in a competitive market.

Headlines: China urges U.S. to remove sanctions on Chinese firms
Description: China strongly urges the U.S. to remove sanctions on Chinese firms and will take any necessary measures to firmly protect its own interests, China's commerce ministry said in a statement late on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. senators call for probe of Brazilian meatpacker JBS
Description: Two U.S. senators called on the U.S. Treasury on Tuesday to open an investigation into the world's largest meat processing company, Brazil's JBS S.A. , due to alleged ties with the Venezuelan government of leftist President Nicolas Maduro.

Headlines: U.S. visa move against China casts pall over talks to end trade war
Description: The United States on Tuesday imposed visa restrictions on Chinese officials for the detention or abuse of Muslim minorities, angering Beijing, but a U.S. official said high-level trade talks would still take place on Thursday and Friday as planned.

Headlines: Russia to keep U.S. investor Calvey under house arrest until January: TASS
Description: A court in Moscow ruled on Tuesday that U.S. investor Michael Calvey should remain under house arrest facing charges of embezzlement until January 13, the TASS news agency reported.

Headlines: Shoemaker Vans treads warily as China fumes over Hong Kong protests
Description: U.S. sports brand Vans has removed "a small number" of submissions in a sneaker design competition including one apparently giving a shout out to Hong Kong's pro-democracy protests, as companies weigh the risks of angering China.

Headlines: China Vice Premier Liu will travel to U.S. for trade talks on October 10-11
Description: Chinese Vice Premier Liu He and top trade negotiator will be traveling to Washington for the next round of trade talks with the United States on Oct.10-11, China's commerce ministry said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Trump economic adviser says delisting Chinese firms 'not on the table'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump's chief economic adviser on Monday said the administration had begun studying U.S. investor protections in China, but that delisting Chinese companies traded on U.S. exchanges "is not on the table."

Headlines: U.S.-China strains over Hong Kong and minority rights hinder chance of trade deal
Description: Prospects for progress in U.S.-China trade talks dimmed on Monday after Washington blacklisted Chinese companies over Beijing's treatment of predominantly Muslim ethnic minorities, and President Donald Trump said a quick trade deal was unlikely.

Headlines: China, asked about U.S. blacklisting of Chinese firms, says will protect its sovereign security
Description: China's foreign ministry said on Tuesday that China will continue to take firm and resolute measures to protect its sovereign security, when asked about the U.S. blacklisting of Chinese firms.

Headlines: Netflix CEO says plans to open offices, pay tax in Italy
Description: Netflix Inc plans to open offices and start paying tax in Italy, Reed Hastings, chief executive of the U.S. video streaming service said on Tuesday after launching a production partnership agreement with Mediaset .

Headlines: China's Hikvision resolutely opposes U.S. blacklisting: state media
Description: Chinese state media said on Tuesday video surveillance firm Hikvision resolutely opposes the U.S. move to blacklist the firm, saying the decision has no basis in fact. The U.S. Commerce Department on Monday placed 28 Chinese public security bureaus and companies - including Hikvision - on a U.S. trade blacklist over Beijing's treatment of Uighur Muslims and other minorities.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. adds eight Chinese firms to trade blacklist
Description: The U.S. government expanded its trade blacklist on Monday to include some of China's top artificial intelligence (AI) startups over Beijing's treatment of Muslim minorities.

Headlines: U.S. expands blacklist to include China's top AI startups ahead of trade talks
Description: The U.S. government widened its trade blacklist to include some of China's top artificial intelligence startups, punishing Beijing for its treatment of Muslim minorities and ratcheting up tensions ahead of high-level trade talks in Washington this week.

Headlines: U.S.-China made no progress in deputy-level trade talks: South China Morning Post
Description: The United States and China made no progress in deputy-level trade talks held on Monday and Tuesday in Washington, the South China Morning Post (SCMP) said, citing unnamed sources with knowledge of the meetings.

Headlines: Trump says there is a 'really good chance' of U.S.-China trade deal
Description: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday there was a very good chance that the United States and China will reach a trade agreement.

Headlines: Oil steady as attack in Syria supports but U.S. crude stocks weigh
Description: Oil futures were mixed on Wednesday as a Turkey-launched offensive in Syria and hopes of progress in ending the U.S.-China trade war supported oil, but a build in U.S. crude inventories held prices back.

Headlines: Wearable device Fitbit to shift production out of China from January
Description: Fitbit Inc will manufacture all its trackers and smart watches outside China from January, the wearable device maker said on Wednesday, the latest U.S. company looking to insulate itself from tariffs.

Headlines: Halliburton cutting 650 jobs in U.S. as oilfield business slows
Description: U.S. oilfield services firm Halliburton on Wednesday said it was cutting 650 jobs across Colorado, Wyoming, New Mexico and North Dakota amid slowing oil and gas activity.

Headlines: AT&T to sell certain assets in Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands for $1.95 billion
Description: AT&T Inc said on Wednesday it would sell its wireless and wireline operations in Puerto Rico and U.S. Virgin Islands to Liberty Latin America Ltd for $1.95 billion, as the second-largest U.S. wireless carrier cuts its huge debt pile.

Headlines: China plans to restrict visas for U.S. visitors with 'anti-China' links
Description: China is planning tighter visa restrictions for U.S. nationals with ties to anti-China groups, people with knowledge of the proposed curbs said, following similar U.S. restrictions on Chinese nationals, as relations between the countries sour.

Headlines: Pompeo says China's treatment of Muslims 'enormous human rights violation'
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Wednesday that China's treatment of Muslims, including the Uighurs, in western China was an "enormous human rights violation" and Washington will continue to raise the issue.

Headlines: WeWork to open new co-working sites in Singapore and Manila
Description: Office-sharing startup WeWork will open new locations in Singapore and the Philippines this year, it said, even as it seeks a $1 billion lifeline from its biggest-backer Softbank Group Corp for a major restructuring.

Headlines: U.S. to issue licenses for supply of non-sensitive goods to Huawei: NYT
Description: The United States will soon issue licenses allowing some U.S. companies to supply non-sensitive goods to China's Huawei, the New York Times reported, as high-level officials from the two countries meet this week to resume trade talks.

Headlines: China lowers expectations for U.S. trade talks after blacklist: officials
