Headlines: China will increase imports from U.S. according to 'market principles': official
Description: China will negotiate with American companies and increase imports of U.S. goods and products according to market principles, an official with its state planner said on Sunday.

Headlines: EU industry chief dismisses fears strict security rules could delay 5G
Description: European industrial policy chief Thierry Breton dismissed claims that relying on European companies to build a 5G network would delay its rollout, weighing in on an increasingly tense debate in Germany over the risk posed by China's Huawei.

Headlines: Tesla moves a step closer to opening first European factory with German property deal
Description: U.S. electric car pioneer Tesla has agreed to buy a property on the outskirts of Berlin, bringing it a step closer to opening its first European factory, local authorities said on Sunday.

Headlines: Global FDI dips, hit by Hong Kong divestment, Brexit: U.N.
Description: Global direct foreign investment (FDI) dipped slightly around the world last year, hit by massive divestment in Hong Kong and a drop in flows into Britain due to Brexit uncertainty, the United Nations said on Monday.

Headlines: A thousand EU financial firms plan to open UK offices after Brexit
Description: More than a thousand banks, asset managers, payments companies and insurers in the European Union plan to open offices in post-Brexit Britain so they can continue serving UK clients, regulatory consultancy Bovill said on Monday.

Headlines: China repeats call on Canada to release Huawei CFO Meng
Description: China repeated its call on Monday for Canada to release detained Huawei Technologies Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou as soon as possible, ahead of the executive's first extradition hearing later in the day.

Headlines: Wall Street falls as China virus reaches the U.S.
Description: Wall Street lost ground on Tuesday, backing away from record highs as a viral outbreak from China found its way to U.S. shores and the International Monetary Fund (IMF) lowered its global economic growth forecast.

Headlines: Oil market shrugs off Libya crisis amid ample global supply
Description: Oil prices fell on Tuesday on expectations that a well-supplied global market, including supplies from record U.S. production, would be able to absorb disruptions that have cut Libya's crude production to a trickle.

Headlines: Huawei CFO's lawyer attacks U.S. extradition case in Canadian trial
Description: A lawyer for Huawei Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou argued on Monday that "double criminality" was at the center of a trial to decide whether she can be extradited to the United States, a case that has strained relations between Ottawa and Beijing.

Headlines: Uber cuts losses from Eats business in India with sale to Zomato
Description: Uber has sold its loss-making online food-ordering business in India to local rival Zomato in exchange for a 9.99% stake in the startup backed by China's Ant Financial.

Headlines: China virus scare sends shudder through European luxury goods sector
Description: European luxury stocks slumped across the board on Tuesday on fears that the coronavirus virus outbreak in China could hurt sales of high-end brands that had managed to weather months of protests in Hong Kong.

Headlines: KFC apologizes for 'sexist' Australian ad
Description: KFC on Tuesday apologized for an advertisement in Australia that shows two boys ogling a woman's breasts, after calls from a local campaign group to boycott the fast-food giant over the ad it called "sexist".

Headlines: Aramco IPO proceeds to fund Saudi industry, including defense: finance minister
Description: Saudi Arabia will pump the proceeds from last month's listing of oil giant Saudi Aramco into the local economy over several years, including building up the domestic defense industry amid tensions with Iran, its finance minister said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Trump to break bread with Apple's Cook and other CEOs: sources
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will attend a breakfast meeting on Wednesday with Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook and other business leaders on the sidelines of the annual meeting of the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, according to sources familiar with the situation.

Headlines: Angola's dos Santos named suspect over alleged fraud, selling Eurobic stake
Description: Angola's billionaire former first daughter, Isabel dos Santos, has decided to sell her stake in Portuguese bank Eurobic, the small lender said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Oil slides 2% as glut forecast, China virus overshadow Libya disruption
Description: Oil prices fell more than 2% on Wednesday as a market surplus forecast by the International Energy Agency (IEA) and demand worries amid the outbreak of a virus in China outweighed concern over disruptions to Libya's crude output.

Headlines: U.S. economy to coast, no big boost expected from trade deal: Reuters poll
Description: The initial trade deal between Washington and Beijing is unlikely to provide a significant boost to the U.S. economy and will only reduce the downside risk or at best help activity moderately, a Reuters poll showed.

Headlines: Lab-grown meat producer Memphis Meats raises $161 million in funding led by SoftBank
Description: Lab-grown meat producer Memphis Meats said on Wednesday it raised $161 million in a funding round led by Japan's SoftBank Group , Singapore's wealth fund Temasek Holdings and Norwest Venture Partners.

Headlines: Hainan Airlines to halt Prague flights from March: Czech authorities
Description: China's Hainan Airlines will halt regular direct flights between Beijing and Prague starting in March, the Prague Airport and the Czech Foreign Ministry said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. regulator to review recommendation on Fiat Chrysler's Jeep complaint against Mahindra
Description: A U.S. regulator said it will review part of a recommendation made last fall that India's Mahindra and Mahindra Ltd infringed upon the intellectual property rights of Fiat Chrysler Automobiles' Jeep SUV design.

Headlines: Oil falls 2% as specter of China virus threatens fuel demand
Description: Oil prices fell 2% on Thursday on concern that the spread of a virus from China could lower fuel demand if it stunts economic growth, but losses were limited by a drawdown in U.S. crude inventories.

Headlines: Mexico goes ghost as its oil hedge bill spirals
Description: Mexico is playing a risky game of hide and seek with the oil market.

Headlines: Exclusive: Malaysia to buy more Indian sugar to resolve palm oil spat - sources
Description: Malaysia's top sugar refiner said it will increase purchases of the commodity from India, which according to two sources is part of efforts to placate New Delhi amid an ongoing spat over palm oil imports.

Headlines: United States cautions Britain over Huawei
Description: The United States cautioned Britain ahead of a decision by Prime Minister Boris Johnson on what role Huawei will have in 5G telecommunications networks that Washington still had significant concerns about the Chinese telecoms behemoth.

Headlines: CITIC Capital bidding for 22% McDonald's China stake: chief
Description: Chinese private equity firm CITIC Capital is actively bidding for a 22% stake in McDonald's Corp's mainland China and Hong Kong businesses, its chairman and chief executive told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Waymo to test autonomous trucks, vans in Texas and New Mexico
Description: Waymo, the self-driving unit of Alphabet Inc , said on Thursday it will start testing autonomous trucks and vans in Texas and New Mexico this week.

Headlines: Tesla's German factory gets off to an explosive start
Description: Seven U.S. bombs from World War Two have been found in the plot of land outside Berlin where electric car pioneer Tesla wants to build its first European factory, local authorities said on Thursday.

Headlines: New U.S. curb on Huawei in limbo amid pushback from Pentagon: sources
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department has withdrawn a rule aimed at further reducing sales to China's Huawei Technologies amid concerns from the Defense Department the move would harm U.S. businesses, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Trump speaks with British PM Johnson about telecoms security: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday discussed the security of telecommunications networks with British Prime Minister Boris Johnson, the White House said, as Britain nears a decision on Huawei's role in the country's future 5G network.

Headlines: U.S. Treasury Secretary Mnuchin expects next China trade talks in 'near future'
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday that he expects to begin negotiations with China on a so-called Phase 2 trade deal soon, with Washington and Beijing on the same page.

Headlines: Ericsson hit by higher 5G costs and weaker U.S. market
Description: Sweden's Ericsson warned it faced higher costs this year as it rolls out new 5G networks and was also hit by a temporary slowdown in its U.S. market, sending its shares 7% lower on Friday. After a number of lean years, Ericsson has been boosted by the roll-out of 5G, particularly in the United States, and analysts hope it can benefit from a U.S. campaign to shut out Chinese rival Huawei [HWT.UL] from supplying 5G equipment.

Headlines: Lebanon and Japan have 40 days to agree on Ghosn's fate: sources
Description: Lebanon and Japan have about 40 days to decide whether ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn will be extradited to Japan or stand trial in Lebanon, a judicial source and a source close to Ghosn said on Thursday, following his escape from Japan last month.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. pushing India to buy $5-6 billion more farm goods to seal trade deal - sources
Description: The United States wants India to buy at least another $5-6 billion worth of American farm goods if New Delhi wants to win reinstatement of a key U.S. trade concession and seal a wider pact, four sources familiar with the talks told Reuters.

Headlines: Bombardier scrambles to craft rail merger with Alstom, Hitachi: sources
Description: Bombardier has approached France's Alstom and Japan's Hitachi to find a merger partner for its rail business as it struggles to contain costs that have eaten into margins, sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Four-comma club: Predicting the next company to join trillion-dollar value elite
Description: The trillion-dollar market cap club expanded last week to a third U.S. company, with Google parent Alphabet Inc topping the lofty valuation mark. Adding the next member, however, is likely to take a while.

Headlines: Boeing weighing new 787 Dreamliner production cut: sources
Description: Boeing Co is weighing another production cut of its 787 Dreamliner, but may not have to take that step depending on the size and timing of orders from China stemming from a recent U.S. trade agreement, people briefed on the matter said Friday.

Headlines: Dollar dips vs yen as investors reach for safe havens on virus scare
Description: The U.S. dollar slipped against the safe-haven Japanese yen on Friday as investors fretted over concerns that a spreading virus from China would curb travel and hurt economic demand.

Headlines: China virus fears spook U.S. shares, oil prices
Description: U.S. shares and crude prices fell sharply on Friday as investors moved into safe-haven assets amid concerns that a spreading virus from China would curb travel and hurt economic demand.

Headlines: U.S. state AGs, Justice Department officials to meet and coordinate on Google probe: sources
Description: U.S. state attorneys general will meet Justice Department attorneys next week to share information on their investigations into Alphabet Inc's Google, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Sunday. The probes revolve around monopolistic behavior that may harm consumers through Google's control of online advertising markets and search traffic.

Headlines: Mexico's America Movil fined by regulator; calls it 'illegal and disproportionate'
Description: America Movil, the telecoms giant controlled by the family of Mexican billionaire Carlos Slim, said on Monday that one of its subsidiaries had been fined 1.3 billion pesos ($69.53 million) by Mexico's telecoms regulator.

Headlines: Wall Street tumbles as virus fuels economic worry
Description: U.S. stocks suffered their worst day in over three months on Monday as China extended the Lunar New Year holiday due to a virus outbreak, fueling worries about the economic impact of containment efforts in the world's second largest economy.

Headlines: UK's Johnson tells Trump on Huawei that collaboration is needed to diversify market
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson told President Trump on Tuesday that countries should work together to break the dominance of a small number of companies after Britain granted Chinese firm Huawei [HWT.UL] a limited role in its 5G mobile network.

Headlines: Trump, Britain's Johnson discussed 'telecommunications' after Huawei decision: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Britain's Prime Minister Boris Johnson "discussed critical regional and bilateral issues, including telecommunications security" in a conversation on Tuesday, White House spokesman Judd Deere said in a statement.

Headlines: United Airlines suspends some U.S. flights to China as demand drops over virus fears
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc said on Tuesday it was suspending some flights between the United States and Beijing, Hong Kong and Shanghai between Feb. 1 and Feb. 8 due to a "significant decline in demand" as the new coronavirus spreads.

Headlines: 'Flash crash' trader sentenced to time served plus a year of home confinement: lawyers
Description: A Chicago-based U.S. federal district court judge on Tuesday sentenced Navinder Sarao, a London-based trader accused of contributing to Wall Street's 2010 "flash crash", to time already served in jail of four months, with a year of home confinement, Sarao's attorneys said in a statement.

Headlines: Starbucks sees hit as coronavirus prompts over 2,000 China store closures
Description: Starbucks Corp on Tuesday became the first major U.S. company to warn of a financial hit from the new coronavirus outbreak in China, as it closed thousands of restaurants and adjusted operating hours in its biggest growth market.

Headlines: 3M forecasts 2020 profit below estimates on weak China demand
Description: U.S. industrial giant 3M Co forecast 2020 profit below expectations after narrowly missing quarterly revenue estimates on Tuesday as weak demand from China dents overall growth.

Headlines: Apple sparks Wall Street bounce ahead of results
Description: U.S. stocks rebounded on Tuesday, as the S&P 500 bounced back from its worst day in nearly four months, led by a climb in Apple and other names hit by exposure concerns to the coronavirus outbreak in China that sparked a recent sell-off.

Headlines: Google temporarily shutting down all China offices
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Wednesday it is temporarily shutting down all its offices in China due to the outbreak of a new coronavirus in the country.

Headlines: Canada panel urges taxes and domestic content rules for Netflix, other U.S. firms
Description: Ottawa should require U.S. tech companies such as Netflix , Amazon and Facebook to collect the same taxes as Canadian companies and also be subject to the same requirements for supporting domestically produced content, a Canadian government-mandated panel recommended on Wednesday.

Headlines: Ford to resume production at China joint venture with Changan on February 10
Description: Ford Motor plans to resume production on Feb. 10 at its manufacturing facilities in China with joint venture partner Chongqing Changan Automobile , a spokesman for the U.S. automaker said on Wednesday.

Headlines: How the North American trade deal will affect autos, digital trade, drugs
Description: The U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade agreement (USMCA) signed by President Donald Trump on Wednesday modernizes the 26-year-old North American Free Trade Agreement, which has been blamed for hollowing out the U.S. manufacturing sector.

Headlines: EU deals another blow to U.S., allowing members to decide on Huawei's 5G role
Description: The EU followed Britain's example on Wednesday, allowing members to decide what part China's Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL] can play in its 5G telecoms networks and resisting pressure from Washington for an outright ban.

Headlines: Factbox: Huawei's involvement in telecoms networks around the world
Description: European Union countries can either restrict or exclude high-risk 5G vendors from core parts of their telecoms networks, according to new EU guidelines announced on Wednesday, a move targeting China's Huawei Technologies but falling short of a U.S. call for a complete ban.

Headlines: China flexes oil refining muscle, upping pain for Asian rivals
Description: China is set to further expand its massive oil refining capacity this year, offering support to global oil prices, and U.S. producers in particular, but its plans spell more gloom for Asia's hard-hit refining industry.

Headlines: UK's Huawei decision will not affect intelligence-sharing: PM's spokesman
Description: Britain's decision to allow China's Huawei to have a role in its 5G networks does not affect the country's ability to securely share intelligence data, Prime Minister Boris Johnson's spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Wall Street reverses course to end higher after WHO comments
Description: U.S. stocks rebounded late to close higher on Thursday after the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the China coronavirus a global emergency, while earnings painted a mixed picture.

Headlines: Exclusive: New tensions surface over U.S.-Mexico seasonal farm trade
Description: Fresh battle lines are being drawn that could lead to farm trade restrictions between the United States and Mexico, a letter from a top Mexican trade official seen by Reuters shows, despite the goodwill generated by the newly signed North American trade pact.

Headlines: Chevron asks staff to postpone all non-essential travel to China
Description: U.S. oil major Chevron Corp said on Thursday it has asked its employees to postpone all "non-essential" business travel to China in the aftermath of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Paris shops feel the pinch as virus keeps Chinese tourists away
Description: For some shopkeepers in Paris, home to prestigious stores where Chinese tourists love to splurge, an abrupt drop-off in visitors as China tries to contain a fast-spreading coronavirus health crisis is hitting hard.

Headlines: U.S. LNG producers fear more price drops as they await China buys under Phase 1 deal
Description: China has restarted talks with U.S. liquefied natural gas marketers to buy more LNG, several industry executives told Reuters, but they are worried that any purchases may come too late to keep natural gas prices from falling further due to a glut of global supply.

Headlines: Japan issues arrest warrants for ex-U.S. soldier, two others for Ghosn escape
Description: Japanese authorities on Thursday issued arrest warrants for a former U.S. special forces soldier and two other men on suspicion of smuggling former Nissan Motor Co boss Carlos Ghosn out of Japan.

Headlines: Iraq's Basra airport to deny entry to travellers from China and Chinese citizens over coronavirus - state news agency
Description: Iraq's Basra International Airport will deny entry to passengers of any nationality travelling to Iraq from China, the state news agency reported on Friday amid fears from the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: U.S. State Department organizing more flights for Americans to return from Wuhan: official
Description: The U.S. State Department is working with U.S. and Chinese agencies to organize additional flights for U.S. citizens to return to the United States from Wuhan, the epicenter of China's coronavirus outbreak, a State Department official said on Friday.

Headlines: Paraguay restricts travelers from China amid virus outbreak
Description: Landlocked Paraguay said on Friday that it had suspended indefinitely issuance of visas to people traveling from China because of the coronavirus outbreak centered in the city of Wuhan, Hubei province.

Headlines: U.S. declares coronavirus a public health emergency
Description: The Trump administration on Friday declared a public health emergency over the coronavirus outbreak and said it would take the extraordinary step of barring entry to the United States of foreign nationals who have traveled to China.

Headlines: Major U.S. airlines cancel China flights as government steps up warnings
Description: All three major U.S. airlines announced the cancellation of flights to mainland China on Friday as the U.S. government unveiled additional steps to curb the spread of the coronavirus, which originated in China.

Headlines: Japan Airlines: 25% of reservations for China flights canceled in past 10 days
Description: Japan's second-biggest carrier, Japan Airlines Co, has seen 25% of reservations for China flights canceled in the past 10 days, an executive said on Friday, amid growing concerns over the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: France's Orange chooses Nokia and Ericsson to deploy its 5G network at home
Description: Orange , France's biggest telecoms company, said it had chosen Nokia and Ericsson to deploy its 5G network in mainland France, as China's Huawei Technologies faces intense political scrutiny in Europe.

Headlines: U.S. could face difficulties sanctioning Danske over money-laundering: report
Description: U.S. authorities could face difficulties fining Danske Bank over its involvement in suspected money-laundering in Estonia, according to a report by S&P Global Market Intelligence.

Headlines: Westpac hit with class-action suit in U.S. linked to money-laundering case
Description: Australia's No. 2 lender Westpac Banking Corp said on Saturday a class-action lawsuit, naming former Chief Executive Brian Hartzer and interim CEO Peter King as defendants, has been filed in a U.S. court on behalf of its shareholders.

Headlines: Iran suspends all flights to and from China due to coronavirus
Description: Iran has suspended all flights to China because of the coronavirus outbreak, Iran's semi-official Tasnim news agency reported on Friday, adding that all flights from China to the Islamic Republic have also been banned.

Headlines: U.S. declares coronavirus health emergency, bars foreign nationals who visited China
Description: WASHINGTON Reuters) - The Trump administration, while insisting the risk to Americans from coronavirus is low, nevertheless declared a public health emergency on Friday and announced the extraordinary step of barring entry to the United States of foreign nationals who have recently visited China.

Headlines: Malaysia regulator to probe if AirAsia broke rules in Airbus deals
Description: Malaysia's securities regulator said on Sunday it will examine whether AirAsia Group and unit AirAsia X broke securities laws, after UK prosecutors accused executives of receiving bribes from Airbus for buying planes.

Headlines: Huawei, ZTE urge U.S. not to impose national security risk labels
Description: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd and ZTE Corp on Monday both asked the U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) not to finalize its designation of the China tech giants as risks to U.S. national security.

Headlines: U.S. class actions pile up against Australia's Westpac amid money-laundering scandal
Description: Australia's No.2 lender Westpac Banking Corp was hit with another U.S. class-action lawsuit in less than a week on Monday, over issues with its financial crime monitoring amid a recent money laundering scandal.

Headlines: Wall Street rebounds from virus fears, helped by factory strength and tech stocks
Description: U.S. stocks rallied on Monday, boosted by heavyweight technology shares and on surprise strength in U.S. manufacturing activity, following a sharp selloff last week on concerns about the economic impact from the fast-spreading coronavirus out of China.

Headlines: Stocks rally as China markets reopen, dollar gains
Description: The dollar strengthened and a gauge of global stocks jumped on Monday, lifted by an unexpected rebound in U.S. manufacturing that helped temper fears that caused stocks overnight in Asia to plunge on the potential impact of the coronavirus in China.

Headlines: Virus fears wipe $393 billion off China's stock market despite government support moves
Description: Investors erased $393 billion from China's benchmark stock index on Monday, sold the yuan and dumped commodities as fears about the spreading coronavirus and its economic impact drove selling on the first day of trade in China since the Lunar New Year.

Headlines: ConocoPhillips' outlook weighed down by coronavirus, disruptions in Malaysia, Libya
Description: ConocoPhillips issued a muted annual outlook on Tuesday, expecting a hit from weaker oil demand growth due to the coronavirus outbreak and disruptions at its operations in Malaysia and Libya.

Headlines: Hyundai to halt South Korea output as China virus disrupts parts supply
Description: Hyundai Motor will suspend production in South Korea because the coronavirus outbreak has disrupted the supply of parts, it said, becoming the first major carmaker to do so outside of China.

Headlines: Bombardier in talks to sell business-jet unit to Textron: WSJ
Description: Canada's Bombardier Inc is in talks to sell its business-jet unit to U.S. maker of Cessna jets, Textron Inc, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Shale pioneer John Hess says key U.S. fields starting to plateau
Description: Shale pioneer John Hess said on Tuesday that key U.S. shale fields are starting to plateau, calling shale "important but not the next Saudi Arabia."

Headlines: Australia's wine exports could take a hit from coronavirus: industry body
Description: Australia's wine export growth slowed last year and could take another hit in 2020 from the coronavirus outbreak if China, its biggest market, orders fewer crates, a report by an industry body said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Indonesia says to stop livestock imports from China
Description: Indonesia said on Tuesday its plan to temporarily stop some imports from China over coronavirus concerns would only apply to shipments of live animals, and not all food and beverage products, a senior minister said.

Headlines: S&P 500, Nasdaq mint record highs after strong U.S. data, waning virus fears
Description: The benchmark S&P 500 posted a record closing high on Wednesday as U.S. stocks rallied for a third straight day on encouraging U.S. economic data and waning fears of the financial fallout from the corona virus in China.

Headlines: Foxconn sees full China production resuming late-February: source
Description: Taiwan's Foxconn aims to gradually restart operations at factories in China next week but it could take one to two weeks from then to resume full production due to the coronavirus outbreak, a person with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Headlines: U.S. trade deficit narrows in 2019 for first time in six years
Description: The U.S. trade deficit fell for the first time in six years in 2019 as the White House's trade war with China curbed the import bill, keeping the economy on a moderate growth path despite a slowdown in consumer spending and weak business investment.

Headlines: American Revolut-ion: European banking apps face crowded U.S. market
Description: When London-based Revolut opens its virtual doors in America this year, it will be the latest European digital bank to challenge incumbent U.S. lending giants after forays by Monzo and N26, but the challenges it faces have not diminished.

Headlines: U.S. to review new curbs on Huawei, China in Feb. meeting: sources
Description: The Trump administration plans to meet this month to discuss further curbing technology exports to China and its flagship telecoms company Huawei, two sources said, in a bid to resolve differences within the government over the possible crackdown.

Headlines: Intel bets on smart buildings in Israel to attract tech talent
Description: Intel Corp is investing heavily in "smart buildings" in Israel that will be full of perks to keep employees happy, helping the U.S. chipmaker compete for the country's top professionals.

Headlines: Argentina's 'little trees' blossom as forex controls fuel black market
Description: On the streets of Buenos Aires, money changers known as "arbolitos" or "little trees" are taking advantage of Argentina's capital controls to take a slice of a booming black market trade in U.S. dollars.

Headlines: How Chinese tariffs on U.S. imports will stand after February 14 cuts
Description: China is preparing to halve the extra tariffs on U.S goods that went into effect last September, including on crude oil, soybeans, pork and beef.

Headlines: Exclusive: Prudential eyes full control of China venture, considers U.S. options
Description: Prudential is in talks that could lead to it taking full control of its 50:50 joint venture with China's CITIC and is considering selling some or all of its U.S. business to sharpen its focus on Asia, a source told Reuters.

Headlines: Volvo Cars posts rise in fourth-quarter profit, helped by cost cuts and sales growth
Description: Sweden's Volvo Car Group, owned by China's Geely, reported an 18% rise in fourth-quarter operating profit as cost cuts and growing sales more than offset the impact of subdued global auto markets.

Headlines: Toyota to make more pickup trucks at Mexican plant in shift from U.S.
Description: Toyota Motor Corp will ramp up production at its new Mexican plant to 100,000 vehicles a year by 2021 in a major step to shift production of its popular mid-size Tacoma pickup truck to Mexico from the United States, the company said on Thursday.

Headlines: Wall St. reaches new highs as China moves to limit coronavirus impact
Description: U.S. stocks gained for a fourth straight session on Thursday and Wall Street's main indexes hit record highs as concerns eased over the economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak in China.

Headlines: China to halve tariffs on some U.S. imports as coronavirus risks grow
Description: China on Thursday said it would halve additional tariffs levied against 1,717 U.S. goods last year, following the signing of a Phase 1 deal that defused a bruising trade war between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: Stocks rally, safe-haven currencies drop, on China plan to cut tariffs
Description: World equity markets rallied for a fourth day on Thursday, with key stock indexes touching fresh peaks, as news that China plans to cut tariffs in half on some U.S. goods buoyed risk sentiment and pushed safe-haven currencies lower.

Headlines: Huawei sues Verizon over patents; Verizon blasts 'PR stunt'
Description: China's biggest telecommunications equipment maker will square off in court against the No. 1 U.S. wireless carrier over whether Verizon Communications Inc should pay Huawei Technologies Co Ltd for patent infringement.

Headlines: Trump, Xi reaffirm backing for Phase 1 of U.S.-China trade deal
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump expressed confidence in China's strength and resilience in confronting its coronavirus outbreak during a conversation with President Xi Jinping on Thursday, a White House spokesman said.

Headlines: White House adviser says UK's 5G actions won't hinder trade deal
Description: Britain's decision to grant China-based Huawei Technologies a limited role in its 5G network despite U.S. concerns will not hinder efforts to reach a U.S.-UK trade deal, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Friday.

Headlines: Take Five: China's virus paralysis
Description: The coronavirus continues to claim lives, yet the impact on global demand and companies is just starting to be felt. Recent days have seen an unremitting flow of dire headlines as supply chains from New Zealand to the United States felt the impact of a paralyzed China.

Headlines: White House sees minimal impact on U.S. economy from China's coronavirus
Description: The White House's economic adviser on Friday said that President Donald Trump's administration does not expect the coronavirus in China will have a major effect on the U.S. economy.

Headlines: White House dismisses idea of U.S. buying Nokia, Ericsson to challenge Huawei
Description: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence on Friday and the top White House economic adviser dismissed an unusual suggestion from U.S. Attorney General William Barr that the United States consider taking control of two major foreign rivals of China-based Huawei Technologies Co Ltd.

Headlines: Lockheed Martin drops out of Singapore Airshow over coronavirus concerns
Description: U.S. weapons maker Lockheed Martin Corp said on Friday it will not participate in next week's Singapore Airshow over coronavirus concerns.

Headlines: White House adviser: Xi told Trump that China will meet trade targets despite virus
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping told U.S. President Donald Trump that China would still meet its Phase 1 trade deal purchasing targets despite delays linked to the coronavirus, White House adviser Larry Kudlow told Bloomberg Television on Friday.

Headlines: Suzuki considers China supply options, third-quarter profit falls 11%
Description: Suzuki Motor Corp said on Friday it was considering sourcing vehicle components from outside China, as the spread of a new coronavirus in the country threatens to disrupt vehicle production in its biggest market, India.

Headlines: Burberry says coronavirus hurting luxury demand
Description: Burberry said the outbreak of the coronavirus was hitting luxury demand in China and Hong Kong, both important markets for the British fashion brand, sending its shares lower for a second day in a row.

Headlines: Sweden says U.S. interest in Ericsson logical for 5G capability
Description: U.S. interest in Ericsson is logical given that it is one of only a few companies offering a complete portfolio for the rollout of super-fast 5G mobile telecoms networks, Sweden's Minister for Energy and Digital Development said on Friday.

Headlines: Majority of U.S. firms in China see revenue hit from coronavirus: AmCham survey
Description: The majority of U.S. firms with operations in China expect a virus outbreak to cut revenue this year, and some are accelerating plans to shift their supply chains out of the country, according to a poll by Shanghai's American Chamber of Commerce.

Headlines: Shanghai to help Tesla resume production amid coronavirus spread
Description: U.S. electric carmaker Tesla's factory in China's financial hub of Shanghai will resume production on Feb. 10 with assistance to help it cope with a spreading epidemic of coronavirus, a Shanghai government official said on Saturday.

Headlines: Wall Street futures fall as coronavirus toll rises, China plans return to work
Description: U.S. stock futures fell on Sunday after China's death toll from the coronavirus outbreak exceeded the global total from the SARS epidemic and as authorities prepared for millions of people to return to work after an extended Lunar New Year break.

Headlines: Anti-Huawei UK lawmakers conducting 'witch-hunt': Chinese ambassador
Description: Senior members of Prime Minister Boris Johnson's Conservatives who have demanded Chinese telecoms giant Huawei must not have a role in Britain's 5G mobile network are conducting "a kind of witch-hunt", China's ambassador to London said on Sunday.

Headlines: Climate activists invade BlackRock office in Paris
Description: Dozens of climate activists invaded U.S. asset manager BlackRock's office in central Paris on Monday, calling for the fund to pull out of fossil fuel investments.

Headlines: Walmart's Mexico unit posts 2.7% rise in January same-store sales
Description: Walmart de Mexico, the country's biggest retailer, said on Monday that sales at stores in Mexico open for more than a year rose 2.7% in January, compared with the same month last year.

Headlines: Amazon wants Trump to testify on â€˜order to screw Amazonâ€™ in Pentagon deal
Description: Amazon Web Services said on Monday it was seeking to depose President Donald Trump and Defense Secretary Mark Esper in its lawsuit over whether the president was trying "to screw Amazon" when the Pentagon awarded a contract for cloud computing to rival Microsoft Corp.

Headlines: Merkel's conservatives stop short of Huawei 5G ban in Germany
Description: Lawmakers from German Chancellor Angela Merkel's ruling conservatives have backed a position paper on 5G mobile networks that recommends tougher rules on foreign vendors while stopping short of banning China's Huawei [HWT.UL], sources said.

Headlines: German conservative lawmakers back compromise on 5G: sources
Description: Lawmakers from German Chancellor Angela Merkel's ruling conservatives have backed a position paper on 5G mobile networks that recommends tougher rules on foreign vendors while stopping short of banning China's Huawei, sources said.

Headlines: SoftBank stock surges to seven-month high after judge OKs Sprint-T-Mobile merger
Description: SoftBank Group Corp stock surged to its highest price in over half a year in Tokyo on Wednesday, after a U.S. federal judge rejected an antitrust challenge to the proposed takeover of subsidiary Sprint Corp by T-Mobile US Inc .

Headlines: Virus fears, China diplomacy loom over Singapore Airshow
Description: Singapore kicked off Asia's largest aerospace event under heightened scrutiny on Tuesday as thousands of visitors shunned the Singapore Airshow over coronavirus fears, while all eyes were on a sensitive fly-off between U.S. and Chinese fighters.

Headlines: Geely to deepen ties with Volvo, plans to list under one umbrella
Description: Geely Automobile and its sister company Volvo Cars are planning to merge and list in Hong Kong and possibly Stockholm, giving Volvo access to public markets after it dropped a move to list its stock two years ago.

Headlines: Fed's Powell says economy in good place, warns on coronavirus
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell told Congress on Tuesday that the U.S. economy is in a good place, even as he cited the potential threat from the coronavirus in China and concerns about the economy's long-term health.

Headlines: Stocks surge to record highs on hopes virus is peaking, gold ebbs
Description: Major U.S. and European stock indexes surged to fresh records on Tuesday after China's senior medical adviser suggested the deadly coronavirus may be over by April, an outlook that also helped crude prices gain on hopes of renewed Chinese demand.

Headlines: U.S. lawmaker calls for ouster of CalPERS CIO over China ties: letter
Description: A U.S. Republican lawmaker on Wednesday urged California to fire the chief investment officer of its public pension fund, the nation's largest, citing what he called the CIO's "long and cozy" relationship with Beijing, and assailed the fund's investments in Chinese companies.

Headlines: Interest in private jets surges as coronavirus keeps airlines away from China
Description: A drop in airline flights from China and Hong Kong due to the coronavirus is increasing demand for private jets as wealthy passengers try to get out, executives say, but travel bans and nervous crew have kept that from translating to more business.

Headlines: Fed Chair Powell: 'no reason' rising wages, job gains can't continue
Description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Wednesday reiterated his confidence in the U.S. economic outlook, even as he said he expected some drag "soon" from China's new coronavirus epidemic and called out the threat from income inequality and an expanding federal debt.

Headlines: Mexico's America Movil to focus on bringing 5G to Latin America
Description: America Movil, Mexico's largest telecommunications provider, shed light on its plans to roll out 5G technology in Latin America on Wednesday as the company's shares surged on a strong earnings report.

Headlines: Stocks gain as China says fewer new coronavirus cases
Description: Global equity markets scaled fresh highs on Wednesday after China reported the lowest number of new coronavirus cases in two weeks, boosting hopes the epidemic will be contained and driving up the price of commodities sensitive to Chinese demand.

Headlines: Walmart's Mexico unit blames government cash aid, as revenue rise slowest in three quarters
Description: Walmart de Mexico , Mexico's biggest retailer, reported on Thursday its slowest revenue growth in three quarters, with its core supermarket chain hit by competition after the government altered a welfare spending programme.

Headlines: Judge grants Amazon motion for pause in Microsoft's Pentagon contract work
Description: A U.S. judge on Thursday granted Amazon.com Inc's request to temporarily halt the U.S. Department of Defense and Microsoft Corp from moving forward on an up-to-$10 billion cloud computing deal that Amazon says reflected undue influence by President Donald Trump.

Headlines: White House stands by Fed nominee after contentious Senate hearing
Description: The White House expects President Donald Trump's two nominees for the Federal Reserve Board, Judy Shelton and Christopher Waller, to win Senate confirmation, a spokesman said on Thursday, disputing a report that Shelton's nomination would be pulled.

Headlines: U.S. gives Huawei another 45 days to buy from American suppliers
Description: The Trump administration said Thursday it was issuing a 45-day extension allowing U.S. companies to continue doing some business with Chinaâ€™s Huawei Technologies Co Ltd.

Headlines: American Airlines selects Seattle for first direct U.S. flight to Bangalore
Description: American Airlines Group Inc said on Thursday it would launch its first direct U.S. flight to Bangalore from Seattle, a new route meant to meet corporate customers' demand for travel to the center of India's high-tech industry.

Headlines: Jump in coronavirus cases halts stock rally; dollar gains
Description: The dollar rose and global equity markets slumped on Thursday after a new methodology that boosted the coronavirus death toll in China unnerved investors, curbing a rally that had lifted U.S. and European stocks to a series of record peaks.

Headlines: Exclusive: Venezuela's PDVSA to unload $57 million oil cargo disputed by rival Citgo boards
Description: Venezuela's state-run oil company PDVSA this week plans to discharge nearly 1 million barrels of crude stranded for over a year at sea over U.S. sanctions against the company and an ownership dispute with its refining unit, Citgo Petroleum, according to internal documents viewed by Reuters.

Headlines: Injured by China's trade practices? Call 202-395-3900, USTR says
Description: The U.S. Trade Representative's office said on Friday it has established a dispute resolution office and complaint hotline to enforce President Donald Trump's "Phase 1" trade deal with China, which takes effect on Saturday.

Headlines: U.S. raises tariffs on European aircraft in ongoing dispute over subsidies
Description: The U.S. government on Friday said it would increase tariffs on aircraft imported from the European Union to 15% from 10%, ratcheting up pressure on Brussels in a nearly 16-year transatlantic dispute over aircraft subsidies.

Headlines: China urges U.S. to stop suppressing Chinese companies after Huawei indictment
Description: China's foreign ministry said on Friday it urges the United States to immediately stop suppressing Chinese companies without reason, after U.S. prosecutors unveiled a new indictment against Huawei Technologies.

Headlines: Volkswagen to shut coal-fired power stations at main factory to cut CO2
Description: Volkswagen is shutting down two coal-fired power stations at its main plant in Wolfsburg, Germany and has declined offers to sell them to cut down the company's carbon dioxide emissions, Chief Executive Herbert Diess said on Friday.

Headlines: Euro zone GDP slows as expected in fourth-quarter, but employment beats consensus
Description: Euro zone economic growth slowed as expected in the last three months of 2019 as gross domestic product shrank in France and Italy against the previous quarter, but employment growth picked up more than expected, official estimates showed on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. accuses Huawei of stealing trade secrets, assisting Iran
Description: U.S. prosecutors on Thursday accused Huawei of stealing trade secrets and helping Iran track protesters in its latest indictment against the Chinese company, escalating the U.S. battle with the world's largest telecommunications equipment maker.

Headlines: Lebanon's MEA reverses move to charge in dollars
Description: Lebanon's state-owned carrier Middle East Airlines (MEA) reversed a decision to accept payment only in U.S. dollars after a backlash on Sunday, Lebanese media and an MEA source said.

Headlines: U.S. weighs blocking GE engine sales for China's new airplane: sources
Description: The U.S. government is considering whether to stop General Electric Co from continuing to supply engines for a new Chinese passenger jet, according to people familiar with the matter, casting uncertainty over China's efforts to enter the civil aviation market.

Headlines: Great Wall says to buy GM's Thailand car plant
Description: China's Great Wall Motor said on Monday it had signed a binding agreement to purchase a car plant from General Motors in Thailand.

Headlines: Euro zone ministers discuss fiscal boost options as virus worries weigh
Description: Euro zone finance ministers discussed ways to pursue a more growth-friendly fiscal policy mix on Monday, in a potential nudge to Germany and the Netherlands to spend more as fears of a downturn grow in the wake of the coronavirus epidemic.

Headlines: Alstom to buy Bombardier rail unit for up to $6.7 billion
Description: France's Alstom SA has agreed to buy the rail division of Canada's Bombardier Inc for up to 6.2 billion euros ($6.7 billion) to create the world's No. 2 train manufacturer and better take on Chinese leader CRRC Corp.

Headlines: GM shuts Australia, NZ operations; sells Thai plant to Great Wall
Description: General Motors Co said it would wind down its Australian and New Zealand operations and sell a Thai plant in the latest restructuring of its global business, costing the U.S. auto maker $1.1 billion.

Headlines: U.S. firms in China report staff shortages, say coronavirus hitting global operations: AmCham
Description: Nearly half of the U.S. companies in China say their global operations are already seeing an impact from business shutdowns due to the coronavirus epidemic, according to a poll by Shanghai's American Chamber of Commerce (AmCham).

Headlines: Japan on brink of recession as economy contracts, virus heightens risk
Description: Japan's economy shrank at the fastest pace in almost six years in the December quarter as a sales tax hike hit consumer and business spending, raising the risk of a recession as China's coronavirus outbreak chills global activity.

Headlines: U.S. mulls cutting Huawei off from global chip suppliers, with TSMC in crosshairs
Description: The Trump administration is considering changing U.S. regulations to allow it to block shipments of chips to Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL] from companies such as Taiwan's TSMC , the world's largest contract chipmaker, two sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Huawei accuses U.S. of overlooking HSBC misconduct to go after Chinese firm
Description: U.S. prosecutors overlooked apparent violations of U.S. sanctions against Iran by HSBC Holdings in exchange for the British bank's cooperation with a government investigation of Huawei Technologies, lawyers for the Chinese telecoms giant said.

Headlines: Trump blasts proposed U.S. restrictions on sale of jet parts to China
Description: President Donald Trump objected on Tuesday to U.S. proposals that would prevent companies from supplying jet engines and other components to China's aviation industry and suggested he had instructed his administration not to implement them.

Headlines: Samsung poised to benefit from China virus woes afflicting Apple, other rivals
Description: Samsung Electronics stands to be a major beneficiary of the China production problems announced by rival Apple Inc on Monday, reaping the rewards of a decade-long bet on low-cost smartphone manufacturing in Vietnam.

Headlines: Oil near flat; virus impact offsets Libya supply disruptions
Description: Oil prices were near flat on Tuesday, pressured by concerns over the impact on crude demand from the coronavirus outbreak in China, but prices drew support from a reduction in supply from Libya.

Headlines: China to grant tariff exemptions on 696 U.S. goods to support purchases
Description: China will grant exemptions on retaliatory duties imposed against 696 U.S. goods, the most substantial tariff relief to be offered so far, as Beijing seeks to fulfill commitments made in its interim trade deal with the United States.

Headlines: Stocks scale fresh peaks on slowing virus, dollar gains
Description: The dollar gained while several U.S. and European equity indexes scaled fresh peaks on Wednesday after China reported another decline in new coronavirus cases and on expectations of Chinese stimulus to counter a slowdown in growth.

Headlines: U.S. meeting on Huawei, China policy still on for Thursday despite Trump tweets: sources
Description: A meeting of U.S. government officials to discuss further curbs on exports to Huawei and China is still on for Thursday, two sources said, despite pushback from President Donald Trump against the restrictions.

Headlines: Microsoft to invest $1.1 billion in Mexico over next five years: CEO
Description: Microsoft Chief Executive Satya Nadella said the technology giant will invest $1.1 billion in Mexico over the next five years, according to a promotional video released by the Mexican government on Thursday.

Headlines: Oil prices rise as U.S. crude stocks build less than expected
Description: Oil prices were up slightly on Thursday after the U.S. government reported a much smaller-than-anticipated rise in crude stocks, but gains were capped by worries about the spread of Coronavirus outside China.

Headlines: Wall St. eases, led by tech decline on mounting fears coronavirus could spread
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Thursday, led by declines in technology heavyweights, after reports of new coronavirus cases in China and other countries intensified fears over its spread and impact on the global economy.

Headlines: New Mexico AG sues Google for collecting school kids' personal data
Description: New Mexico Attorney General Hector Balderas on Thursday sued Alphabet Inc's Google search engine, alleging that its educational software collects young students' personal information without the required parental consent.

Headlines: Uber returns to Colombia less than a month after exit
Description: Uber Technologies Inc resumed transporting passengers in Colombia on Thursday with a new service model that allows users to rent cars with drivers, just 20 days after it exited the Andean country following a ruling by regulators which the company described as arbitrary.

Headlines: China says to exempt extra tariffs on 65 U.S. goods from Feb. 28
Description: Chinaâ€™s finance ministry said it will begin exempting 65 U.S. goods from retaliatory tariffs implemented amid the bilateral trade dispute with the United States for one year starting Feb. 28.

Headlines: Outbreak will not change China's commitments to buy U.S. goods: senior U.S. official
Description: The U.S. government expects China to honor its commitments to buy more U.S. goods under a trade deal signed by the world's two largest economies in January despite the fast-spreading coronavirus outbreak, a senior U.S. official said on Thursday.

Headlines: France ready to hear U.S. proposal on digital tax
Description: France is ready to listen to the U.S. administration's proposal of offering U.S. companies a "safe harbor" from a new, international digital tax, its finance minister said on Saturday, while admitting that he still didn't know what that meant in practice.

Headlines: Shifting sands of inflation unsettle top bankers at Riyadh G20 meeting
Description: Central bankers from the United States, Japan and the euro zone meeting in the desert kingdom of Saudi Arabia this weekend had their own shifting sands to cross â€“ those of elusive inflation.

Headlines: Japan criticizes U.S. digital tax proposal at G20
Description: Japanese finance minister Taro Aso criticized on Sunday a U.S. tax reform proposal that he said could undermine global efforts to agree new rules on taxing big tech companies.

Headlines: Fed's Mester sees U.S. economy performing well, coronavirus a 'big risk'
Description: The U.S. economy should continue to perform well this year and monetary policy is currently well positioned despite the risk posed by the coronavirus outbreak, Cleveland Fed President Loretta Mester said on Monday, as Wall Street stocks tumbled on worries the spread of the virus to multiple countries outside China could pose an escalating threat to global growth.

Headlines: China's Didi to launch Japan food delivery service from April
Description: China's ride hailing company Didi Chuxing plans to launch a food delivery service in Japan from April, the firm, backed by SoftBank Group Corp , said on Tuesday, as it seeks to grow its overseas business.

Headlines: U.S. still eyeing ways to curb sales to Huawei after Trump's chipmaker comments: sources
Description: U.S. government officials are still considering ways to further curb sales to China's Huawei Technologies [HWT.UL], despite President Donald Trump's tweets and comments last week in support of sales to China, according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: German industrial sectors see supply shortage over virus: BDI
Description: Several sectors of Germany's manufacturing sector are expecting a shortness of supplies from the Far East region in the coming weeks due to the outbreak of the coronavirus in China, business association BDI said on Monday.

Headlines: Trump administration in talks about Chevron's operations in Venezuela: envoy
Description: The Trump administration is in discussions about whether to renew a license for Chevron Corp's operations in Venezuela as Washington looks to increase pressure on its socialist leader, the U.S. special envoy to the South American country said.

Headlines: U.S. trade rep Lighthizer to meet British counterpart as allies gear up for talks
Description: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer will meet with Britain's trade minister Liz Truss this week, British government officials said on Tuesday, as the two allies gear up for post-Brexit trade talks that could prove contentious.

Headlines: Japan's ANA orders 15 more Boeing 787 Dreamliners worth $5 billion at list prices
Description: Japan's ANA Holdings Inc will buy 15 Boeing Co 787 Dreamliners worth $5 billion at list prices, it said, the first commercial order announcement for the U.S. planemaker this year as it wrestles with the grounding of the smaller 737 MAX.

Headlines: HSBC targets the globally mobile with $1.4 trillion wealth business
Description: HSBC plans to invest heavily in its newly combined retail and private banking business as it targets internationally minded customers in markets such as China, the United States and Singapore, the unit's Chief Executive Charlie Nunn told Reuters.

Headlines: Panasonic to exit solar production at Tesla's New York plant as partnership frays
Description: Panasonic Corp said it would exit solar cell production at Tesla Inc's New York plant, the latest sign of strain in a partnership where Panasonic's status as the U.S. electric vehicle (EV) maker's exclusive battery supplier is ending.

Headlines: Trump, Modi hope talks lead to phase one of U.S.-India trade deal: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi have agreed to "promptly" conclude ongoing trade talks that they hope can lead to the first phase of a bilateral U.S.-India trade deal, the White House said.

Headlines: Jury weighs verdict for ex-Barclays bankers in Qatar fee trial
Description: The jury in the London trial of three former Barclays bankers accused of funneling secret fees to Qatar in return for emergency funding during the financial crisis in 2008, retired to consider its verdict on Wednesday.

Headlines: Delta Air waives travel change fees for South Korea as coronavirus spreads
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc said on Wednesday it has expanded its travel change fee waiver to include Seoul, South Korea, through April 30, as coronavirus spreads to regions outside China.

Headlines: Delta cutting flights to South Korea; JetBlue waives U.S. change fees
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc said on Wednesday it would temporarily cut flights to and from South Korea in half, citing global health concerns related to the coronavirus outbreak as U.S. airlines grapple with lagging travel demand.

Headlines: Investors ditch market risk as stocks fall into correction
Description: Fears of a sustained global economic impact as the coronavirus rapidly spreads beyond China have sent investors scrambling to find safety less than 10 days after the U.S. stock market set record highs.

Headlines: Europe looking for positive signal from U.S. on trade: EU lawmaker
Description: The European Union hopes to de-escalate trade tensions with the United States but wants Washington to lower steel tariffs or make another goodwill gesture after a series of concessions by Brussels in recent years, a top EU lawmaker said Thursday.

Headlines: Japan's January factory output beats forecasts but slowdown expected
Description: Japan's factory output rose more than expected in January, providing some relief for policymakers amid heightened risks of a recession as the coronavirus outbreak in China disrupts supply chains and business activity.

Headlines: Texas prosecutors accuse Arkema, executives of failures over chemical fire
Description: Jurors in the criminal case against the U.S. arm of a French company on Thursday heard it routinely stored combustible chemicals where floodwaters could reach them and failed to alert emergency workers as toxic fires erupted.

Headlines: Factbox: U.S. business forecasts earnings pressure as coronavirus spreads
Description: As the coronavirus epidemic spreads in China and beyond, U.S. companies will see profits stagnate in 2020, according to a Goldman Sachs report.

Headlines: StanChart posts strong results but coronavirus, economic headwinds to hamper profit growth
Description: Standard Chartered booked a robust 46% jump in annual profit but warned a key earnings target would take longer to meet as the coronavirus epidemic adds to headwinds in its main markets of China and Hong Kong.

Headlines: Vivendi files appeal against Milan court OK to Mediaset revamp
Description: France's Vivendi has filed an appeal against a decision by a Milan judge to clear the way for a planned reorganization at Mediaset , Italy's biggest commercial broadcaster said on Thursday.

Headlines: Factbox: Barclays bosses cleared of credit crisis-era fraud
Description: Three former Barclays executives were cleared of credit-crisis era fraud charges by a jury on Friday after a landmark London trial over undisclosed payments to Qatar in 2008.

Headlines: USTR vows to push for trade deals with Britain, EU; seeks reforms at WTO
Description: The Trump administration on Friday said it would focus on concluding new trade agreements with Britain, the European Union and Kenya over the coming year, while strictly enforcing trade laws and pushing for reforms of the World Trade Organization.

Headlines: U.S. moves high-level U.S. meeting on China tech, possible new Huawei curbs to March: sources
Description: Trump administration officials have rescheduled for March 11 a critical meeting to discuss potential new U.S. restrictions on sales of technology to Huawei and China, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: United Airlines sharply cuts flights to Asia, cancels investor day
Description: United Airlines Holdings Inc said on Friday it was sharply cutting flights to Japan and South Korea, as travelers worried about the coronavirus outbreak slash ticket purchases for those destinations.

Headlines: Japan minister flying to Lebanon to make case for Ghosn's return
Description: Japan's deputy justice minister is traveling to Lebanon this weekend to try to make the case that fugitive ex-Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn should stand trial in Japan.

Headlines: Kenya's high court orders suspension of flights from China over coronavirus
Description: Kenya's High Court on Friday ordered flights from China to be temporarily suspended over the coronavirus outbreak, following a petition by the Law Society of Kenya.

Headlines: Trafigura forms venture with Phillips 66 for deepwater Texas oil port
Description: Global commodities trader Trafigura said on Friday it had formed a joint venture with U.S. refiner Phillips 66 to build a major deepwater port in Texas capable of handling supertankers, ditching its own competing project.

Headlines: American Airlines suspending flights to Milan after U.S. travel warning
Description: American Airlines Inc will suspend all U.S. flights to Milan, the airline said late on Saturday, just hours after the U.S. State Department said it was raising its travel warning for parts of Italy due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Citgo, Aruba reach deal to transfer control of refinery to island government
Description: U.S. refiner Citgo has reached an agreement with Aruba to transfer control of the San Nicolas refinery to the island's government, Citgo said late on Saturday, after the two parties last year suspended a contract to overhaul the facility.

Headlines: Banco BPM sets up new 'disaster recovery rooms' in Italy's virus emergency: sources
Description: Italy's Banco BPM is rushing to set up new "disaster recovery rooms" after an area close to one of its existing crisis facilities emerged as the epicenter of the coronavirus outbreak, three sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Japanese minister tells Lebanon Ghosn should stand trial in Japan
Description: Fugitive ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn should stand trial in Japan, a Japanese government minister told the Lebanese government during a visit to Beirut on Monday, adding that Beirut had agreed to cooperate but without saying how.

Headlines: Nike temporarily closes European HQ in the Netherlands due to coronavirus case
Description: U.S. sportswear giant Nike said on Monday its European headquarters in the Netherlands would be closed until Wednesday after an employee was infected with the new coronavirus.

Headlines: Exclusive: SoftBank-backed CloudMinds blocked from exporting U.S. tech to China
Description: SoftBank-backed startup CloudMinds has been blocked from sharing U.S.-origin technology with its China business, documents showed, illustrating how increased U.S. government restrictions are creating new headaches for tech firms and their investors.

Headlines: Fed's Mester sees possible economic impact from coronavirus outbreak
Description: The coronavirus outbreak has muddied the outlook for the U.S. economy and could weigh on growth in the first half of this year, Cleveland Federal Reserve Bank President Loretta Mester said in London on Tuesday.

Headlines: Algeria energy minister says OPEC+ countries to discuss 'substantial' oil output cuts
Description: Algeria energy minister and OPEC president said on Tuesday OPEC+ countries will discuss new "substantial" oil production cuts at their meetings in Vienna this week, Algerian state news agency APS reported.

Headlines: OPEC and allies to consider significant oil output cuts as coronavirus hits demand
Description: OPEC and its allies will consider making substantial oil production cuts to lift prices that have been battered by the coronavirus outbreak, Algeria's oil minister said on Tuesday, as ministers began arriving for talks in Vienna this week.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers seek to step up pressure on UK to reverse Huawei 5G decision
Description: Members of the U.S. Congress on Wednesday took another step to try to prod Britain to reverse its decision to allow China's Huawei Technologies Co to build portions of the UK's next generation 5G networks.

Headlines: Exclusive: Mexican private sector pitches $92 billion in energy investment - document
Description: Mexico's private sector has drawn up a broad package of proposed energy investments for the government worth almost $92 billion, according to a document seen by Reuters on Wednesday, providing a potential lift to the country's misfiring economy.

Headlines: How an ill-timed bet on a U.S. oil refinery cost ICBCS millions
Description: A team of ICBC Standard bankers celebrated in London last June after closing its first major U.S. refinery deal and gaining a foothold in the biggest energy market in the world.

Headlines: Kroger's quarterly profit, sales top estimates on private-label strength
Description: U.S. supermarket chain Kroger Co topped fourth-quarter profit and sales estimates on Thursday, boosted by strong demand for its high-margin private-label brands, sending its shares up as much as 7.2%.

Headlines: AT&T partners with Google Cloud for 5G edge computing
Description: AT&T Inc has partnered with Alphabet Inc's Google Cloud to use 5G edge computing technologies to help clients improve speed and increase security by running applications closer to end users.

Headlines: Top French court deals blow to Uber by giving driver 'employee' status
Description: France's top court has recognized the right of an Uber driver to be considered an employee, a ruling that could upend the U.S. firm's business model and potentially require it to pay more taxes and benefits such as paid holidays.

Headlines: India plans to airlift components from China to help local tech industry: sources
Description: India is planning to backstop its growing electronics sector by arranging to airlift components from China, three government officials said, as it tries to contain the fallout from the coronavirus crisis in China.

Headlines: South Korea, Japan to hold export control talks via teleconference, Jiji says
Description: South Korea and Japan will hold export control talks originally planned for March 10 in Seoul via teleconference, the Jiji news agency reported on Friday, reflecting the widening impact of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Stocks tumble as coronavirus cases rise rapidly outside China
Description: Global equity markets tumbled and the dollar slid on Thursday as the coronavirus spread quickly outside China, leading Britain to prepare for a significant increase in cases and France to say it appeared "inevitable" the outbreak would become an epidemic in the country.

Headlines: Canada's tourism industry 'deeply affected' by virus outbreak: minister
Description: The outbreak of the new coronavirus is hammering Canada's tourism industry, a senior government official said on Friday, as the number of visitors from China plummeted and after the cancellation of a major technology convention.

Headlines: In Canada, doctors broadened coronavirus testing, and made an unlikely save
Description: Canada's official guidance on the novel coronavirus has been to test patients who recently traveled to affected areas, but some doctors and hospitals have expanded testing on their own, finding the first in a series of patients linked to Iran before the scale of the Iranian outbreak was known.

Headlines: Coronavirus impact is overwhelming, Spain's hotels association says
Description: Hotel bookings have fallen by as much as 40% in some areas of Spain, the country's hotel federation said and flagged an overwhelming impact for the eurozone's fourth largest economy as anxiety about the coronavirus outbreak takes hold.

Headlines: Facebook closes London offices until Monday due to coronavirus
Description: Facebook said on Friday it is closing its London offices until Monday after a visiting employee from Singapore was diagnosed with coronavirus.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. discussing non-renewal of Chevron's Venezuela waiver, moves to cut oil trade - sources
Description: The U.S. government is preparing to impose new measures as soon as next week to stifle Venezuela's oil exports, including a move not to renew Chevron Corp's license to do business with state-run company PDVSA, sources familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Austria introducing 'spot' health checks at Italian border
Description: Austria is introducing "spot" health checks at its border with Italy for two weeks as of next week in response to the coronavirus outbreak, in which Italy is the hardest-hit country in Europe, Chancellor Sebastian Kurz said on Friday.

Headlines: Iran's oil minister expects very difficult OPEC, non-OPEC meeting: Shana
Description: Iran's oil minister expects a "very difficult" meeting in Vienna on Friday between OPEC and oil exporting countries that are not part of the group, including Russia, the Iranian energy news service Shana cited him as saying.

Headlines: Russian source says Moscow won't back OPEC's call for deeper oil cuts
Description: A Russian high-level source told Reuters on Friday that Moscow would not back an OPEC call for extra reductions in oil output and would only agree to extending existing OPEC+ cuts.

Headlines: Tesla advertises for solar, energy storage staff in China
Description: Tesla Inc has advertised for solar and energy storage project managers in China, as the U.S. electric vehicle maker moves to expand its energy business into the country.

Headlines: Trump: No promises regarding steel and aluminum tariffs on Brazil
Description: President Donald Trump praised the United States' relationship with Brazil under Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro on Saturday, but declined to say whether he would impose steel and aluminum tariffs on the South American country.

Headlines: U.S. judge says Amazon likely to succeed on key argument in contract challenge
Description: A U.S. judge said Amazon.com Inc is likely to succeed on a key argument of its challenge to the U.S. Department of Defense's decision to award cloud computing deal worth up to $10 billion to Microsoft Corp.

Headlines: Trump blames oil fight, 'Fake News' for stock market drop
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump blamed a fight for oil market share between Saudi Arabia and Russia, as well as unspecified "Fake News," for a precipitous drop in U.S. stock prices on Monday, amid sliding demand for crude due to the coronavirus.

Headlines: Samsung Display asks Vietnam not to quarantine 700 engineers from virus-hit South Korea
Description: Samsung Display, a supplier for Samsung Electronics and Apple, has asked Vietnam to exempt 700 engineers from coronavirus-hit South Korea from a mandatory quarantine, saying they need to prepare for the production of screens for new smartphones.

Headlines: Tesco plans $6.6 billion shareholder return from Asia disposals
Description: Tesco plans to return $6.6 billion to shareholders after agreeing to sell its supermarket businesses in Thailand and Malaysia to Charoen Pokphand Group as part of plans to refocus on Britain.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia, Russia raise stakes in oil production standoff
Description: Saudi Arabia said on Tuesday it would boost its oil supplies to a record high in April, raising the stakes in a standoff with Russia and effectively rebuffing Moscow's suggestion for new talks.

Headlines: In Malaysia's Silicon Valley, fortunes flip as virus wrecks trade war gains
Description: Tech firms at Malaysia's one-time Silicon Valley of the East, swimming in orders from customers fleeing trade war-hit China, have seen fortunes turn again in the space of just a year as the coronavirus outbreak cuts them off from Chinese suppliers.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. sanctions have idled a quarter of Iranian oil rigs
Description: At least a quarter of Iran's oil rigs are out of action as U.S. sanctions strangle the Islamic Republic's vital oil industry, according to a Reuters review of financial documents and industry sources, dealing a potentially long-term blow to its oil industry.

Headlines: China urges Tesla to keep products consistent as buyers complain about computers
Description: China's industry ministry said on Tuesday it has urged Tesla Inc to keep its China-made vehicles consistent after some Chinese customers complained the U.S. electric vehicle maker put less advanced computer chips in their cars.

Headlines: U.S. senator says Trump administration mulling use of oil reserve to help crude producers
Description: U.S. Senator John Thune said on Wednesday he believes the Trump administration is evaluating use of the Strategic Petroleum Reserve, and other measures, to help oil producers deal with the plunge in crude prices due to the coronavirus and a price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia.

Headlines: U.S. senator calls for action on forced labor in China's Xinjiang
Description: A senior U.S. senator on Tuesday accused U.S. firms of willfully ignoring "horrific" forced labor conditions in China's Xinjiang region and called on the Commerce Department to stop American companies and consumers buying goods produced by such labor.

Headlines: Japan's Sharp files patent infringement lawsuit against U.S. TV brand Vizio
Description: Japan's Sharp Corp said on Wednesday it has filed a patent infringement lawsuit against U.S. TV brand Vizio Inc and two others, seeking an injunction to ban one of Vizio's TV products in the United States.

Headlines: U.S. again postpones high-level meeting on Huawei and China: sources
Description: Trump administration officials have postponed for a second time a critical meeting originally set for Wednesday to discuss potential new U.S. restrictions on sales of technology to Huawei and China, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Suriname confirms first coronavirus case, authorities will close borders
Description: Suriname on Friday confirmed its first case of coronavirus infection in a person who traveled to the South American country last week from the Netherlands, the vice president told the national assembly.

Headlines: Guatemala bans arrivals from U.S., Canada to fight coronavirus
Description: Guatemala will from Monday widen travel restrictions to fight the spread of coronavirus, banning arrivals from the United States and Canada, President Alejandro Giammattei said on Friday.

Headlines: Mexican coronavirus tally increases to 26: health ministry
Description: Mexico has registered a rise in the number of confirmed coronavirus cases to 26 from 15 a day earlier, the Mexican health ministry on Friday.

Headlines: Drumbeat of bad coronavirus news starts to hit U.S. auto dealers
Description: A relentless barrage of bad news surrounding the coronavirus epidemic has begun to affect customer visits at some U.S. auto dealers and even those businesses that have thrived so far believe a big sales decline is imminent if China's experience is any guide.

Headlines: South Korea reports more recoveries than coronavirus cases for the first time
Description: South Korea reported more recoveries from the coronavirus than new infections on Friday for the first time since its outbreak emerged in January, as a downward trend in daily cases raised hopes that Asia's biggest epidemic outside China may be slowing.

Headlines: Zhang Yiming, founder of TikTok owner ByteDance, gears up for the global stage
Description: The founder of China's ByteDance, owner of the wildly successful TikTok app, has for years aspired to make ByteDance the first Chinese firm to rival U.S. internet giants on the global stage. On Thursday Zhang Yiming made a key move to achieve that.

Headlines: Factbox: Latest on the spread of coronavirus around the world
Description: Global markets suffered record falls on Thursday as alarm over the coronavirus intensified and governments from Ireland to Italy unveiled measures to try to slow the spread of a disease that has infected more than 127,000 people worldwide.

Headlines: Exclusive: France to allow some Huawei gear in its 5G network - sources
Description: France will authorize the use of some of Huawei's equipment in the rollout of its 5G network, two sources close to the matter told Reuters, despite U.S. calls to exclude the Chinese telecoms giant from the West's next-generation communications.

Headlines: U.S. import prices post biggest drop in six months
Description: U.S. import prices fell by the most in six months in February as the cost of petroleum products dropped, and economists said they could decline further because of the coronavirus pandemic and an oil price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia.

Headlines: Morocco suspends all passenger sea and air trips to France - state news agency
Description: Morocco on Friday suspended all flights and passenger ship traffic to and from France, the state news agency said.

Headlines: South Korea reports 107 new coronavirus cases, total 8,086: KCDC
Description: South Korea reported more recoveries from the coronavirus than new infections on Saturday for the second day in a row, as a downward trend in daily cases raised hopes that Asia's biggest epidemic outside China may be slowing.

Headlines: Germany tries to halt U.S. interest in firm working on coronavirus vaccine
Description: Berlin is trying to stop Washington from persuading a German company seeking a coronavirus vaccine to move its research to the United States, prompting German politicians to insist no country should have a monopoly on any future vaccine.

Headlines: U.S. car buyers may get a break on loans as coronavirus threatens auto sales
Description: Several automakers on Monday said U.S. buyers of new vehicles will have the option to defer their payments and customers with existing car loans could ask for payment rescheduling if impacted by shutdowns due to the spread of coronavirus.

Headlines: Google parent Alphabet shared YouTube revenue after U.S. SEC request
Description: Alphabet Inc began disclosing revenue for its YouTube video service this year after U.S. securities regulators asked the Google parent to give more "quantitative and qualitative" data on the business, according to filings released Monday.

Headlines: Australia's Afterpay settles with California regulator for loans issued without license
Description: Australia's buy-now-pay-later firm Afterpay Ltd will refund late fees paid by customers in California for loans, which were deemed "illegal" by the U.S. state's financial regulator, the two sides said as part of a settlement.

Headlines: Uniqlo owner says most shops in China outside Hubei have reopened
Description: Japan's Fast Retailing said only 30 of its 750 Uniqlo stores in China were still closed, meaning most of its shops outside Hubei province, the epicenter of the coronavirus outbreak, had reopened.

Headlines: Exclusive: India plans to top up strategic tanks with cheap Saudi, UAE oil - sources
