Description: India plans to take advantage of low prices for oil from Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates to top up its strategic petroleum reserves (SPR), two sources familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Airbus suspends production in France and Spain, shares slide
Description: Airbus announced plans to halt operations at its plants in France and Spain for four days as the coronavirus crisis spread from battered airlines to the manufacturing sector.

Headlines: Amazon warehouses receive only vital supplies in U.S., Europe amid coronavirus
Description: Amazon.com Inc will only receive vital supplies at its U.S. and UK and other European warehouses until April 5, its latest move to free up inventory space for medical and household goods in high demand as a result of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Peru miners halt operations to slow coronavirus spread; Chile braces for impact
Description: Miners shuttered or wound down operations in Peru on Tuesday and were girding for extended supply chain disruptions in neighboring Chile as governments tightened restrictions to try to slow the spread of the coronavirus in the resource-rich region.

Headlines: Credit Suisse sharply cuts Mexico's 2020 GDP, sees economy shrinking by 4%
Description: Credit Suisse sharply lowered its forecast for Mexico's economic performance this year and now expects a 4.0% contraction, according to a note sent to the bank's clients on Tuesday, adding to a series of downgrades since the coronavirus spread.

Headlines: L Brands temporarily closes stores, draws down $950 million from existing credit line
Description: L Brands Inc said on Tuesday it would temporarily close all its stores, including those of Bath & Body Works and Victoria's Secret, in the United States and Canada through March 29 and that it has drawn down $950 million from an existing credit line due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Chairman of Santander's Portuguese unit dies from coronavirus
Description: The chairman of the Portuguese unit of Spain's largest bank, Santander, Antonio Vieira Monteiro, died from the coronavirus on Wednesday, the second victim of the disease in Portugal, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: Israel's Hapoalim will pay $870 million to end U.S. tax probe
Description: Israel's biggest bank, Hapoalim, said on Wednesday it expects to pay $870 million to settle a U.S. tax evasion investigation.

Headlines: Governments scramble to prop up airlines as virus forces more flight, job cuts
Description: Australia and Taiwan joined governments offering financial aid to airlines, while authorities in Europe rushed on Wednesday to agree steps to rescue carriers which have had to park planes and cut jobs as the coronavirus puts the brake on travel.

Headlines: Audi says will temporarily suspend Mexican car production due to coronavirus
Description: German carmaker Audi AG said on Wednesday that it will suspend production at its plant in Mexico's Puebla state from March 23 through April 13 as the coronavirus hits global supply chains.

Headlines: Ford to suspend production in Brazil, Argentina due to coronavirus
Description: Ford Motor Co on Thursday said it will suspend production in Brazil and Argentina starting next week due to the coronavirus outbreak, joining General Motors Co and Mercedes Benz which have also announced similar measures in Brazil.

Headlines: Trump says he will enter Saudi-Russia oil fray at appropriate time
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday said he would get involved in the oil price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia at the appropriate time, saying low gasoline prices were good for U.S. consumers even as they were hurting the industry.

Headlines: Latin American airlines slash flights, salaries in response to coronavirus
Description: Latin America's major airlines sharply curtailed international flights on Thursday because of the coronavirus outbreak as Panama and Colombia imposed month-long travel bans and the largest carrier cut the salaries of 43,000 employees.

Headlines: GM Mexico to halt operations at San Luis Potosi plant from March 20-April 13
Description: General Motors Co said on Thursday that it will suspend operations at its plant in Mexico's San Luis Potosi state from March 20 to April 13 due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Exclusive: ECB's Lagarde overruled German and Dutch resistance to 'no-limits' pledge - sources
Description: ECB President Christine Lagarde overruled objections from Germany and the Netherlands to adopt a historic "no-limits" commitment to shore up the region's economy in the face of the coronavirus meltdown, three sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Russia's Putin, China's Xi discuss coronavirus, agree medical cooperation: Kremlin
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese President Xi Jinping discussed the coronavirus by phone on Thursday and agreed to deepen cooperation on developing pharmaceuticals, the Kremlin said.

Headlines: Chad confirms first case of coronavirus: government statement
Description: Chad confirmed its first case of coronavirus on Thursday, a Moroccan national who had traveled to the country from Cameroon, the government said in a statement.

Headlines: Ukrainian man in wetsuit arrested after smuggling surgical masks into Romania
Description: Border guards have arrested a man in a wetsuit who admitted to smuggling surgical masks across a river from Ukraine into Romania, Ukraine's border guard service said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. to send envoy to Saudi Arabia; Texas suggests oil output cuts
Description: The Trump administration plans to send a special energy envoy to Saudi Arabia to work with the kingdom on stabilizing the global oil market, officials said on Friday, as the U.S. scrambles to deal with a price crash so deep that regulators in Texas considered curbing production there for the first time in nearly 50 years.

Headlines: Oil falls for fourth week; U.S. crude posts steepest weekly loss since 1991
Description: U.S. crude tumbled 10.7% on Friday and posted its biggest weekly decline since the 1991 Gulf War as the coronavirus epidemic dried up global demand and as officials in Washington said an envoy would head to Saudi Arabia to deal with fallout of a Saudi-Russia oil price war.

Headlines: EU okays Danish aid for rail-road link to Germany
Description: EU state aid regulators cleared on Friday Danish financial support for a rail-road link between Denmark and Germany, part of the North-South route connecting central Europe and the Nordic countries.

Headlines: Qatar eases exit restrictions on migrant employees in the oil and gas industry
Description: Qatar has removed exit visa requirements for an additional segment of its foreign labour force, including some of those working in the oil and gas industry, according to official tweets posted on Friday.

Headlines: Tesla's China car registrations fall 35% month-on-month in February
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc's China car registrations fell 35% in February, month on month, data from auto consultancy LMC Automotive showed.

Headlines: U.S. seeks comments on tariff cuts for Chinese imports to aid coronavirus battle
Description: The Trump administration on Friday said it was soliciting public comments on lifting additional tariffs on Chinese imports that could help the United States battle the coronavirus pandemic, showing some flexibility in its trade war against Beijing.

Headlines: Uber suspends taxi booking option in Saudi Arabia
Description: Uber Technologies has suspended the option to book regular taxi services through its app in Saudi Arabia until further notice, a company statement said on Friday.

Headlines: Google launches coronavirus website in the United States
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Saturday it launched a United States-focused website with information about coronavirus guidance and testing, as the country works on slowing the spread of the highly contagious virus.

Headlines: Volkswagen to close factories in Mexico to protect public health
Description: German automaker Volkswagen will temporarily close its factories in Mexico's Puebla and Guanajuato states in a bid to preserve public health, the company's Mexican unit said in a statement on Friday, amid growing worries over the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon.com to stop shipping non-essentials to consumers in Italy and France
Description: Amazon.com will stop shipping non-essential products to consumers in Italy and France, the company said on Saturday, representing an escalation in the e-commerce giant's response in regions hard hit by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: McDonald's to temporarily close all UK, Ireland restaurants amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: McDonald's Corp said on Sunday it would temporarily close all its restaurants in the UK and Ireland by Monday evening because of the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Factbox: Latest on the spread of the coronavirus around the world
Description: Coronavirus cases ballooned in Europe, prompting more lockdown measures to try to slow the spread. New Jersey's governor followed four other U.S. states that have imposed unprecedented restrictions. Australia announced it was shutting a large array of businesses from Monday.

Headlines: Coronavirus deaths in Italy overtake China as economic damage mounts
Description: The world's richest nations poured unprecedented aid into the global economy on Thursday as coronavirus cases ballooned in the new epicentre Europe, with the number of deaths in Italy outstripping those in mainland China, where the virus originated.

Headlines: U.S. trade regulators approve tariff exemption for Apple Watches
Description: U.S. trade regulators have approved Apple Inc's request to waive tariffs on China-made Apple Watches, the Office of the United States Trade Representative said in a letter dated Friday.

Headlines: Mexican referendum rejects U.S. Modelo brewer in new investment blow
Description: Residents of a Mexican city on the U.S. border voted against completing a billion-dollar brewery being built by Constellation Brands Inc, the government said Monday, dealing a fresh blow to investor confidence under President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador.

Headlines: Crude oil futures rise, but support seen weak
Description: U.S. crude oil futures climbed nearly 3% on Tuesday in light trading as the Trump administration launched an effort to work with Saudi Arabia to stabilise oil prices.

Headlines: U.S. locks in tariffs on wooden cabinets from China
Description: The U.S. International Trade Commission said on Tuesday it made a final determination that dumped and subsidized imports of wood cabinets and vanities from China were harming American producers, locking in steep U.S. tariffs for five years.

Headlines: China to resume U.S. LPG imports as Beijing waives trade-war tariff: sources
Description: China has begun buying U.S. liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) again after a hiatus of nearly 20 months as Beijing waived punitive tariffs to boost imports of U.S. goods as part of the Sino-U.S. Phase 1 trade deal, industry sources said.

Headlines: Coronavirus exposes U.S. Uber, Lyft drivers' lack of safety net
Description: As independent contractors, U.S. ride-hail drivers for Uber and Lyft benefited from soaring trip demand and flexible work hours.

Headlines: A falling yen may not be the economic cure Japan seeks
Description: Fallout from the coronavirus outbreak may finally lift the curse of the safe-haven yen for Japan but policymakers fear fiscal laxity could lead to a currency free-fall eventually, undermining efforts to cushion the economy from the pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: Venezuela in talks with China over support amid pandemic, oil price drop - sources
Description: Venezuela has opened talks with China over possible financial support to cope with a sharp drop in oil prices and the arrival of the novel coronavirus, four sources familiar with the negotiations said.

Headlines: Geely's Volvo Cars warns virus outbreak to hit 2020 earnings
Description: Sweden's Volvo Car Group, owned by China's Geely, scaled back its guidance for the full year, warning that sales, earnings and cash flow in the first half of 2020 would decline from a year ago as the coronavirus pandemic weighed on its business.

Headlines: Exclusive: Capital One got CFTC waiver after oil price plunge increased swap exposure - sources
Description: U.S. lender Capital One Financial Corp got a waiver from the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) after plunging oil prices increased the bank's derivatives exposure above a key regulatory threshold, according to two sources with knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: U.S. coronavirus stimulus bill adds billions in support for farmers
Description: The U.S. coronavirus stimulus bill would add $14 billion to the Agriculture Department's Commodity Credit Corp spending authority, and authorize another $9.5 billion for U.S. farmers hurt by the fast-spreading pandemic, according to a copy of the bill's text.

Headlines: Hedge fund manager to lead Norway sovereign fund after $124 billion loss
Description: Norway's sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, named a London-based hedge fund manager as its new chief executive on Thursday and said it had lost $124 billion this year as stock markets tanked due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. prepares crackdown on Huawei's global chip supply - sources
Description: Senior officials in the Trump administration agreed to new measures to restrict the global supply of chips to China's Huawei Technologies, sources familiar with the matter said, as the White House ramps up criticism of China over coronavirus.

Headlines: U.S.-Saudi oil alliance idea born at White House, put on back burner for now
Description: Top U.S. officials have for now put aside a proposal for an alliance with Saudi Arabia to manage the global oil market, according to three sources with knowledge of the matter, an idea one of them said came from White House national security advisers.

Headlines: Trump says he may join Saudi, Russia in talks on oil prices
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he would join Saudi Arabia and Russia, if need be, for talks about the sharp fall in oil prices resulting from a price war between the two countries.

Headlines: Oil ends March with biggest monthly and quarterly losses ever
Description: Crude oil benchmarks ended a volatile quarter with their biggest losses in history, as both U.S. and Brent futures were hammered throughout March on the global economic freeze due to the coronavirus pandemic and the eruption of a price war between Russia and Saudi Arabia.

Headlines: Chinese buyers snap up U.S. oil purchases at widest discounts ever
Description: China has increased U.S. crude purchases with some buyers snapping up cargoes at the widest discounts ever as sellers seek to offload excess supplies in Asia, six trade sources said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Putin calls for action on 'challenging' energy market, Trump laments cheap oil
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin called on Wednesday for global oil producers and consumers to address "challenging" oil markets while U.S. President Donald Trump complained that oil cheaper "than water" was hurting the industry.

Headlines: Oil jump lifts Wall Street as jobless claims data surges
Description: U.S. stocks rallied on Thursday as hopes for a truce in the price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia and a cut in oil output drove gains, taking some sting out of a shocking jump in Americans filing jobless claims due to coronavirus-led lockdowns.

Headlines: Russia does not rule out returning to oil talks with Saudi Arabia
Description: Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak said on Thursday that Moscow may return to oil negotiations with Saudi Arabia after talks collapsed last month, which, coupled with the spread of the new coronavirus, dragged oil prices to their 18-year lows.

Headlines: Trump says expects Russia-Saudi oil deal soon, invites U.S. oil chiefs to White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he has invited U.S. oil executives to the White House to discuss ways to help the industry "ravaged" by slumping energy demand during the coronavirus outbreak and a price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia.

Headlines: Volkswagen extends Mexico production halt as coronavirus bites
Description: German automaker Volkswagen said on Wednesday it would extend until April 30 a suspension of activities at two production plants in central Mexico after the government declared a health emergency because of coronavirus.

Headlines: Trump says he expects Saudi-Russia oil production deal in coming days
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he expected Saudi Arabia and Russia to reach a deal in the next few days on oil production to end a price war that has "ravaged" the oil industry worldwide.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump does not plan to ask U.S. oil producers for coordinated cuts - official
Description: The United States will not ask U.S. domestic oil companies for a coordinated cut in production to counter a historic meltdown in global prices and is still awaiting the details of planned cuts in Saudi Arabia and Russia, a senior administration official told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. officials agree on new ways to control high tech exports to China - sources
Description: The Trump administration is tightening rules to prevent China from obtaining advanced U.S. technology for commercial purposes and then diverting it to military use, several sources told Reuters.

Headlines: Ford to build face shields at Brazil and Argentina car plants
Description: Ford Motor Co said on Thursday it will make 50,000 face shields at factories in Brazil and Argentina to donate in the fight against the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Facebook launches fact-checking service on WhatsApp in Italy to fight coronavirus hoaxes
Description: Facebook Inc. launched a service in Italy to check the accuracy of information on coronavirus circulating on its messaging platform WhatsApp, the U.S. tech firm said on Thursday.

Headlines: Oil futures pare record gains as doubts creep in on Trump's Saudi-Russia output deal
Description: Oil prices fell on Friday, coming off their biggest one-day gains in the previous session after U.S. President Donald Trump said he had brokered a deal between Saudi Arabia and Russia to cut output, but made no offer to reduce U.S. production.

Headlines: Business booms for coffin-makers in coronavirus-hit France
Description: Two hauliers load their lorries with what is fast becoming a precious commodity in France as the coronavirus pandemic takes its dreadful toll - coffins.

Headlines: China probes alleged fraud at Luckin Coffee, banks review IPO work
Description: China's securities regulator said on Friday it would investigate claims of fraud at Luckin Coffee Inc and sources said some of the banks involved in the Chinese chain's successful U.S. IPO last year were reviewing their work in the listing.

Headlines: Venezuela's financial crisis exacerbated by oil price war, coronavirus
Description: A price war between world oil producers has slashed Venezuela's revenue for its top export and exacerbated the country's financial crisis as it also faces the coronavirus pandemic, U.S. sanctions and sliding crude output.

Headlines: Factbox: Oil analysts sceptical about Saudi-Russian 'deal'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is stoking the possibility of Saudi Arabia and Russia negotiating oil output cuts as the coronavirus outbreak hammers demand.

Headlines: Mexico stops brewing Corona beer, deemed non-essential in epidemic
Description: Mexico's Grupo Modelo said on Thursday it will temporarily stop brewing Corona beer and other brands exported to 180 countries after its business activities were declared non-essential under a government order aimed at curbing the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: Trump touts 'great' Saudi-Russia oil deal to halt price rout, but details unclear
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he had brokered a deal with top crude producers Russia and Saudi Arabia to cut output and arrest an oil price rout amid the global coronavirus pandemic, though details of how cuts would work were unclear.

Headlines: Google data shines light on whether coronavirus lockdowns worldwide are working
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google has published charts showing how the coronavirus has brought hard-hit Italy to a standstill, led to runs on grocery stores around the world and prompted a stark drop in going-out between Mardi Gras and St. Patrick's Day.

Headlines: U.S. biofuels industry seeks bailout to weather 'collapsing demand': letter
Description: The U.S. biofuel industry has asked the Trump administration for funds from the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Commodity Credit Corporation to help it survive a demand slump triggered by the coronavirus outbreak, according to a letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Constellation Brands says Mexico breweries still running amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Constellation Brands Inc , the U.S. distributor of Corona beer, said on Friday its Mexican breweries were still operational and supply to the United States was intact even as rivals suspended production due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Mexico without Corona: Brewers suspend production during pandemic
Description: Mexicans fretted about beer supplies on Friday after Dutch brewer Heineken said it will suspend production at its seven plants in Mexico to comply with coronavirus containment measures, following a similar announcement by rival Modelo.

Headlines: Capital One says it won't use CFTC waiver related to oil lending
Description: U.S. lender Capital One Financial Corp said on Saturday it would not use a U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) waiver after commodity price volatility lifted the bank's derivatives exposure toward a key regulatory threshold.

Headlines: Mexican president calls on Russia, Saudi Arabia to end oil price war
Description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Saturday called on Russia and Saudi Arabia to reach a deal soon and end their oil price war to avoid deepening the oil price crisis.

Headlines: Trump threatens tariffs on oil imports to 'protect' U.S. energy workers
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday he would impose tariffs on crude imports if he has to "protect" U.S. energy workers from the oil price crash that has been exacerbated by a war between Russia and Saudi Arabia over market share.

Headlines: OPEC+ meeting delayed as Saudi Arabia and Russia row over oil price collapse: sources
Description: OPEC and Russia have postponed a Monday meeting to discuss oil output cuts until April 9, OPEC sources said on Saturday, as a dispute between Moscow and Saudi Arabia over who is to blame for plunging crude prices intensified.

Headlines: Take Five: Life in the time of corona
Description: The world's biggest economy won't be open for business by Easter, as U.S. President Donald Trump had hoped, but the second biggest economy may come close. How China fares offers a guide to other countries when their coronavirus lockdowns lift.

Headlines: Canada, U.S. farms face crop losses due to foreign worker delays
Description: Mandatory coronavirus quarantines of seasonal foreign workers in Canada could hurt that country's fruit and vegetable output this year, and travel problems related to the pandemic could also leave U.S. farmers with fewer workers than usual.

Headlines: Australia's Treasury Wine, to cope with virus, weighs Penfolds demerger, U.S. cutback
Description: Australia's Treasury Wine Estates Ltd said it may spin off the prestigious Penfolds label and shrink its low-end "commercial" division in the United States as it seeks ways to grow profit amid upheaval brought by the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: U.S. oil state senators to talk crude markets with Saudi officials Saturday: source
Description: Republican U.S. senators who have introduced a bill that would remove U.S. defense systems and troops in Saudi Arabia unless it cuts oil output will hold a call with the kingdom's officials on Saturday, a source familiar with the planning said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Size of OPEC+ oil cuts will depend on how much others cut: source
Description: Any final agreement for how much OPEC and its allies, a group know as OPEC+, will cut during their talks on Thursday would depend on the volumes that other producers such as the United States, Canada and Brazil are willing to reduce, an OPEC source said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Toshiba should sell stake in ex-chip unit at IPO, says HK activist fund in letter
Description: A Hong Kong-based activist investor in Toshiba Corp has asked the Japanese conglomerate to sell its entire stake in Kioxia Holdings when the flash memory chip firm is listed in an IPO that could raise up to $32 billion, according to a letter reviewed by Reuters.

Headlines: Side effects: Fuel demand crash shuts U.S. ethanol plants, meatpackers lack refrigerant
Description: A slew of U.S. ethanol plants have shut down as fuel demand has collapsed during the coronavirus outbreak, and meatpackers have been hit by a worrying side-effect: less carbon dioxide is now available to chill beef, poultry and pork.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. grants GE license to sell engines for China's new airplane
Description: The Trump administration on Tuesday granted a license to General Electric Co to supply engines for China's new COMAC C919 passenger jet, a spokeswoman for the company said.

Headlines: Mexican president lashes out at companies over layoffs, taxes as big business seethes
Description: Mexico's president threw himself into a new confrontation with businesses on Wednesday, accusing big companies of not paying taxes and upbraiding others for laying off workers during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Mexico auto sector to resume operations once U.S. industry gears up
Description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Wednesday the domestic auto sector can resume operations shortly after the U.S. industry gears up from a coronavirus-led halt, to avoid further disruption to closely interconnected supply chains.

Headlines: Trump says U.S. producers have already cut back oil production
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday U.S. oil producers have already cut production and he had many options if Saudi Arabia and Russia do not reduce their output when they and other exporters meet on Thursday.

Headlines: Centerview turns to Matthieu Pigasse to lead new Paris hub
Description: U.S. investment bank Centerview has hired Lazard's former France boss, Matthieu Pigasse, to lead its newly-launched Paris office and win business from European companies grappling with the economic damage caused by the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Exclusive: Venezuela gasoline shortages worsen as U.S. tells firms to avoid supply - sources
Description: Gasoline shortages in Venezuela are worsening after U.S. officials have told foreign firms to refrain from supplying the fuel to the sanctioned South American nation and only provide diesel, according to five people familiar with the situation.

Headlines: Corona beer maker Constellation to reduce production in Mexico during pandemic
Description: Constellation Brands Inc , the U.S. distributor of Corona beer, said on Wednesday it would reduce production at its Mexican breweries, just days after it announced they were fully operational.

Headlines: Saudi king, Trump, Putin review importance of cooperation between oil producing countries
Description: Saudi Arabia's King Salman, U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin reviewed, in a phone call, the importance of cooperation between oil producing countries, after Thursday's OPEC+ meeting, Saudi state news agency SPA reported.

Headlines: Mexico proposes 100,000 bpd oil output cut at OPEC meeting
Description: In a meeting with OPEC and its allies, Mexico proposed reducing its oil output by 100,000 barrels per day (bpd) in the next two months, Energy Minister Rocio Nahle said on Thursday.

Headlines: Trump says he had good call with Russia's Putin, Saudi king on oil
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he had a good conversation with Russian President Vladimir Putin and Saudi Arabia's King Salman and expected that OPEC and other countries would be announcing a deal soon.

Headlines: Costco set to open new store in China's Suzhou city
Description: U.S. retail giant Costco will open a new store in China's eastern city of Suzhou, near Shanghai, state media reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Putin has no plans to talk oil with Trump, Saudis on Thursday: Kremlin
Description: Russian President Putin has no plans as of Thursday to discuss oil markets with U.S. President Donald Trump and Saudi Arabia's leadership, a Kremlin spokesman told Reuters.

Headlines: Automakers push to reopen plants with testing and lots of masks
Description: Global automakers reeling from the COVID-19 pandemic are accelerating efforts to restart factories from Wuhan to Maranello to Michigan, using safety protocols developed for China and U.S. ventilator production operations launched in recent weeks.

Headlines: Saudi, others resist Mexican plan to make small oil output cuts - sources
Description: Saudi Arabia and other oil producers in the OPEC+ group pushed back on Friday on a Mexican plan to cut less than requested under plans for global supply curbs, two sources from the OPEC+ group said on Friday.

Headlines: Trump, Putin discuss coronavirus, global energy markets: White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump spoke with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin on Friday about the coronavirus and energy markets, the White House said.

Headlines: Kremlin says Putin, Trump, Saudi king seek to stabilise oil trade
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin, U.S. President Donald Trump and Saudi Arabia's King Salman, discussed the OPEC+ oil group meeting in a phone call on Friday and confirmed their aim was to stabilise the global oil trade, the Kremlin said.

Headlines: Saudi energy minister says OPEC+ oil pact hinges on Mexico joining
Description: Saudi Arabia's energy minister said on Friday that a final OPEC+ oil supply pact to reduce 10 million barrels per day (bpd), which was agreed on Thursday, hinges on Mexico joining in the cuts.

Headlines: Tesla expands locally made line-up, blunting trade war impact
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc said on Friday it has started China sales of two more Model 3 variants built at its Shanghai plant, meaning all Model 3 sedans sold in the country are now locally made and not subject to import tax.

Headlines: Kremlin: Putin and Trump discuss OPEC+ oil cuts deal
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and U.S. President Donald Trump, in a phone call on Friday, discussed a potential global deal on oil production cuts by the group known as OPEC+, the Kremlin said.

Headlines: Kremlin says 'work' on Mexico joining oil cuts under way
Description: The Kremlin said on Friday that "work" to persuade Mexico to join efforts to curb oil production was under way a day after marathon talks among producers produced a deal on cutting out conditional on Mexico's participation.

Headlines: Mexican president's nationalist oil vision fuels standoff with Saudis
Description: The biggest supply cut ever contemplated by the world's top oil producers is hanging in the balance as a refusal by Mexico's leftist leader to imperil his plans to rebuild state oil company Pemex has angered the Saudi prince who helped craft the deal.

Headlines: U.S. senators hold call with Saudi officials urging them to put oil cut in motion
Description: Republican U.S. senators from oil states who recently introduced legislation to remove American troops from Saudi Arabia said on Saturday they had spoken with three officials from the kingdom and urged them to take concrete action to cut crude output.

Headlines: Air France in talks with French govt over emergency funding: Les Echos
Description: Air France KLM has requested several billion euros of emergency funds from the French state while it negotiates a loan package from banks, which would be guaranteed by France and the Netherlands, French business daily Les Echos reported.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia, Russia, U.S. welcome outcome of OPEC+ meeting: SPA
Description: Saudi Arabia's king Salman, Russia's president Vladimir Putin and his U.S. counterpart Donald Trump welcomed the outcome of OPEC+ meeting during a joint phone call, Saudi state news agency SPA said on late Sunday.

Headlines: Saudi energy minister says OPEC+ effective oil cuts are 12.5 million bpd
Description: The Saudi energy minister said on Sunday that effective oil supply cuts by OPEC and its allies, a group known as OPEC+, will amount to 12.5 million barrels per day, because of higher output in April from Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and Kuwait.

Headlines: Mexico to cut oil output by 100,000 bpd from May: officials
Description: Mexico will reduce its oil output by 100,000 barrels per day (bpd) from May after top oil producers collectively agreed to cut production by 9.7 million barrels per day at OPEC+ talks, Mexican officials said on Sunday.

Headlines: Kremlin says leaders of Russia, U.S., Saudi Arabia support OPEC+ oil deal
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin, U.S. President Donald Trump and Saudi Arabia's King Salman all supported the OPEC+ deal to cut global crude output, the Kremlin said on Sunday.

Headlines: Volkswagen offers cars for relief efforts in U.S. virus-hit regions
Description: Germany's Volkswagen AG said on Monday its U.S. dealers would provide cars for free delivery of essential supplies to people in need during the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Toyota plans limited operations in France, Poland from April 22
Description: Toyota Motor Corp on Monday said it plans to restart limited production at vehicle plants in France and Poland from April 22 after closing them due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Honda extends Mexican plant shutdown, furloughs more U.S. workers
Description: Japanese automaker Honda Motor Co said Wednesday it will extend a shutdown of its Mexican plants through April 30 and plans to furlough most U.S. salaried workers for two weeks as a result of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Tesla's China car registrations surge in March as Shanghai factory back up
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc's China car registrations jumped 450% in March, month on month, data from auto consultancy LMC Automotive showed.

Headlines: United cuts May flights by 90%, tells employees to brace for job cuts
Description: (This April 15 story corrects to show flights starting between Buenos Aires and Houston, not Washington, in paragraph 12.)

Headlines: L'Oreal eyes post-confinement rush to hair salons
Description: L'Oreal is counting on consumers rushing back to hair salons to help its business recover quickly once European and U.S. coronavirus lockdowns are lifted, it said on Thursday, adding that beauty sales were bouncing back already in China.

Headlines: Most U.S. firms have no plans to leave China due to coronavirus: survey
Description: Most U.S. firms in China currently have no plans to relocate production to other parts of the country or abroad due to the coronavirus, but there is less certainty about the long term due to growing worries over U.S.-China decoupling, a survey showed.

Headlines: U.S.'s Pompeo: Nations should rethink use of China's Huawei amid coronavirus
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Friday said China's role in the global coronavirus pandemic is likely to force countries to rethink their telecommunications infrastructure, including the adoption of China-based Huawei's 5G networks.

Headlines: U.S. banks seek term changes as Fed finalizes Main Street Lending Program
Description: U.S. banks are pushing the Federal Reserve to change the terms of a $600 billion lending program for small and medium-sized businesses, including reducing minimum loan sizes and allowing more flexibility on underlying reference rates, industry groups said.

Headlines: Germany to grant rescue liquidity for carrier Condor: sources
Description: Germany has agreed in principle to support struggling carrier Condor with emergency liquidity after the owner of Poland's national airline LOT pulled out of a deal to buy the airline, two people close to the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: China's top brokerage hires Vanguard ex-Asia boss for global drive
Description: China's Citic Securities Co. , has hired Charles Lin, the former Asia head of Vanguard Group, to be vice chairman of Hong Kong unit CLSA, as the biggest Chinese securities company seeks to build up an international presence.

Headlines: Oil giveaway spells doom, brings out market bears
Description: The crash in U.S. crude prices has turned a reliable commodity less than worthless and given fresh urgency to bearish voices, who say it sounds alarm bells for global growth and are bracing for a catastrophic collapse in asset prices.

Headlines: U.S. orders Chevron to 'wind down' Venezuela operations by December 1
Description: The Trump administration on Tuesday gave Chevron Corp , the last major U.S. oil company still operating in Venezuela, until Dec. 1 to "wind down" its business in the OPEC member-nation and will allow it to conduct only severely limited operations there until then.

Headlines: Factbox: Rare earths projects under development in U.S.
Description: The U.S. government is planning to fund domestic rare earths projects in an attempt to reduce its reliance on China, the global leader of the specialized sector.

Headlines: Saudi Arabia may re-route tankers if U.S. imposes crude import ban, sources say
Description: Saudi Arabia is exploring re-routing millions of barrels of oil onboard tankers sailing to the United States if President Donald Trump decides to block imports of crude from the kingdom, shipping and trade sources say.

Headlines: Chevron barred from drilling, transporting oil in Venezuela: U.S official
Description: Chevron Corp has been banned from drilling or transporting oil in Venezuela and its assets there are "mothballed" as the Trump administration cracks down on money going to the government of socialist President Nicolas Maduro, a senior U.S. official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Oil exec and Trump ally Hamm seeks U.S. probe of oil price crash
Description: The founder of Continental Resources Inc , an ally of U.S. President Donald Trump, is pressing the U.S. commodity markets regulator and the exchange to probe whether market manipulation or system failure was behind this week's unprecedented plunge in U.S. crude futures.

Headlines: Iran says it will fare better than others after oil crash amid battered economy
Description: Iran will not suffer as much as other countries from the oil price plunge as it is less reliant on crude exports, its president said on Wednesday, with the state budget depending far less than before on oil revenue due to U.S. sanctions.

Headlines: U.S. states test safety of reopening as pandemic pushes jobless claims higher
Description: An array of U.S. merchants in Georgia and other states prepared on Thursday to reopen for the first time in a month under newly relaxed coronavirus restrictions, as another week of massive unemployment claims highlighted the grim economic toll of the pandemic.

Headlines: Italy's Triboo starts selling Chinese COVID-19 antibody tests
Description: Italian digital services company Triboo said on Thursday it had started selling antibody tests for Covid-19 produced by China's SOBC Outdo Biotech, as Italy draws closer to easing the lockdown measures imposed to tackle the coronavirus outbreak.

Headlines: Volkswagen pushes back possible restart of operations in Mexico
Description: German automaker Volkswagen will extend until at least May 18 a suspension on operations at its Puebla production plant in Mexico due to the ongoing coronavirus pandemic, the company said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: France, Germany in standoff with Silicon Valley on contact tracing
Description: A standoff between the two largest nations in the European Union and Silicon Valley escalated on Friday as Apple and Google rebuffed demands by France and Germany to back their approach to using smartphone technology to trace coronavirus infections.

Headlines: Ireland should consider forcing Google, Facebook to pay media for content: PM
Description: The Irish government should consider copying Australia's plan to force Facebook Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google to share advertising revenue with local media, Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Friday.

Headlines: IKEA says visitors returning fast to reopened shopping centres in China and Germany
Description: Furniture brand IKEA's main retail vehicle said on Friday shoppers were returning quickly to its shopping centres after it reopened three in China last week, and one in Germany this week - its first four to open after closures due to the coronavirus.

Headlines: Here's why you can't find frozen fries, while U.S. farmers are sitting on tons of potatoes
Description: Shopper Lexie Mayewski is having a hard time finding frozen french fries in Washington, D.C.-area supermarkets in the wake of coronavirus-fueled stockpiling.

Headlines: As U.S. coronavirus death toll tops 51,000, handful of states move toward reopening
Description: With the U.S. coronavirus death toll topping 51,000 and nearly one in six workers out of a job, Georgia, Oklahoma and several other states took tentative steps at reopening businesses on Friday, despite disapproval from President Donald Trump and medical experts.

Headlines: Coronavirus came to New York from Europe, not China, governor says
Description: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo on Friday pointed to research showing that strains of the novel coronavirus entered his state from Europe, not China, and said that travel bans enacted by U.S. President Donald Trump were too late to halt its spread.

Headlines: Exclusive: India plans to fast track Chinese investments after policy change - sources
Description: India plans to fast track the review of some investment proposals from neigbouring countries such as China following concerns new screening rules could hit plans of companies and investors, three sources told Reuters on Saturday.

Headlines: Embraer takes Boeing to arbitration over failed deal as Brazil eyes China tie-up
Description: Brazil's Embraer SA said on Monday it had begun an arbitration process against Boeing Co, after the U.S. planemaker abruptly canceled a $4.2 billion deal over the weekend that was years in the making.

Headlines: U.S. stocks advance as some states reopen for business
Description: Wall Street gained more than 1% on Monday at the onset of a hectic earnings week, as investors turned a hopeful eye toward several U.S. states that are relaxing shutdown restrictions put in place to curb the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Mirae Asset says sued after deadline miss on $5.8 billion Anbang U.S. hotels deal
Description: South Korean asset manager Mirae Asset Global Investments has been sued over a $5.8 billion deal to buy 15 U.S. hotels from China's Anbang Insurance Group after missing a deadline for the deal's closing, a Mirae spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Small U.S. businesses hope second time's the charm for emergency aid
Description: Cheryl Wellman is one of thousands of small business owners anxious to see if she'll get a slice of the $310 billion in new emergency aid that was just released by Washington.

Headlines: China committed to Phase 1 trade deal despite pandemic: U.S. official
Description: China remains "very, very committed" to meeting its commitments under a Phase 1 trade deal with the United States, despite the unprecedented economic and health impacts of the new coronavirus outbreak, a senior U.S. trade official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Geely's Volvo Cars gives notice to 1,300 white-collar staff in Sweden
Description: Volvo Car Group, owned by China's Geely Holding, said on Wednesday it was giving notice of redundancy to 1,300 white-collar workers in Sweden as the impact from the pandemic raised the urgency of lowering structural costs.

Headlines: Tesla cuts price for China-made Model 3 cars by 10% to qualify for subsidies
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc said in Friday it has cut the starting price for China-made Model 3 sedans by 10% to qualify for subsidies in the world's biggest auto market.

Headlines: Cargill expands plant-based protein food for China
Description: U.S. agribusiness giant Cargill [CARG.UL] said on Thursday it will introduce a range of plant-based food products to China following a successful trial of plant-based nuggets by Yum China Holdings Inc's KFC.

Headlines: Wall Street tumbles as renewed tariff threat adds to uncertainties
Description: Wall Street sold off sharply on Friday after President Donald Trump revived a threat of new tariffs against China in response to the COVID-19 pandemic, which has brought global economies to a grinding halt.

Headlines: Take Five: Trade winds to blow again?
Description: China has headed off on Labour Day holidays but its leaders won't be resting easy. U.S. President Donald Trump has ratcheted up anti-China rhetoric again. He is threatening trade tariffs to punish Beijing for its alleged failure to contain the coronavirus, even accusing a Chinese lab of manufacturing the pathogen.

Headlines: Trump threatens new tariffs on China in retaliation for coronavirus
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday his hard-fought trade deal with China was now of secondary importance to the coronavirus pandemic and he threatened new tariffs on Beijing, as his administration crafted retaliatory measures over the outbreak.

Headlines: Trump administration pushing to rip global supply chains from China: officials
Description: The Trump administration is "turbocharging" an initiative to remove global industrial supply chains from China as it weighs new tariffs to punish Beijing for its handling of the coronavirus outbreak, according to officials familiar with U.S. planning.

Headlines: Mirae Asset scraps $5.8 billion deal to buy U.S. hotels from China's Anbang
Description: South Korea's Mirae Asset Global Investments said on Monday that it has terminated a $5.8 billion deal to buy 15 U.S. hotels from China's Anbang Insurance Group [ANBANG.UL], accusing the insurer of breaching contract obligations.

Headlines: Exclusive: Nissan to retrench further in new plan to focus on U.S., Japan, China
Description: Nissan Motor Co Ltd will pull back from Europe and elsewhere to focus on the United States, China and Japan under a plan that represents a new strategic direction for the embattled carmaker, people with direct knowledge of the plan told Reuters.

Headlines: Airline SAS agrees credit facility backed by Sweden, Denmark
Description: Airline SAS said on Tuesday it had signed a 3.3 billion Swedish crown ($336 million) three-year revolving credit facility agreement, 90% guaranteed by Sweden and Denmark's governments, as it looked to beat a path through the coronavirus crisis.

Headlines: Wizz Air plans for easing of restrictions with holiday flights from June
Description: Low cost airline Wizz Air said it is planning for the easing of travel restrictions by starting new routes from Britain's London Luton airport to holiday destinations in Portugal from 16 June and to Greece from July.

Headlines: Ford's China ventures saw sales growth in April as market rebounds
Description: U.S. automaker Ford Motor Co's two ventures in China have reported year-on-year sales growth for April, indicating the world's biggest auto market has started its recovery from coronavirus-induced lows.

Headlines: E-cigarette maker Juul Labs to exit South Korea after year of health controversies
Description: U.S. e-cigarette maker Juul Labs said on Wednesday it would end operations in South Korea, a year after it entered the market there but failed to gain traction amid government health warnings.

Headlines: Government aid for Brazil's airlines shrinks, while Panama's Copa shrugs off bailout
Description: Stress has been mounting for Latin American airlines as carriers brace for a slow recovery from the coronavirus pandemic, but Brazil's government on Thursday reduced the loan aid available for carriers, while Panama's Copa Airlines said it did not need a bailout.

Headlines: World stocks climb on China trade relief, while U.S. jobs data dents dollar
Description: World shares rose on Thursday after China's exports came in far stronger than expected, suggesting an economic recovery was under way, but the dollar fell from two-week highs as U.S. data showed millions more Americans joined the ranks of the unemployed.

Headlines: Exclusive: Iran-linked hackers recently targeted coronavirus drugmaker Gilead - sources
Description: Hackers linked to Iran have targeted staff at U.S. drugmaker Gilead Sciences Inc in recent weeks, according to publicly-available web archives reviewed by Reuters and three cybersecurity researchers, as the company races to deploy a treatment for the COVID-19 virus.

Headlines: Turkey charges seven people over Ghosn escape: lawyer
Description: Turkish prosecutors have prepared an indictment charging seven people, including four pilots, over former Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn's escape via Istanbul to Lebanon after fleeing Japan, a lawyer for one of the suspects said on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. drafts rule to allow Huawei and U.S. firms to work together on 5G standards - sources
Description: The U.S. Department of Commerce is close to signing off on a new rule that would allow U.S. companies to work with China's Huawei Technologies on setting standards for next generation 5G networks, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Tesla China sold 3,635 Model 3 vehicles in April, down 64% vs March: CPCA
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc sold 3,635 Shanghai-made Model 3 vehicles in China in April, down 64% from March, according to the China Passenger Car Association (CPCA).

Headlines: French, Dutch join forces to urge EU to show teeth on trade
Description: France and the Netherlands have joined forces to urge the European Union to enforce environmental and labour standards more forcefully with countries the bloc signs trade deals with, according to a document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: As U.S. meat workers fall sick and supplies dwindle, exports to China soar
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump ordered meat processing plants to stay open to protect the nation's food supply even as workers got sick and died. Yet the plants have increasingly been exporting to China while U.S. consumers face shortages, a Reuters analysis of government data showed.

Headlines: Trump 'not interested' in reopening U.S.-China trade deal after report of Beijing discontent
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he opposed renegotiating the U.S.-China "Phase 1" trade deal after a Chinese state-run newspaper reported some government advisers in Beijing were urging fresh talks and possibly invalidating the agreement.

Headlines: China announces new tariff waivers for some U.S. imports
Description: China announced on Tuesday a new list of 79 U.S. products eligible for waivers from retaliatory tariffs imposed at the height of the bilateral trade war, amid continued pressure on Beijing to boost imports from the United States.

Headlines: China working to fulfil pledge on U.S. purchases despite import slowdown: sources
Description: China is committed to its Phase 1 trade deal with the United States and is working towards meeting its promise to boost U.S. purchases, even though the pace of buying has been restrained by the coronavirus outbreak, three Chinese sources said.

Headlines: Jersey jackpot of $2 million awaits Deutsche's lost shareholders
Description: While Deutsche Bank employees fret about their jobs and pay, Germany's largest lender is trying to track down several hundred former staff to claim share payouts it has been holding in Jersey.

Headlines: Emirates plans scheduled flights from May 21 to nine cities
Description: Emirates Airline from May 21 plans to operate scheduled flight services from Dubai to London Heathrow, Frankfurt, Paris, Milan, Madrid, Chicago, Toronto, Sydney and Melbourne, it said in a statement on Wednesday.

Headlines: Trump threatens new taxes on companies that make goods outside United States
Description: President Donald Trump threatened on Thursday to impose new taxes on American companies that produce goods outside the United States, another move his administration could make to push supply chains away from China and raise new trade barriers.

Headlines: Trump rips into China over coronavirus, 'very disappointed'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday said he was very disappointed in China over its failure to contain the novel coronavirus, saying the worldwide pandemic cast a pall over his U.S.-China trade deal.

Headlines: U.S. stock market swings higher despite rising U.S.-China tensions; oil up
Description: U.S. stocks gyrated on Friday before ending slightly higher, as investors worried about increased China-U.S. trade hostilities and disappointing retail sales figures, while signs of a pick-up in crude demand boosted oil prices.

Headlines: U.S. gave no assurances to Taiwan's TSMC for license to sell to Huawei: official
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd, which unveiled a $12 billion investment plan in Arizona on Friday, has not been given any assurances that it will be granted a license to allow it to sell U.S. technology to China's Huawei, a senior U.S. official said.

Headlines: Trump says doesn't want to talk to Xi, could even cut China ties
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump signaled a further deterioration of his relationship with China over the coronavirus outbreak, saying he has no interest in speaking to President Xi Jinping right now and going so far as to suggest he could even cut ties with the world's second largest economy.

Headlines: Taiwan's TSMC to build Arizona chip plant as U.S.-China tech rivalry escalates
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd , the biggest contract chipmaker, said it plans to build a $12 billion factory in Arizona in an apparent win for the Trump administration's efforts to wrestle global tech supply chains back from China.

Headlines: Pompeo says TSMC's $12 billion investment to increase U.S. economic independence from China
Description: Chipmaker Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co's $12 billion investment in the United States will increase U.S. economic independence from China, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said in a statement early on Friday.

Headlines: J.C. Penney has need for speed in bankruptcy, lawyer says
Description: J.C. Penney Co Inc needs to exit bankruptcy proceedings in just a matter of months to survive the unprecedented financial strain of prolonged store closures due to the COVID-19 pandemic, a lawyer for the iconic U.S. department store chain said during a court hearing on Saturday.

Headlines: China asks United States to stop 'unreasonable suppression' of Huawei
Description: China's foreign ministry said on Saturday the United States needed to stop the "unreasonable suppression" of Chinese companies like Huawei, and a Chinese newspaper said the government was ready to retaliate against Washington.

Headlines: Reliance in $870 million General Atlantic deal as Jio Platforms funding tops $8 billion
Description: India's Reliance Industries on Sunday announced U.S. fund General Atlantic will invest 65.98 billion rupees ($870 million) in Jio Platforms, a fourth deal that takes investment in its digital unit to over $8 billion in less than a month.

Headlines: U.S. mulls paying companies, tax breaks to pull supply chains from China
Description: U.S. lawmakers and officials are crafting proposals to push American companies to move operations or key suppliers out of China that include tax breaks, new rules, and carefully structured subsidies.

Headlines: Total calls off plan to buy Occidental Petroleum's Ghana assets
Description: Total has called off a plan to acquire Occidental Petroleum's assets in Ghana, which was conditional on the completion of the acquisition of Occidental's other assets in Algeria, the French energy company said on Monday.

Headlines: Tesla's China car registrations plunge 64% month-on-month in April
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc suffered a slump of 64% in car registrations in China in April on the month, data from auto consultancy LMC Automotive showed.

Headlines: Mnuchin defends U.S. fiscal response to pandemic, seeks payroll loan extension
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Tuesday defended the Trump administration's fiscal response to the coronavirus pandemic and told senators he was willing to consider extending and modifying a payroll loan program for small businesses.

Headlines: Business group cautions U.S. on 'reshoring' too much China supply
Description: The U.S. Chamber of Commerce on Tuesday warned the U.S. government against overdoing a major effort underway to rip U.S. supply chains out of China in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic, saying such moves could harm the economy.

Headlines: Trump administration abruptly postpones New Mexico oil and gas auction
Description: The Trump administration abruptly postponed an auction of oil and gas leases in New Mexico that had been scheduled to begin on Wednesday morning without providing a reason for the move.

Headlines: Japan 'closely communicating' with U.S. after arrest of two men over Ghosn escape: source
Description: Japan is closely communicating with relevant U.S. authorities following the U.S. arrest of two men on charges they enabled former Nissan Motor Co chairman Carlos Ghosn to escape from Japan last year, a Japanese government source said on Thursday.

Headlines: AT&T shuts Venezuela subscription TV unit, citing U.S. sanctions
Description: AT&T Inc said on Tuesday it was shutting its DirecTV subscription access to Venezuela due to U.S. sanctions, cutting off a key source of entertainment for millions of people stuck in their homes under a strict coronavirus quarantine.

Headlines: GM gradually restarts in Mexico as Lear Corp readies for return
Description: General Motors Co said on Thursday it was gradually restarting the transmission and motor lines at its Mexican facilities in Silao and Ramos Arizpe, while U.S. auto parts maker Lear Corp also geared up for production.

Headlines: Wall Street finishes down as U.S.-China tensions heighten trade deal worries
Description: Wall Street ended lower on Thursday, a day after hitting two-month highs, on a fresh wave of China-U.S. tensions that raised doubts about the trade deal reached early this year between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: Wanted: New head of WTO. Must thrive under global pressure and conflict
Description: Against the backdrop of a global pandemic, steep recession, intensifying U.S-China tensions and rising protectionism, the WTO needs to name a leader. Only the resilient should apply.

Headlines: U.S. arrests two men wanted by Japan over ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn's escape
Description: U.S. authorities on Wednesday arrested a former U.S. Army Special Forces soldier and another man in Massachusetts wanted by Japan on charges that they enabled the escape of former Nissan Motor Co boss Carlos Ghosn out of the country.

Headlines: Starbucks recoups nearly two-thirds of comparable U.S. sales as stores reopen
Description: Starbucks Corp said on Thursday it had regained nearly two-thirds of its comparable U.S. store sales from the prior year, as it reopened stores and modified operations due to the coronavirus-related restrictions.

Headlines: Hong Kong tensions rattle world stock markets, oil tumbles
Description: Oil prices tumbled and global equity markets fell on Friday as China's move to impose a new security law on Hong Kong further strained U.S.-China relations and clouded economic recovery prospects.

Headlines: GM delays resumption of second shift at 3 North American truck plants -source
Description: General Motors Co is delaying the resumption of second shifts at truck assembly plants in Michigan, Indiana and Mexico because of a lack of parts from Mexico, a person briefed on the matter said.

Headlines: Wall Street ends mixed as China-U.S. tensions weigh
Description: Wall Street ended mixed on Friday in a mostly tame finish to a week of strong gains, as investors gauged China-U.S. tensions and amid ongoing uncertainty about the pace of economic recovery from the coronavirus.

Headlines: Explainer: How ending Hong Kong's 'special status' could affect U.S. companies
Description: New Chinese national security restrictions imposed on Hong Kong could draw a U.S. revocation of the former British colony's "special status" under U.S. law, a move that would have far-reaching trade and investment implications.

Headlines: U.S. strikes at a Huawei prize: chip juggernaut HiSilicon
Description: The latest U.S. government action against China's Huawei takes direct aim at the company's HiSilicon chip division -- a business that in a few short years has become central to China's ambitions in semiconductor technology but will now lose access to tools that are central to its success.

Headlines: Why bond investors are willing to bet on money-losing Pemex after oil price crash
Description: Mexico's state-owned oil company Petroleos Mexicanos has seen investor sentiment improve in recent weeks despite sky-high debts, a slump in demand and no clear direction about how the government will turn the money-losing driller around.

Headlines: Chile's Latam Airlines Group hires PJT Partners to restructure debt: report
Description: Chile's Latam Airlines Group SA has hired U.S. investment boutique PJT Partners to explore debt restructuring options that may include bankruptcy protection filings in three countries, Brazilian newspaper O Estado de S. Paulo reported late on Monday.

Headlines: Michelin says its Mexican plants have resumed operations
Description: French tire maker Michelin resumed operations at its two plants in Mexico on Monday, saying that activity will be staggered at first.

Headlines: Germany still in talks with EU over Lufthansa bailout, expects green light: Altmaier
Description: Germany is still in talks with the European Commission over its rescue package for flagship carrier Lufthansa , Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said on Monday, adding that Berlin expected Brussels to give the green light for the bailout.

Headlines: Toyota, Nissan and Honda gear up for Mexico reboot after COVID-19 lockdowns
Description: Japanese automakers Toyota, Nissan and Honda said they are gradually restarting in Mexico as the nation's automotive industry reboots in line with a broader economic reopening, despite still-high numbers of new coronavirus cases.

Headlines: Toyota prepping for gradual re-start in Mexico: spokesman
Description: Toyota Motor Corp's Mexico unit is in a preparation phase for the gradual re-start of its operations in the states of Baja California and Guanajuato, a spokesman told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: French billionaires raise stakes in defence of publisher Lagardere
Description: France's business elite closed ranks around publishing group Lagardere on Monday with LVMH's Bernard Arnault and Vivendi's Vincent Bollore swooping in to bolster its defences against London-based hedge fund Amber Capital.

Headlines: Volkswagen Mexico won't talk of restart while state decree in place
Description: German automaker Volkswagen said on Monday it had satisfied federal requirements to resume production in Mexico but would not make announcements about renewing operations as long as a decree in the state of Puebla remains in effect.

Headlines: Stocks rally, S&P 500 crosses 3,000 barrier; oil gains
Description: Global equities and oil rose on Tuesday as China's promise of more stimulus and prospects of a world economic recovery cheered investors, who set aside concerns about tense rhetoric between Washington and Beijing.

Headlines: Exclusive: Coronavirus spreads in Brazil's oilfields, as six offshore operators register cases
Description: Norway's Equinor ASA , Brazil's Dommo Energia SA and Anglo-French firm Perenco are among at least six oil producers that have registered coronavirus cases among employees or contractors at facilities off the coast of Brazil, according to industry and regulatory sources.

Headlines: Travel and leisure stocks rejoice on summer holiday hopes
Description: European travel and leisure stocks soared on Tuesday amid reports Spain and Germany would ease travel restrictions, and no noticeable increase in infections were reported during the re-opening of businesses after a two-month lockdown.

Headlines: Hong Kong lines up MSCI derivatives launch amid doubts on city's future
Description: Hong Kong's exchange is launching derivatives with index provider MSCI in a deal that hurts rival Singapore and boosts its global appeal amid U.S. warnings that Chinese pressure on the cityâ€™s autonomy threatens its future as a financial hub.

Headlines: China's Chery Auto plans to sell cars in EU, United States: chairman
Description: China's Chery Automobile, which has a manufacturing partnership with Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) , is planning to sell its own-branded cars in the European Union and United States for the first time, its chairman said.

Headlines: Stocks rally on EU stimulus plan, euro gains
Description: Equity markets rallied on Wednesday, lifted by enthusiasm for the European Union's plans for a 750 billion euro ($823 billion) recovery fund, but crude prices slid on concerns about unrest in Hong Kong over Beijing's proposed national security laws.

Headlines: Exclusive: Google faces antitrust case in India over payments app - sources
Description: India's antitrust body is looking into allegations that Alphabet Inc's Google is abusing its market position to unfairly promote its mobile payments app in the country, five sources familiar with the case told Reuters.

Headlines: Factbox: Where do Trump and Biden stand on tech policy issues?
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday threatened to regulate or shut down social media companies, a day after Twitter Inc for the first time added a fact-checking label to some of his tweets about mail-in ballots.

Headlines: Germany's Bosch to begin restarting operations in Mexico
Description: German automotive supplier Bosch on Monday said it has received government approval in Mexico to restart operations, which had been suspended since late March due to measures taken to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Headlines: Mexico's auto industry restart gathers steam as lockdown eases
Description: Mexico's auto industry reopening picked up pace on Tuesday, with Fiat Chrysler and BMW AG joining peers in gradually dusting off operations even as the wait for approvals slowed the return of some companies.

Headlines: U.S. state of Arizona files consumer fraud lawsuit against Google
Description: Arizona filed a consumer fraud lawsuit against Alphabet Inc's Google on Wednesday, alleging that the U.S. tech giant used "deceptive" and "unfair" practices to obtain the location data of users.

Headlines: Senator sees U.S. sticking to trade deal with China despite pandemic concerns
Description: U.S. Senate Finance Committee Chairman Chuck Grassley on Thursday said he did not expect President Donald Trump to walk away from a Phase 1 trade deal with China despite concerns over Beijing's handling of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: LATAM's bankruptcy filing to delay its Brazil bailout to at least July: sources
Description: LATAM Airlines Group's U.S. bankruptcy filing this week will delay its potential bailout in Brazil to at least July and also push back aid to its rivals at least through the end of June, two sources said on Thursday.

Headlines: If Trump kicks out Twitter, there's always Germany
Description: If U.S. President Donald Trump goes ahead with his threat to close Twitter, the micro-blogging site can always relocate to Germany.

Headlines: Wall Street ends down in late selloff; Facebook and China weigh
Description: Wall Street ended lower on Thursday following a late-session reversal, with Facebook weighing on the market after President Donald Trump said he would sign an executive order related to social media companies and would hold a news conference on China on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. senators weigh additional sanctions on Russia's Nord Stream 2
Description: Two U.S. senators are considering drafting further sanctions on Russia's Nord Stream 2 natural gas pipeline if Moscow goes ahead and finishes laying pipes, in another blow to a project which has already faced delays.

Headlines: U.S. senators urge probe of TikTok on children's privacy
Description: Four U.S. senators, including a China hawk, urged the Federal Trade Commission on Friday to investigate allegations that the popular video app TikTok violated a consent decree protecting children's privacy.

Headlines: Wall Street ends mostly higher as U.S.-China spat simmers
Description: U.S. stocks finished mostly higher on Friday after President Donald Trump announced measures against China in response to new security legislation that were less threatening to the U.S. economy than investors had feared.

Headlines: Canada's Huawei extradition ruling could unleash more Chinese backlash
Description: A Canadian court ruling that could permit the extradition of a senior Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] executive to the United States leaves Canada vulnerable to further retaliation from Beijing, analysts said.

Headlines: German official sees Lufthansa bailout in reach, demands fairness
Description: The Berlin government is likely to reach a deal with Brussels on a $10 billion government bailout of stricken airline Lufthansa , senior government official Thomas Jarzombek said on Friday, but stressed the German airline needed fair treatment.

Headlines: World equities edge higher despite U.S.-China tensions
Description: World stock markets hovered near three-month highs and safe-haven government bonds inched lower as risk appetite grew on signs that the global economic downturn has bottomed, despite worries over violent protests in the United States and unease over Washington's standoff with Beijing.

Headlines: Workers return to Mexico's border factories as auto sector reopens
Description: Tens of thousands of workers lined up before dawn to return to work at automotive factories along Mexico's northern border on Monday, the first day that industries joined the country's list of essential activities beginning to reopen.

Headlines: Volkswagen says ready to restart Mexico operations on June 15
Description: The Mexican unit of Germany's Volkswagen AG said on Monday the automaker was ready to restart operations in the states of Puebla and Guanajuato on June 15 after activity was idled in late March due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Europe's factories starting to recover, Asia's pain worsens
Description: European manufacturers may be over the worst of a coronavirus-driven downturn, but Asia's pain deepened in May due to a slump in global trade, with export powerhouses Japan and South Korea seeing the sharpest falls in activity in over a decade, surveys showed.

Headlines: Goldman Sachs commits to new central Paris headquarters
Description: U.S. bank Goldman Sachs has signed a lease for a new Paris headquarters building, committing to a city centre office development at a time when many banks are weighing scaling back their presence in cities amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: U.S. launches trade probe into digital taxes, plowing ground for new tariffs
Description: The United States is investigating digital services taxes being adopted or considered by Britain, Italy, Brazil and other countries, the U.S. Trade Representative's office said on Tuesday, a move that could lead to new punitive tariffs and heighten trade tensions.

Headlines: Exclusive: Winning bidder for Grindr has ties to Chinese owner
Description: An investor group that got U.S. approval to buy Grindr Inc has financial and personal links to the dating app's current owner, China's Beijing Kunlun Tech Co Ltd , Reuters has found, in a possible departure from Washingtonâ€™s national security policy on deals.

Headlines: Tech advocacy group's lawsuit says Trump's order on social media is unconstitutional
Description: An advocacy group backed by the tech industry sued President Donald Trump on Tuesday over his executive order that would weaken a law protecting online platforms including social media companies that label or fact-check his posts.

Headlines: Trump administration to bar Chinese passenger carriers from flying to U.S.
Description: President Donald Trump's administration on Wednesday barred Chinese passenger carriers from flying to the United States starting on June 16 as it pressures Beijing to let U.S. air carriers resume flights amid simmering tensions between the world's two largest economies.

Headlines: Democratic-led U.S. House panel opposes any U.S. trade deal with Brazil
Description: The U.S. House Ways and Means Committee said on Wednesday it opposed the Trump administration's plan to expand economic ties with Brazil given its record on human rights and the environment under President Jair Bolsonaro.

Headlines: BlackRock focuses on China credit, oil and travel in Asia
Description: The world's biggest asset manager, BlackRock Inc, called out oil stocks, domestic tourism and debt in China and India as investment opportunities in its Asia outlook on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. senator Cotton cautions Britain over Huawei cooperation
Description: U.S. Republican Senator Tom Cotton cautioned Britain on Wednesday that a decision to allow China's Huawei a role in 5G networks could hurt military cooperation and be an issue in trade talks.

Headlines: Saudi, Russia agree oil cuts extension, raise pressure for compliance
Description: OPEC leader Saudi Arabia and non-OPEC Russia have agreed a preliminary deal to extend existing record oil output cuts by one month while raising pressure on countries with poor compliance to deepen their cuts, OPEC+ sources told Reuters.

Headlines: China eases flight curbs after United States targets its carriers
Description: China will ease coronavirus restrictions to allow more foreign carriers to fly to the mainland, shortly after Washington vowed to bar Chinese airlines from flying to the United States due to Beijing's curbs on U.S. airlines.

Headlines: Facebook to apply state media labels on Russian, Chinese outlets
Description: Facebook Inc will start labeling Russian, Chinese and other state-controlled media organizations, and later this summer will block any ads from such outlets that target U.S. users, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Donald Trump says Warren Buffett makes a mistake selling airline stocks
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday said Warren Buffett, often regarded as the world's greatest investor, made a mistake by recently exiting a multi-billion dollar investment in the airline industry.

Headlines: Reliance says Silver Lake, co-investors to invest extra $601 million in digital unit
Description: India's Reliance Industries late on Friday said U.S. private equity fund Silver Lake and its co-investors will invest an additional 45.46 billion rupees ($601.40 million) in the company's digital unit Jio Platforms.

Headlines: Chevron oil cargo tangled in U.S. sanctions on Venezuela
Description: A Chevron Corp crude oil cargo has become embroiled in U.S. sanctions on shipping companies for violating restrictions on doing business with Venezuela, the company confirmed on Friday.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. weighs blacklisting dozens more oil tankers over Venezuela - officials
Description: The United States is considering imposing sanctions on dozens of additional foreign oil tankers for trading with Venezuela, U.S. officials told Reuters on Friday, the latest effort to sever what Washington sees as a lifeline for President Nicolas Maduro.

Headlines: Trump administration orders Marriott to cease Cuba hotel business
Description: The Trump administration has ordered Marriott International to wind down hotel operations in Communist-run Cuba, a company spokeswoman told Reuters, extinguishing what had been a symbol of the U.S.-Cuban detente.

Headlines: China says forcing Chinese firms off U.S. exchanges will harm U.S.
Description: China said on Friday that forcing Chinese firms to retreat from U.S. stock exchanges would severely harm U.S. interests.

Headlines: Pompeo calls Nasdaq's strict rules a model to guard against fraudulent Chinese companies
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Thursday warned American investors against fraudulent accounting practices at China-based companies and said the Nasdaq's recent decision to tighten listing rules for such players should be "a model" for all other exchanges around the world.

Headlines: Take Five: Bulls charge past hurdles
Description: Have HSBC and Standard Chartered "chosen profits over human rights" in backing China's national security law for Hong Kong, as some suggest? Or does it reflect the tightrope businesses must navigate between Hong Kong's protesters and Beijing?

Headlines: Trump says he views U.S.-China trade deal differently amid coronavirus
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he views the Phase 1 trade deal inked between the United States and China differently in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Mexico to propose NAFTA renegotiator to lead WTO: sources
Description: Mexico is set to propose senior trade official Jesus Seade, who helped rework the North American Free Trade Agreement, as a candidate to be the next director-general of the World Trade Organization (WTO), sources said on Sunday.

Headlines: Chinese telecom firms urge FCC not to revoke ability to operate in U.S.
Description: The U.S. units of China Telecom Corpâ€™s and China Unicom urged the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) not to revoke the company's nearly two-decade old authorization to provide international telecommunications services to and from the United States.

Headlines: British financier Staveley's $2 billion Barclays lawsuit hits High Court
Description: British buinesswoman Amanda Staveley's private equity firm told London's High Court on Monday it had received a "substantially worse" deal than Qatar when its syndicate invested billions of pounds in Barclays during the financial crisis in 2008.

Headlines: HK residents rush for offshore bank accounts on China law worries: sources
Description: Banks including HSBC, Standard Chartered and Citigroup have seen a spike in enquiries from Hong Kong residents about opening offshore accounts amid concerns stemming from China's decision to impose a national security law on the city, five people said.

Headlines: Tesla China sold 11,095 Model 3 vehicles in May, triple April's volume: CPCA
