Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc sold 11,095 Shanghai-made Model 3 vehicles in China in May, more than triple the volume seen in April, according to the China Passenger Car Association (CPCA).

Headlines: Tiffany amends debt pacts for financial leeway amid pandemic, slump in sales
Description: U.S. luxury jeweler Tiffany & Co , which is being bought by France's LVMH for $16 billion, said on Tuesday it had amended some of its debt agreements to gain more financial leeway amid the coronavirus pandemic after its quarterly sales sank 44%.

Headlines: Europe's Just Eat Takeaway to buy U.S. delivery firm Grubhub for $7.3 billion
Description: European food ordering firm Just Eat Takeaway.com NV on Wednesday announced a $7.3 billion deal to buy U.S. food delivery firm Grubhub Inc and create the world's biggest food delivery company outside of China.

Headlines: Pompeo chides HSBC for 'corporate kowtow' to Beijing
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Tuesday chided British bank HSBC for backing moves by China to end Hong Kong's autonomy, saying such "corporate kowtows" got little in return from Beijing.

Headlines: Walmart's Mexico business set to absorb two internal units
Description: The Mexican unit of U.S. retailer Walmart said on Wednesday a shareholder meeting would discuss the absorption of two internal units, Holding de Restaurantes y Servicios and Tiendas Wal-Mart.

Headlines: 'Fifty drivers fight for one order': Southeast Asia gig economy slammed by virus
Description: Indonesian motorcycle taxi driver Aji chain-smokes and checks his smartphone constantly while waiting for orders by the roadside in downtown Jakarta on a hot June morning, but is staring at the prospect of another fruitless day.

Headlines: Europe's Just Eat Takeaway to buy Grubhub for $7.3 billion
Description: European food-ordering firm Just Eat Takeaway.com NV said on Wednesday it had agreed to buy U.S. peer Grubhub Inc in an all-stock deal that, if completed, would create the world's largest food delivery company outside China.

Headlines: Volkswagen, Audi on hold as Mexico's Puebla state not ready to reopen
Description: Mexico's Puebla state, where German automaker Volkswagen and its luxury brand unit Audi have major plants, said it is not ready to reopen its automotive sector due to ongoing concerns about the spread of the coronavirus.

Headlines: China's Tencent Music reports passive stake in Warner Music
Description: China's Tencent Music Entertainment Group on Friday reported a 5.2% passive stake in Class A shares of Warner Music Group Corp, about a week after the world's third-largest recording label's debut on the Nasdaq.

Headlines: Zoom hits political turbulence in Washington, Beijing; lobbyists ready
Description: Zoom Video Communications, whose remote meeting app made the obscure California company a hub for global communications during the coronavirus pandemic, now finds itself fighting political battles in Washington and Beijing.

Headlines: U.S. regulator sides with FCA in Jeep trade case against Mahindra
Description: A U.S. regulator ruled that India's Mahindra and Mahindra Ltd infringed upon the intellectual property rights of Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV's (FCA) Jeep brand, barring the sale of the vehicles in question.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers ask Zoom to clarify China ties after it suspends accounts
Description: Three U.S. lawmakers asked Zoom Video Communications Inc to clarify its data-collection practices and relationship with the Chinese government after the firm said it had suspended user accounts to meet demands from Beijing.

Headlines: Anti-China group urges Trump administration to block Chinese companies from U.S. markets: document
Description: An anti-China advocacy group that includes former White House adviser Steve Bannon is calling on the Trump administration to exclude Chinese companies from U.S. financial markets, as the White House studies new ways to crack down on China.

Headlines: Exclusive: Venezuelan shipping magnate faces U.S. sanctions probe - officials
Description: The United States is investigating a Venezuelan shipping magnate for possibly violating U.S. sanctions by bringing fuel to gasoline-short Venezuela, according to two senior Trump administration officials.

Headlines: HSBC gets veiled rebuke from UK government over Hong Kong
Description: Britain's Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab voiced a thinly veiled criticism of HSBC on Monday after the bank backed China's national security law for Hong Kong, contradicting the British government's opposition to it.

Headlines: GM CEO optimistic on U.S. demand, China, EV profitability
Description: General Motors Co's top executive struck an optimistic note on Monday about U.S. new vehicle demand despite the coronavirus pandemic, and the ability to sell electric vehicles at a profit, especially in China.

Headlines: Exclusive: Mexico's oil hedge to be pricier, but government likely doing it anyway
Description: Mexico will have to pay more for less coverage under its giant oil revenue insurance policy for 2021, but will likely go ahead anyway to avoid further damaging its financial standing with international investors, sources said.

Headlines: U.S. calls bid by men to avoid extradition over ex-Nissan boss Ghosn's escape 'flawed'
Description: U.S. prosecutors on Tuesday said a former Green Beret and his son, wanted by Japan for helping former Nissan Motor Co boss Carlos Ghosn flee the country, were advancing a "flawed" interpretation of Japanese law to fight their extradition.

Headlines: U.S. posts rule allowing U.S. companies to work with Huawei on 5G and other standards
Description: The U.S. Department of Commerce on Tuesday posted a new rule that allows U.S. companies to work with China's Huawei to develop standards for 5G and other cutting-edge technologies, despite restrictions on doing business with the telecommunications equipment maker.

Headlines: China keen to seek benefits from pandemic, distressed U.S. assets: report
Description: U.S. lawmakers and policymakers should be wary of China's moves to target vulnerable U.S. assets and expand its market share in the wake of the global economic crisis triggered by the novel coronavirus, according to a study prepared for a U.S. trade group and released on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. companies can work with Huawei on 5G, other standards: Commerce Department
Description: The United States on Monday confirmed a Reuters report that it will amend its prohibitions on U.S. companies doing business with China's Huawei to allow them to work together on setting standards for next-generation 5G networks.

Headlines: U.S. fines Copa Airlines $450K for transporting passengers between U.S., Venezuela
Description: The U.S. Transportation Department said on Wednesday it fined Panama's Copa Airlines $450,000 for unlawfully transporting passengers between the United States and Venezuela via a stopover point, and ordered the airline to avoid future similar violations.

Headlines: Safe-haven dollar lifted by rise in coronavirus cases
Description: The U.S. dollar was slightly higher on Wednesday afternoon as evidence of a surge in coronavirus cases in some U.S. states and in Beijing sent investors into safe-haven assets.

Headlines: Oil slides on fresh COVID-19 outbreaks, bump in crude stocks
Description: Oil prices settled lower on Wednesday on fuel demand worries due to an uptick in coronavirus cases, with emerging hotspots in China and the United States, and as U.S. crude stocks grew again, taking commercial inventories to another all-time high.

Headlines: Trade war? U.S. battle over kitchen cabinets really a domestic dispute
Description: The anti-China trade mood has reached U.S. kitchens, where a battle is being waged over competing visions of where and how cabinets should be made.

Headlines: New U.S. Huawei rule targets standards, security concerns remain: Ross
Description: A new U.S. rule regarding China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd is a needed "clarification" to help develop standards, U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Wednesday, adding that security concerns remain over the telecoms equipment maker.

Headlines: Trump administration proposes rolling back protections for big tech
Description: The U.S. Justice Department proposed on Wednesday that Congress take up legislation to curb protections big tech platforms like Alphabet's Google and Facebook have had for decades, a senior official said, following through on President Donald Trump's bid to crack down on tech giants.

Headlines: U.S. Chamber urges China to accelerate purchases of U.S. goods
Description: The U.S. Chamber of Commerce on Thursday underscored the importance of functional U.S.-China ties and urged Beijing to step up its purchases of U.S. goods and services as agreed under a Phase 1 trade deal despite delays caused by the coronavirus.

Headlines: Exclusive: Amazon signals entry into alcohol delivery in India with nod in key state - document
Description: Amazon.com Inc has secured clearance to deliver alcohol in India's eastern state of West Bengal, according to a document seen by Reuters, signalling the U.S. e-commerce giant's first foray into the country's multi-billion-dollar sector.

Headlines: UK tells telcos to stockpile Huawei gear in face of U.S. sanctions: letter
Description: British security officials have told UK telecom operators to ensure they have adequate stockpiles of Huawei equipment due to fears that new U.S. sanctions will disrupt the Chinese firm's ability to maintain critical supplies, according to a letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Top French court upholds $56 million Google privacy breach fine
Description: France's top administrative court upheld a 50 million-euro fine ($56 million) imposed last year on Alphabet's Google for breaching European Union online privacy rules, it said on Friday.

Headlines: Trump renews threat to cut ties with Beijing, a day after high-level U.S.-China talks
Description: President Donald Trump on Thursday renewed his threat to cut ties with China, a day after his top diplomats held talks with Beijing and his trade representative said he did not consider decoupling the U.S. and Chinese economies a viable option.

Headlines: D.Telekom: we will keep control of T-Mobile if Softbank sells shares
Description: Deutsche Telekom is in talks to buy out shares in its U.S. unit T-Mobile from Japan's Softbank , CEO Tim Hoettges said on Friday, noting that under a shareholder agreement it has the right of first refusal.

Headlines: Deutsche Telekom to keep grip on T-Mobile in chase for U.S. top spot
Description: Deutsche Telekom will retain control of T-Mobile should Japan's Softbank liquidate its stake, CEO Tim Hoettges said on Friday as he vowed to claim top spot in the U.S. market.

Headlines: 'Total disaster': Phantom billions plunge Wirecard into chaos
Description: Wirecard said on Monday that 1.9 billion euros ($2.1 billion) it had booked in its accounts likely never existed, a black hole that threatens to engulf the payments company and tarnish the reputation of Germany's financial watchdog.

Headlines: Scores of Volkswagen's Mexico staff test positive for coronavirus
Description: Volkswagen AG's Mexican unit on Monday said about 2% of its workers tested for coronavirus had contracted the disease at some point, underlining the challenge faced by automakers in reopening factories before the pandemic has peaked in Mexico.

Headlines: Analysts' View: Take Navarro's China trade deal is 'over' comments with a pinch of salt
Description: U.S. stock futures fell and the dollar rose after White House adviser Peter Navarro said that the trade deal with China is "over". But President Donald Trump later tweeted that the deal "is fully intact" and said he hoped Beijing would continue to live up to terms of the agreement.

Headlines: U.S. fights bail bid by men accused of helping former Nissan boss escape
Description: A U.S. prosecutor on Monday urged a judge to keep a former Green Beret and his son locked up as Japan prepares to formally seek their extradition on charges that they helped former Nissan Motor Co boss Carlos Ghosn flee the East Asian country.

Headlines: Google's U.S. ad revenue to take a hit due to pandemic: report
Description: Google Inc's U.S. advertising revenue will drop 5.3% as brands pare spending during the coronavirus pandemic, according to an eMarketer report on Monday, the first decline since 2008 when the research firm began estimating the Alphabet Inc unit's ad revenues.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S., Brazil protest Thailand's pesticide ban over impact on wheat, soy exports - documents
Description: The United States and Brazil lodged separate protests with Thailand over its ban on two farm chemicals earlier this month, documents reviewed by Reuters show, saying the "restrictive" and "serious" move could hurt key agricultural exports.

Headlines: Taiwan minister says TSMC has offset lost Huawei orders
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC) has made up its order book with other customers now that it has lost China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL], which is subject to U.S. sales restrictions, a government minister said on Monday.

Headlines: Delta to resume flights between U.S. and China
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc said on Monday it would resume flights between Seattle and Shanghai on June 25, making it the first U.S. airline to restart operations between the United States and China after flights were suspended in February due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Headlines: Top German court reimposes data curbs on Facebook
Description: Facebook must comply with an order by Germany's antitrust watchdog to curb data collection from users, a top German court ruled on Tuesday, in a setback for the U.S. social network company that could set a wider precedent.

Headlines: China has picked up its 'game' on trade with U.S., Trump adviser says
Description: The U.S. trade deal with China is not only fully intact, but Beijing has actually stepped forward in a number of areas in a constructive way, a top White House adviser said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Mnuchin says U.S.-China decoupling will occur if firms cannot compete fairly
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Tuesday that a decoupling of the U.S. and Chinese economies will result if U.S. companies are not allowed to compete on a fair and level basis in China's economy.

Headlines: Trump threat to 'decouple' U.S. and China hits trade, investment reality
Description: Conflicting talk from Trump administration officials about "decoupling" the U.S. economy from China is running into a challenging reality: Chinese imports of U.S. goods are rising, investment by American companies into China continues, and markets are wary of separating the world's biggest economies.

Headlines: Italy arrests Siemens, Alstom executives over Milan subway deals
Description: Italian tax police arrested 13 people, including executives of the Italian units of Germany's Siemens and France's Alstom , in an investigation into alleged bribery relating to Milan subway contracts, prosecutors said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Trump administration sees no loophole in new Huawei curb
Description: The U.S. government sees no loopholes in a new rule aimed at crimping global chip sales to China's Huawei and will "aggressively" crack down on any bid to disobey the intent of the curb, Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Top German court reimposes data curbs on Facebook
Description: Facebook must comply with an order by Germany's antitrust watchdog to curb data collection from users, a top German court ruled on Tuesday, in a setback for the U.S. social network company that could set a wider precedent.

Headlines: Bayer nears glyphosate settlement after lengthy talks: sources
Description: Germany's Bayer is set to reach a settlement this week with U.S. plaintiffs that claim its glyphosate-based weedkillers cause cancer, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headlines: With no tourists to watch migration, Kenyan operator's planes are grounded
Description: For Kenyan-based safari operator Safarilink, June is the busiest time of year, as the company's small planes ferry tourists to national parks in Kenya and Tanzania to witness the majestic annual migration of 2 million animals.

Headlines: Oil dives over 5% as U.S. crude stocks hit record, COVID cases mount
Description: Oil prices tumbled over 5%, or more than $2 a barrel on Wednesday, after U.S. crude storage hit another record and coronavirus cases rebounded in countries like Germany and surged in heavily populated areas of the United States.

Headlines: Swissport to cut up to 4,556 jobs in UK and Ireland: internal letter
Description: Aviation services company Swissport said it could cut up to 4,556 jobs, or up to 53% of its workforce in the UK and Ireland, as it forecasts regional revenues will be cut by half as a result of the travel slump caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: BP's stranded Canadian, Angolan assets expose wider industry risks
Description: When BP slashed its long-term oil price outlook last week, prospects in Canada and Angola were rendered worthless, company sources and analysts said, exposing broader risks the industry faces as the world pivots to low-carbon energy.

Headlines: Walmart to stop Mississippi flag display; reviews third party sales on Canada website
Description: Walmart said it will not display in its stores the flag of the U.S. state of Mississippi, which includes a Confederate flag emblem, and is separately reviewing if items sold on its website in Canada breached its terms after online outrage over "All Lives Matter" products on the site.

Headlines: U.S. imposes sanctions on companies operating in Iran's metals sector
Description: The United States on Thursday blacklisted four companies in Iran's metals sector, as well as one German and three Emirati subsidiaries of Iran's largest steelmaker that Washington said generate millions of dollars for Tehran's metals industry.

Headlines: Canada's Trudeau rejects call to swap Huawei executive for detainees in China
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Thursday rejected a call to swap an imprisoned Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] executive for two citizens held by Beijing, saying such a move would set a bad precedent and harm Canada.

Headlines: India's auto and pharma sectors not ready to wean off China
Description: Days after a border clash with China this month in which 20 Indian soldiers were killed, New Delhi told firms to find ways to cut imports from China. But two big industries, automobiles and pharmaceuticals, say this is easier said than done.

Headlines: Nissan to lay off 200 Mexico workers amid global auto slowdown
Description: Japanese automaker Nissan will lay off about 200 workers at a plant in Mexico amid local and global challenges facing the automotive industry, the carmaker said on Thursday.

Headlines: Carnival seeks first leveraged loan to shore up liquidity
Description: LONDON (LPC) - US cruise line operator Carnival is looking to raise its first leveraged loan as it seeks alternative forms of liquidity to shore up its business, which has been sunk by the coronavirus pandemic.

Headlines: Former Wirecard COO Marsalek left Philippines this week, bound for China: minister
Description: A former board member of collapsed German payments company Wirecard was briefly in the Philippines this week but left the country on Wednesday headed for China, Manila's justice minister said on Friday.

Headlines: Oil dips on rise in U.S. coronavirus cases, set for weekly fall
Description: Oil prices settled lower on Friday as new coronavirus cases spiked in the United States and China, and on growing concerns about rising U.S. output ticking up while crude stockpiles sat at record highs.

Headlines: Mexico's Interjet to gradually reopen more routes from July
Description: Mexico's Interjet airline will begin restarting national and international routes in July, the company said on Sunday, as airlines across the world pin their hopes on recovering demand as some coronavirus pandemic restrictions on travel ease.

Headlines: Norwegian Air cancels 97 Boeing MAX and Dreamliners, claims compensation
Description: Norwegian Air has cancelled orders for 97 Boeing aircraft and will claim compensation from the U.S. plane maker for the grounding of the 737 MAX and for 787 engine troubles that hit its bottom line, the Oslo-based carrier said on Monday.

Headlines: Tim Tam maker Arnott's loses 50 jobs in first cuts since KKR buyout
Description: Arnott's, maker of Tim Tam biscuits and other snacks, is shedding about 50 staff, a representative told Reuters, the first such cuts since U.S. private equity firm KKR & Co Inc bought one of Australia's best-known brands last year.

Headlines: Google postpones U.S. office reopening to September as virus cases spike
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google said late on Tuesday it was delaying the reopening of its U.S. offices by around two months because of a surge in the number of coronavirus cases in some states.

Headlines: Carlyle to buy 25% of Bharti Airtel's data center arm for $235 million
Description: Carlyle will buy a 25% stake in Indian telecom firm Bharti Airtel Ltd's data center arm for $235 million, the U.S. private equity group said on Wednesday, as it taps into the rapid growth of digital services in India.

Headlines: SocGen's Australian securities arm pleads guilty to client money offences
Description: Australia's corporate regulator on Wednesday said the Australian securities unit of France's Societe Generale SA (SocGen) has pleaded guilty to charges of breaching client money provisions.

Headlines: Federated Hermes questions HSBC's stance on Hong Kong law
Description: HSBC investor Federated Hermes said it has questions about the bank's support for China's new security law for Hong Kong, the second investor in Europe's biggest bank in recent weeks to voice concerns about the lender's stance.

Headlines: India's Chinese app ban seen jolting ByteDance's India plans, angers some TikTok users
Description: An Indian ban on dozens of Chinese apps following a border clash between the two nations has possibly derailed a $1 billion India expansion plan of China's ByteDance, while also sparking an uproar from users of its popular TikTok video app.

Headlines: China says India's ban on Chinese apps may violate WTO rules
Description: China said on Tuesday that India's move to ban 59 Chinese-origin mobile apps could be a breach of World Trade Organisation (WTO) rules, and urged New Delhi to create an open and fair business environment.

Headlines: India's Chinese app ban seen jolting $1 billion expansion of ByteDance
Description: An Indian ban on dozens of Chinese apps following a border clash between the two nations has possibly derailed a $1 billion India expansion plan of China's ByteDance, while also sparking an uproar from users of its popular TikTok video app.

Headlines: Business groups say flexibility needed to implement new North American trade deal
Description: U.S., Mexican and Canadian business groups applauded a new North American trade deal's entry into force on Wednesday, but said more work and flexibility was needed to overcome challenges including implementation of new labor and automotive rules.

Headlines: Apple supplier Foxconn, others hit as India holds up imports from China: sources
Description: India's additional scrutiny of imports from China has disrupted operations at plants owned by Apple supplier Foxconn in southern India, three sources told Reuters, and other foreign firms are also facing delays as tensions between the two countries build.

Headlines: China hopes India corrects actions against Chinese firms immediately
Description: China's commerce ministry said on Thursday that it hopes India would correct its discriminatory actions against Chinese companies immediately, after India banned Chinese mobile apps amid a border crisis between the two countries.

Headlines: EU banks to take on Visa, Mastercard with new payments system
Description: Sixteen banks from Germany, France and three other euro zone countries on Thursday said a "truly European" payments system was expected to be up and running in 2022 to fully digitalise a region where half of all retail payments are still in cash.

Headlines: Turkish suspect tells court Ghosn mused on Hollywood movie of escape from Japan
Description: A Turkish jet executive on trial over Carlos Ghosn's dramatic escape from Japan told a court on Friday that the former Nissan boss spoke about Hollywood making a movie of his getaway as he flew in a private jet to Beirut.

Headlines: Canada's biggest banks join boycott of Facebook platforms
Description: Canada's biggest lenders confirmed on Friday they had joined a widespread boycott of Facebook Inc begun by U.S. civil rights groups seeking to pressure the world's largest social media platform to take concrete steps to block hate speech.

Headlines: Uber widens taxi app to Japan's Tokyo but ride-sharing still barred
Description: Uber Technologies launched a ride-hailing smartphone application in Tokyo on Friday in partnership with three domestic taxi firms, even as strict regulations block its popular ride-sharing service in Japan.

Headlines: Wirecard ex-COO Marsalek's entry into Philippines was faked, minister says
Description: Immigration records showing Wirecard's former chief operating officer Jan Marsalek arrived in the Philippines on June 23 and departed for China the next day were falsified, Philippines Justice Secretary Menardo Guevarra said on Saturday.

Headlines: Wall Street jumps on strong services sector, hopes of China recovery
Description: U.S. stocks rose sharply on Monday as a rebound in U.S. services industry activity in June and expectations of a revival in China's economy boosted optimism, helping investors look past a surge in new coronavirus cases in the United States.

Headlines: Asia's equity valuations hit 10-1/2-year high in June
Description: The valuation of Asian shares surged to a 10-1/2-year high in June, tracking a rally in global stocks, as upbeat U.S. and China data renewed hopes of a swift economic recovery, offsetting concerns over rising coronavirus cases.

Headlines: On Huawei, UK PM Johnson says cannot be vulnerable to high risk state vendors
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Monday said the government would have to think carefully about the role China's Huawei plays in Britain because he does not want the country to be "vulnerable to a high risk state vendor".

Headlines: Britain jeopardising China relationship, says Huawei's UK boss
Description: Britain risks throwing away its long-standing relationship with China if it bans Huawei from its 5G networks at the behest of the United States as part of a global battle for technological supremacy, the UK chairman of the tech group told Reuters.

Headlines: Biden previews manufacturing plan to counter 'America First' president
Description: Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden on Tuesday promised to revive U.S. manufacturing so that the country is not dependent on China, taking aim at his rival's promises to revive factories.

Headlines: U.S. says Ghosn wired money to man who helped him flee Japan
Description: Carlos Ghosn, the former Nissan Motor Co chairman, wired $862,500 last year to a company managed by one of the two men who later helped him escape from Japan, U.S. prosecutors said in a Tuesday court filing.

Headlines: Huawei says U.S. pressure on Brazil threatens long delays in 5G rollout
Description: A Huawei Technologies executive warned that Brazil could suffer years of delay in deploying a 5G telecoms network and higher costs if it succumbs to mounting U.S. pressure to snub the Chinese equipment supplier.

Headlines: U.S. firms in India not ready to pay digital tax, lobby group says
Description: A lobby group representing U.S. technology giants has said its members are not yet ready to make the first payment of the country's digital tax due this week, urging New Delhi to defer the move.

Headlines: TikTok says it will exit Hong Kong market within days
Description: TikTok will exit the Hong Kong market within days, a spokesman told Reuters late on Monday, as other technology companies including Facebook Inc suspend processing government requests for user data in the region.

Headlines: TikTok quits Hong Kong as U.S. giants suspend processing data requests
Description: Chinese-owned social media platform TikTok announced on Tuesday it would pull out of Hong Kong within days, as global tech giants struggle to figure out how to operate in the city under sweeping new security rules imposed by Beijing.

Headlines: Carlos Ghosn's accused smugglers unlikely to win quick bail
Description: A U.S. judge said she is unlikely to quickly release a Massachusetts father and son being held on charges they helped smuggle former Nissan Motor Co chairman Carlos Ghosn out of Japan.

Headlines: Dollar tumbles to two-week low as Nasdaq hit record closing high
Description: The dollar dropped to two-week lows on Wednesday, showing reduced safe-haven appeal for now, as U.S. tech stocks rallied and commodity prices firmed, even as sentiment remained cautious amid a resurgence of new coronavirus cases globally, particularly in the United States.

Headlines: Furloughs at U.S. legacy airlines could help low-cost carriers like Southwest
Description: U.S. legacy airlines with lackluster employee demand for early exit packages face large furloughs in the fall, signaling higher post-pandemic labor costs because union contracts require airlines to furlough in reverse order of seniority.

Headlines: TikTok's ad launch faces challenges from U.S. ban threat, hoaxes
Description: TikTokâ€™s launch on Wednesday of a new platform to court small business advertisers is fraught with challenges, especially after the Trump administration's threat this week to impose a ban on China-based social media apps.

Headlines: Tesla China sold 14,954 Model 3 vehicles in June, up 35% on the month
Description: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc sold 14,954 Shanghai-made Model 3 vehicles in China in June, up 35% month-on-month, according to the China Passenger Car Association (CPCA).

Headlines: Huawei says U.S. sanctions have no immediate impact on UK 5G supplies
Description: U.S. sanctions targeting China's Huawei have had no immediate impact on its ability to supply 5G equipment to Britain, a senior company executive said on Wednesday, calling for more time to understand the full repercussions of the restrictions.

Headlines: Ruling in EU Apple tax case due next Wednesday: Ireland
Description: The European Union's second highest court will next week rule in an appeal by Apple and Ireland against an EU ruling for the U.S. company to pay 13 billion euros ($16 billion) in back taxes, the Irish government said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Airbus workers stage rare protest over job cuts
Description: Thousands of Airbus workers marched alongside an airport runway in France and staged an 'empty chair' protest in Germany on Wednesday to protest against plans to cut up to 15,000 jobs.

Headlines: U.S. judge rejects immediate bail for accused Carlos Ghosn smugglers
Description: A U.S. judge on Thursday refused to grant immediate bail to a Massachusetts father and son who are trying to avoid extradition to Japan, after being accused of helping smuggle former Nissan Motor Co chairman Carlos Ghosn out of that country.

Headlines: China's market euphoria trumps political risk in Hong Kong
Description: Investors in China's soaring stock market are increasingly turning to Hong Kong for bargains, egging on an investment boom on the back of large tech listings and shaking off fears of political risks in the bruised financial hub.

Headlines: U.S. slaps French goods with 25% duties in digital tax row, but delays effective date
Description: The Trump administration on Friday announced additional duties of 25% on French cosmetics, handbags and other imports valued at $1.3 billion in response to France's digital services tax, but would hold off on implementing the move for up to 180 days.

Headlines: Upbeat economic data helps European shares snap three-day losing run
Description: European shares rose on Friday after upbeat industrial output data from Italy and France raised hopes of an economic recovery, even as a spike in coronavirus cases around the world kept gains in check.

Headlines: Japan Display aims to bring some panel production back from China after coronavirus
Description: Japan Display Inc aims to bring some automotive panel production back to Japan after the novel coronavirus outbreak disrupted its supply chain in China, a company executive said on Friday.

Headlines: Uber agrees to pay $3.8 million Denmark fine over taxi law: police
Description: Uber has agreed to pay a 25 million Danish crowns ($3.8 million) fine in Denmark, settling claims of breaching local taxi law out of court, Danish police said on Friday.

Headlines: Take Five: A bull with underlying health conditions
Description: Southern European bonds and the euro have rallied hard in the two months since France and Germany mooted a 750 billion-euro ($848 billion) post-COVID-19 recovery fund. On July 17-18, European leaders meet to hammer out details. But differences remain on whether the fund should be based on loans or grants; if the proposal stumbles, markets will take it badly.

Headlines: 'Let's get going': UK tells businesses to prepare for Brexit crunch
Description: Britain is urging businesses and individuals to prepare for the Dec. 31 end of the Brexit transition period with an information campaign titled: "The UK's new start: let's get going."

Headlines: Oil slips on surge in COVID-19 infections, U.S.-China tension
Description: Oil prices slipped about 1% on Monday after global coronavirus cases rose by a record daily amount, fanning fears of renewed government lockdowns, and on growing U.S. and European tension with China.

Headlines: Chipmaker Analog Devices to buy rival Maxim for about $21 billion
Description: Semiconductor maker Analog Devices Inc said on Monday it would buy rival Maxim Integrated Products Inc for about $21 billion in the largest U.S. deal this year, aimed at boosting its market share in automotive and 5G chipmaking.

Headlines: China's first-half exports to U.S. down 8.1% year-on-year, imports fall 1.5%
Description: China's exports to the United States fell by 8.1% in the first half from the same period a year earlier while imports from the U.S. declined 1.5%, customs spokesman Li Kuiwen told reporters on Tuesday.

Headlines: China's export slump to ease in June as economies reopen, imports fall less: Reuters poll
Description: The slump in China's exports likely eased in June as some countries reopened their economies, while imports contracted less sharply on higher crude oil and commodities purchases, a Reuters poll showed on Monday.

Headlines: Alphabet's Google commits $10 billion to accelerate digitization in India
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google on Monday said it would spend around $10 billion in India over the next five to seven years through equity investments and tie-ups, marking its biggest commitment to a key growth market.

Headlines: Ex-Nissan boss Ghosn says helping everyone who stood by him
Description: Former Nissan Motor chairman Carlos Ghosn is helping everyone who stood by him, he said in an interview broadcast on Saturday, though he declined to comment on cases of people accused of helping him flee to Lebanon from Japan.

Headlines: Google supports OECD engagement on digital taxes, CEO Pichai says
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google supports a multilateral solution for taxing digital services that is under discussion by the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD), its chief executive Sundar Pichai told Reuters in an interview.

Headlines: Tech sell-off weighs on Europe as virus fears mount; FTSE 100 outperforms
Description: European stocks were hit by a selloff in technology shares on Tuesday, as U.S. peers slumped on fears of new coronavirus restrictions, while London blue-chips outperformed on a boost for the telecoms and energy sectors.

Headlines: UK's Huawei block protects its security, trade and rights-U.S. envoy
Description: Britain's decision to ban China's Huawei from its 5G mobile networks was welcomed by the U.S ambassador to the country, Woody Johnson, who said it was a win for fair trade and human rights.

Headlines: China posts first import growth since pandemic, exports also up
Description: China's imports in June rose for the first time since the coronavirus crisis paralysed the economy, as government stimulus stoked demand for commodities, while exports, fuelled by medical goods, also rose in a sign the recovery is gaining traction.

Headlines: Chongqing city district says it discussed projects with Tesla
Description: U.S. automaker Tesla Inc has met with officials from a district in the city of Chongqing in southwestern China to discuss "accelerating projects", the Liangjiang New Area said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Singapore and Malaysia to reopen business travel next month
Description: Singapore and Malaysia are to resume essential business and official travel between their countries, they said on Tuesday, letting people cross their border for the first time since most movements were suspended because of the coronavirus in March.

Headlines: UK bans Huawei from its 5G network: reaction
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson has ordered Huawei equipment to be purged completely from Britain's 5G network by 2027, risking the ire of China by signalling that the world's biggest telecoms equipment maker is no longer welcome in the West.

Headlines: Google offers data pledge in bid to win EU okay for Fitbit buy
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google has offered not to use health data of fitness tracker company Fitbit to help it target ads in an attempt to address EU antitrust concerns about its proposed $2.1 billion acquisition, the U.S. tech company said late on Monday.

Headlines: UK firms rethink FX hedging as coronavirus and Brexit fog outlook
Description: Coronavirus and the end-2020 Brexit deadline have left UK firms facing historic uncertainties, prompting many to find more flexible ways to protect their foreign exchange exposure -- even if these come at a higher initial cost.

Headlines: Pompeo says U.S. to have decisions soon on Chinese technology firms, apps
Description: The United States hopes to have a set of decisions shortly on Chinese telecoms companies that will reflect Washington's central understanding that the information of U.S. citizens should be protected from Beijing authorities, U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Pompeo says U.S. to impose visa curbs on Huawei over rights
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo took fresh aim at China on Wednesday, saying the United States would impose visa restrictions on Chinese firms like Huawei Technologies Co Ltd that he accused of facilitating human-rights violations.

Headlines: Amid Hong Kong convulsion, Taiwan pitches investors its democracy
Description: Amid political turmoil in financial hub Hong Kong, Taiwan is pitching investors its democracy, rule of law and high quality of life as the island aims to draw more foreign money and talent, Taiwan's top financial regulator said on Wednesday.

Headlines: SMIC's Shanghai listing tests if money alone can bring chip dominance to China
Description: China's biggest chipmaker SMIC is set to follow its staggering $6.6 billion share sale with its Shanghai market debut on Thursday, just as Sino-U.S. tension widens the chasm it wants to cross to reach global leader TSMC, industry insiders said.

Headlines: UK to purge Huawei from 5G by end of 2027, siding with Trump over China
Description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson ordered Huawei equipment to be purged completely from Britain's 5G network by the end of 2027, risking the ire of China by signalling that the world's biggest telecoms equipment maker is not welcome in the West.

Headlines: China says UK's 'dumping' of Huawei will hit investment
Description: China said on Wednesday that Prime Minister Boris Johnson's 5G ban on Huawei was disheartening and that other Chinese businesses had followed how the telecoms giant was "dumped" so investment would be hurt.

Headlines: Special Report: Drug cartel â€˜narco-antennasâ€™ make life dangerous for Mexicoâ€™s cell tower repairmen
Description: The young technician shut off the electricity at a cellular tower in rural Mexico to begin some routine maintenance.

Headlines: U.S. judge approves transfer of jailed former VW executive to Germany
Description: A U.S. judge in Detroit on Thursday approved the transfer to Germany of a former Volkswagen AG executive imprisoned in the automaker's diesel emissions scandal.

Headlines: Exclusive: Natixis plans shake-up to focus on greener lending
Description: French bank Natixis will merge its commodities and infrastructure operations to focus on clean energy in a restructuring sources said was accelerated by a series of loss-making loans to oil traders.

Headlines: India's Reliance seen emerging as bigger threat for U.S. firms like Amazon, Walmart
Description: A $20 billion fund raising spree may take India's Reliance closer to its dream of becoming a digital giant, further threatening the ambitious plans U.S. companies like Amazon, Walmart and Zoom have for India.

Headlines: China says UK has lost independence on Huawei issue
Description: China said on Thursday that Britain has lost its independence on the matter of Huawei Technologies Co Ltd after London decided to ban all Huawei equipment from its 5G networks by the end of 2027.

Headlines: Daimler to stop building sedans in the U.S. after second-quarter loss
Description: Daimler will stop building Mercedes-Benz sedans in the United States and Mexico as it seeks deeper cuts after posting a smaller-than-expected quarterly loss.

Headlines: Former Pemex boss Lozoya taken to hospital after arrival in Mexico
Description: Emilio Lozoya, a former boss of Mexican state oil company Pemex who faces corruption charges, was taken to hospital early on Friday due to the delicate state of his health after his extradition to Mexico, the attorney general's office said.

Headlines: Canopy Growth CEO: 'We're ready to launch vape products into Canada'
Description: Canopy Growth CEO Mark Zekulin says Canada has rules that will govern the [vape] products that we put to market," while the U.S. battles controversies.

Headlines: S&P hits record high after USâ€“China trade truceâ€”5 experts weigh in on what's next for markets
Description: U.S. stocks rose after President Trump met with Chinese President Xi at the G-20 summit. Five experts discuss what this means for the second half of the year.

Headlines: Cramer's week ahead: The market can go higher if Trump makes trade progress with Mexico
Description: "I bet this market can go higher still as long as the President works out something with Mexico over the weekend," Jim Cramer says.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: A trade deal could push this stock even higher
Description: Jim Cramer breaks down how a truce between the U.S. and China could alleviate the headwinds for 3M.

Headlines: Wells Fargo says the S&P 500 could test the 3,000 level
Description: Kirk Hartman of Wells Fargo Asset Management says there could be another leg up for U.S. markets if earnings are "pretty good" and a trade deal is reached between Washington and Beijing.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: Fentanyl could derail a US-China trade deal
Description: Jim Cramer says China must follow through on its fentanyl-related promise or risk President Trump suspending talks.

Headlines: Cramer: US-China trade talks are now more about a 'trust gap' than the 'trade gap'
Description: Jim Cramer explains why he thinks President Donald Trump plans to leave tariffs in place and why the Federal Reserve helped in his trade standoff with China.

Headlines: Cramer: Why Trump could decide to walk away from a trade deal with China
Description: Jim Cramer says Trump could abandon trade negotiations with China, but it could come at a cost he might not want to take on.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: Why China has much more to lose in a trade war
Description: Jim Cramer explains how China's manufacturing-based economy leaves it vulnerable to U.S. trade tariffs.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: When it comes to trade, ignore Treasury Secretary Mnuchin
Description: Jim Cramer explains why it's best to disregard the top Trump advisor when it comes to China.

Headlines: This CEO is watching out for the 2,800 level of the S&P 500
Description: Michael Jones of RiverFront Investment Group says he is "skeptical that we're in the final innings" of the trade war between the U.S. and China.

Headlines: Cramer Remix: What Trumpâ€™s endgame with China could really be about
Description: Jim Cramer breaks down President Trumpâ€™s strategy on trade and why he has taken a hard stance with China.

Headlines: Cramer points to 'China's ultimate weapon' in the trade war: Boycotts
Description: Jim Cramer worries that organized boycotts against U.S. products in China could escalate tensions in the burgeoning trade war.

Headlines: New tariffs let China get 'off more or less scot-free': Former U.S. trade representative
Description: President Trump's steel and aluminum tariffs would affect U.S. allies, not China, says former U.S. trade representative.
